" "[48-mrs. linton] [Mrs. Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton ? [she]56-catherine looked very well , and very handsome ; yet , [I]0-i think , not very happy . " "[56-catherine] Oh dear , [I]0-i do n't wonder ! " And how did [you]2571-sir like [the master]430-the master ? "[56-catherine] " [A rough fellow]2744-a rough fellow , rather , [Mrs. Dean]71-mrs. dean . Is not that [his]430-the master character ? "[0-i] " Rough as a saw - edge , and hard as whinstone ! The less [you]2571-sir meddle with [him]430-the master the better . "[56-catherine] " [He]430-the master must have had some ups and downs in life to make [him]430-the master such a churl . Do [you]2571-sir know anything of [his]430-the master history ? "[56-catherine] " It 's a cuckoo 's ; [sir]2571-sir — [I]0-i know all about it ; except where [he]430-the master was born , and who were [[his]430-the master parents]2746-his parents , and how [he]430-the master got [his]430-the master money , at first — And [Hareton]47-hareton has been cast out like [an unfledged dunnock]2747-an unfledged dunnock — [The unfortunate lad]2748-the unfortunate lad is the only one , in all [this parish]2749-this parish , that does not guess how [he]430-the master has been cheated ! "[0-i] " Well , [Mrs. Dean]71-mrs. dean , it will be a charitable deed to tell [me]56-catherine something of [[my]56-catherine neighbours]2750-my neighbours — [I]56-catherine feel [I]56-catherine shall not rest , if [I]56-catherine go to bed ; so , be good enough to sit , and chat an hour . "[56-catherine] " Oh , certainly , [sir]2571-sir ! [I]471-the worthy woman 'll just fetch a little sewing , and then [I]471-the worthy woman 'll sit as long as [you]2571-sir please but [you]2571-sir 've caught cold , [I]471-the worthy woman saw [you]2571-sir shivering , and [you]2571-sir must have some gruel to drive it out . "[471-the worthy woman] [The worthy woman]471-the worthy woman bustled off ; and [I]0-i crouched nearer the fire : [my]0-i head felt hot , and the rest of [me]0-i chill : moreover [I]0-i was excited , almost to a pitch of foolishness through [my]0-i nerves and brain . This caused [me]0-i to feel , not uncomfortable , but rather fearful , as [I]0-i am still , of serious effects from the incidents of today and yesterday . [She]471-the worthy woman returned presently , bringing a smoking basin , and a basket of work ; and , having placed the former on the hob , drew in [her]471-the worthy woman seat , evidently pleased to find [me]0-i so companionable . " Before [I]471-the worthy woman came to live [here]2574-here , "[471-the worthy woman] [she]471-the worthy woman commenced , waiting no further invitation to [her]471-the worthy woman story ; " [I]471-the worthy woman was almost always at [Wuthering Heights]11-wuthering heights ; because , [[my]471-the worthy woman mother]2753-my mother had nursed [Mr. Hindley Earnshaw]75-hindley , that was [[Hareton]47-hareton 's father]2754-hareton 's father , and [I]471-the worthy woman got used to playing with [the children]2755-the children — [I]471-the worthy woman ran errands too , and helped to make hay , and hung about [the farm]2643-the farm ready for anything that [anybody]329-anybody would set [me]471-the worthy woman to . "[471-the worthy woman] One fine summer morning — it was the beginning of harvest , [I]0-i remember — [Mr. Earnshaw]47-hareton , [the old master]472-the old master , came down [stairs]416-stairs , dressed for a journey ; and , after [he]47-hareton had told [Joseph]45-joseph what was to be done during the day , [he]47-hareton turned to [Hindley]75-hindley , and [Cathy]56-catherine , and [me]0-i — for [I]0-i sat eating [my]0-i porridge , with [them]474-them , and [he]47-hareton said , speaking to [[his]47-hareton son]475-his son , " Now [[my]47-hareton bonny man]2758-my bonny man , [I]47-hareton 'm going to [Liverpool]12-liverpool , to - day . . .What shall [I]47-hareton bring [you]2758-my bonny man ? [You]2758-my bonny man may choose what [you]2758-my bonny man like ; only let it be little , for [I]47-hareton shall walk there and back ; sixty miles each way , that is a long spell ! "[47-hareton] [Hindley]75-hindley named a fiddle , and then [he]47-hareton asked [Miss Cathy]56-catherine ; [she]56-catherine was hardly six years old , but [she]56-catherine could ride any horse in [the stable]476-the stable , and [she]56-catherine chose a whip . [He]47-hareton did not forget [me]0-i , for , [he]47-hareton had a kind heart , though [he]47-hareton was rather severe , sometimes . [He]47-hareton promised to bring [me]0-i a pocketful of apples , and pears , and then [he]47-hareton kissed [[his]47-hareton children]477-his children , good bye , and set off . It seemed a long while to [us]478-us all — the three days of [his]47-hareton absence — and often did little [Cathy]56-catherine ask when [he]47-hareton would be [home]239-home : [Mrs. Earnshaw]76-mrs. earnshaw , expected [him]47-hareton by supper - time , on the third evening ; and [she]76-mrs. earnshaw put the meal off hour after hour ; there were no signs of [his]47-hareton coming , however , and at last [the children]2755-the children got tired of running down to the gate to look — Then it grew dark , [she]76-mrs. earnshaw would have had [them]2755-the children to bed , but [they]2755-the children begged sadly to be allowed to stay up : and , just about eleven o'clock , the door - latch was raised quietly and in stept [the master]430-the master . [He]47-hareton threw [himself]47-hareton into a chair , laughing and groaning , and bid [them]2755-the children all stand off , for [he]47-hareton was nearly killed — [he]47-hareton would not have such another walk for [the three kingdoms]482-the three kingdoms . " And at the end of it , to be flighted to death ! "[47-hareton] [he]47-hareton said opening [his]47-hareton great coat , which [he]47-hareton held bundled up in [his]47-hareton arms , " See here , [wife]284-wife ; [I]47-hareton was never so beaten with anything in [my]47-hareton life ; but [you]284-wife must e'en take it as a gift of [God]66-god ; though it 's as dark almost as if it came from the devil . "[47-hareton] [We]483-we crowded round , and , over [Miss Cathy]56-catherine 's head , [I]0-i had a peep at [a dirty , ragged , black - haired child ; big enough both to walk and talk]484-a dirty , ragged , black - haired child ; big enough both to walk and talk — indeed , [its]484-a dirty , ragged , black - haired child ; big enough both to walk and talk face looked older than [Catherine's]77-catherine's — yet , when it was set on [its]484-a dirty , ragged , black - haired child ; big enough both to walk and talk feet , it only stared round , and repeated over and over again , some gibberish that [nobody]442-nobody could understand . [I]0-i was frightened , and [Mrs. Earnshaw]76-mrs. earnshaw was ready to fling it out of doors : [she]76-mrs. earnshaw did fly up — asking how [he]47-hareton could fashion to bring [that gipsy brat]486-that gipsy brat into [the house]185-the house , when [they]488-they had [their]488-they own bairns to feed , and fend for ? What [he]47-hareton meant to do with it , and whether [he]47-hareton were mad ? [The master]430-the master tried to explain the matter ; but , [he]47-hareton was really half dead with fatigue , and all that [I]0-i could make out , amongst [her]76-mrs. earnshaw scolding , was a tale of [his]47-hareton seeing it starving , and houseless , and as good as dumb in [the streets of [Liverpool]12-liverpool]490-the streets of liverpool where [he]47-hareton picked [it]486-that gipsy brat up and inquired for [its owner]491-its owner — Not a soul knew to whom it belonged , [he]47-hareton said , and [his]47-hareton money and time , being both limited , [he]47-hareton thought it better , to take it [home]239-home with [him]47-hareton , at once , than run , into vain expences there ; because [he]47-hareton was determined [he]47-hareton would not leave as [he]47-hareton found it . Well , the conclusion was that [[my]0-i mistress]493-my mistress grumbled [herself]493-my mistress calm ; and [Mr Earnshaw]75-hindley told [me]0-i to wash it , and give [it]486-that gipsy brat clean things , and let [it]486-that gipsy brat sleep with [the children]2755-the children . [Hindley]75-hindley and [Cathy]56-catherine contented [themselves]495-them with looking and listening till peace was restored : then , [both]496-both began searching [[their]496-both father]497-their father 's pockets for the presents [he]75-hindley had promised [them]495-them . [The former]304-the former was [a boy of fourteen]499-a boy of fourteen , but when [he]304-the former drew out , what had been a fiddle crushed to morsels in the great coat , [he]304-the former blubbered aloud , and [Cathy]56-catherine , when [she]56-catherine learnt [the master]430-the master had lost [her]430-the master whip in attending on [the stranger]501-the stranger , showed [her]56-catherine humour by grinning and spitting at the stupid little thing , earning for [her]56-catherine pains , a sound blow from [[her]56-catherine father]502-her father to teach [her]56-catherine cleaner manners . [They]495-them entirely refused to have it in bed with [them]495-them , or even in [[their]495-them room]503-their room , and [I]0-i had no more sense , so , [I]0-i put it on [the landing of the stairs]504-the landing of the stairs , hoping it might be gone on the morrow . By chance , or else attracted by hearing [his]304-the former voice , it crept to [Mr. Earnshaw]75-hindley 's door and there [he]304-the former found it on quitting [[his]304-the former chamber]505-his chamber . Inquiries were made as to how it got there ; [I]0-i was obliged to confess , and in recompense for [my]0-i cowardice and inhumanity was sent out of [the house]185-the house . This was [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff 's first introduction to [the family]335-the family : on coming back a few days afterwards , for [I]0-i did not consider [my]0-i banishment perpetual , [I]0-i found [they]335-the family had christened [him]43-heathcliff " [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff , "[335-the family] it was the name of [a son who died in childhood]508-a son who died in childhood , and it has served [him]43-heathcliff ever since , both for christian and surname . [Miss Cathy]56-catherine and [he]43-heathcliff were now very thick ; but [Hindley]75-hindley hated [him]43-heathcliff , and to say the truth [I]0-i did the same ; and [we]509-we plagued and went on with [him]43-heathcliff shamefully , for [I]0-i was'nt reasonable enough to feel [my]0-i injustice , and [the mistress]429-the mistress never put in a word on [his]43-heathcliff behalf , when [she]429-the mistress saw [him]43-heathcliff wronged . [He]43-heathcliff seemed [a sullen , patient child]511-a sullen , patient child ; hardened , perhaps , to ill - treatment : [he]43-heathcliff would stand [Hindley]75-hindley 's blows without winking or shedding a tear , and [my]0-i pinches moved [him]43-heathcliff only to draw in a breath , and open [his]43-heathcliff eyes as if [he]43-heathcliff had hurt [himself]43-heathcliff by accident , and [nobody]442-nobody was to blame . This endurance made [old Earnshaw]75-hindley furious when [he]75-hindley discovered [[his]75-hindley son]475-his son persecuting [the poor , fatherless child]514-the poor , fatherless child , as [he]75-hindley called [him]43-heathcliff . [He]43-heathcliff took to [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff strangely , believing , all [he]43-heathcliff said , ( for that matter , [he]43-heathcliff said precious little , and generally the truth , ) and petting [him]43-heathcliff up far above [Cathy]56-catherine , who was too mischievous and wayward for [a favourite]515-a favourite . So , from the very beginning , [he]43-heathcliff bred bad feeling in [the house]185-the house ; and at [Mrs Earnshaw]76-mrs. earnshaw 's death , which happened in less than two years after , [the young master]517-the young master had learnt to regard [[his]517-the young master father]518-his father as [an oppressor]519-an oppressor rather than [a friend]520-a friend , and [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff as [a usurper of [[his]517-the young master parent]522-his parent 's aflfections]521-a usurper of his parent 's aflfections , and [his]43-heathcliff privileges , and [he]43-heathcliff grew bitter with brooding over these injuries . [I]0-i sympathised awhile , but , when [the children]2755-the children fell ill of the measles and [I]0-i had to tend them , and take on [me]0-i the cares of [a woman]524-a woman , at once , [I]0-i changed [my]0-i ideas . [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff was dangerously sick , and while [he]43-heathcliff lay at the worst [he]43-heathcliff would have [me]0-i constantly by [his]43-heathcliff pillow ; [I]0-i suppose [he]43-heathcliff felt [I]0-i did a good deal for [him]43-heathcliff , and [he]43-heathcliff had'nt wit to guess that [I]0-i was compelled to do it . However , [I]0-i will say this , [he]43-heathcliff was [the quietest child that ever nurse watched over]525-the quietest child that ever nurse watched over . The difference between [him]43-heathcliff and [the others]526-the others forced [me]0-i to be less partial : [Cathy]56-catherine and [[her]56-catherine brother]527-her brother harassed [me]0-i terribly : [he]43-heathcliff was as uncomplaining as a lamb ; though hardness , not gentleness , made [him]43-heathcliff give little trouble . [He]43-heathcliff got through , and [the doctor]528-the doctor affirmed it was in a great measure owing to [me]0-i , and praised [me]0-i for [my]0-i care . [I]0-i was vain of [his]43-heathcliff commendations , and softened towards the being by whose means , [I]0-i earned them , and thus [Hindley]75-hindley lost [[his]75-hindley last ally]529-his last ally ; still [I]0-i could n't dote on [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff , and [I]0-i wondered often what [[my]0-i master]530-my master saw to admire so much in [the sullen boy who never , to [my]0-i recollection , repaid [his]43-heathcliff indulgence by any sign of gratitude]531-the sullen boy who never , to my recollection , repaid his indulgence by any sign of gratitude . [He]43-heathcliff was not insolent to [[his]43-heathcliff benefactor]532-his benefactor ; [he]43-heathcliff was simply insensible , though knowing perfectly the hold [he]43-heathcliff had on [his]43-heathcliff heart , and conscious [he]43-heathcliff had only to speak and all [the house]185-the house would be obliged to bend to [his]43-heathcliff wishes . As an instance , [I]0-i remember [Mr. Earnshaw]75-hindley once bought a couple of colts at the parish fair , and gave [the lads]534-the lads each one . [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff took the handsomest , but it soon fell lame , and when [he]43-heathcliff discovered it , [he]43-heathcliff said to [Hindley]75-hindley , " [You]75-hindley must exchange horses with [me]43-heathcliff ; [I]43-heathcliff do n't like mine , and , if [you]75-hindley wo n't [I]43-heathcliff shall tell [[your]75-hindley father]2760-your father of the three thrashings [you]75-hindley 've given [me]43-heathcliff this week , and show [him]2760-your father [my]43-heathcliff arm which is black to the shoulder . "[43-heathcliff] [Hindley]75-hindley put out [his]75-hindley tongue , and cuffed [him]43-heathcliff over the ears . " [You]75-hindley 'd better do it , at once , "[75-hindley] [he]75-hindley persisted escaping to [the porch]535-the porch , ( [they]536-they were in [the stable]476-the stable ) " [you]75-hindley will have to , and , if [I]75-hindley speak , of these blows , [you]75-hindley 'll get them again with interest . "[75-hindley] " Off dog ! "[75-hindley] cried [Hindley]75-hindley , threatening [him]43-heathcliff with an iron weight , used for weighing potatoes , and hay . " Throw it , "[75-hindley] [he]75-hindley replied , standing still , " and then [I]75-hindley 'll tell how [you]75-hindley boasted that [you]75-hindley would turn [me]75-hindley out of doors as soon as [he]43-heathcliff died , and see whether [he]43-heathcliff will not turn [you]75-hindley out directly . "[75-hindley] [Hindley]75-hindley threw it , hitting [him]43-heathcliff on the breast and down [he]43-heathcliff fell but staggered up , immediately , breathless and white , and had not [I]0-i prevented it [he]43-heathcliff would have gone just so to [the master]430-the master , and got full revenge by letting [his]43-heathcliff condition plead for [him]43-heathcliff , intimating who had caused it . " "[43-heathcliff] Take [my]0-i colt , [gipsy]539-gipsy , then ! " said [young Earnshaw]75-hindley , "[539-gipsy] And [I]0-i pray that [he]43-heathcliff may break [your]539-gipsy neck , take [him]43-heathcliff , and be damned , [[you]539-gipsy [beggarly interloper]541-beggarly interloper]540-you beggarly interloper ! and wheedle [[my]0-i father]338-my father out of all [he]338-my father has , only , afterwards , show [him]338-my father what [you]539-gipsy are , [imp of Satan]543-imp of satan — And take that , [I]0-i hope [he]43-heathcliff 'll kick out [your]539-gipsy brains ! " [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff had gone to loose the beast , and shift [it]43-heathcliff to [[his]43-heathcliff own stall]2761-his own stall — [He]43-heathcliff was passing behind it , when [Hindley]75-hindley finished [his]75-hindley speech by knocking [him]43-heathcliff under [its]43-heathcliff feet , and without stopping to examine whether [his]43-heathcliff hopes were fulfilled , ran away as fast as [he]43-heathcliff could . [I]75-hindley was surprised to witness how coolly [the child]2762-the child gathered [himself]2762-the child up , and went on with [his]2762-the child intention , exchanging saddles and all ; and then sitting down on a bundle of hay to overcome the qualm which the violent blow occasioned , before [he]2762-the child entered [the house]185-the house . [I]75-hindley persuaded [him]2762-the child easily to let [me]75-hindley lay the blame of [his]2762-the child bruises on the horse ; [he]2762-the child minded little what tale was told since [he]2762-the child had what [he]2762-the child wanted . [He]2762-the child complained so seldom , indeed , of such stirs as these , that [I]75-hindley really thought [him]2762-the child not vindictive — [I]75-hindley was deceived , completely , as [you]2764-you will hear . In the course of time , [Mr. Earnshaw]75-hindley began to fail . [He]75-hindley had been active and healthy , yet [his]75-hindley strength left [him]75-hindley suddenly ; and when [he]75-hindley was confined to the chimney - corner [he]75-hindley grew grievously irritable . [A nothing]2765-a nothing vexed [him]75-hindley , and suspected slights of [his]75-hindley authority nearly threw [him]75-hindley into fits . This was especially to be remarked if [any one]2573-any one attempted to impose upon , or domineer over [[his]75-hindley favourite]2767-his favourite ; [he]75-hindley was painfully jealous lest a word should be spoken amiss to [him]75-hindley , seeming to have got into [his]75-hindley head the notion that , because [he]75-hindley liked [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff , all hated , and longed to do [him]43-heathcliff an ill - turn . It was a disadvantage to [the lad]2768-the lad , for [the kinder among [us]2770-we]2769-the kinder among us did not wish to fret [the master]430-the master , so [we]2770-we humoured [his]75-hindley partiality ; and that humouring was rich nourishment to [the child]2762-the child 's pride and black tempers . Still it became in a manner necessary ; twice , or thrice , [Hindley]75-hindley 's manifestations of scorn , while [[his]2762-the child father]518-his father was near , roused [the old man]2774-the old man to a fury . [He]2774-the old man seized [his]2774-the old man stick to strike [him]2774-the old man , and shook with rage that [he]2774-the old man could not do it . At last , [[our]2770-we curate]2775-our curate , ( [we]2770-we had [a curate]2776-a curate then who made the living answer by teaching [the little Lintons]74-the lintons and [Earnshaws]78-earnshaws , and farming [[his]75-hindley bit of land [himself]75-hindley]2777-his bit of land himself , ) [he]2775-our curate advised that [the young man]259-the young man should be sent to [college]2779-college , and [Mr , Earnshaw]75-hindley agreed , though with a heavy spirit , for [he]2775-our curate said — "[75-hindley] [Hindley]75-hindley was naught , and would never thrive as where [he]75-hindley wandered . " [I]75-hindley hoped heartily [we]2770-we should have peace now . It hurt [me]75-hindley to think [the master]430-the master should be made uncomfortable by [his]430-the master own good deed . [I]75-hindley fancied the discontent of age and disease arose from [[his]430-the master family]2781-his family disagreements , as [he]430-the master would have it that it did — really , [you]2782-you know , [sir]2571-sir , it was in [his]430-the master sinking frame . [We]2770-we might have got on tolerably , notwithstanding ; but , for [two people]2784-two people . [Miss Cathy]56-catherine , and [Joseph]45-joseph , [the servant]2711-the servant ; [you]2782-you saw [him]430-the master , [I]75-hindley dare say , up yonder . [He]430-the master was , and is yet , most likely , [the wearisomest , self - righteous pharisee that ever ransacked a bible to rake the promises to [himself]430-the master , and fling the curses on [[his]430-the master neighbours]2787-his neighbours]2786-the wearisomest , self - righteous pharisee that ever ransacked a bible to rake the promises to himself , and fling the curses on his neighbours . By [his]430-the master knack of sermonizing and pious discoursing , [he]430-the master contrived to make a great impression on [Mr. Earnshaw]75-hindley , and , the more feeble [the master]430-the master became , the more influence [he]430-the master gained . [He]430-the master was relentless in worrying [him]430-the master about [his]430-the master soul 's concerns , and about ruling [[his]430-the master children]477-his children rigidly . [He]430-the master encouraged [him]430-the master to regard [Hindley]75-hindley as a reprobate ; and , night after night , [he]430-the master regularly grumbled out a long string of tales against [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff and [Catherine]56-catherine ; always minding to flatter [Earnshaw]75-hindley 's weakness by heaping the heaviest blame on the last . Certainly , [she]430-the master had ways with [her]430-the master such as [I]75-hindley never saw [a child]265-a child take up before ; and [she]430-the master put all of [us]2791-us past [our]2791-us patience fifty times and oftener in a day : from the hour [she]430-the master came down [stairs]416-stairs , till the hour [she]430-the master went to bed , [we]2791-us had not a minute 's security that [she]430-the master would n't be in mischief . [Her]430-the master spirits were always at high - water mark , [her]430-the master tongue always going — singing , laughing , and plaguing [everybody who would not do the same]2793-everybody who would not do the same . [A wild , wick slip]2794-a wild , wick slip [she]430-the master was — but , [she]430-the master had the bonniest eye , and sweetest smile , and lightest foot in [the parish]2795-the parish ; and , after all , [I]75-hindley believe [she]430-the master meant no harm ; for when once [she]430-the master made [you]2796-you cry in good earnest , it seldom happened that [she]430-the master would not keep [you]2796-you company ; and oblige [you]2796-you to be quiet that [you]2796-you might comfort [her]430-the master . [She]430-the master was much too fond of [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff . The greatest punishment [we]2791-us could invent for [her]430-the master was to keep [her]430-the master separate from [him]43-heathcliff : yet , [she]430-the master got chided more than any of [us]2791-us on [his]43-heathcliff account . In play , [she]430-the master liked , exceedingly , to act [the little mistress]2797-the little mistress ; using [her]430-the master hands freely , and commanding [[her]430-the master companions]2798-her companions : [she]430-the master did so to [me]75-hindley , but [I]75-hindley would not bear slapping , and ordering ; and so [I]75-hindley let [her]430-the master know . Now , [Mr. Earnshaw]75-hindley did not understand jokes from [[his]75-hindley children]477-his children : [he]75-hindley had always been strict and grave with [them]477-his children ; and [Catherine]56-catherine , on [her]56-catherine part , had no idea why [[her]56-catherine father]502-her father should be crosser and less patient in [his]75-hindley ailing condition , than [he]75-hindley was in [his]75-hindley prime . [His]75-hindley peevish reproofs wakened in [her]56-catherine a naughty delight to provoke [him]75-hindley ; [she]56-catherine was never so happy as when [we]2801-we were all scolding [her]56-catherine at once , and [she]56-catherine defying [us]2801-we with [her]56-catherine bold , saucy look , and [her]56-catherine ready words ; turning [Joseph]45-joseph 's religious curses into ridicule , baiting [me]75-hindley , and doing just what [[her]56-catherine father]502-her father hated most , showing how [her]56-catherine pretended insolence , which [he]75-hindley thought real , had more power over [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff than [his]75-hindley kindness . How [the boy]2803-the boy would do [her]56-catherine bidding in anything , and [his]2803-the boy only when it suited [his]2803-the boy own inclination . After behaving as badly as possible all day , [she]56-catherine sometimes came fondling to make it up at night . "[75-hindley] Nay , [Cathy]56-catherine , " [the old man]2774-the old man would say , "[56-catherine] [I]0-i can not love [thee]56-catherine ; thou'rt worse than [[thy]56-catherine brother]544-thy brother . Go , say [thy]56-catherine prayers , [child]545-child , and ask [God]66-god 's pardon . [I]0-i doubt [[thy]56-catherine mother]546-thy mother and [I]0-i must rue that [we]547-we ever reared [thee]56-catherine ! " That made [her]56-catherine cry , at first ; and then , being repulsed continually hardened [her]56-catherine , and [she]56-catherine laughed if [I]0-i told [her]56-catherine to say [she]56-catherine was sorry for [her]56-catherine faults , and beg to be forgiven . But the hour came , at last , that ended [Mr. Earnshaw]75-hindley 's troubles on [earth]2805-earth . [He]75-hindley died quietly in [his]75-hindley chair one October evening , seated by the fire - side . A high wind blustered round [the house]185-the house , and roared in the chimney : it sounded wild and stormy , yet it was not cold , and [we]547-we were all together — [I]0-i , a little removed from the hearth , busy at [my]0-i knitting , and [Joseph]45-joseph reading [his]45-joseph Bible near the table , ( for [the servants]2807-the servants generally sat in [the house]185-the house then , after [their]2807-the servants work was done . ) [Miss Cathy]56-catherine had been sick , and that made [her]56-catherine still ; [she]56-catherine leant against [[her]56-catherine father]502-her father 's knee , and [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff was lying on the floor with [his]43-heathcliff head in [her]56-catherine lap . [I]0-i remember [the master]430-the master , before [he]430-the master fell into a doze , stroking [her]56-catherine bonny hair — it pleased [him]430-the master rarely to see [her]56-catherine gentle — and saying — "[0-i] Why canst [thou]548-thou not always be [a good lass]549-a good lass , [Cathy]56-catherine ? " And [she]56-catherine turned [her]56-catherine face up to [his]550-his , and laughed , and answered , "[56-catherine] Why can not [you]550-his always be [a good man]551-a good man , [father]552-father ? " But as soon as [she]56-catherine saw [him]550-his vexed again , [she]56-catherine kissed [his]550-his hand , and said [she]56-catherine would sing [him]550-his to sleep . [She]56-catherine began singing very low , till [his]550-his fingers dropped from [hers]56-catherine , and [his]550-his head sank on [his]550-his breast . Then [I]551-a good man told [her]56-catherine to hush , and not stir , for fear [she]56-catherine should wake [him]550-his . [We]2811-we all kept as mute as mice a full half - hour , and should have done longer , only [Joseph]45-joseph , having finished [his]45-joseph chapter , got up and said that [he]45-joseph must rouse [the master]430-the master for prayers and bed . [He]45-joseph stepped forward , and called [him]430-the master by name , and touched [his]430-the master shoulder , but [he]430-the master would not move — so [he]45-joseph took the candle and looked at [him]430-the master . [I]551-a good man thought there was something wrong as [he]45-joseph set down the light ; and seizing [the children each]2813-the children each by an arm , whispered [them]554-them to "[551-a good man] frame up - [stairs]416-stairs , and make little din — [they]554-them might pray alone that evening — [he]555-he had summut to do . " "[555-he] [I]0-i shall bid [father]552-father good - night first , " said [Catherine]56-catherine , putting [her]56-catherine arms round [his]555-he neck , before [we]2814-we could hinder [her]56-catherine . [The poor thing]2815-the poor thing discovered [her]56-catherine loss directly — [she]56-catherine screamed out — "[0-i] Oh , [he]555-he 's dead , [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff ! [he]555-he 's dead ! " And [they]2813-the children each both set up a heart - breaking cry . [I]43-heathcliff joined [my]43-heathcliff wail to [theirs]2813-the children each , loud and bitter ; but [Joseph]45-joseph asked what [we]2814-we could be thinking of to roar in that way over a saint in [Heaven]13-heaven . [He]45-joseph told [me]43-heathcliff to put on [my]43-heathcliff cloak and run to [Gimmerton]14-gimmerton for [the doctor]528-the doctor and [the parson]2817-the parson . [I]43-heathcliff could not guess the use that either would be of , then . However , [I]43-heathcliff went , through wind and rain , and brought [one]285-one , [the doctor]528-the doctor , back with [me]43-heathcliff ; [the other]289-the other said [he]289-the other would come in the morning . Leaving [Joseph]45-joseph to explain matters , [I]43-heathcliff ran to [[the children]2755-the children 's room]2822-the children 's room ; [their]2755-the children door was ajar , [I]43-heathcliff saw [they]2755-the children had never laid down , though it was past midnight ; but [they]2755-the children were calmer , and did not need [me]43-heathcliff to console [them]2755-the children . [The little souls]2823-the little souls were comforting each other with better thoughts than [I]43-heathcliff could have hit on ; [no parson in [the world]267-the world]2824-no parson in the world ever pictured Heaven so beautifully as [they]2755-the children did , in [their]2755-the children innocent talk ; and , while [I]43-heathcliff sobbed , and listened , [I]43-heathcliff could not help wishing [we]2826-us were all there safe together . [Mr. Hindley]75-hindley came [home]239-home to the funeral ; and — a thing that amazed [us]2826-us , and set [the neighbours]2828-the neighbours gossipping right and left — [he]75-hindley brought [a wife]2829-a wife with [him]75-hindley . What [she]2829-a wife was , and where [she]2829-a wife was born [he]75-hindley never informed [us]2826-us ; probably , [she]2829-a wife had neither money nor name to recommend [her]2829-a wife , or [he]75-hindley would scarcely have kept the union from [[his]75-hindley father]518-his father . [She]2829-a wife was not one that would have disturbed [the house]185-the house much on [her]2829-a wife own account . Every object [she]2829-a wife saw , the moment [she]2829-a wife crossed the threshold , appeared to delight [her]2829-a wife ; and every circumstance that took place about [her]2829-a wife , except the preparing for the burial , and the presence of [the mourners]2832-the mourners . [I]43-heathcliff thought [she]2829-a wife was half silly from [her]2829-a wife behaviour while that went on ; [she]2829-a wife ran into [[her]2829-a wife chamber]2833-her chamber , and made [me]43-heathcliff come with [her]2829-a wife , though [I]43-heathcliff should have been dressing [the children]2755-the children ; and there [she]2829-a wife sat shivering and clasping [her]2829-a wife hands , and asking repeatedly — "[43-heathcliff] Are [they]557-they gone yet ? " Then [she]2829-a wife began describing with hysterical emotion the effect it produced on [her]2829-a wife to see black ; and started , and trembled , and , at last , fell a weeping — and when [I]43-heathcliff asked what was the matter ? answered , [she]2829-a wife did n't know ; but [she]2829-a wife felt so afraid of dying ! [I]43-heathcliff imagined [her]2829-a wife as little likely to die as [myself]43-heathcliff . [She]2829-a wife was rather thin , but young , and fresh complexioned , and [her]2829-a wife eyes sparkled as bright as diamonds . [I]43-heathcliff did remark , to be sure , that mounting the stairs made [her]2829-a wife breathe very quick , that the least sudden noise set [her]2829-a wife all in a quiver , and that [she]2829-a wife coughed troublesomely sometimes : but , [I]43-heathcliff knew nothing of what these symptoms portended , and had no impulse to sympathize with [her]2829-a wife . [We]2835-we do n't in general take to foreigners here , [Mr. Lockwood]44-mr. lockwood , unless [they]557-they take to [us]2835-we first . [Young Earnshaw]79-young earnshaw was altered considerably in the three years of [his]79-young earnshaw absence . [He]79-young earnshaw had grown sparer , and lost [his]79-young earnshaw colour , and spoke and dressed quite differently : and , on the very day of [his]79-young earnshaw return , [he]79-young earnshaw told [Joseph]45-joseph and [me]43-heathcliff [we]2835-we must thenceforth quarter [ourselves]2835-we in [the back - kitchen]2679-the back - kitchen , and leave [the house]185-the house for [him]79-young earnshaw . Indeed [he]79-young earnshaw would have carpeted and papered [a small spare room for [a parlour]2839-a parlour]2838-a small spare room for a parlour ; but [[his]79-young earnshaw wife]2670-his wife expressed such pleasure at the white floor , and huge glowing fire - place , at the pewter dishes , and delf - case , and dog - kennel , and the wide space there was to move about in , where [they]2841-they usually sat , that [he]79-young earnshaw thought it unnecessary to [her]2670-his wife comfort , and so dropped the intention . [She]2670-his wife expressed pleasure , too , at finding [a sister]2842-a sister among [[her]2670-his wife new acquaintance]2843-her new acquaintance , and [she]2670-his wife prattled to [Catherine]56-catherine , and kissed [her]56-catherine , and ran about with [her]56-catherine , and gave [her]56-catherine quantities of presents , at the beginning . [Her]2670-his wife affection tired very soon , however , and when [she]2670-his wife grew peevish , [Hindley]75-hindley became tyrannical . A few words from [her]2670-his wife , evincing a dislike to [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff , were enough to rouse in [him]75-hindley all [his]75-hindley old hatred of [the boy]2803-the boy . [He]79-young earnshaw drove [him]75-hindley from [[their]2845-they company]2846-their company to [the servants]2807-the servants , deprived [him]75-hindley of the instructions of [the curate]2848-the curate , and insisted that [he]75-hindley should labour out of doors instead , compelling [him]75-hindley to do so , as hard as [any other lad on [the farm]2643-the farm]2849-any other lad on the farm . [He]75-hindley bore [his]75-hindley degradation pretty well at first , because [Cathy]56-catherine taught [him]75-hindley what [she]56-catherine learnt , and worked or played with [him]75-hindley in [the fields]2851-the fields . [They]2845-they both promised fair to grow up as rude as [savages]2852-savages , [the young master]517-the young master being entirely negligent how [they]2845-they behaved , and what [they]2845-they did , so [they]2845-they kept clear of [him]75-hindley . [He]75-hindley would not even have seen after [their]2845-they going to [church]2667-church on Sundays , only [Joseph]45-joseph and [the curate]2848-the curate reprimanded [his]75-hindley carelessness when [they]2845-they absented [themselves]2845-they , and that reminded [him]75-hindley to order [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff a flogging , and [Catherine]56-catherine a fast from dinner or supper . But it was one of [their]2845-they chief amusements to run away to [the moors]352-the moors in the morning and remain [there]2637-there all day , and the after punishment grew a mere thing to laugh at . [The curate]2848-the curate might set as many chapters as [he]2848-the curate pleased for [Catherine]56-catherine to get by heart , and [Joseph]45-joseph might thrash [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff till [his]45-joseph arm ached ; [they]2845-they forgot everything the minute [they]2845-they were together again , at least the minute [they]2845-they had contrived some naughty plan of revenge , and many a time [I]43-heathcliff 've cried to [myself]43-heathcliff to watch [them]2845-they growing more reckless daily , and [I]43-heathcliff not daring to speak a syllable for fear of losing the small power [I]43-heathcliff still retained over [the unfriended creatures]2859-the unfriended creatures . One Sunday evening , it chanced that [they]2845-they were banished from [the sitting - room]2860-the sitting - room , for making a noise , or a light offence of the kind , and when [I]43-heathcliff went to call [them]2845-they to supper , [I]43-heathcliff could discover [them]2845-they nowhere . [We]2861-we searched [the house]185-the house , above and below , and [the yard]252-the yard , and [stables]2864-stables , [they]2845-they were invisible ; and , at last , [Hindley]75-hindley in a passion told [us]2861-we to bolt the doors , and swore [nobody]442-nobody should let [them]2845-they in that night . [The household]227-the household went to bed ; and [I]43-heathcliff , too anxious to lie down , opened [my]43-heathcliff lattice and put [my]43-heathcliff head out to hearken , though it rained , determined to admit [them]2845-they in spite of the prohibition , should [they]2845-they return . In a while , [I]43-heathcliff distinguished steps coming up [the road]2638-the road , and the light of a lantern glimmered through the gate . [I]43-heathcliff threw a shawl over [my]43-heathcliff head and ran to prevent [them]2845-they from waking [Mr. Earnshaw]75-hindley by knocking . There was [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff , by [himself]43-heathcliff ; it gave [me]43-heathcliff a start to see [him]43-heathcliff alone . "[43-heathcliff] Where is [Miss Catherine]56-catherine ? " [I]56-catherine cried hurriedly . "[56-catherine] No accident , [I]0-i hope ? " "[56-catherine] At [Thrushcross Grange]73-mr. linton , " [he]0-i answered , "[56-catherine] and [I]0-i would have been [there]2637-there too , but [they]559-they had not the manners to ask [me]0-i to stay . " "[559-they] Well , [you]0-i will catch it ! " [I]0-i said , "[0-i] [you]0-i 'll never be content till [you]0-i 're sent about [your]0-i business . What in [the world]267-the world led [you]0-i wandering to [Thrushcross Grange]73-mr. linton ? " "[80-ellen] Let [me]0-i get off [my]0-i wet clothes , and [I]0-i 'll tell [you]0-i all about it , [Nelly]80-ellen , " [he]0-i replied . [I]80-ellen bid [him]0-i beware of rousing [the master]430-the master , and while [he]0-i undressed , and [I]80-ellen waited to put out the candle , [he]0-i continued — "[80-ellen] [Cathy]56-catherine and [I]0-i escaped from [the wash house]561-the wash house to have a ramble at liberty , and getting a glimpse of the Grange lights , [we]562-we thought [we]562-we would just go and see whether [the Lintons]74-the lintons passed [their]74-the lintons Sunday evenings standing shivering in corners , while [[their]74-the lintons father]497-their father and [mother]564-mother sat eating and drinking and singing and laughing , and burning [their]74-the lintons eyes out before the fire . Do [you]0-i think [they]74-the lintons do ? Or reading sermons , and being catechised by [[their]74-the lintons manservant]565-their manservant , and set to learn a column of Scripture names , if [they]74-the lintons do n't answer properly ? " "[0-i] Probably not , " [I]0-i responded . "[0-i] [They]74-the lintons are [good children]566-good children , no doubt , and do n't deserve the treatment [you]0-i receive , for [your]0-i bad conduct . " "[0-i] Do n't [you]0-i ca nt , [Nelly]80-ellen , " [he]0-i said "[0-i] nonsense ! [We]562-we ran from [the top of [the Heights]568-the heights]567-the top of the heights to [the park]2652-the park , without stopping — [Catherine]56-catherine completely beaten in the race , because [she]56-catherine was barefoot . [You]0-i 'll have to seek for [her]56-catherine shoes in [the bog]570-the bog to - morrow . [We]562-we crept through a broken hedge , groped [our]562-we way up the path , and planted [ourselves]562-we on a flower - plot under [the drawing room]571-the drawing room window . The light came from thence ; [they]572-they had not put up the shutters , and the curtains were only half closed . [Both of [us]562-we]573-both of us were able to look in by standing on [the basement]574-the basement , and clinging to the ledge , and [we]562-we saw — ah ! it was beautiful — a splendid place carpeted with crimson , and crimson - covered chairs and tables , and a pure white ceiling bordered by gold , a shower of glass - drops hanging in silver chains from the centre , and shimmering with little soft tapers . [Old Mr.]575-old mr. and [Mrs. Linton]48-mrs. linton were not [there]2637-there . [Edgar]81-edgar and [[his]81-edgar sister]577-his sister had it entirely to [themselves]572-they ; should n't [they]572-they have been happy ? [We]562-we should have thought [ourselves]562-we in heaven ! And now , guess what [[your]578-you good children]579-your good children were doing ? [Isabella]82-isabella , [I]0-i believe [she]82-isabella is eleven , a year younger than [Cathy]56-catherine , lay screaming at the farther end of [the room]243-the room , shrieking as if witches were running red hot needles into [her]82-isabella . [Edgar]81-edgar stood on the hearth weeping silently , and in the middle of the table sat a little dog shaking its paw and yelping , which , from [their]572-they mutual accusations , [we]562-we understood [they]572-they had nearly pulled in two between [them]572-they . [The idiots]581-the idiots ! That was [their]581-the idiots pleasure ! to quarrel who should hold a heap of warm hair , and [each begin to cry]582-each begin to cry because [both]496-both , after struggling to get it , refused to take it . [We]562-we laughed outright at the petted things , [we]562-we did despise [them]581-the idiots ! When would [you]578-you catch [me]0-i wishing to have what [Catherine]56-catherine wanted ? or find [us]562-we by [ourselves]562-we , seeking entertainment in yelling , and sobbing , and rolling on the ground , divided by [the whole room]584-the whole room ? [I]0-i 'd not exchange , for a thousand lives , [my]0-i condition here , for [Edgar Linton]81-edgar 's at [Thrushcross Grange]73-mr. linton — not if [I]0-i might have the privilege of flinging [Joseph]45-joseph off the highest gable , and painting [the house]185-the house - front with [Hindley]75-hindley 's blood ! " "[0-i] Hush , hush ! " [I]0-i interrupted . "[0-i] Still [you]0-i have not told [me]0-i , [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff , how [Catherine]56-catherine is left behind ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i told [you]578-you [we]562-we laughed , " [he]0-i answered . [The Linton]81-edgar 's heard [us]562-we , and with one accord , [they]562-we shot like arrows to the door ; there was silence , and then a cry , ' Oh , [mamma]2869-mamma , [mamma]2869-mamma ! Oh , [papa]2871-papa ! Oh , [mamma]2869-mamma , come here . Oh papa , oh ! ' [They]562-we really did howl out , something in that way . [We]562-we made frightful noises to terrify [them]562-we still more , and then [we]562-we dropped off the ledge , because [somebody]2654-somebody was drawing the bars , and [we]562-we felt [we]562-we had better flee . [I]562-we had [Cathy]56-catherine by the hand , and was urging [her]589-she on , when all at once [she]589-she fell down . "[562-we] Run , [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff , run ! " [she]589-she whispered . "[43-heathcliff] [They]586-they have let the bull - dog loose , and [he]587-he holds [me]0-i ! " "[2631-the devil] [The devil]2631-the devil had seized [her]589-she ankle , [Nelly]80-ellen ; [I]0-i heard [his]2631-the devil abominable snorting . [She]589-she did not yell out — no ! [She]589-she would have scorned to do it , if [she]589-she had been spitted on the horns of a mad cow . [I]0-i did , though , [I]0-i vociferated curses enough to annihilate [any fiend in [Christendom]15-christendom]590-any fiend in christendom , and [I]0-i got a stone and thrust it between [his]2631-the devil jaws , and tried with all [my]0-i might to cram it down [his]2631-the devil throat . [A beast of a servant]591-a beast of a servant came up with a lantern , at last , shouting — " Keep fast , [Skulker]83-skulker , keep fast ! "[591-a beast of a servant] " [He]382-the man changed [his]382-the man note , however , when [he]382-the man saw [Skulker]83-skulker 's game . The dog was throttled off , [his]382-the man huge , purple tongue hanging half a foot out of [his]382-the man mouth , and [his]382-the man pendant lips streaming with bloody slaver . "[382-the man] [The man]382-the man took [Cathy]56-catherine up ; [she]56-catherine was sick ; not from fear , [I]0-i 'm certain , but from pain . [He]382-the man carried [her]56-catherine in ; [I]0-i followed grumbling execrations and vengeance . " "[382-the man] What prey , [Robert]84-robert ? " hallooed [Linton]56-catherine from the entrance . "[84-robert] " [Skulker]83-skulker has caught [a little girl]2874-a little girl , [sir]2571-sir , "[382-the man] [he]382-the man replied , and there 's [a lad]593-a lad here , " [ha]382-the man added , making a clutch at [me]593-a lad , "[593-a lad] who looks an out - and - outer ! "[84-robert] [The rascals]599-the rascals knew that yesterday was [my]0-i rent day ; [they]599-the rascals thought to have [me]0-i cleverly . Do n't be afraid , it is but [a boy]602-a boy — yet , [the villain]603-the villain scowls so plainly in [his]603-the villain face , would it not be a kindness to [the country]438-the country to hang [him]603-the villain at once , before [he]603-the villain shows [his]603-the villain nature in acts , as well as features ? " [He]603-the villain pulled [me]603-the villain under the chandelier , and [Mrs. Linton]48-mrs. linton placed [her]48-mrs. linton spectacles on [her]48-mrs. linton nose and raised [her]48-mrs. linton hands in horror . [The cowardly children]2877-the cowardly children crept nearer also , [Isabella]82-isabella lisping — "[603-the villain] Frightful thing ! [Edgar Linton]81-edgar , after an inquisitive stare , collected sufficient wit to recognise [her]56-catherine . [They]609-they see [us]610-us at [church]2667-church , [you]2871-papa know , though [we]610-us seldom meet [them]609-they elsewhere . " "[609-they] That 's [Miss Earnshaw]88-miss earnshaw ! " [he]0-i whispered to [[his]0-i mother]2878-his mother , "[609-they] and look how [Skulker]83-skulker has bitten [her]88-miss earnshaw — how [her]88-miss earnshaw foot bleeds ! " "[88-miss earnshaw] [Miss Earnshaw]88-miss earnshaw ? Nonsense ! " cried [the dame]2879-the dame , "[88-miss earnshaw] [Miss Earnshaw]88-miss earnshaw scouring [the country]438-the country with [a gipsy]613-a gipsy ! Aud yet , [[my]0-i dear]601-my dear , [the child]2762-the child is in mourning — surely it is — and [she]2762-the child may be lamed for life ! " "[2762-the child] What culpable carelessness in [[her]2762-the child brother]527-her brother ! " exclaimed [Mr. Linton]73-mr. linton , turning from [me]0-i to [Catherine]56-catherine . "[0-i] [I]0-i 've understood from [Shielders]89-shielders ( that was [the curate sir]617-the curate sir ) that [he]527-her brother lets [her]2762-the child grow up in absolute heathenism . But who is this ? Where did [she]2762-the child pick up [this companion]618-this companion ? Oho ! [I]0-i declare [he]618-this companion is that strange acquisition [[my]0-i late neighbour]619-my late neighbour made in [his]619-my late neighbour journey to [Liverpool]12-liverpool — [a little Lascar]620-a little lascar , or [an American or Spanish castaway]621-an american or spanish castaway . " "[622-a wicked boy] [A wicked boy]622-a wicked boy , at all events , " remarked [the old lady]2880-the old lady , "[622-a wicked boy] and quite unfit for [a decent house]623-a decent house ! Did [you]0-i notice [his]618-this companion language , [Linton]56-catherine ? [I]0-i 'm shocked that [[my]0-i children]624-my children should have heard it . " "[0-i] [I]0-i recommenced cursing — don't be angry [Nelly]80-ellen — and so [Robert]84-robert was ordered to take [me]0-i off — [I]0-i refused to go without [Cathy]56-catherine — [he]84-robert dragged [me]0-i into [the garden]2718-the garden , pushed the lantern into [my]0-i hand , assured [me]0-i that [Mr. Earnshaw]75-hindley , should be informed of [my]0-i behaviour , and bidding [me]0-i march , directly , secured the door again . " The curtains were still looped up at one corner ; and [I]56-catherine resumed [my]56-catherine station as [spy]2881-spy , because , if [Catherine]56-catherine had wished to return , [I]56-catherine intended shattering [their]2882-their great glass panes to a million fragments , unless [they]2882-their let [her]56-catherine out . "[56-catherine] [She]56-catherine sat on the sofa quietly , [Mrs. Linton]48-mrs. linton took off the grey cloak of [the dairy maid which [we]627-we had borrowed for [our]627-we excursion]626-the dairy maid which we had borrowed for our excursion ; shaking [her]56-catherine head , and expostulating with [her]56-catherine , [I]0-i suppose ; [she]56-catherine was [a young lady]628-a young lady and [they]629-they made a distinction between [her]56-catherine treatment , and [mine]0-i . Then [the woman servant]630-the woman servant brought a basin of warm water , and washed [her]56-catherine feet ; and [Mr. Linton]73-mr. linton mixed a tumbler of negus , and [Isabella]82-isabella emptied a plateful of cakes into [her]82-isabella lap , and [Edgar]81-edgar , stood gaping at a distance . Afterwards , [they]629-they dried and combed [her]56-catherine beautiful hair , and gave [her]56-catherine a pair of enormous slippers , and wheeled [her]56-catherine to the fire , and [I]0-i left [her]56-catherine , as merry as [she]56-catherine could be , dividing [her]56-catherine food , between the little dog and [Skulker]83-skulker whose nose [she]56-catherine pinched as [he]81-edgar ate ; and kindling a spark of spirit in the vacant blue eyes of [the Lintons]74-the lintons — a dim reflection from [her]56-catherine own enchanting face — [I]0-i saw [they]629-they were full of stupid admiration ; [she]56-catherine is so immeasurably superior to [them]629-they — to everybody on [earth]2805-earth ; is [she]56-catherine not , [Nelly]80-ellen ? " "[80-ellen] There will more come of this business than [you]80-ellen reckon on . " [I]80-ellen answered covering [him]75-hindley up and extinguishing the light , "[80-ellen] [You]80-ellen are incurable [Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton , and [Mr. Hindley]75-hindley will have to proceed to extremities , see if [he]75-hindley wo nt . " [My]75-hindley words came truer than [I]75-hindley desired . The luckless adventure made [Earnshaw]75-hindley furious — And then , [Mr. Linton]73-mr. linton , to mend matters , paid [us]2883-us a visit [himself]73-mr. linton , on the morrow ; and read [the young master]517-the young master such a lecture on the road [he]73-mr. linton guided [[his]73-mr. linton family]2781-his family , that [he]73-mr. linton was stirred to look about [him]73-mr. linton , in earnest . [Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton received no flogging , but [he]75-hindley was told that the first word [he]75-hindley spoke to [Miss Catherine]56-catherine should ensure a dismissal ; and [Mrs. Earnshaw]76-mrs. earnshaw undertook to keep [[her]76-mrs. earnshaw sister - in - law]2886-her sister - in - law in due restraint , when [she]76-mrs. earnshaw returned [home]239-home employing art , not force — with force [she]76-mrs. earnshaw would have found it impossible . [Cathy]56-catherine stayed at [Thrushcross Grange]73-mr. linton five weeks , till Christmas . By that time [her]56-catherine ankle was thoroughly cured , and [her]56-catherine manners much improved . [The mistress]429-the mistress visited [her]56-catherine often , in the interval , and commenced [her]429-the mistress plan of reform , by trying to raise [her]56-catherine self - respect with fine clothes , and flattery , which [she]429-the mistress took readily : so that , instead of [a wild , hatless little savage]2889-a wild , hatless little savage jumping into [the house]185-the house , and rushing to squeeze [us]2891-us all breathless , there lighted from [a handsome black pony]2892-a handsome black pony [a very dignified person with brown ringlets falling from the cover of a feathered beaver]2893-a very dignified person with brown ringlets falling from the cover of a feathered beaver , and a long cloth habit which [she]2893-a very dignified person with brown ringlets falling from the cover of a feathered beaver was obliged to hold up with both hands that [she]2893-a very dignified person with brown ringlets falling from the cover of a feathered beaver might sail in . [Hindley]75-hindley lifted [her]56-catherine from [her]2893-a very dignified person with brown ringlets falling from the cover of a feathered beaver horse exclaiming delightedly , "[75-hindley] Why [Cathy]56-catherine , [you]56-catherine are quite [a beauty]632-a beauty ! [I]0-i should scarcely have known [you]56-catherine — [you]56-catherine look like [a lady]633-a lady now — [Isabella Linton]82-isabella is not to be be compared with [her]82-isabella , is [she]82-isabella [Frances]60-frances ? " "[82-isabella] [Isabella]82-isabella has not [her]82-isabella natural advantages , " replied [[his]0-i wife]2670-his wife , "[82-isabella] but [she]82-isabella must mind and not grow wild again here . [Ellen]80-ellen , help [Miss Catherine]56-catherine off with [her]56-catherine things — Stay , [dear]634-dear , [you]634-dear will disarrange [your]634-dear curls — let [me]0-i untie [your]634-dear hat . " [I]0-i removed the habit , and there shone forth , beneath a grand plaid silk frock , white trousers , and burnished shoes ; and , while [her]2670-his wife eyes sparkled joyfully when the dogs came bounding up to welcome [her]2670-his wife , [she]2670-his wife dare hardly touch [them]2895-them lest [they]2895-them should fawn upon [her]2670-his wife splendid garments . [She]2670-his wife kissed [me]0-i gently , [I]0-i was all flour making the Christmas cake , and it would not have done to give [me]0-i a hug ; and , then , [she]2670-his wife looked round for [Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton . [Mr.]2896-mr. and [Mrs. Earnshaw]76-mrs. earnshaw watched anxiously [their]2895-them meeting , thinking it would enable [them]2895-them to judge , in some measure , what grounds [they]2895-them had for hoping to succeed in separating [the two friends]2897-the two friends . [Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton was hard to discover , at first — If [he]2898-he were careless , and uncared for , before [Catherine]56-catherine 's absence , [he]2898-he had been ten times more so , since . [Nobody]442-nobody , but [I]0-i even did [him]2898-he the kindness to call [him]2898-he [a dirty boy]2900-a dirty boy , and bid [him]2898-he wash [himself]2898-he , once a week ; and [children of]2901-children of [his]2898-he age , seldom have a natural pleasure in soap and water . Therefore , not to mention [his]2898-he clothes , which had seen three month 's service , in mire and dust , and [his]2898-he thick uncombed hair ; the surface of [his]2898-he face and hands was dismally beclouded . [He]2898-he might well skulk behind the settle , on beholding such [a bright , graceful damsel]2902-a bright , graceful damsel enter [the house]185-the house , instead of [a rough - headed counterpart to [himself]2898-he]2904-a rough - headed counterpart to himself , as [he]2898-he expected . "[0-i] Is [Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton not [here]2574-here ? " [she]56-catherine demanded pulling off [her]56-catherine gloves , and displaying fingers wonderfully whitened with doing nothing , and staying in doors . "[48-mrs. linton] [Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton [you]48-mrs. linton may come forward , " cried [Mr. Hindley]75-hindley enjoying [his]2898-he discomfiture and gratified to see what [a forbidding young blackguard]2905-a forbidding young blackguard [he]2898-he would be compelled to present [himself]2898-he . "[48-mrs. linton] [You]48-mrs. linton may come and wish [Miss Catherine]56-catherine welcome , like [the other servants]636-the other servants . " [Cathy]56-catherine , catching a glimpse of [[her]56-catherine friend]2906-her friend in [his]2906-her friend concealment , flew to embrace [him]2906-her friend , [she]56-catherine bestowed seven or eight kisses on [his]2906-her friend cheek within the second , and , then , stopped , and drawing back , burst into a laugh , exclaiming , "[56-catherine] Why , how very black and cross [you]48-mrs. linton look [I]0-i and how — how funny and grim ! But that 's because [I]0-i 'm used to [Edgar]81-edgar , and [Isabella Linton]82-isabella . Well , [Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton , have [you]48-mrs. linton forgotten [me]0-i ? " [She]56-catherine had some reason to put the question , for shame , and pride threw double gloom over [his]2906-her friend countenance , and kept [him]2906-her friend immoveable . "[48-mrs. linton] Shake hands , [Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton , " said [Mr. Earnshaw]75-hindley , condescendingly ; "[48-mrs. linton] once in a way , that is permitted . " "[48-mrs. linton] [I]0-i shall not ! " replied [the boy]2803-the boy finding [his]0-i tongue at last , "[0-i] [I]0-i shall not stand to be laughed at , [I]0-i shall not bear it ! " And [he]2803-the boy would have broken from the circle , but [Miss Cathy]56-catherine seized [him]2803-the boy again . "[0-i] [I]0-i did not mean to laugh at [you]48-mrs. linton , " [she]56-catherine said , "[0-i] [I]0-i could not hinder [myself]0-i , [Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton , shake hands , at least ! What are [you]48-mrs. linton sulky for ? It was only that [you]48-mrs. linton looked odd — If [you]48-mrs. linton wash [your]48-mrs. linton face , and brush [your]48-mrs. linton hair it will be all right . But [you]48-mrs. linton are so dirty ! " [She]56-catherine gazed concernedly at the dusky fingers [she]56-catherine held in [her]56-catherine own , and also at [her]56-catherine dress which [she]56-catherine feared had gained no embellishment from its contact with [his]0-i . "[48-mrs. linton] [You]0-i need n't have touched [me]0-i ! " [He]0-i answered , following [her]56-catherine eye and snatching away [his]0-i hand . [I]0-i shall be as dirty as [I]0-i please , and [I]0-i like to be dirty , and [I]0-i will be dirty . "[0-i] With that [he]0-i dashed head foremost out of [the room]243-the room , amid the merriment of [the master]430-the master and [mistress]639-mistress , and to the serious disturbance of [Catherine]56-catherine who could not comprehend how [her]56-catherine remarks should have produced such an exhibition of bad temper . After playing [[lady]640-lady 's maid]641-lady 's maid to [the new comer]642-the new comer , and putting [my]0-i cakes in the oven , and making [the house]185-the house and [kitchen]192-kitchen cheerful with great fires befitting Christmas eve , [I]0-i prepared to sit down and amuse [myself]0-i by singing carols , all alone ; regardless of [Joseph]45-joseph 's affirmations that [he]45-joseph considered the merry tunes [I]0-i chose as next door to songs . [He]45-joseph had retired to private prayer in [[his]45-joseph chamber]505-his chamber , and [Mr.]646-mr. and [Mrs. Earnshaw]76-mrs. earnshaw were engaging [Missy]90-missy 's attention by sundry gay trifles bought for [her]90-missy to present to [the little Lintons]74-the lintons , as an acknowledgment of [their]74-the lintons kindness [They]74-the lintons had invited [them]74-the lintons to spend the morrow at [Wuthering Heights]11-wuthering heights , and the invitation had been accepted , on one condition , [Mrs. Linton]48-mrs. linton begged that [[her]90-missy darlings]647-her darlings might be kept carefully apart from [that " naughty , swearing boy]2908-that " naughty , swearing boy . "[48-mrs. linton] Under these circumstances [I]0-i remained solitary . [I]0-i smelt the rich scent of the heating spices ; and admired the shining kitchen utensils , the polished clock , decked in holly , the silver mugs ranged on a tray ready to be filled with mulled ale for supper ; and , above all , the speckless purity of [my]0-i particular care — the scoured and well - swept floor . [I]0-i gave due inward applause to every object and , then , [I]0-i remembered how old [Earnshaw]76-mrs. earnshaw used to come in when all was tidied , and call [me]0-i [a ca nt lass]648-a ca nt lass , and slip a shilling into [my]0-i hand , as a christmas box : and , from that , [I]0-i went on to think of [his]649-his fondness for [Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton , and [his]649-his dread lest [he]649-his should suffer neglect after death had removed [him]649-his ; and that naturally led [me]0-i to consider [the poor lad]650-the poor lad 's situation now , and from singing [I]0-i changed [my]0-i mind to crying . It struck [me]0-i soon , however , there would be more sense in endeavouring to repair some of [his]649-his wrongs than shedding tears over them — [I]0-i got up and walked into [the court]180-the court to seek [him]649-his . [He]649-his was not far , [I]0-i found [him]649-his smoothing the glossy coat of the new pony in [the stable]476-the stable , and feeding the other beasts , according to custom . " Make haste , [Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton ! "[0-i] [I]0-i said " [the kitchen]194-the kitchen is so comfortable — and [Joseph]45-joseph is [upstairs]2910-upstairs ; make haste , and let [me]0-i dress [you]649-his smart before [Miss Cathy]56-catherine comes out — and then [you]649-his can sit together , with the whole hearth to [yourselves]649-his , and have a long chatter till bedtime . "[0-i] [He]649-his proceeded with [his]649-his task and never turned [his]649-his head towards [me]0-i . " Come — are [you]649-his coming ? "[0-i] [I]0-i continued , " There 's a little cake for each of [you]649-his , nearly enough ; and [you]649-his 'll need half an hour 's donning . "[0-i] [I]0-i waited five minutes , but getting no answer left [him]649-his . . .Catherine supped with [[her]653-her brother and sister - in law]654-her brother and sister - in law : [Joseph]45-joseph and [I]0-i joined at an unsociable meal seasoned with reproofs on one side , and sauciness on the other . [His]649-his cake and cheese remained on the table all night , for the fairies . [He]649-his managed to continue work till nine o'clock , and , then , marched dumb and dour , to [[his]649-his chamber]505-his chamber . [Cathy]56-catherine sat up late ; having a world of things to order for the reception of [[her]56-catherine new friends]656-her new friends : [she]56-catherine came into [the kitchen]194-the kitchen , once , to speak to [[her]56-catherine old one]658-her old one , but [he]658-her old one was gone , and [she]56-catherine only staid to ask what was the matter with [him]658-her old one , and then went back . " In the morning , [he]658-her old one rose early ; and , as it was a holiday , carried [his]658-her old one ill - humour onto [the moors]352-the moors ; not re - appearing till [the family]335-the family were departed for [church]2667-church . Fasting , and reflection seemed to have brought [him]658-her old one to a better spirit . [He]658-her old one hung about [me]80-ellen , for a while , and having screwed up [his]658-her old one courage , exclaimed abruptly , "[80-ellen] [Nelly]80-ellen , make [me]0-i decent , [I]0-i 'm going to be good . " "[80-ellen] High time , [Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton , " [I]48-mrs. linton said , "[48-mrs. linton] [you]48-mrs. linton have grieved [Catherine]56-catherine ; [she]56-catherine 's sorry [she]56-catherine ever came [home]239-home , [I]0-i dare say ! It looks as if [you]48-mrs. linton envied [her]56-catherine , because [she]56-catherine is more thought of than [you]48-mrs. linton . " The notion of envying [Catherine]56-catherine was incomprehensible to [him]0-i , but the notion of grieving [her]56-catherine , be understood clearly enough . "[56-catherine] Did [she]56-catherine say [she]56-catherine was grieved ? " [he]0-i inquired looking very serious . "[56-catherine] [She]56-catherine cried when [I]0-i told [her]56-catherine [you]48-mrs. linton were off again this morning . " "[56-catherine] Well , [I]0-i cried last night " [he]0-i returned , "[56-catherine] and [I]0-i had more reason to cry than [she]56-catherine . " "[0-i] Yes , [you]48-mrs. linton had the reason of going to bed , with a proud heart , and an empty stomach , " said [I]48-mrs. linton , "[48-mrs. linton] [Proud people]660-proud people breed sad sorrows for [themselves]660-proud people — But , if [you]48-mrs. linton be ashamed of [your]48-mrs. linton touchiness , [you]48-mrs. linton must ask pardon , mind , when [she]56-catherine comes in . [You]48-mrs. linton must go up , and offer to kiss [her]56-catherine , and say — [you]48-mrs. linton know best what to say , only , do it heartily , and not as if [you]48-mrs. linton thought [her]56-catherine converted into [a stranger]2580-a stranger by [her]56-catherine grand dress . And now , though [I]0-i have dinner to get ready , [I]0-i 'll steal time to arrange [you]48-mrs. linton so that [Edgar Linton]81-edgar shall look quite a doll beside [you]48-mrs. linton : and that [he]81-edgar does — [You]48-mrs. linton are younger , and yet , [I]0-i 'll be bound , [you]48-mrs. linton are taller and twice as broad across the shoulders — [you]48-mrs. linton could knock [him]81-edgar down in a twinkling ; do n't [you]48-mrs. linton feel that [you]48-mrs. linton could ? " [Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton 's face brightened a moment ; then , it was overcast afresh , and [he]0-i sighed . "[48-mrs. linton] But , [Nelly]80-ellen , if [I]0-i knocked [him]81-edgar down twenty times , that would n't make [him]81-edgar less handsome , or [me]0-i more so . [I]0-i wish [I]0-i had light hair and a fair skin , and was dressed , and behaved as well , and had a chance of being as rich as [he]81-edgar will be ! " "[2869-mamma] And cried for [mamma]2869-mamma , at every turn — " [I]2869-mamma added , "[2869-mamma] and trembled if [a country lad]663-a country lad heaved [his]663-a country lad fist against [you]48-mrs. linton , and sat at [home]239-home all day for a shower of rain.—O , [Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton , [you]48-mrs. linton are showing [a poor spirit]665-a poor spirit ! Come to the glass , and [I]0-i 'll let [you]48-mrs. linton see what [you]48-mrs. linton should wish . Do [you]48-mrs. linton mark those two lines between [your]48-mrs. linton eyes , and those thick brow , that instead of rising arched , sink in the middle , and [that couple of black fiends]666-that couple of black fiends , so deeply buried , who never open [their]666-that couple of black fiends windows boldly , but lurk glinting under them , like [devil 's spies]667-devil 's spies ? Wish and learn to smooth away the surly wrinkles , to raise [your]48-mrs. linton lids frankly , and change [the fiends]668-the fiends to [confidant]669-confidant , [innocent angels , suspecting and doubting nothing]670-innocent angels , suspecting and doubting nothing , and always seeing friends where [they]671-they are not sure of [foes]672-foes — Don't get the expression of [a vicious cur that appears to know the kicks it gets are its desert]673-a vicious cur that appears to know the kicks it gets are its desert , and yet , hates all [the world]267-the world , as well as [the kicker]675-the kicker , for what it suffers . " "[0-i] In other words , [I]0-i must wish for [Edgar Linton]81-edgar 's great blue eyes , and even forehead , " [he]0-i replied . "[0-i] [I]0-i do — and that wo nt help [me]0-i to [them]676-them . " "[678-a bad one] A good heart will help [you]48-mrs. linton to a bonny face [[my]0-i lad]677-my lad , " [I]678-a bad one continued , "[678-a bad one] if [you]48-mrs. linton were a regular black ; and [a bad one]678-a bad one will turn the bonniest into something worse than ugly . And now that [we]679-we 've done washing , and combing , and sulking — tell [me]0-i whether [you]48-mrs. linton do n't think [yourself]48-mrs. linton rather handsome ? [I]0-i 'll tell [you]48-mrs. linton , [I]0-i do . [You]48-mrs. linton 're fit for [a prince in disguise]680-a prince in disguise . Who knows , but [[your]48-mrs. linton father]2760-your father was [Emperor of [China]16-china]682-emperor of china , and [[your]48-mrs. linton mother]683-your mother [an Indian queen]684-an indian queen , each of [them]685-them able to buy up , with one week 's income , [Wuthering Heights]11-wuthering heights and [Thrushcross Grange]73-mr. linton together ? And [you]48-mrs. linton were kidnapped by [wicked sailors]686-wicked sailors , and brought to [England]17-england . Were [I]0-i in [[your]48-mrs. linton place]687-your place , [I]0-i would frame high notions of [my]0-i birth ; and the thoughts of what [I]0-i was should give [me]0-i courage and dignity to support the oppressions of [a little farmer]688-a little farmer ! " So [I]236-the fellow chattered on ; and [Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton gradually lost [his]2914-his frown , and began to look quite pleasant ; when , all at once , [our]2915-our conversation was interrupted by a rumbling sound moving up [the road]2638-the road and entering [the court]180-the court . [He]2914-his ran to the window , and [I]236-the fellow to the door , just in time to behold [the two Lintons]2918-the two lintons descend from the family carriage , smothered in cloaks and furs , and [the Earnshaws]2919-the earnshaws dismount from [their]2919-the earnshaws horses — [they]2919-the earnshaws often rode to [church]2667-church in winter . [Catherine]56-catherine took a hand of each of [the children]2755-the children , and brought [them]2755-the children into [the house]185-the house , and set [them]2755-the children before the fire which quickly put colour into [their]2755-the children white faces . [I]236-the fellow urged [[my]236-the fellow companion]350-my companion to hasten now , and show [his]350-my companion amiable humour ; and [he]350-my companion willingly obeyed : but ill luck would have it , that as [he]350-my companion opened the door leading from [the kitchen]194-the kitchen on one side , [Hindley]75-hindley opened it on the other ; [they]2919-the earnshaws met , and [the master]430-the master irritated at seeing [him]350-my companion clean and cheerful , or , perhaps , eager to keep [his]236-the fellow promise to [Mrs. Linton]48-mrs. linton shoved [him]350-my companion back with a sudden thrust , and angrily bade [Joseph]45-joseph "[236-the fellow] keep [the fellow]236-the fellow out of [the room]243-the room — send [him]236-the fellow into [the garret]2669-the garret till dinner is over . [He]236-the fellow 'll be cramming [his]236-the fellow fingers in the tarts , and stealing the fruit , if left alone with [them]692-them a minute . " "[236-the fellow] Nay , [sir]2571-sir , " [I]236-the fellow could not avoid answering , "[236-the fellow] [he]236-the fellow 'll touch nothing , not [he]236-the fellow — and , [I]0-i suppose , [he]236-the fellow must have [his]236-the fellow share of [the dainties]694-the dainties as well as [we]695-we . " "[236-the fellow] [He]236-the fellow shall have [his]236-the fellow share of [my]0-i hand , if [I]0-i catch [him]236-the fellow down stairs again till dark , " cried [Hindley]75-hindley . "[0-i] Begone , [[you]696-you vagabond]697-you vagabond ! What , [you]696-you are attempting the coxcomb , are [you]696-you ? Wait till [I]0-i get hold of those elegant locks — see if [I]0-i wo n't pull them a bit longer ! " "[0-i] They are long enough already , " observed [Master Linton]73-mr. linton , peeping from the door - way , "[0-i] [I]0-i wonder [they]698-they do n't make [his]236-the fellow head ache . It 's like [a colt]699-a colt 's mane over [his]236-the fellow eyes ! " [He]73-mr. linton ventured this remark without any intention to insult ; but , [Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton 's violent nature was not prepared to endure the appearance of impertinence from one whom [he]236-the fellow seemed to hate , even then , as [a rival]2926-a rival . [He]73-mr. linton seized a tureen of hot apple - sauce , the first thing that came under [his]73-mr. linton gripe , and dashed it full against [the speaker]2714-the speaker 's face and neck — who instantly commenced a lament that brought [Isabella]82-isabella and [Catherine]56-catherine hurrying to [the place]188-the place . [Mr. Earnshaw]75-hindley snatched up [the culprit]2929-the culprit directly and conveyed [him]2929-the culprit to [[his]75-hindley chamber]505-his chamber , where , doubtless , [he]75-hindley administered a rough remedy to cool the fit of passion , for [he]2929-the culprit reappeared red and breathless . [I]699-a colt got the dishcloth , and , rather spitefully , scrubbed [Edgar]81-edgar 's nose and mouth , affirming , it served [him]701-him right for meddling . [[His]81-edgar sister]577-his sister began weeping to go [home]239-home , and [Cathy]56-catherine stood by confounded , blushing for all . "[699-a colt] [You]700-you should not have spoken to [him]701-him ! " [she]56-catherine expostulated with [Master Linton]73-mr. linton . "[700-you] [He]701-him was in a bad temper , and now [you]700-you 've spoilt [your]700-you visit , and [he]701-him 'll be flogged — [I]0-i hate [him]701-him to be flogged ! [I]0-i ca n't eat [my]0-i dinner . Why did [you]700-you speak to [him]701-him , [Edgar]81-edgar ? " "[700-you] [I]0-i did n't , " sobbed [the youth]293-the youth , escaping from [my]0-i hands , and finishing the remainder of the purification with [his]293-the youth cambric pocket - handkerchief . "[0-i] [I]0-i promised [mamma]2869-mamma that [I]0-i would n't say one word to [him]701-him , and [I]0-i did n't ! " "[0-i] Well , do n't cry ! " replied [Catherine]56-catherine , contemptuously . "[0-i] [You]81-edgar 're not killed — don't make more mischief — [[my]0-i brother]2672-my brother is coming — be quiet ! Give over , [Isabella]82-isabella ! Has any body hurt [you]81-edgar ? " "[0-i] There , there , [children]704-children — to [your]704-children seats ! " cried [Hindley]75-hindley , bustling in . "[705-that brute of a lad] [That brute of a lad]705-that brute of a lad has warmed [me]0-i nicely . Next time , [Master Edgar]91-edgar , take the law into [your]704-children own fists — it will give [you]704-children an appetite ! ' [The little party]706-the little party recovered [its]706-the little party equanimity at sight of the fragrant feast . [They]706-the little party were hungry , after [their]706-the little party ride , and easily consoled , since no real harm had befallen [them]706-the little party . [Mr. Earnshaw]75-hindley carved bountiful platefuls ; and [the mistress]429-the mistress made [them]706-the little party merry with lively talk . [I]0-i waited behind [her]429-the mistress chair , and was pained to behold [Catherine]56-catherine , with dry eyes and an indifferent air , commence cutting up the wing of a goose before [her]56-catherine . " [An unfeeling child]2934-an unfeeling child , "[0-i] [I]0-i thought to [myself]0-i , " how lightly [she]429-the mistress dismisses [her]429-the mistress old playmate 's troubles . [I]0-i could not have imagined [her]429-the mistress to be so selfish . "[0-i] [She]429-the mistress lifted a mouthful to [her]429-the mistress lips ; then , [she]429-the mistress set it down again : [her]429-the mistress cheeks flushed , and the tears gushed over them . [She]429-the mistress slipped [her]429-the mistress fork to the floor , and hastily dived under the cloth to conceal [her]429-the mistress emotion . [I]0-i did not call [her]429-the mistress unfeeling long , for , [I]0-i perceived [she]429-the mistress was in purgatory throughout the day , and wearying to find an opportunity of getting by [herself]429-the mistress , or paying a visit to [Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton , who had been locked up by [the master]430-the master , as [I]0-i discovered , on endeavouring to introduce to [him]430-the master a private mess of victuals . In the evening [we]709-we had a dance , [Cathy]56-catherine begged that [he]430-the master might be liberated then , as [Isabella Linton]82-isabella had [no partner]710-no partner ; [her]429-the mistress entreaties were vain , and [I]0-i was appointed to supply the deficiency . [We]709-we got rid of all gloom in the excitement of the exercise , and [our]709-we pleasure was increased by the arrival of [the Gimmerton band]711-the gimmerton band , mustering fifteen strong ; a trumpet , a trombone , clarionets , bassoons , French horns , and a bass viol , besides [singers]712-singers . [They]711-the gimmerton band go the rounds of all [the respectable houses]713-the respectable houses , and receive contributions every Christmas , and [we]709-we esteemed it a first - rate treat to hear [them]711-the gimmerton band . After the usual carols had been sung , [we]709-we set [them]711-the gimmerton band to songs and glees . [Mrs. Earnshaw]76-mrs. earnshaw loved the music , and , so , [they]714-they gave [us]709-we plenty . [Catherine]56-catherine loved it too ; but [she]56-catherine said it sounded sweetest at the top of the steps , and [she]56-catherine went up in the dark : [I]0-i followed . [They]714-they shut [the house]185-the house door below , never noting [our]709-we absence , [it]716-it was so full of [people]445-people . [She]56-catherine made no stay at [the stairs]718-the stairs ' head , but mounted farther , to [the garret where [Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton was confined]719-the garret where heathcliff was confined ; and called [him]720-i . [He]720-i stubbornly declined answering for a while — [she]56-catherine persevered , and finally persuaded [him]720-i to hold communion with [her]56-catherine through the boards . [I]0-i let the poor things converse unmolested , till [I]0-i supposed the songs were going to cease , and [the singers]721-the singers to get some refreshment : then , [I]0-i clambered up the ladder to warn [her]56-catherine . [The little monkey]722-the little monkey had crept by the skylight of [one garret]723-one garret , along the roof , into the skylight of the other , and it was with the utmost difficultly [I]0-i could coax [her]56-catherine out again . [He]720-i went down ; [I]0-i set [him]720-i a stool by the fire , and offered [him]720-i a quantity of good things ; but , [he]720-i was sick and could eat little : and [my]0-i attempts to entertain [him]720-i were thrown away . [He]720-i leant [his]720-i two elbows on [his]720-i knees , and [his]720-i chin on [his]720-i hands , and remained wrapt in dumb meditation . "[0-i] " The clock is on the stroke of eleven , [sir]2571-sir . "[720-i] " No matter — [I'm]0-i not accustomed to go to bed in the long hours . "[0-i] " A terribly lazy mood , [I]720-i should say . "[720-i] " On the contrary , [a tiresomely active one]2941-a tiresomely active one .
