[I]0-i perceive that [people]445-people in [these regions]2943-these regions acquire over [people]445-people in [towns]2945-towns the value that a spider in [a dungeon]2946-a dungeon does over a spider in [a cottage]2947-a cottage , to [[their]445-people various occupants]2948-their various occupants ; and yet the deepened attraction is not entirely owing to the situation of [the looker - on]2949-the looker - on . " [I]92-kenneth delivered this message to [Mrs. Earnshaw]76-mrs. earnshaw ; [she]76-mrs. earnshaw seemed in flighty spirits , and replied merrily — "[92-kenneth] [I]0-i hardly spoke a word , [Ellen]80-ellen , and there [he]92-kenneth has gone out twice , crying . Till within a week of [her]76-mrs. earnshaw death that [gay]2977-gay heart never failed [her]76-mrs. earnshaw ; and [[her]76-mrs. earnshaw husband]2614-her husband persisted doggedly , nay , furiously , in affirming [her]76-mrs. earnshaw health improved every day . When [Kenneth]92-kenneth warned [him]0-i that [his]0-i medicines were useless at that stage of the malady , and [he]0-i need n't put [him]0-i to further expense by attending [her]749-i , [he]0-i retorted — "[0-i] [I]0-i know [you]0-i need not — [she]749-i 's well — [she]749-i does not want any more attendance from [you]0-i ! [She]749-i never was in a consumption . It was a fever ; and it is gone — [her]749-i pulse is as slow as [mine]0-i now , and [her]749-i cheek as cool . " [He]0-i told [[his]0-i wife]2670-his wife the same story , and [she]2670-his wife seemed to believe [him]0-i ; but one night , while leaning on [his]0-i shoulder , in the act of saying [she]2670-his wife thought [she]2670-his wife should be able to get up to - morrow , a fit of coughing took [her]2670-his wife — a very slight one — [he]0-i raised [her]2670-his wife in [his]0-i arms ; [she]2670-his wife put [her]2670-his wife two hands about [his]0-i neck , [her]2670-his wife face changed , and [she]2670-his wife was dead . As [the girl]739-the girl had anticipated ; [the child Hareton]2981-the child hareton , fell wholly into [my]749-i hands . [Mr. Earnshaw]75-hindley , provided [he]75-hindley saw [him]0-i healthy , and never heard [him]0-i cry , was contented , as far as regarded [him]0-i . For [himself]0-i , [he]0-i grew desperate ; [his]0-i sorrow was of that kind that will not lament , [he]0-i neither wept nor prayed — [he]0-i cursed and defied — execrated [God]66-god and [man]283-man , and gave [himself]0-i up to reckless dissipation . [The servants]2807-the servants could not bear [his]0-i tyrannical and evil conduct long : [Joseph]45-joseph and [I]749-i were [the only two that would stay]2984-the only two that would stay . [I]749-i had not the heart to leave [my]749-i charge ; and besides , [you]2985-you know , [I]749-i had been [[his]0-i foster sister]2986-his foster sister , and excused [his]0-i behaviour more readily than [a stranger]2580-a stranger would . [Joseph]45-joseph remained to hector over [tenants]2988-tenants and [labourers]2989-labourers ; and because it was [his]45-joseph vocation to be where [he]45-joseph had plenty of wickedness to reprove . [The master]430-the master 's bad ways and bad companions formed a pretty example for [Catherine]56-catherine and [Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton . [His]0-i treatment of [the latter]2991-the latter was enough to make [a fiend]2992-a fiend of [a saint]2993-a saint . And , truly , it appeared as if [the lad]2768-the lad were possessed of something diabolical at that period . [He]0-i delighted to witness [Hindley]75-hindley degrading [himself]0-i past redemption ; and became daily more notable for savage sullenness and ferocity . [I]749-i could not half tell what [an infernal house]2995-an infernal house [we]2996-we had . [The curate]2848-the curate dropped calling , and [nobody decent]2998-nobody decent came near [us]2996-we , at last ; unless , [Edgar Linton]81-edgar 's visits to [Miss Cathy]56-catherine might be an exception . At fifteen [she]56-catherine was [the queen of [the country - side]3000-the country - side]2999-the queen of the country - side ; [she]56-catherine had [no peer]3001-no peer : and [she]56-catherine did turn out [a haughty , headstrong creature]3002-a haughty , headstrong creature ! [I]749-i own [I]749-i did not like [her]56-catherine , after [her]56-catherine infancy was past ; and [I]749-i vexed [her]56-catherine frequently by trying to bring down [her]56-catherine arrogance ; [she]56-catherine never took an aversion to [me]749-i though . [She]56-catherine had a wondrous constancy to old attachments ; even [Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton kept [his]81-edgar hold on [her]56-catherine affections unalterably , and [young Linton]81-edgar , with all [his]81-edgar superiority , found it difficult to make an equally deep impression . [He]81-edgar was [[my]749-i late master]3003-my late master ; that is [his]81-edgar portrait over the fireplace . It used to hang on one side , and [[his]81-edgar wife]2670-his wife 's on the other ; but [her]56-catherine 's has been removed , or else [you]3005-you might see something of what [she]56-catherine was . Can [you]3005-you make that out ? [Mrs. Dean]71-mrs. dean raised the candle , and [I]749-i discerned a soft - featured face , exceedingly resembling [the young lady at the Heights]3006-the young lady at the heights , but more pensive and amiable in expression . It formed a sweet picture . The long light hair curled slightly on the temples ; the eyes were large and serious ; the figure almost too graceful . [I]749-i did not marvel how [Catherine Earnshaw]54-catherine could forget [[her]54-catherine first friend]3007-her first friend for such [an individual]3008-an individual . [I]749-i marvelled much how [he]750-he , with a mind to correspond with [[his]750-he person]3009-his person , could fancy [my]749-i idea of [Catherine Earnshaw]54-catherine . "[749-i] A very agreeable portrait , " [I]749-i observed to [the housekeeper]240-the housekeeper . "[749-i] Is it like ? " "[749-i] Yes , " [she]240-the housekeeper answered ; "[749-i] but [he]750-he looked better when [he]750-he was animated , that is [his]750-he every day countenance ; [he]750-he wanted spirit in general . " [Catherine]54-catherine had kept up [her]54-catherine acquaintance with [the Lintons]74-the lintons since [her]54-catherine five weeks ' residence among [them]74-the lintons ; and as [she]54-catherine had no temptation to show [her]54-catherine rough side in [their]74-the lintons company , and had the sense to be ashamed of being rude where [she]54-catherine experienced such invariable courtesy , [she]54-catherine imposed unwittingly on [the old lady]2880-the old lady and [gentleman]3012-gentleman , by [her]54-catherine ingenious cordiality ; gained the admiration of [Isabella]82-isabella , and the heart and soul of [[her]54-catherine brother]527-her brother — acquisitions that flattered [her]54-catherine from the first , for [she]54-catherine was full of ambition — and led [her]54-catherine to adopt a double character without exactly intending to deceive [anyone]3014-anyone . In the place where [she]54-catherine heard [Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton termed [a "[750-he] vulgar young ruffian , " and "[750-he] worse than a brute]3015-a " vulgar young ruffian , " and " worse than a brute , " [she]54-catherine took care not to act like [him]3015-a " vulgar young ruffian , " and " worse than a brute ; but at [home]239-home [she]54-catherine had small inclination to practise politeness that would only be laughed at , and restrain an unruly nature when it would bring [her]54-catherine neither credit , nor praise . [Mr. Edgar]91-edgar seldom mustered courage to visit [Wuthering Heights]11-wuthering heights openly . [He]91-edgar had a terror of [Earnshaw]54-catherine 's reputation , and shrunk from encountering [him]91-edgar , and yet , [he]91-edgar was always received with [our]3017-our best attempts at civility : [the master]430-the master [himself]430-the master , avoided offending [him]91-edgar — knowing why [he]91-edgar came , and if [he]91-edgar could not be gracious , kept out of the way . [I]56-catherine rather think [his]3015-a " vulgar young ruffian , " and " worse than a brute appearance there was distasteful to [Catherine]54-catherine ; [she]54-catherine was not artful , never played [the coquette]3019-the coquette , and had evidently an objection to [[her]54-catherine two friends]3020-her two friends meeting at all : for when [Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton expressed contempt of [Linton]48-mrs. linton , in [his]3015-a " vulgar young ruffian , " and " worse than a brute presence , [she]54-catherine could not half coincide , as [she]54-catherine did in [his]3015-a " vulgar young ruffian , " and " worse than a brute absence ; and when [Linton]48-mrs. linton evinced disgust , and antipathy to [Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton , [she]54-catherine dare not treat [his]3015-a " vulgar young ruffian , " and " worse than a brute sentiments with indifference , as if depreciation of [[her]54-catherine playmate]3021-her playmate were of scarcely any consequence to [her]54-catherine . [I]56-catherine 've had many a laugh at [her]54-catherine perplexities , and untold troubles , which [she]54-catherine vainly strove to hide from [my]56-catherine mockery . That sounds ill - natured — but [she]54-catherine was so proud , it became really impossible to pity [her]54-catherine distresses , till [she]54-catherine should be chastened into more humility . [She]54-catherine did bring [herself]54-catherine , finally , to confess , and confide in [me]56-catherine . There was not a soul else that [she]54-catherine might fashion into [an adviser]3022-an adviser . [Mr. Hindley]75-hindley had gone from [home]239-home , one afternoon ; and [Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton presumed to give [himself]48-mrs. linton a holiday , on the strength of it . [He]3015-a " vulgar young ruffian , " and " worse than a brute had reached the age of sixteen then , [I]56-catherine think , and without having bad features or being deficient in intellect , [he]3015-a " vulgar young ruffian , " and " worse than a brute contrived to convey an impression of inward and outward repulsiveness that [his]3015-a " vulgar young ruffian , " and " worse than a brute present aspect retains no traces of . In the first place , [he]3015-a " vulgar young ruffian , " and " worse than a brute had , by that time , lost the benefit of [his]3015-a " vulgar young ruffian , " and " worse than a brute early education : continual hard work , begun soon and concluded late , had extinguished any curiosity [he]3015-a " vulgar young ruffian , " and " worse than a brute once possessed in pursuit of knowledge , and any love for books , or learning . [His]3015-a " vulgar young ruffian , " and " worse than a brute childhood 's sense of superiority , instilled into [him]3015-a " vulgar young ruffian , " and " worse than a brute by the favours of [old Mr. Earnshaw]75-hindley , was faded away . [He]3015-a " vulgar young ruffian , " and " worse than a brute struggled long to keep up an equality with [Catherine]54-catherine in [her]54-catherine studies and yielded with poignant though silent regret : but , [he]3015-a " vulgar young ruffian , " and " worse than a brute yielded completely ; and there was no prevailing on [him]3015-a " vulgar young ruffian , " and " worse than a brute to take a step in the way of moving upward , when [he]3015-a " vulgar young ruffian , " and " worse than a brute found [he]3015-a " vulgar young ruffian , " and " worse than a brute must , necessarily , sink beneath [his]3015-a " vulgar young ruffian , " and " worse than a brute former level . Then personal appearance sympathised with mental deterioration ; [he]3015-a " vulgar young ruffian , " and " worse than a brute acquired a slouching gait , and ignoble look ; [his]3015-a " vulgar young ruffian , " and " worse than a brute naturally reserved disposition was exaggerated into an almost idiotic excess of unsociable moroseness ; and [he]3015-a " vulgar young ruffian , " and " worse than a brute took a grim pleasure , apparently , in exciting the aversion rather than the esteem of [[his]3015-a " vulgar young ruffian , " and " worse than a brute few acquaintance]3024-his few acquaintance . [Catherine]54-catherine and [he]3015-a " vulgar young ruffian , " and " worse than a brute were [constant companions]3025-constant companions still , at [his]3015-a " vulgar young ruffian , " and " worse than a brute seasons of respite from labour ; but , [he]3015-a " vulgar young ruffian , " and " worse than a brute had ceased to express [his]3015-a " vulgar young ruffian , " and " worse than a brute fondness for [her]54-catherine in words , and recoiled with angry suspicion from [her]54-catherine girlish caresses , as if conscious there could be no gratification in lavishing such marks of affection on [him]3015-a " vulgar young ruffian , " and " worse than a brute . On the before - named occasion [he]3015-a " vulgar young ruffian , " and " worse than a brute came into [the house]185-the house to announce [his]3015-a " vulgar young ruffian , " and " worse than a brute intention of doing nothing , while [I]56-catherine was assisting [Miss Cathy]56-catherine to arrange [her]56-catherine dress — [she]56-catherine had not reckoned on [his]3015-a " vulgar young ruffian , " and " worse than a brute taking it into [his]3015-a " vulgar young ruffian , " and " worse than a brute head to be idle , and imagining [she]56-catherine would have the whole place to [herself]56-catherine , [she]56-catherine managed , by some means , to inform [Mr. Edgar]91-edgar of [[her]56-catherine brother]527-her brother 's absence , and was then preparing to receive [him]3015-a " vulgar young ruffian , " and " worse than a brute . [She]276-the young lady never had power to conceal [her]276-the young lady passion , it always set [her]276-the young lady whole complexion in a blaze . "[0-i] What 's that then ? " [I]56-catherine retorted showing a decided purple witness to refute [her]276-the young lady . "[56-catherine] [Catherine]56-catherine , love ! [Catherine]56-catherine ! [Little Hareton]47-hareton , who followed [me]56-catherine everywhere , and was sitting near [me]56-catherine on the floor , at seeing [my]56-catherine tears commenced crying [himself]47-hareton , and sobbed out complaints against "[56-catherine] wicked aunt [Cathy]56-catherine , " which drew [her]276-the young lady fury on to [his]47-hareton unlucky head : [she]276-the young lady seized [his]47-hareton shoulders , and shook [him]47-hareton till [the poor child]3042-the poor child waxed livid , and [Edgar]91-edgar thoughtlessly laid hold of [her]276-the young lady hands to deliver [him]47-hareton . [Edgar]81-edgar persevered in [his]81-edgar resolution as far as [the court]180-the court ; there , [he]81-edgar lingered . [I]0-i resolved to encourage [him]81-edgar . "[0-i] [Miss]771-miss is dreadfully wayward , [sir]2571-sir ! " [I]771-miss called out . "[771-miss] As bad as [any marred child]773-any marred child — [you'd]2571-sir better be riding [home]239-home , or else [she]771-miss will be sick , only to grieve [us]775-us . " [The soft thing]3049-the soft thing looked askance through the window — [he]81-edgar possessed the power to depart , as much as a cat possesses the power to leave a mouse half killed , or a bird half eaten — Ah , [I]2571-sir thought ; there will be no saving [him]81-edgar — [He]81-edgar 's doomed , and flies to [his]81-edgar fate ! And , so it was ; [he]81-edgar turned abruptly , hastened into [the house]185-the house again , shut the door behind [him]81-edgar ; and , when [I]2571-sir went in a while after to inform [them]3051-them that [Earnshaw]75-hindley had come [home]239-home rabid drunk , ready to pull the old place about [our]775-us ears , ( [his]75-hindley ordinary frame of mind in that condition ) [I]2571-sir saw the quarrel had merely affected a closer intimacy — had broken the outworks of youthful timidity , and enabled [them]3051-them to forsake the disguise of friendship , and confess [themselves]3051-them [lovers]3053-lovers . Intelligence of [Mr. Hindley]75-hindley 's arrival drove [Linton]81-edgar speedily to [his]81-edgar horse , and [Catherine]56-catherine to [[her]56-catherine chamber]2833-her chamber . [I]2571-sir went to hide [little Hareton]47-hareton , and to take the shot out of [the master]430-the master 's fowling piece which [he]81-edgar was fond of playing with in [his]81-edgar insane excitement , to the hazard of the lives of any who provoked , or even , attracted [his]81-edgar notice too much ; and [I]2571-sir had hit upon the plan of removing it , that [he]81-edgar might do less mischief , if [he]81-edgar did go the length of firing the gun . [He]81-edgar entered , vociferating oaths dreadful to hear ; and caught [me]2571-sir in the act of stowing [[his]81-edgar son]475-his son away in the kitchen cupboard . [Hareton]47-hareton was impressed with a wholesome terror of encountering either [his]47-hareton wild - beast 's fondness , or [[his]47-hareton madman]3057-his madman 's rage — for in one [he]47-hareton ran a chance of being squeezed and kissed to death , and in the other of being flung into the fire , or dashed against the wall — and [the poor thing]2815-the poor thing remained perfectly quiet wherever [I]2571-sir chose to put [him]47-hareton . "[2571-sir] [There]2637-there [I]0-i 've found it out at last ! " cried [Hindley]75-hindley , pulling [me]0-i back by the skin of the neck , like a dog , "[0-i] By Heaven and Hell , [you]777-you 've sworn between [you]777-you to murder [that child]778-that child ! [I]0-i know how it is , now , that [he]778-that child is always out of [my]0-i way . But , with the help of [Satan]95-satan , [I]0-i shall make [you]777-you swallow the carving knife , [Nelly]80-ellen ! [you]777-you need n't laugh ; for [I]0-i 've just crammed [Kenneth]92-kenneth head - downmost , in [the Blackhorse marsh]779-the blackhorse marsh ; and two is the same as one — and [I]0-i want to kill some of [you]777-you , [I]0-i shall have no rest till [I]0-i do ! " "[777-you] But [I]0-i do n't like the carving knife , [Mr. Hindley]75-hindley ; " [I]0-i answered , it has been cutting red herrings — [I'd]0-i rather be shot if [you]0-i please . "[0-i] " [You]0-i 'd rather be damned ! "[0-i] [he]0-i said , " and so [you]0-i shall — No law in [England]17-england can hinder [a man]2653-a man from keeping [[his]2653-a man house]3060-his house decent , and [mine]0-i 's abominable ! open [your]0-i mouth . "[0-i] [He]0-i held the knife in [his]0-i hand , and pushed its point between [my]0-i teeth : but , for [my]0-i part [I]0-i was never much afraid of [his]0-i vagaries . [I]0-i spat out , and affirmed it tasted detestably — [I]0-i would not take it on any account . " "[0-i] Oh ! " said [he]0-i releasing [me]0-i , [I]0-i see [that hideous little villain]3061-that hideous little villain is not [Hareton]47-hareton — [I]0-i beg [your]0-i pardon , [Nell]80-ellen — if it be [he]0-i deserves flaying alive for not running to welcome [me]0-i , and for screaming as if [I]0-i were [a goblin]3062-a goblin . [Unnatural cub]96-unnatural cub , come hither ! [I]0-i 'll teach [thee]0-i to impose on [a good - hearted , deluded father]3063-a good - hearted , deluded father — Now , do n't [you]0-i think [the lad]2768-the lad would be handsomer cropped ? It makes a dog fiercer , and [I]0-i love something fierce — Get [me]0-i a scissors — something fierce and trim ! Besides , it 's infernal affectation — devilish conceit , it is to cherish [our]3065-our ears — [we're]3065-our asses enough without them . [He]45-joseph 'll be as much to [me]0-i as [he]45-joseph has been all [his]45-joseph lifetime . [Edgar]81-edgar must shake off [his]45-joseph antipathy , and tolerate [him]45-joseph , at least . [He]45-joseph will when [he]45-joseph learns [my]0-i true feelings towards [him]45-joseph . [Nelly]80-ellen , [I]0-i see now , [you]80-ellen think [me]0-i [a selfish wretch]828-a selfish wretch , but , did it never strike [you]80-ellen that , if [Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton and [I]0-i married , [we]829-we should be [beggars]830-beggars ? whereas , if [I]0-i marry [Linton]81-edgar , [I]0-i can aid [Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton to rise , and place [him]45-joseph out of [[my]0-i brother]2672-my brother 's power . " "[45-joseph] With [[your]80-ellen husband]832-your husband 's money , [Miss Catherine]56-catherine ? " [I]56-catherine asked . "[56-catherine] [You]80-ellen 'll find [him]45-joseph not so pliable as [you]80-ellen calculate upon : and , though [I]0-i 'm hardly [a judge]833-a judge , [I]0-i think that 's the worst motive [you]80-ellen 've given yet for being [the wife of [young Linton]81-edgar]834-the wife of young linton . " "[0-i] It is not , " retorted [she]80-ellen , "[0-i] it is the best ! The others were the satisfaction of [my]0-i whims ; and for [Edgar]81-edgar 's sake , too , to satisfy [him]81-edgar . This is for the sake of [one who comprehends in [his]835-one who comprehends in his person person]835-one who comprehends in his person [my]0-i feelings to [Edgar]81-edgar and [myself]0-i . [I]0-i can not express it ; but surely [you]80-ellen and [every body]3089-every body have a notion that there is , or should be an existence of [yours]80-ellen beyond [you]80-ellen . What were the use of [my]0-i creation if [I]0-i were entirely contained here ? [My]0-i great miseries in [this world]837-this world have been [Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton 's miseries , and [I]0-i watched and felt each from the beginning ; [my]0-i great thought in living is [himself]48-mrs. linton . If all else perished , and [he]81-edgar remained , [I]0-i should still continue to be ; and , if all else remained , and [he]81-edgar were annihilated , [the Universe]19-the universe would turn to [a mighty stranger]838-a mighty stranger . [I]0-i should not seem a part of it . [My]0-i love for [Linton]81-edgar is like the foliage in [the woods]839-the woods . Time will change it , [I]0-i 'm well aware , as winter changes [the trees]840-the trees — [my]0-i love for [Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton resembles [the eternal rocks beneath]841-the eternal rocks beneath — a source of little visible delight , but necessary . [Nelly]80-ellen , [I]0-i am [Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton — [he]81-edgar 's always , always in [my]0-i mind — not as a pleasure , any more than [I]0-i am always a pleasure to [myself]0-i — but , as [my]0-i own being — so , do n't talk of [our]842-our separation again — it is impracticable ; and — " [She]80-ellen paused , and hid [her]80-ellen face in the folds of [my]843-miss gown ; but [I]843-miss jerked it forcibly away . [I]843-miss was out of patience with [her]80-ellen folly ! "[843-miss] If [I]0-i can make any sense of [your]80-ellen nonsense , [Miss]843-miss , " [I]0-i said , "[0-i] it only goes to convince [me]0-i that [you]80-ellen are ignorant of the duties [you]80-ellen undertake in marrying ; or else , that [you]80-ellen are [a wicked , unprincipled girl]844-a wicked , unprincipled girl . But , trouble [me]0-i with no more secrets . [I]0-i 'll not promise to keep them . " "[0-i] [You]0-i 'll keep that ? " [she]80-ellen asked , eagerly . "[0-i] No , [I]0-i 'll not promise , " [I]0-i repeated . [She]80-ellen was about to insist , when the entrance of [Joseph]45-joseph finished [our]3103-we conversation ; and [Catherine]56-catherine removed [her]56-catherine seat to a corner , and nursed [Hareton]97-hareton , while [I]0-i made the supper . After it was cooked , [[my]0-i fellow servant]3104-my fellow servant and [I]0-i began to quarrel who should carry some to [Mr. Hindley]75-hindley ; and [we]3103-we did n't settle it till all was nearly cold . Then [we]3103-we came to the agreement that [we]3103-we would let [him]45-joseph ask , if [he]45-joseph wanted any , for [we]3103-we feared particularly to go into [his]45-joseph presence when [he]45-joseph had been sometime alone . "[0-i] Und hah is n't that nowt comed in frough th ' field , be this time ? What is [he]845-i abaht ? girt eedle seeght ! " demanded [the old man]2774-the old man , looking round for [Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton . "[845-i] [I]0-i 'll call [him]845-i , " [I]845-i replied . "[845-i] [He]845-i 's in [the barn]249-the barn , [I]0-i 've no doubt . " [I]845-i went and called , but got no answer . On returning , [I]845-i whispered to [Catherine]56-catherine that [he]45-joseph had heard a good part of what [she]56-catherine said , [I]845-i was sure ; and told how [I]845-i saw [him]45-joseph quit [the kitchen]194-the kitchen just as [she]56-catherine complained of [[her]56-catherine brother]527-her brother 's conduct regarding [him]45-joseph . [She]56-catherine jumped up in a fine fright — flung [Hareton]97-hareton onto the settle , and ran to seek for [[her]56-catherine friend]2906-her friend [herself]56-catherine , not taking leisure to consider why [she]56-catherine was so flurried , or how [her]56-catherine talk would have affected [him]45-joseph . [She]56-catherine was absent such a while that [Joseph]45-joseph proposed [we]3109-they should wait no longer . [He]45-joseph cunningly conjectured [they]3109-they were staying away in order to avoid hearing [his]45-joseph protracted blessing . [They]3109-they were "[845-i] ill eneugh for ony fahl manners , " [he]45-joseph affirmed . And , on [their]3109-they behalf , [he]45-joseph added , that night a special prayer to the usual quarter of an hour 's supplication before meat , and would have tacked another to the end of the grace , had not [[his]45-joseph young mistress]3110-his young mistress broken in upon [him]45-joseph with a hurried command , that [he]45-joseph must run down [the road]2638-the road , and , wherever [Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton had rambled , find and make [him]847-he re - enter directly ! "[845-i] " [I]847-he want to speak to [him]847-he , and [I]847-he must , before [I]847-he go up - [stairs]416-stairs , [she]847-he said . "[847-he] And the gate is open , [he]847-he is somewhere out of hearing ; for [he]847-he would not reply , though [I]0-i shouted at the top of the fold as loud as [I]0-i could . " [Joseph]45-joseph objected at first ; [she]847-he was too much in earnest , however , to suffer contradiction ; and , at last , [he]45-joseph placed [his]45-joseph hat on [his]45-joseph head , and walked grumbling forth . Meantime , [Catherine]56-catherine paced up and down the floor , exclaiming — "[0-i] [I]0-i wonder where [he]847-he is — [I]0-i wonder where [he]847-he can be ! " What did [I]0-i say , [Nelly]80-ellen ? [I]0-i 've forgotten . Was [he]847-he vexed at [my]0-i bad humour this afternoon ? [Dear]634-dear ! tell [me]0-i what [I]0-i 've said to grieve [him]847-he ? [I]0-i do wish [he]847-he 'd come . [I]0-i do wish be would ! "[0-i] " What a noise for nothing ! "[0-i] [I]0-i cried , though rather uneasy [myself]0-i . " What a trifle scares [you]80-ellen ! It 's surely no great cause of alarm that [Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton should take a moonlight saunter on [the moors]352-the moors , or , even lie too sulky to speak to [us]3115-us , in [the hay - loft]3116-the hay - loft . [I]0-i 'll engage [he]847-he 's lurking there . See , if [I]0-i do n't ferret [him]847-he out ! "[0-i] [I]0-i departed to renew [my]0-i search ; its result was disappointment , and [Joseph]45-joseph 's quest ended in the same . " [Yon lad]3117-yon lad gets war un war ! " [He]847-he 's left [th]3118-yah ' yate ut t ' full swing , and [miss]3119-miss 's pony has trodden dahn two rigs uh corn , un plottered through , raight o'er intuh t ' meadow ! "[45-joseph] " Have [you]848-you found [Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton , [you]848-you ass ? "[56-catherine] interrupted [Catherine]56-catherine . " Have [you]848-you been looking for [him]847-he , as [I]56-catherine ordered ? "[56-catherine] " Aw sud more likker look for th ' horse , "[848-you] [he]848-you replied . " It ' ud be [tuh]3124-tuh more sense . "[848-you] It was a very dark evening for summer : the clouds appeared inclined to thunder , and [I]0-i said [we]849-we had better all sit down ; the approaching rain would be certain to bring [him]848-you [home]239-home without further trouble . However , [Catherine]56-catherine would not be persuaded into tranquillity . [She]56-catherine kept wandering to and fro , from the gate to the door , in a state of agitation , which permitted no repose : and , at length , took up a permanent situation on one side of the wall , near [the road]2638-the road ; where , heedless of [my]0-i expostulations , and the growling thunder , and the great drops that began to plash around [her]56-catherine , [she]56-catherine remained calling , at intervals , and then listening , and then crying outright . [She]56-catherine beat [Hareton]97-hareton , or [any child]852-any child , at a good , passionate fit of crying . About midnight , while [we]849-we still sat up , the storm came rattling over [the Heights]11-wuthering heights in full fury . There was a violent wind , as well as thunder , and either one or [the other]289-the other split a tree off at the corner of [the building]854-the building ; a huge bough fell across the roof , and knocked down a portion of the east chimney - stack , sending a clatter of stones and soot into the kitchen fire . [We]849-we thought a bolt had fallen in the middle of [us]849-we , and [Joseph]45-joseph swung onto [his]45-joseph knees , beseeching [the Lord]2633-the lord to remember [the Patriarchs [Noah]101-noah and [Lot]102-lot]856-the patriarchs noah and lot ; and , as in former times , spare [the righteous]857-the righteous , though [he]45-joseph smote the ungodly . [I]0-i felt some sentiment that it must be a judgment on [us]849-we also . [The Jonah]103-the jonah , in [my]0-i mind , was [Mr. Earnshaw]75-hindley , and [I]0-i shook the handle of [[his]103-the jonah den]858-his den that [I]0-i might ascertain if [he]103-the jonah were yet living . [He]103-the jonah replied audibly enough , in a fashion which made [[my]0-i companion]350-my companion vociferate more clamorously than before that a wide distinction might be drawn between [saints like [himself]103-the jonah , and sinners like [[his]103-the jonah master]216-his master]860-saints like himself , and sinners like his master . But , the uproar passed away in twenty minutes , leaving [us]849-we all unharmed , excepting [Cathy]56-catherine , who got thoroughly drenched for [her]56-catherine obstinacy in refusing to take shelter , and standing bonnetless and shawlless to catch as much water as [she]56-catherine could with [her]56-catherine hair and clothes . [She]56-catherine came in , and lay down on the settle , all soaked as [she]56-catherine was , turning [her]56-catherine face to the back , and putting [her]56-catherine hands before it . " Well Miss ! "[0-i] [I]0-i exclaimed , touching [her]56-catherine shoulder . " [You]56-catherine are not bent on getting [your]56-catherine death , are [you]56-catherine ? Do [you]56-catherine know what o'clock it is ? Half - past twelve . Come ! come to bed ; there 's no use waiting longer on [that foolish boy]3127-that foolish boy — [he'll]3127-that foolish boy be gone to [Gimmerton]14-gimmerton , and [he]3127-that foolish boy 'll stay [there]2637-there now . [He]3127-that foolish boy guesses [we]3129-we should n't wake for [him]3127-that foolish boy till this late hour ; at least , [he]3127-that foolish boy guesses that only [Mr. Hindley]75-hindley would be up ; and [he]3127-that foolish boy 'd rather avoid having the door opened by [the master]430-the master . "[0-i] " Nay , nay , [he]3127-that foolish boy 's noan at [Gimmerton]14-gimmerton ! "[45-joseph] said [Joseph]45-joseph . " Aw 's niver wonder , bud [he]3127-that foolish boy 's at t ' bothoin uf a bog - hoile . This visitation worn't for nowt , und aw wod [hev]3131-hev [ye]3131-hev tub look aht . [Miss,—yah]104-miss,—yah muh be t ' next . Thank [Hivin]105-hivin for all ! All warks togither for gooid tuh [them]3132-them as is chozzen , and piked aht froo ' th ' rubbidge ! [Yah]3131-hev knaw whet t ' Scripture ses — "[45-joseph] And [he]45-joseph began quoting several texts ; refering [us]862-us to the chapters and verses , where [we]862-us might find them . [I]0-i having vainly begged [the wilful girl]863-the wilful girl to rise and remove [her]863-the wilful girl wet things , left [him]45-joseph preaching , and [her]863-the wilful girl shivering , and betook [myself]0-i to bed with [little Hareton]97-hareton ; who slept as fast as if every one had been sleeping round [him]45-joseph . [I]0-i heard [Joseph]45-joseph read on a while afterwards ; then , [I]0-i distinguished [his]45-joseph slow step on the ladder , and then [I]0-i dropt asleep . Coming down somewhat later than usual , [I]0-i saw , by the sunbeams piercing the chinks of the shutters . [Miss Catherine]56-catherine still seated near [the fire - place]864-the fire - place . [The house]185-the house door was ajar , too light entered from [its]185-the house unclosed windows , [Hindley]75-hindley had come out , and stood on the [kitchen hearth]866-kitchen hearth , haggard and drowsy . " What ails [you]0-i , [Cathy]56-catherine ? "[45-joseph] [he]45-joseph was saying when [I]0-i entered ; " [You]0-i look as dismal as a drowned whelp — Why are [you]0-i [so damp and pale child]3133-so damp and pale child ? "[45-joseph] " [I]56-catherine 've been wet ; "[56-catherine] [she]56-catherine answered reluctantly " and [I]45-joseph 'm cold , that 's all . "[45-joseph] " Oh , [she]56-catherine is naughty ! "[0-i] [I]0-i cried , perceiving [the master]430-the master to be tolerably sober ; " [She]56-catherine got steeped in the shower of yesterday evening , and there [she]56-catherine has sat , the night through , and [I]0-i could n't prevail on [her]56-catherine to stir . "[0-i] [Mr. Earnshaw]75-hindley stared at [us]868-us in surprise . " The night through , "[75-hindley] [he]75-hindley repeated . " What kept [her]56-catherine up , not fear of the thunder , surely ? That was over , hours since . "[75-hindley] Neither of [us]868-us wished to mention [Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton 's absence , as long as [we]868-us could conceal it ; so , [I]0-i replied , [I]0-i did n't know how [she]56-catherine took it into [her]56-catherine head to sit up ; and [she]56-catherine said nothing . The morning was fresh and cool ; [I]0-i threw back the lattice , and presently [the room]243-the room filled with sweet scents from [the garden]2718-the garden : but [Catherine]56-catherine called peevishly to [me]0-i . " [Ellen]80-ellen , shut the window . [I]56-catherine 'm starving ! "[56-catherine] And [her]56-catherine teeth chattered as [she]56-catherine shrunk closer to the almost extinguished embers . " [She]56-catherine 's ill — "[75-hindley] said [Hindley]75-hindley , taking [her]56-catherine wrist , " [I]75-hindley suppose that 's the reason [she]56-catherine would not go to bed — Damn it ! [I]75-hindley do n't want to be troubled with more sickness , here — What took [you]0-i into the rain ? "[75-hindley] " Running after [t'lads]3134-t'lads , as usuald ! "[45-joseph] croaked [Joseph]45-joseph , catching an opportunity , from [our]871-our hesitation , to thrust in [his]45-joseph evil tongue . " If Aw wur [yah]3135-yah , [maister]2658-maister , Aw'd just slam t'boards [i]45-joseph ' [their]3134-t'lads faces all on ['em]3137-'em , gentle and simple ! Never a day ut yah're off , but yon cat uh [Linton]56-catherine comes sneaking hither — and [Miss Nelly]3138-miss nelly shoo 's [a fine lass]3139-a fine lass ! shoo sits watching for [ye]0-i [i]45-joseph ' t'kitchen ; and as [yah're]0-i in at one door , [he]45-joseph 's aht at t'other — Und , then , [wer]871-our [grand lady]3140-grand lady goes a coorting uf hor side ! It 's bonny behaviour , lurking amang t'flields , after twelve ut ' night , wi that fahl , flaysome divil uf [a gipsy]613-a gipsy , [Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton , ! [They]3134-t'lads think [Aw'm]106-aw'm blind ; but [Aw'm noan]106-aw'm , now't ut t'soart ! [Aw seed young Linton]48-mrs. linton , boath coming and going , and [Aw seed]107-aw [yah]48-mrs. linton ( directing [his]45-joseph discourse to [me]45-joseph . ) [Yah]48-mrs. linton gooid fur nowt , [slattenly witch]3142-slattenly witch ! nip up nud bolt intuh th ' haks , t ' minute [yah]48-mrs. linton heard [t'maister]108-t'maister 's horse fit clatter up [t ' road]3143-t ' road . "[45-joseph] Silence , [eavesdropper]872-eavesdropper ! " cried [Catherine]56-catherine , "[872-eavesdropper] None of [your]872-eavesdropper insolence , before [me]0-i ! " [Edgar Linton]81-edgar , came yesterday , by chance , [Hindley]75-hindley : and it was [I]872-eavesdropper who told [him]45-joseph to be off : because , [I]872-eavesdropper knew [you]872-eavesdropper would not like to have met [him]45-joseph as [you]872-eavesdropper were . "[872-eavesdropper] " [You]56-catherine lie , [Cathy]56-catherine , no doubt , "[527-her brother] answered [[her]873-her brother]527-her brother , " and [you]56-catherine are [a confounded simpleton]3144-a confounded simpleton ! But , never mind [Linton]81-edgar , at present — Tell [me]527-her brother , were [you]872-eavesdropper not with [Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton , last night ? Speak the truth , now . [You]872-eavesdropper need not be afraid of harming [him]45-joseph — Though [I]527-her brother hate [him]45-joseph as much as ever , [he]45-joseph did [me]527-her brother a good turn , a short time since , that will make [my]527-her brother conscience tender of breaking [his]45-joseph neck . To prevent it , [I]527-her brother shall send [him]45-joseph about [his]45-joseph business , this very morning ; and after [he]45-joseph 's gone , [I]527-her brother 'd advise [you]872-eavesdropper all to look sharp , [I]527-her brother shall only have the more humour for [you]872-eavesdropper ! "[527-her brother] " [I]56-catherine never saw [Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton last night , "[56-catherine] answered [Catherine]56-catherine , beginning to sob bitterly : " and if [yon]3145-yon do turn [him]45-joseph out of doors , [I]56-catherine 'll go with [him]45-joseph . But , perhaps , [you]3145-yon 'll never have an opportunity — perhaps , [he]45-joseph 's gone . "[56-catherine] Here [she]56-catherine burst into uncontrollable grief , and the remainder of [her]56-catherine words were inarticulate . [Hindley]75-hindley lavished on [her]56-catherine a torrent of scornful abuse , and bid [her]56-catherine get to [[her]56-catherine room]800-her room immediately , or [she]56-catherine should n't cry for nothing ! [I]0-i obliged [her]56-catherine to obey ; and [I]0-i shall never forget what a scene [she]56-catherine acted , when [we]876-we reached [[her]56-catherine chamber]2833-her chamber . It terrified [me]0-i — [I]0-i thought [she]56-catherine was going mad , and [I]0-i begged [Joseph]45-joseph to run for [the doctor]528-the doctor . It proved the commencement of delirium : [Mr. Kenneth]92-kenneth , as soon as [he]92-kenneth saw [her]56-catherine , pronounced [her]56-catherine dangerously ill ; [she]56-catherine had a fever . [He]92-kenneth bled [her]56-catherine , and [he]92-kenneth told [me]0-i to let [her]56-catherine live on whey , and water gruel ; and take care [she]56-catherine did not throw [herself]56-catherine down [stairs]416-stairs , or out of the window ; and then [he]92-kenneth left ; for , [he]92-kenneth had enough to do in [the parish]2795-the parish where two or three miles was the ordinary distance between [cottage]881-cottage and [cottage]881-cottage . Though [I]0-i can not say [I]0-i made [a gentle nurse]883-a gentle nurse , and [Joseph]45-joseph and [the master]430-the master were no better ; and , though [[our]885-our patient]886-our patient was as wearisome and headstrong as [a patient]887-a patient could be , [she]56-catherine weathered it through . [Old Mrs. Linton]109-old mrs. linton paid [us]885-our several visits , to be sure ; and set things to rights , and scolded and ordered [us]885-our all ; and when [Catherine]56-catherine was convalescent , [she]56-catherine insisted on conveying [her]56-catherine to [Thrushcross Grange]73-mr. linton ; for which deliverance [we]885-our were very grateful . But , [the poor dame]888-the poor dame had reason to repent of [her]888-the poor dame kindness ; [she]888-the poor dame , and [[her]888-the poor dame husband]2614-her husband , both took the fever , and died within a few days of [each other]313-each other . [[Our]885-our young lady]891-our young lady returned to [us]885-our , saucier , and more passionate , and haughtier than ever . [Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton had never been heard of since the evening of the thunder - storm , and , one day , [I]0-i had the misfortune , when [she]891-our young lady had provoked [me]0-i exceedingly , to lay the blame of [his]892-his disappearance on [her]891-our young lady ( where indeed it belonged , as [she]891-our young lady well knew . ) From that period for several months , [she]891-our young lady ceased to hold any communication with [me]0-i save in the relation of [a mere servant]893-a mere servant . [Joseph]45-joseph fell under a ban also ; [he]45-joseph would speak [his]45-joseph mind , and lecture [her]891-our young lady all the same as if [she]891-our young lady were [a little girl]2874-a little girl ; and [she]891-our young lady esteemed [herself]891-our young lady [a woman]524-a woman , and [[our]885-our mistress]896-our mistress ; and thought that [her]891-our young lady recent illness gave [her]891-our young lady a claim to be treated with consideration . Then [the doctor]528-the doctor had said that [she]891-our young lady would not bear crossing much , [she]891-our young lady ought to have [her]891-our young lady own way ; and it was nothing less than murder , in [her]891-our young lady eyes , for [any one]2573-any one , to presume to stand up and contradict [her]891-our young lady . From [Mr. Earnshaw]75-hindley , and [[his]75-hindley companions]899-his companions [she]891-our young lady kept aloof , and tutored by [Kenneth]92-kenneth , and serious threats of a fit that often attended [her]891-our young lady rages , [[her]891-our young lady brother]527-her brother allowed [her]891-our young lady whatever [she]891-our young lady pleased to demand , and generally avoided aggravating [her]891-our young lady fiery temper . [He]75-hindley was rather too indulgent in humouring [her]891-our young lady caprices ; not from affection , but from pride ; [he]75-hindley wished earnestly to see [her]891-our young lady bring honour to [the family]335-the family by an alliance with [the Lintons]74-the lintons , and , as long as [she]891-our young lady let [him]75-hindley alone , [she]891-our young lady might trample [us]902-us like [slaves]903-slaves for ought [he]75-hindley cared ! [Edgar Linton]81-edgar , as [multitudes]904-multitudes have been before , and will be after [him]75-hindley , was infatuated ; and believed [himself]75-hindley [the happiest man alive]905-the happiest man alive on the day [he]75-hindley led [her]891-our young lady to [Gimmerton chapel]906-gimmerton chapel , three years subsequent to [[his]75-hindley father]518-his father 's death . Much against [my]0-i inclination , [I]0-i was persuaded to leave [Wuthering Heights]11-wuthering heights and accompany [her]891-our young lady [here]2574-here . [Little Hareton]47-hareton was nearly five years old , and [I]0-i had just began to teach [him]47-hareton [his]47-hareton letters : [We]909-we made a sad parting , but [Catherine]56-catherine 's tears were more powerful than [ours]909-we — When [I]0-i refused to go , and when [she]56-catherine found [her]56-catherine entreaties did not move [me]0-i , [she]56-catherine went lamenting to [[her]56-catherine husband]2614-her husband , and [brother]911-brother . [The former]304-the former offered [me]0-i munificent wages ; [the latter]2991-the latter ordered [me]0-i to pack up — [he]47-hareton wanted [no women in [the house]185-the house]914-no women in the house , [he]47-hareton said , now that there was [no mistress]916-no mistress ; and as to [Hareton]47-hareton , [the curate]2848-the curate should take [him]47-hareton in hand , by and bye . And so , [I]0-i had but one choice left , to do as [I]0-i was ordered — [I]0-i told [the master]430-the master [he]430-the master got rid of [all decent people]919-all decent people only to run to ruin a little faster ; [I]0-i kissed [Hareton]47-hareton good bye ; and , since then , [he]47-hareton has been [a stranger]2580-a stranger , and it 's very queer to think it , but [I]0-i 've no doubt , [he]47-hareton has completely forgotten all about [Ellen Dean]80-ellen and that [he]47-hareton was ever more than all [the world]267-the world to [her]80-ellen , and [she]80-ellen to [him]47-hareton ! At this point of [the housekeeper]240-the housekeeper 's story [she]240-the housekeeper chanced to glance towards the time - piece over the chimney ; and was in amazement , on seeing the minute - hand measure half past one . [She]240-the housekeeper would not hear of staying a second longer — In truth , [I]0-i felt rather disposed to defer the sequel of [her]240-the housekeeper narrative , [myself]0-i : and now , that [she]240-the housekeeper is vanished to [her]240-the housekeeper rest , and [I]0-i have meditated for another hour or two , [I]0-i shall summon courage to go , also , in spite of aching laziness of head and limbs . A charming introduction to [a hermit]923-a hermit 's life ! Four weeks ' torture , tossing and sickness ! Oh , these bleak winds , and bitter , northern skies , and impassable roads , and [dilatory country surgeons]924-dilatory country surgeons ! And , oh , this dearth of the human physiognomy , and , worse than all , the terrible intimation of [Kenneth]92-kenneth that [I]0-i need not expect to be out of doors till spring ! [Mr. Heathcliff]43-heathcliff has just honoured [me]0-i with a call . About seven days ago [he]43-heathcliff sent [me]0-i a brace of grouse — the last of the season . [Scoundrel]110-scoundrel ! [He]43-heathcliff is not altogether guiltless in this illness of [mine]0-i ; and that [I]0-i had a great mind to tell [him]43-heathcliff . This is quite an easy interval . [I]0-i am too weak to read , yet [I]0-i feel as if [I]0-i could enjoy something interesting . [I]71-mrs. dean got [Miss Catherine]56-catherine and [myself]71-mrs. dean to [Thrushcross Grange]73-mr. linton : and to [my]71-mrs. dean agreeable disappointment , [she]56-catherine behaved infinitely better than [I]71-mrs. dean dared to expect . [She]56-catherine seemed almost over fond of [Mr. Linton]73-mr. linton ; and even to [[his]73-mr. linton sister]577-his sister , [she]56-catherine showed plenty of affection . [They]3154-they were both very attentive to [her]56-catherine comfort , certainly . It was not the thorn bending to the honeysuckles , but the honeysuckles embracing the thorn . There were no mutual concessions ; [one]285-one stood erect , and [the others]526-the others yielded ; and who can be ill - natured , and bad - tempered , when [they]3154-they encounter neither opposition , nor indifference ? "[71-mrs. dean] [I]0-i observed that [Mr. Edgar]91-edgar had a deep - rooted fear of ruffling [her]928-her humour . [He]91-edgar concealed it from [her]928-her ; but if ever [he]91-edgar heard [me]0-i answer sharply , or saw [any other servant]929-any other servant grow cloudy at some imperious order of [hers]928-her , [he]91-edgar would show [his]91-edgar trouble by a frown of displeasure that never darkened on [his]91-edgar own account . [He]91-edgar , many a time , spoke sternly to [me]0-i about [my]0-i pertness ; and averred that the stab of a knife could not inflict a worse pang than [he]91-edgar suffered at seeing [[his]91-edgar lady]930-his lady vexed . " Not to grieve [a kind master]3157-a kind master [I]91-edgar learnt to be less touchy ; and , for the space of half a year , the gunpowder lay as harmless as sand , because no fire came near to explode it . [Catherine]56-catherine had seasons of gloom and silence , now and then , [they]3158-they were respected with sympathizing silence by [[her]56-catherine husband]2614-her husband , who ascribed [them]3158-they to an alteration in [her]56-catherine constitution , produced by [her]56-catherine perilous illness , as [she]56-catherine was never subject to depression of spirits before . Well , [we]931-we must be for [ourselves]931-we in the long run ; the mild and generous are only more justly selfish than the domineering — and it ended when circumstances caused [each]2715-each to feel that [the one]933-the one 's interest was not the chief consideration in the other 's thoughts . " On a mellow evening in September , [I]80-ellen was coming from [the garden]2718-the garden with a heavy basket of apples which [I]80-ellen had been gathering . It had got dusk , and the moon looked over the high wall of [the court]180-the court , causing undefined shadows to lurk in the corners of the numerous projecting portions of [the building]854-the building . [I]80-ellen set [my]80-ellen burden on [the house]185-the house steps by the kitchen door , and lingered to rest , and draw in a few more breaths of the soft , sweet air ; [my]80-ellen eyes were on the moon , and [my]80-ellen back to the entrance , when [I]80-ellen heard a voice behind [me]80-ellen say — "[80-ellen] ' [Nelly]80-ellen , is that [you]80-ellen ? ' " It was a deep voice , and foreign in tone : yet , there was something in the manner of pronouncing [my]80-ellen name which made it sound familiar . [I]80-ellen turned about to discover who spoke , fearfully , for the doors were shut , and [I]80-ellen had seen [nobody on approaching the steps]3164-nobody on approaching the steps . "[80-ellen] Something stirred in [the porch]535-the porch ; and moving nearer , [I]0-i distinguished [a tall man dressed in dark clothes , with dark face and hair]935-a tall man dressed in dark clothes , with dark face and hair . " ' Who can it be ? ' [I]0-i thought . ' [Mr. Earnshaw]75-hindley ? Oh , no ! The voice has no resemblance to [his]0-i . ' "[0-i] ' [I]0-i have waited [here]2574-here an hour , ' [he]0-i resumed , while [I]0-i continued staring ; ' and the whole of that time all round has been as still as death [I]0-i dared not enter . [You]0-i do not know [me]0-i ? Look , [I]0-i 'm not [a stranger]2580-a stranger ! ' A ray fell on [his]0-i features ; the cheeks were sallow , and half covered with black whiskers ; the brows lowering , the eyes deep set and singular . [I]0-i remembered the eyes . " "[0-i] What ! "[91-edgar] [I]0-i descended and found [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff waiting under [the porch]535-the porch , evidently anticipating an invitation to enter . [He]43-heathcliff followed [my]0-i guidance without waste of words , and [I]0-i ushered [him]43-heathcliff into the presence of [the master]430-the master and [mistress , whose flushed cheeks betrayed signs of warm talking]968-mistress , whose flushed cheeks betrayed signs of warm talking . Now fully revealed by the fire and candlelight , [I]0-i was amazed , more than ever , to behold the transformation of [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff . [He]43-heathcliff had grown [a tall , athletic , well - formed man]971-a tall , athletic , well - formed man ; beside whom , [[my]0-i master]530-my master seemed quite slender and youth - like . [His]43-heathcliff upright carriage suggested the idea of [his]43-heathcliff having been in [the army]973-the army . [His]43-heathcliff countenance was much older in expression , and decision of feature than [Mr. Linton]73-mr. linton 's ; it looked intelligent , and retained no marks of former degradation . A half - civilized ferocity lurked yet in the depressed brows , and eyes full of black fire , but it was subdued ; and [his]43-heathcliff manner was even dignified , quite divested of roughness though too stern for grace . [[My]0-i master]530-my master 's surprise equalled or exceeded [mine]0-i : [he]530-my master remained for a minute at a loss how to address [the ploughboy]975-the ploughboy , as [he]530-my master had called [him]975-the ploughboy ; [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff dropped [his]43-heathcliff slight hand , and stood looking at [him]975-the ploughboy coolly till [he]43-heathcliff chose to speak . " [Mrs. Linton]48-mrs. linton , recalling old times , would have [me]43-heathcliff give [you]2571-sir a cordial reception , and , of course , [I]43-heathcliff am gratified when anything occurs to please [her]48-mrs. linton . "[43-heathcliff] " And [I]43-heathcliff also , "[43-heathcliff] answered [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff , " especially if it be anything in which [I]43-heathcliff have a part . [I]43-heathcliff shall stay an hour or two willingly . "[43-heathcliff] [He]43-heathcliff took a seat opposite [Catherine]56-catherine , who kept [her]56-catherine gaze fixed on [him]43-heathcliff as if [she]56-catherine feared [he]43-heathcliff would vanish were [she]56-catherine to remove it . [He]43-heathcliff did not raise [his]43-heathcliff to [her]56-catherine , often ; a quick glance now and then sufficed ; but it flashed back , each time , more confidently , the undisguised delight [he]43-heathcliff drank from [hers]56-catherine . [They]976-they were too much absorbed in [their]976-they mutual joy to suffer embarrassment ; not so [Mr. Edgar]91-edgar , [he]91-edgar grew pale with pure annoyance , a feeling that reached its climax when [[his]91-edgar lady]930-his lady rose — and stepping across the rug , seized [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff 's hands again , and laughed like one beside [herself]930-his lady . " [I]930-his lady shall think it a dream to - morrow ! "[930-his lady] [she]930-his lady cried . " [I]930-his lady shall not be able to believe that [I]930-his lady have seen , and touched , and spoken to [you]43-heathcliff once more — and yet , [cruel Heathcliff]43-heathcliff ! [you]43-heathcliff do n't deserve this welcome . To be absent and silent for three years , and never to think of [me]930-his lady ! "[930-his lady] " A little more than [you]56-catherine have thought of [me]43-heathcliff ! "[43-heathcliff] [he]43-heathcliff murmured . " [I]930-his lady heard of [your]56-catherine marriage , [Cathy]56-catherine , not long since ; and , while waiting in [the yard below]3188-the yard below , [I]930-his lady meditated this plan — just to have one glimpse of [your]56-catherine face — a stare of surprise , perhaps , and pretended pleasure ; afterwards settle [my]930-his lady score with [Hindley]75-hindley ; and then prevent the law by doing execution on [myself]930-his lady . [Your]56-catherine welcome has put these ideas out of [my]930-his lady mind ; but beware of meeting [me]930-his lady with another aspect next time ! Nay , [you]56-catherine 'll not drive [me]930-his lady off again — [you]56-catherine were really sorry for [me]930-his lady , were [you]56-catherine ? Well , there was cause . [I]930-his lady 've fought through a bitter life since [I]930-his lady last heard [your]56-catherine voice , and [you]56-catherine must forgive [me]930-his lady , for [I]930-his lady struggled only for [you]56-catherine ! "[930-his lady] " [Catherine]56-catherine , unless [we]980-their are to have cold tea , please to come to the table , "[56-catherine] interrupted [Linton]56-catherine , striving to preserve [his]978-his ordinary tone , and a due measure of politeness . " [Mr. Heathcliff]43-heathcliff will have a long walk , wherever [he]43-heathcliff may lodge to - night ; and [I]979-i 'm thirsty . "[979-i] [She]979-i took [her]979-i post before the urn ; and [Miss Isabella]112-isabella came , summoned by the bell ; then , having handed [their]980-their chairs forward , [I]0-i left [the room]243-the room . The meal hardly endured ten minutes — [Catherine]56-catherine 's cup was never filled , [she]56-catherine could neither eat , nor drink . [Edgar]91-edgar had made a slop in [his]91-edgar saucer , and scarcely swallowed a mouthful . [[Their]980-their guest]982-their guest did not protract [his]982-their guest stay , that evening , above an hour longer . [I]0-i asked , as [he]982-their guest departed , if [he]982-their guest went to [Gimmerton]14-gimmerton ? " No , to [Wuthering Heights]11-wuthering heights , "[982-their guest] [he]982-their guest answered , " [Mr. Earnshaw]75-hindley invited [me]982-their guest when [I]982-their guest called this morning . "[982-their guest] [Mr. Earnshaw]75-hindley invited [him]982-their guest ! and [he]982-their guest called on [Mr. Earnshaw]75-hindley ! [I]0-i pondered this sentence painfully , after [he]982-their guest was gone . Is [he]982-their guest turning out a bit of [a hypocrite]983-a hypocrite , and coming into [the country]438-the country to work mischief under a cloak ? [I]0-i mused — [I]0-i had a presentiment , in the bottom of [my]0-i heart , that [he]982-their guest had better have remained away . About the middle of the night , [I]0-i was wakened from [my]0-i first nap by [Mrs. Linton]48-mrs. linton gliding into [[my]0-i chamber]2693-my chamber , taking a seat on [my]0-i bed - side , and pulling [me]0-i by the hair to rouse [me]0-i . " [I]48-mrs. linton can not rest , [Ellen]80-ellen ; "[48-mrs. linton] [she]48-mrs. linton said by way of apology . " And [I]48-mrs. linton want some living creature to keep [me]48-mrs. linton company in [my]48-mrs. linton happiness ! [Edgar]91-edgar is sulky , because [I]48-mrs. linton 'm glad of a thing that does not interest [him]91-edgar — [He]91-edgar refuses to open [his]91-edgar mouth , except to utter pettish , silly speeches ; and [he]91-edgar affirmed [I]48-mrs. linton was cruel and selfish for wishing to talk when [he]91-edgar was so sick and sleepy . [He]91-edgar always contrives to be sick at the least cross ! [I]48-mrs. linton gave a few sentences of commendation to [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff , and [he]43-heathcliff , either for a headache or a pang of envy , began to cry : so [I]48-mrs. linton got up and left [him]43-heathcliff . "[48-mrs. linton] " What use is it praising [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff to [him]43-heathcliff ? "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , " As [lads]3189-lads [they]3189-lads had an aversion to [each other]313-each other , and [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff would hate just as much to hear [him]43-heathcliff praised — it 's human nature . "[986-i] pursued [she]986-i . " [I]986-i 'm not envious — [I]986-i never feel hurt at the brightness of [Isabella]112-isabella 's yellow hair , and the whiteness of [her]112-isabella skin ; at [her]112-isabella dainty elegance , and the fondness all [the family]335-the family exhibit for [her]112-isabella . Even [you]986-i [Nelly]80-ellen , if [we]3192-we have a dispute sometimes , [you]986-i back [Isabella]112-isabella , at once ; and [I]986-i yield like [a foolish mother]3193-a foolish mother — [I]986-i call [her]112-isabella [a darling]3194-a darling , and flatter [her]112-isabella into a good temper . "[986-i] " [You]0-i 're mistaken , [Mrs. Linton]48-mrs. linton , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " [They]3196-they humour [you]0-i — [I]0-i know what there would be to do if [they]3196-they did not ! "[0-i] " And then [we]3199-we shall fight to the death , sha n't [we]3199-we , [Nelly]80-ellen ? "[987-i] [she]987-i returned laughing , " No ! [I]987-i tell [you]80-ellen , [I]987-i have such faith in [Linton]48-mrs. linton 's love that [I]987-i believe [I]987-i might kill [him]988-he , and [he]988-he would n't wish to retaliate . It is childish ; and , instead of melting into tears , because [I]987-i said that [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff was now worthy of [any one]2573-any one 's regard , and it would honour [the first gentleman in [the country]438-the country]3201-the first gentleman in the country to be [[his]43-heathcliff friend]3203-his friend ; [he]988-he ought to have said it for [me]987-i , and been delighted from sympathy — [He]988-he must get accustomed to [him]43-heathcliff , and [he]988-he may as well like [him]43-heathcliff — considering how [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff has reason to object to [him]43-heathcliff , [I]987-i 'm sure [he]43-heathcliff behaved excellently ! "[0-i] " [He]43-heathcliff explained it , "[989-i] [she]989-i replied . " [I]989-i wondered as much as [you]0-i — [He]43-heathcliff said [he]43-heathcliff called to gather information concerning [me]989-i , from [you]0-i , supposing [you]0-i resided [there]2637-there still ; and [Joseph]45-joseph told [Hindley]75-hindley who came out , and fell to questioning [him]43-heathcliff of what [he]43-heathcliff had been doing , and how [he]43-heathcliff had been living : and finally , desired [him]43-heathcliff to walk in — There were [some persons sitting at cards]3207-some persons sitting at cards — [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff joined [them]3207-some persons sitting at cards ; [[my]989-i brother]2672-my brother lost some money to [him]43-heathcliff ; and , finding [him]43-heathcliff plentifully supplied , [he]2672-my brother requested that [he]43-heathcliff would come again in the evening , to which [he]2672-my brother consented . [Hindley]75-hindley is too reckless to select [his]75-hindley acquaintance prudently ; [he]75-hindley does n't trouble [himself]75-hindley to reflect on the causes [he]75-hindley might have for mistrusting one whom [he]75-hindley has basely injured — But , [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff affirms [his]43-heathcliff principal reason for resuming a connection with [[his]43-heathcliff ancient persecutor]3209-his ancient persecutor is a wish to install [himself]43-heathcliff in quarters at walking distance from [the Grange]2656-the grange , and an attachment to [the house where [we]3212-we lived together]3211-the house where we lived together , and , likewise a hope that [I]989-i shall have more opportunities of seeing [him]43-heathcliff [there]2637-there than [I]989-i could have if [he]43-heathcliff settled in [Gimmerton]14-gimmerton . [He]43-heathcliff means to offer liberal payment for permission to lodge at [the Heights]11-wuthering heights ; and doubtless [[my]989-i brother]2672-my brother 's covetousness will prompt [him]43-heathcliff to accept the terms ; [he]43-heathcliff was always greedy , though what [he]43-heathcliff grasps with one hand , [he]43-heathcliff flings away with the other . "[989-i] " It 's a nice place for [a young man]3215-a young man to fix [[his]3215-a young man dwelling]3216-his dwelling in ! "[989-i] " None for [[my]990-i friend]2666-my friend , "[990-i] [she]990-i replied , " [his]43-heathcliff strong head will keep [him]43-heathcliff from danger — a little for [Hindley]75-hindley ; but , [he]43-heathcliff ca n't be made morally worse than [he]43-heathcliff is ; and [I]990-i stand between [him]43-heathcliff and bodily harm — The event of this evening has reconciled [me]990-i to [God]66-god , and humanity ! [I]990-i had risen in angry rebellion against providence — Oh , [I]990-i 've endured very , very bitter misery . [Nelly]80-ellen ! If that creature knew how bitter , [he]43-heathcliff 'd be ashamed to cloud its removal with idle petulance — It was kindness for [him]43-heathcliff which induced [me]990-i to bear it alone : had [I]990-i expressed the agony [I]990-i frequently felt , [he]43-heathcliff would have been taught to long for its alleviation as ardently as [I]990-i — However , it 's over , and [I]990-i 'll take no revenge on [his]43-heathcliff folly — [I]990-i can afford to suffer anything , hereafter ! should [the meanest thing alive]3218-the meanest thing alive slap [me]990-i on the cheek , [I]990-i 'd not only turn the other , but , [I]990-i 'd ask pardon for provoking it — and , as a proof , [I]990-i 'll , go make [my]990-i peace with [Edgar]91-edgar instantly — Good night — [I'm]990-i [an angel]3219-an angel ! "[990-i] In this self - complacent conviction [she]991-her departed ; and the success of [her]991-her fulfi11ed resolution was obvious on the morrow — [Mr. Linton]73-mr. linton had not only abjured , [his]73-mr. linton peevishness ( though [his]73-mr. linton spirits seemed still subdued by [Catherine]56-catherine 's exuberance of vivacity ) but [he]73-mr. linton ventured no objection to [her]991-her taking [Isabella]112-isabella with [her]991-her to [Wuthering Heights]11-wuthering heights , in the afternoon ; and [she]991-her rewarded [him]73-mr. linton with such a summer of sweetness and affection , in return , as made [the house]185-the house a paradise for several days ; [both master]993-both master , and [servants]2956-servants profiting from the perpetual sunshine . [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff — [Mr. Heathcliff]43-heathcliff [I]0-i should say in future , used the liberty of visiting at [Thrushcross Grange]73-mr. linton cautiously , at first : [he]43-heathcliff seemed estimating how far [its owner]491-its owner would bear [his]43-heathcliff intrusion . [Catherine]56-catherine also , deemed it judicious to moderate [her]56-catherine expressions of pleasure in receiving [him]73-mr. linton ; and [he]73-mr. linton gradually established [his]73-mr. linton right to be expected . [He]73-mr. linton retained a great deal of the reserve for which [his]73-mr. linton boyhood was remarkable , and that served to repress all startling demonstrations of feeling . [[My]0-i master]530-my master 's uneasiness experienced a lull , and further circumstances diverted it into another channel for a space . [His]73-mr. linton new source of trouble sprang from the not anticipated misfortune of [Isabella Linton]82-isabella evincing a sudden and irresistible attraction towards [the tolerated guest]997-the tolerated guest — [She]82-isabella was at that time [a charming young lady of eighteen ; infantile in manners , though possessed of keen wit , keen feelings , and a keen temper]998-a charming young lady of eighteen ; infantile in manners , though possessed of keen wit , keen feelings , and a keen temper , too , if irritated . [[Her]82-isabella brother]527-her brother , who loved [her]82-isabella tenderly , was appalled at this fantastic preference . Leaving aside the degradation of an alliance with [a nameless man]1000-a nameless man , and the possible fact that [his]73-mr. linton property , in default of [heirs male]1001-heirs male , might pass into [such a one]1002-such a one 's power , [he]73-mr. linton had sense to comprehend [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff 's disposition — to know that , though [his]73-mr. linton exterior was altered , [his]73-mr. linton mind was unchangeable , and unchanged . And [he]73-mr. linton dreaded that mind ; it revolted [him]73-mr. linton ; [he]73-mr. linton shrank forebodingly from the idea of committing [Isabella]82-isabella to its keeping . [He]73-mr. linton would have recoiled still more had [he]73-mr. linton been aware that [her]82-isabella attachment rose unsolicited , and was bestowed where it awakened no reciprocation of sentiment ; for the minute [he]73-mr. linton discovered its existence , [he]73-mr. linton laid the blame on [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff 's deliberate designing . [We]1003-we had all remarked , during some time , that [Miss Linton]56-catherine fretted and pined over something . [She]56-catherine grew cross and wearisome , snapping at and teazing [Catherine]56-catherine , continually , at the imminent risk of exhausting [her]56-catherine limited patience . [We]1003-we excused [her]56-catherine to a certain extent , on the plea of ill health — [she]56-catherine was dwindling and fading before [our]1003-we eyes — But , one day " when [she]56-catherine had been peculiarly wayward , rejecting [her]56-catherine breakfast , complaining that [the servants]2807-the servants did not do what [she]56-catherine told [them]2807-the servants ; that [the mistress]429-the mistress would allow [her]56-catherine to be nothing in [the house]185-the house , and [Edgar]91-edgar neglected [her]56-catherine ; that [she]56-catherine had caught a cold with the doors being left open , and [we]1003-we let the parlour fire go out on purpose to vex [her]56-catherine ; with a hundred yet more frivolous accusations ; [Mrs. Linton]48-mrs. linton peremptorily insisted that [she]56-catherine should get to - bed ; and , having scolded [her]56-catherine heartily , threatened to send for [the doctor]528-the doctor . Mention of [Kenneth]92-kenneth , caused [her]56-catherine to exclaim , instantly , that [her]56-catherine health was perfect , and it was only [Catherine]56-catherine 's harshness which made ber unhappy . "[1004-you] How can [you]1004-you say [I]0-i am harsh , [you]1004-you naughty fondling ? " cried [the mistress]429-the mistress , amazed at the unreasonable assertion . "[1004-you] [You]1004-you are surely losing [your]1004-you reason . When have [I]0-i been harsh , tell [me]0-i ? " "[0-i] Yesterday , " sobbed [Isabella]82-isabella , "[0-i] and now ! "[56-catherine] [Catherine]56-catherine declared , emphatically — and [she]56-catherine seemed to speak sincerely . " [Nelly]80-ellen , help [me]56-catherine to convince [her]80-ellen of [her]80-ellen madness . [He]43-heathcliff 's not a rough diamond — a pearl - containing oyster of [a rustic]3230-a rustic ; [he]43-heathcliff 's [a fierce , pitiless , wolfish man]3231-a fierce , pitiless , wolfish man . [They]3247-they sit up all night together continually ; and [Hindley]75-hindley has been borrowing money on [[his]75-hindley land]3248-his land ; and does nothing but play and drink , [I]0-i heard only a week ago ; it was [Joseph]45-joseph who told [me]0-i — [I]0-i met [him]1017-he at [Gimmerton]14-gimmerton . "[0-i] " [Nelly]80-ellen , "[1017-he] [he]1017-he said , " [we]3249-we 's hae a Crahnr 's ' quest enah , at [ahr folks]3250-ahr folks . " "[56-catherine] [You]56-catherine are leagued with the rest , [Ellen]80-ellen ! " [she]56-catherine replied . "[80-ellen] [I]0-i 'll not listen to [your]56-catherine slanders . " Whether [she]56-catherine would have got over this fancy if left to [herself]56-catherine , or persevered in nursing it perpetually , [I]56-catherine can not say ; [she]56-catherine had little time to reflect . The day after , there was a justice - meeting at [the next town]3268-the next town ; [[my]56-catherine master]530-my master was obliged to attend ; and [Mr. Heathcliff]43-heathcliff , aware of [his]43-heathcliff absence , called rather earlier than usual . [Catherine]56-catherine and [Isabella]82-isabella were sitting in [the library]3270-the library , on hostile terms , but silent . [The latter]2991-the latter alarmed at [her]56-catherine recent indiscretion , and the disclosure [she]56-catherine had made of [her]56-catherine secret feelings in a transcient fit of passion ; [the former]304-the former , on mature consideration , really offended with [[her]56-catherine companion]3030-her companion ; and , if [she]56-catherine laughed again at [her]56-catherine pertness , inclined to make it no laughing matter to [her]56-catherine . [She]56-catherine did laugh as [she]56-catherine saw [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff pass the window . [I]56-catherine was sweeping the hearth , and [I]56-catherine noticed a mischievous smile on [her]56-catherine lips . [Isabella]82-isabella , absorbed in [her]82-isabella meditations , or a book , remained till the door opened , and it was too late to attempt an escape , which [she]82-isabella would gladly have done had it been practicable . "[56-catherine] Come in , that 's right ! " exclaimed [the mistress]429-the mistress , gaily , pulling a chair to the fire . "[56-catherine] Here are [two people sadly in need of a third]1022-two people sadly in need of a third to thaw the ice between [them]1022-two people sadly in need of a third ; and [you]1023-you are [the very one [we]1025-we should both of [us]1025-we]1024-the very one we should both of us choose . "[43-heathcliff] [We]1029-we were quarrelling like cats about [you]43-heathcliff , [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff ; and [I]0-i was fairly beaten in protestations of devotion , and admiration ; and , moreover , [I]0-i was informed that if [I]0-i would but have the manners to stand aside , [[my]0-i rival]1030-my rival , as [she]1030-my rival will have [herself]1030-my rival to be , would shoot a shaft into [your]43-heathcliff soul that would fix [you]43-heathcliff for ever , and send [my]0-i image into eternal oblivion ! " "[56-catherine] [Catherine]56-catherine , " said [Isabella]82-isabella , calling up [her]82-isabella dignity , and disdaining to struggle from the tight grasp that held [her]82-isabella . " "[0-i] [I]0-i think [you]43-heathcliff belie [her]1031-this friend of yours , " said [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff , twisting [his]43-heathcliff chair to face [them]3277-them . " And [he]43-heathcliff stared hard at the object of discourse , as one might do at a strange repulsive animal , a centipede from [the Indies]3278-the indies , for instance , which curiosity leads [one]285-one to examine in spite of the aversion it raises . [The poor thing]2815-the poor thing could n't bear that ; [she]1031-this friend of yours grew white and red in rapid succession , and , while tears beaded [her]1031-this friend of yours lashes , bent the strength of [her]1031-this friend of yours small fingers to loosen the firm clutch of [Catherine]56-catherine , and perceiving that , as fast as [she]1031-this friend of yours raised one finger off [her]1031-this friend of yours arm , another closed down , and [she]1031-this friend of yours could not remove the whole together , [she]1031-this friend of yours began to make use of [her]1031-this friend of yours nails , and their sharpness presently ornamented [the detainer]3281-the detainer 's with crescents of red . " "[0-i] [I]0-i 'd wrench them off [her]1034-her fingers , if they ever menaced [me]0-i , " [he]0-i answered , brutally , when the door had closed after [her]1034-her . "[0-i] But , what did [you]1031-this friend of yours mean by teasing the creature in that manner , [Cathy]56-catherine ? "[0-i] [She]1034-her has been pining for [your]0-i sake several weeks ; and raving about [you]0-i this morning , and pouring forth a deluge of abuse , because [I]0-i represented [your]0-i failings in a plain light for the purpose of mitigating [her]1034-her adoration . But do n't notice it further . [I]0-i wished to punish [her]1034-her sauciness , that 's all — [I]0-i like [her]1034-her too well , [[my]0-i dear]601-my dear [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff , to let [you]0-i absolutely seize and devour [her]1034-her up . " "[0-i] And [I]0-i like [her]1034-her too ill to attempt it , " said [he]0-i , "[0-i] except in a very ghoulish fashion . [You]0-i 'd hear of odd things , if [I]0-i lived alone with that mawkish , waxen face ; the most ordinary would be painting on its white the colours of the rainbow , and turning the blue eyes , black , every day or two ; they detestably resemble [Linton]56-catherine 's . " "[56-catherine] Delectably , " observed [Catherine]56-catherine . "[56-catherine] They are dove 's eyes — angel 's ! " "[1034-her] [She]1034-her 's [[[her]1034-her brother]527-her brother 's heir]1037-her brother 's heir , is [she]1034-her not ? " [he]0-i asked , after a brief silence .
