" "[1040-this neighbour] If they were [mine]0-i , [they]1041-they would be none the less that , " said [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff , "[1040-this neighbour] but though [Isabella Linton]82-isabella may be silly , [she]82-isabella is scarcely mad ; and — in short [we]1042-we 'll dismiss the matter as [you]0-i advise . " From [their]1042-we tongues , [they]1042-we did dismiss it ; and [Catherine]56-catherine , probably , from [her]56-catherine thoughts . [The other]289-the other , [I]82-isabella felt certain , recalled it often in the course of the evening ; [I]82-isabella saw [him]43-heathcliff smile to [himself]43-heathcliff — grin rather — and lapse into ominous musing whenever [Mrs. Linton]48-mrs. linton had occasion to be absent from [the apartment]195-the apartment . [I]82-isabella determined to watch [his]43-heathcliff movements . [My]82-isabella heart invariably cleaved to [the master]430-the master 's , in preference to [Catherine]56-catherine 's side ; with reason , [I]82-isabella imagined , for [he]43-heathcliff was kind , and trustful , and honourable : and [she]56-catherine — [she]56-catherine could not be called the opposite , yet , [she]56-catherine seemed to allow [herself]56-catherine such wide latitude , that [I]82-isabella had little faith in [her]56-catherine principles , and still less sympathy for [her]56-catherine feelings . [I]82-isabella wanted something to happen which might have the effect of freeing both [Wuthering Heights]11-wuthering heights and [the Grange of [Mr. Heathcliff]43-heathcliff]24-the grange of mr. heathcliff , quietly , leaving [us]3286-us as [we]3286-us had been prior to [his]43-heathcliff advent . [His]43-heathcliff visits were a continual nightmare to [me]82-isabella ; and , [I]82-isabella suspected , to [[my]82-isabella master]530-my master also . [[His]43-heathcliff abode at [the Heights]11-wuthering heights]3288-his abode at the heights was an oppression past explaining . [I]82-isabella felt that [God]66-god had forsaken the stray sheep there to its own wicked wanderings , and an evil beast prowled between it and [the fold]3289-the fold , waiting [his]43-heathcliff time to spring and destroy . Sometimes , while meditating on these things in solitude , [I]82-isabella 've got up in a sudden terror , and put on [my]82-isabella bonnet to go see how all was at [the farm]2643-the farm ; [I]82-isabella 've persuaded [my]82-isabella conscience that it was a duty to warn [him]43-heathcliff how [people]445-people talked regarding [his]43-heathcliff ways ; and then [I]82-isabella 've recollected [his]43-heathcliff confirmed bad habits , and , hopeless of benefiting [him]43-heathcliff , have flinched from re - entering [the dismal house]3292-the dismal house , doubting if [I]82-isabella could bear to be taken at [my]82-isabella word . One time , [I]82-isabella passed the old gate , going out of [my]82-isabella way , on a journey to [Gimmerton]14-gimmerton . It was about the period that [my]82-isabella narrative has reached — a bright , frosty afternoon ; the ground bare , and [the road]2638-the road hard and dry . [I]82-isabella came to a stone where [the highway]3294-the highway branches off on to [the moor]389-the moor at [your]3296-your left hand ; a rough sand - pillar , with the letters W. H. cut on [its]3297-its north side , on the east , G. , and on the south - west , T. G. It serves as guide - post to [the Grange]2656-the grange , and [Heights]11-wuthering heights , and [village]3299-village . The sun shone yellow on its grey head , reminding [me]82-isabella of summer ; and [I]82-isabella can not say why , but all at once , a gush of [child]545-child 's sensations flowed into [my]82-isabella heart . [Hindley]75-hindley and [I]82-isabella held [it]3297-its a favourite spot twenty years before . [I]82-isabella gazed long at the weather - worn block ; and , stooping down , perceived [a hole near the bottom still full of snail - shells and pebbles which [we]3302-we were fond of storing there with more perishable things]3301-a hole near the bottom still full of snail - shells and pebbles which we were fond of storing there with more perishable things — and , as fresh as reality , it appeared that [I]82-isabella beheld [[my]82-isabella early play - mate]3303-my early play - mate seated on [the withered turf]3304-the withered turf ; [his]75-hindley dark , square head bent forward , and [his]75-hindley little hand scooping out the earth with a piece of slate . "[82-isabella] [Poor Hindley]115-hindley ! " [I]115-hindley exclaimed , involuntarily . [I]115-hindley started — [my]115-hindley bodily eye was cheated into a momentary belief that [the child]2762-the child lifted [its]2762-the child face and stared straight into [mine]82-isabella ! It vanished in a twinkling ; but , immediately , [I]115-hindley felt an irresistible yearning to be at [the Heights]11-wuthering heights . Superstition urged [me]115-hindley to comply with this impulse — supposing [he]2762-the child should be dead ! [I]115-hindley thought — or should die soon!—supposing it were a sign of death ! The nearer [I]115-hindley got to [the house]185-the house the more agitated [I]115-hindley grew : and on catching sight of it , [I]115-hindley trembled every limb . [The apparition]3307-the apparition had outstripped [me]115-hindley ; it stood looking through the gate . That was [my]115-hindley first idea on observing [an elf - locked , brown - eyed boy]3308-an elf - locked , brown - eyed boy setting [his]3308-an elf - locked , brown - eyed boy ruddy countenance against the bars . Further reflection suggested this must be [Hareton]47-hareton , [[my]115-hindley Hareton]3309-my hareton , not altered greatly since [I]115-hindley left [him]47-hareton , ten months since . "[115-hindley] God bless [thee]1043-thee , [darling]344-darling ! " [I]1043-thee cried , forgetting instantaneously [my]1043-thee foolish fears . "[80-ellen] [I]0-i am come to see [[thy]1043-thee father]1046-thy father , [Hareton]47-hareton , " [I]47-hareton added , guessing from the action that [Nelly]80-ellen , if [she]80-ellen lived in [his]47-hareton memory at all , was not recognised as one with [me]47-hareton . [He]47-hareton raised [his]47-hareton missile to hurl it ; [I]47-hareton commenced a soothing speech , but could not stay [his]47-hareton hand . The stone struck [my]47-hareton bonnet , and then ensued , from the stammering lips of [the little fellow]3310-the little fellow , a string of curses which , whether [he]47-hareton comprehended them or not , were delivered with practised emphasis , and distorted [his]47-hareton baby features into a shocking expression of malignity . [You]3311-you may be certain this grieved , more than angered [me]47-hareton . Fit to cry , [I]47-hareton took an orange from [my]47-hareton pocket , and offered it to propitiate [him]47-hareton . [He]47-hareton hesitated , and then snatched it from [my]47-hareton hold , as if [he]47-hareton fancied [I]47-hareton only intended to tempt , and disappoint [him]47-hareton . [I]47-hareton showed another keeping it out of [his]47-hareton reach . "[47-hareton] Who has taught [you]1047-you those fine words , [[my]0-i barn]1048-my barn , " [I]2848-the curate inquired . "[2848-the curate] No , [I]0-i was told [the curate]2848-the curate should have [his]2848-the curate — — — teeth dashed down [his]2848-the curate — — — throat , if [he]2848-the curate stepped over the threshold — [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff , had promised that ! " [I]118-judas put the orange in [his]43-heathcliff hand ; and bade [him]43-heathcliff tell [[his]43-heathcliff father]518-his father that [a woman called [Nelly Dean]80-ellen]3313-a woman called nelly dean , was waiting to speak with [him]43-heathcliff , by the garden gate . [He]43-heathcliff went up [the walk]3314-the walk , and entered [the house]185-the house ; but , instead of [Hindley]115-hindley , [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff appeared on the door stones , and [I]118-judas turned directly and ran down [the road]2638-the road as hard as ever [I]118-judas could race , making no halt till [I]118-judas gained the guide post , and feeling as scared as if [I]118-judas had raised [a goblin]3062-a goblin . This is not much connected with [Miss Isabella]112-isabella 's affair ; except , that it urged [me]118-judas to resolve further , on mounting vigilant guard , and doing [my]118-judas utmost to check the spread of such bad influence at [the Grange]2656-the grange , even though [I]118-judas should wake a domestic storm , by thwarting [Mrs. Linton]48-mrs. linton 's pleasure . The next time [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff came , [[my]118-judas young lady]3319-my young lady chanced to be feeding some pigeons in [the court]180-the court . [She]3319-my young lady had never spoken a word to [[her]3319-my young lady sister - in - law]2886-her sister - in - law , for three days ; but , [she]3319-my young lady had likewise dropped [her]3319-my young lady fretful complaining , and [we]3322-we found it a great comfort . [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff had not the habit of bestowing a single unnecessary civility on [Miss Linton]56-catherine , [I]118-judas knew . Now , as soon as [he]43-heathcliff beheld [her]56-catherine , [his]43-heathcliff first precaution was to take a sweeping survey of [the house]185-the house - front . [I]118-judas was standing by the [kitchen]192-kitchen window , but [I]118-judas drew out of sight . [He]43-heathcliff then stept across [the pavement]3325-the pavement to [her]56-catherine , and said something : [she]56-catherine seemed embarrassed , and desirous of getting away ; to prevent it , [he]43-heathcliff laid [his]43-heathcliff hand on [her]56-catherine arm : [she]56-catherine averted [her]56-catherine face ; [he]43-heathcliff apparently put some question which [she]56-catherine had no mind to answer . There was another rapid glance at [the house]185-the house , and supposing [himself]43-heathcliff unseen , [the scoundrel]3327-the scoundrel had the impudence to embrace [her]56-catherine . "[118-judas] [Judas]118-judas ! [Traitor]1058-traitor ! " [I]983-a hypocrite ejaculated "[983-a hypocrite] [you]1059-you are [a hypocrite]983-a hypocrite too , are [you]1059-you ? [A deliberate deceiver]1061-a deliberate deceiver . " "[1061-a deliberate deceiver] Who is [Nelly]80-ellen ? " said [Catherine]56-catherine 's voice at [my]80-ellen elbow — [I]80-ellen had been over - intent on watching [the pair outside]3328-the pair outside to mark [her]56-catherine entrance . "[80-ellen] [[Your]1059-you worthless friend]1062-your worthless friend ! Had [Edgar]91-edgar never gathered [our]3375-we conversation , [he]91-edgar would never have been the worse for it . Really , when [he]91-edgar opened on [me]48-mrs. linton in that unreasonable tone of displeasure , after [I]48-mrs. linton had scolded [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff till [I]48-mrs. linton was hoarse for [him]91-edgar ; [I]48-mrs. linton did not care , hardly , what [they]3381-they did to [each other]313-each other , especially as [I]48-mrs. linton felt that , however the scene closed , [we]3375-we should all be driven asunder for [nobody]442-nobody knows how long ! Well , if [I]48-mrs. linton can not keep [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff for [[my]48-mrs. linton friend]2666-my friend — if [Edgar]91-edgar will be mean and jealous , [I]48-mrs. linton 'll try to break [their]3381-they hearts by breaking [my]48-mrs. linton own . That will be a prompt way of finishing all , when [I]48-mrs. linton am pushed to extremity ! But it 's a deed to be reserved for a forlorn hope — [I'd]48-mrs. linton not take [Linton]48-mrs. linton by surprise with it . To this this point [he]91-edgar has been discreet in dreading to provoke [me]48-mrs. linton ; [you]3385-you must represent the peril of quitting that policy ; and remind [him]91-edgar of [my]48-mrs. linton passionate temper , verging , when kindled , on frenzy — [I]48-mrs. linton wish [you]3385-you could dismiss that apathy out of [your]3385-you countenance , and look rather more anxious about [me]48-mrs. linton ! "[48-mrs. linton] The stolidity with which [I]0-i received these instructions was , no doubt , rather exasperating ; for they were delivered in perfect sincerity , but [I]0-i believed [a person who could plan the turning of]1101-a person who could plan the turning of [her]1101-a person who could plan the turning of fits of passion to account , beforehand , might , by exerting [her]1101-a person who could plan the turning of will , manage to control [herself]1101-a person who could plan the turning of tolerably even while under [their]1102-their influence ; and [I]0-i did not wish to " frighten "[1101-a person who could plan the turning of] [[her]1101-a person who could plan the turning of husband]2614-her husband , as [she]1101-a person who could plan the turning of said , and multiply [his]2614-her husband annoyances for the purpose of serving [her]1101-a person who could plan the turning of selfishness . Therefore [I]0-i said nothing when [I]0-i met [the master]430-the master coming towards [the parlour]3177-the parlour ; but [I]0-i took the liberty of turning back to listen whether [they]1102-their would resume [their]1102-their quarrel together . [He]430-the master began to speak first . " Remain where [you]0-i are , [Catherine]56-catherine , ' [he]430-the master said , without any anger in [his]430-the master voice , but with much sorrowful despondency . "[430-the master] [I]0-i shall not stay . [I]0-i am neither come to wrangle , nor be reconciled : but [I]0-i wish just to learn whether , after this evening 's events , [you]0-i intend to continue [your]0-i intimacy with — " "[0-i] Oh , for mercy 's sake , " interrupted [the mistress]429-the mistress , stamping [her]429-the mistress foot , "[0-i] for mercy 's sake , let [us]1106-us hear no more of it now ! [Your]0-i cold blood can not be worked into a fever — [your]0-i veins are full of ice - water — but mine are boiling , and the sight of such chillness makes [them]1102-their dance . " "[0-i] To get rid of [me]0-i — answer [my]0-i question , " persevered [Mr. Linton]73-mr. linton . "[0-i] [You]0-i must answer it ; and that violence does not alarm [me]0-i . [I]0-i have found that [you]0-i can be as stoical as [any one]2573-any one , when [you]0-i please . Will [you]0-i give up [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff hereafter , or will [you]0-i give up [me]0-i ? It is impossible for [you]0-i to be [[my]0-i friend]2666-my friend , and [his]43-heathcliff at the same time ; and [I]0-i absolutely require to know which [you]0-i choose . " "[0-i] [I]0-i require to be let alone ! " exclaimed [Catherine]56-catherine , furiously . "[0-i] [I]0-i demand it ! Do n't [you]0-i see [I]0-i can scarcely stand ? [Edgar]91-edgar , [you]0-i — [you]0-i leave [me]0-i ! " [She]56-catherine rung the bell till it broke with a twang : [I]91-edgar entered leisurely . It was enough to try the temper of [a saint , such senseless , wicked rages]3387-a saint , such senseless , wicked rages ! There [she]56-catherine lay dashing [her]56-catherine head against the arm of the sofa , and grinding [her]56-catherine teeth , so that [you]3388-you might fancy [she]56-catherine would crash them to splinters ! [Mr. Linton]73-mr. linton stood looking at [her]56-catherine in sudden compunction and fear . [He]73-mr. linton told [me]91-edgar to fetch some water . [She]56-catherine had no breath for speaking . [I]91-edgar brought a glass full ; and , as [she]56-catherine would not drink , [I]91-edgar sprinkled it on [her]56-catherine face . In a few seconds [she]56-catherine stretched [herself]56-catherine out stiff , and turned up [her]56-catherine eyes , while [her]56-catherine cheeks , at once blanched and livid , assumed the aspect of death . [Linton]73-mr. linton looked terrified . "[91-edgar] There is nothing in [the world]267-the world the matter , " [I]91-edgar whispered . [I]91-edgar did not want [him]73-mr. linton to yield , though [I]91-edgar could not help being afraid in [my]91-edgar heart . "[91-edgar] [She]1110-i has blood on [her]1110-i lips ! " [he]73-mr. linton said , shuddering . "[1110-i] Never mind ! " [I]1110-i answered , tartly . And [I]1110-i told [him]73-mr. linton how [she]56-catherine had resolved , previous to [his]73-mr. linton coming , on exhibiting a fit of frenzy . [I]1110-i incautiously gave the account aloud , and [she]56-catherine heard [me]1110-i , for [she]56-catherine started up — [her]56-catherine hair flying over [her]56-catherine shoulders , [her]56-catherine eyes flashing , the muscles of [her]56-catherine neck and arms standing out preternaturally . [I]1110-i made up [my]1110-i mind for broken bones , at least ; but [she]56-catherine only glared about [her]56-catherine , for an instant , and then rushed from [the room]243-the room . [The master]430-the master directed [me]1110-i to follow ; [I]1110-i did , to [her]56-catherine chamber door ; [she]56-catherine hindered [me]1110-i from going farther by securing it against [me]1110-i . As [she]56-catherine never offered to descend to breakfast next morning , [I]1110-i went to ask whether [she]56-catherine would have some carried up . "[1110-i] No ! " [she]56-catherine replied , peremptorily . The same question was repeated at dinner , and tea ; and again on the morrow after , and received the same answer . [Mr. Linton]73-mr. linton , on [his]73-mr. linton part , spent [his]73-mr. linton time in [the library]3270-the library , and did not inquire concerning [[his]73-mr. linton wife]2670-his wife 's occupations . [Isabella]112-isabella and [he]73-mr. linton had had an hour 's interview , during which [he]73-mr. linton tried to elicit from [her]56-catherine some sentiment of proper horror for [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff 's advances ; but [he]73-mr. linton could make nothing of [her]56-catherine evasive replies , and was obliged to close the examination , unsatisfactorily ; adding , however , a solemn warning , that if [she]56-catherine were so insane as to encourage [that worthless suitor]3393-that worthless suitor , it would dissolve all bonds of relationship between [herself]56-catherine and [him]73-mr. linton . While [Miss Linton]56-catherine moped about [the park and garden]3394-the park and garden , always silent , and almost always in tears ; and [[her]56-catherine brother]527-her brother shut [himself]527-her brother up among books that [he]527-her brother never opened ; wearying , [I]1110-i guessed , with a continual vague expectation that [Catherine]56-catherine , repenting [her]56-catherine conduct , would come of [her]56-catherine own accord to ask pardon , and seek a reconciliation ; and [she]56-catherine fasted pertinaciously , under the idea , probably , that at every meal , [Edgar]91-edgar was ready to choke for [her]56-catherine absence , and pride alone held [him]527-her brother from running to cast [himself]527-her brother at [her]56-catherine feet ; [I]1110-i went about [my]1110-i household duties , convinced that [the Grange]2656-the grange had but one sensible soul in its walls , and that lodged in [my]1110-i body . [I]1110-i wasted no condolences on [miss]3119-miss , nor any expostulations on [[my]1110-i mistress]493-my mistress , nor did [I]1110-i pay attention to the sighs of [[my]1110-i master]530-my master who yearned to hear [[his]530-my master lady]930-his lady 's name , since [he]530-my master might not hear [her]56-catherine voice . [I]1110-i determined [they]3401-they should come about as [they]3401-they pleased for [me]1110-i ; and though it was a tiresomely slow process , [I]1110-i began to rejoice at length in a faint dawn of its progress , as [I]1110-i thought at first . [Mrs. Linton]48-mrs. linton , on the third day , unbarred [her]48-mrs. linton door ; and having finished the water in [her]48-mrs. linton pitcher and decanter , desired a renewed supply , and a basin of gruel , for [she]48-mrs. linton believed [she]48-mrs. linton was dying . That [I]1110-i set down as a speech meant for [Edgar]91-edgar 's ears , [I]1110-i believed no such thing , so [I]1110-i kept it to [myself]1110-i , and brought [her]48-mrs. linton some tea and dry toast . [She]48-mrs. linton eat and drank eagerly ; and sank back on [her]48-mrs. linton pillow again clenching [her]48-mrs. linton hands and groaning . "[1110-i] Oh , [I]0-i will die , " [she]48-mrs. linton exclaimed , "[0-i] since [no one]404-no one cares anything about [me]0-i . [I]0-i wish [I]0-i had not taken that . " Then a good while after [I]0-i heard [her]48-mrs. linton murmur , "[0-i] No , [I]0-i 'll not die — [he'd]1112-he be glad — [he]1112-he does not love [me]0-i at all — [he]1112-he would never miss [me]0-i ! " "[1112-he] Did [you]0-i want anything , [ma'am]3167-ma'am ? " [I]0-i enquired , still preserving [my]0-i external composure , in spite of [her]48-mrs. linton ghastly countenance , and strange exaggerated manner . "[0-i] What is that apathetic being doing ? " [she]48-mrs. linton demanded , pushing the thick entangled locks from [her]48-mrs. linton wasted face . "[0-i] Has [he]1112-he fallen into a lethargy , or is [he]1112-he dead ? " "[0-i] Neither , " replied [I]0-i ; "[0-i] if [you]0-i mean [Mr. Linton]73-mr. linton . [He]1112-he 's tolerably well , [I]0-i think , though [his]1112-he studies occupy [him]1112-he rather more than they ought ; [he]1112-he is continually among [his]1112-he books , since [he]1112-he has [no other society]1114-no other society . " [I]1112-he should not have spoken so , if [I]1112-he had known [her]3402-her true condition , but [I]1112-he could not get rid of the notion that [she]3402-her acted a part of [her]3402-her disorder . "[1112-he] Among [his]1112-he books ! " [she]3402-her cried , confounded . "[1112-he] And [I]0-i dying ! [I]0-i on the brink of the grave ! [[My]0-i God]1115-my god ! does [he]1112-he know how [I]0-i 'm altered ? " continued [she]3402-her , staring at [her]3402-her reflection in a mirror , hanging against the opposite wall . "[1112-he] Is that [Catherine Linton]56-catherine ? [He]1112-he imagines [me]0-i in a pet — in play , perhaps . Can not [you]1116-you inform [him]1112-he that it is frightful earnest ? [Nelly]80-ellen , if it be not too late , as soon as [I]0-i learn how [he]1112-he feels , [I]0-i 'll choose between these two — either to starve , at once , that would be no punishment unless [he]1112-he had a heart — or to recover and leave [the country]438-the country . Are [you]1116-you speaking the truth about [him]1112-he now ? Take care . Is [he]1112-he actually so utterly indifferent for [my]0-i life ? " "[1112-he] Why , [ma'am]3167-ma'am , " [I]430-the master answered , "[430-the master] [the master]430-the master has no idea of [your]3167-ma'am being deranged ; and , of course , [he]430-the master does not fear that [you]3167-ma'am will let [yourself]3167-ma'am die of hunger . " "[1116-you] [You]1116-you think not ? Can not [you]1116-you tell [him]1112-he [I]0-i will ? " [she]3167-ma'am returned ; "[1116-you] persuade [him]1112-he — speak of [your]3167-ma'am own mind — say [you]3167-ma'am are certain [I]0-i will ! " "[3167-ma'am] No , [you]3167-ma'am forget , [Mrs. Linton]48-mrs. linton , " [I]3167-ma'am suggested , "[3167-ma'am] that [you]3167-ma'am have eaten some food with a relish this evening , and to - morrow [you]3167-ma'am will perceive its good effects . " "[48-mrs. linton] If [I]0-i were only sure it would kill [him]1112-he , " [she]3167-ma'am interrupted , "[0-i] [I]0-i 'd kill [myself]0-i directly ! These three awful nights , [I]0-i 've never closed [my]0-i lids — and oh , [I]0-i 've been tormented [I]0-i [I]0-i 've been haunted , [Nelly]80-ellen ! But [I]0-i begin to fancy [you]80-ellen do n't like [me]0-i . How strange ! [I]0-i thought , though [everybody]2736-everybody hated and despised [each other]313-each other , [they]2736-everybody could not avoid loving [me]0-i — and [they]2736-everybody have all turned to [enemies]1122-enemies in a few hour ? . [They]2736-everybody have , [I]0-i 'm positive ; [the people]1123-the people [here]2574-here . How dreary to meet death , surrounded by [their]1123-the people cold faces ! [Isabella]112-isabella , terrified and repelled , afraid to enter [the room]243-the room , it would be so dreadful to watch [Catherine]56-catherine go . And [Edgar]91-edgar standing solemnly by to see it over ; then offering prayers of thanks to [God]66-god for restoring peace to [[his]91-edgar house]3060-his house , and going back to [his]91-edgar books ! What in the name of all that feels , has [he]91-edgar to do with books , when [I]0-i am dying ? " [She]112-isabella could not bear the notion which [I]91-edgar had put into [her]112-isabella head of [Mr. Linton]73-mr. linton 's philosophical resignation . Tossing about , [she]112-isabella increased [her]112-isabella feverish bewilderment to madness , and tore the pillow with [her]112-isabella teeth , then raising [herself]112-isabella up all burning , desired that [I]91-edgar would open the window . [We]3403-we were in the middle of winter , the wind blew strong from [the north - east]3404-the north - east , and [I]91-edgar objected . Both the expressions flitting over [her]112-isabella face , and the changes of [her]112-isabella moods , began to alarm [me]91-edgar terribly ; and brought to [my]91-edgar recollection [her]112-isabella former illness , and [the doctor]528-the doctor 's injunction that [she]112-isabella should not be crossed . A minute previously [she]112-isabella was violent ; now , supported on one arm , and not noticing [my]91-edgar refusal to obey [her]112-isabella , [she]112-isabella seemed to find childish diversion in pulling the feathers from the rents [she]112-isabella had just made , and ranging them on the sheet according to [their]1127-their different species : [her]112-isabella mind had strayed to other associations . "[91-edgar] That 's a turkey 's , " [she]112-isabella murmured to [herself]112-isabella ; "[91-edgar] and this is a wild - duck 's ; and this is a pigeon 's . Ah , [they]1127-their put pigeons ' feathers in the pillows — no wonder [I]0-i could n't die ! Let [me]0-i take care to throw it on the floor when [I]0-i lie down . And here is a moor - cock 's ; and this — [I]0-i should know it among a thousand — it 's a lapwing 's . Bonny bird ; wheeling over [our]1128-our heads in [the middle of [the moor]389-the moor]1129-the middle of the moor . [It]1131-it wanted to get to its nest , for the clouds touched the swells , and it felt rain coming . This feather was picked up from the heath , the bird was not shot — [we]1128-our saw [its]1131-it nest in the winter , full of little skeletons . [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff set a trap over it , and [the old ones]1132-the old ones dare not come . [I]0-i made [him]43-heathcliff promise [he]43-heathcliff 'd never shoot a lapwing , after that , and [he]43-heathcliff did n't . Yes , here are more ! Did [he]43-heathcliff shoot [my]0-i lapwings , [Nelly]80-ellen ? Are they red , any of them ? Let [me]0-i look . " "[0-i] Give over with that baby - work ! " [I]43-heathcliff interrupted , dragging the pillow away , and turning the holes towards the mattress , for [she]80-ellen was removing its contents by handfuls . "[43-heathcliff] Lie down and shut [your]80-ellen eyes , [you]80-ellen 're wandering . There 's a mess ! The down is flying about like snow ! " [I]0-i went here and there collecting it . "[0-i] [I]0-i see in [you]80-ellen , [Nelly]80-ellen , " [she]80-ellen continued , dreamily , "[1133-an aged woman] [an aged woman]1133-an aged woman — [you]80-ellen have grey hair , and bent shoulders . This bed is [the fairy cave under [Peniston Crag]26-peniston crag]1134-the fairy cave under peniston crag , and [you]80-ellen are gathering elf - bolts to hurt [our]1135-our heifers ; pretending , while [I]0-i am near , that they are only locks of wool . That 's what [you]80-ellen 'll come to fifty years hence ; [I]0-i know [you]80-ellen are not so now . [I]0-i 'm not wandering , [you]80-ellen 're mistaken , or else [I]0-i should believe [you]80-ellen really were [that withered hag]1136-that withered hag , and [I]0-i should think [I]0-i was under [Penistone Crag]27-penistone crag , and [I]0-i 'm conscious it 's night , and there are two candles on the table making the black press shine like jet . " The black press ? where is that ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked . " [You]80-ellen are talking in [your]80-ellen sleep ! "[0-i] " It 's against the wall , as it always is , "[80-ellen] [she]80-ellen replied . " It does appear odd — [I]80-ellen see a face in it ! "[80-ellen] " There is no press in [the room]243-the room , and never was , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , resuming [my]0-i seat , and looping up the curtain that [I]0-i might watch [her]80-ellen . " Do n't [you]0-i see that face ? "[80-ellen] [she]80-ellen enquired , gazing earnestly at the mirror . And say what [I]0-i could , [I]0-i was incapable of making [her]80-ellen comprehend it to be [her]80-ellen own ; so [I]0-i rose and covered it with a shawl . " It 's behind there still ! "[80-ellen] [she]80-ellen pursued , anxiously . " And it stirred . Who is it ? "[80-ellen] [I]0-i hope it will not come out when [you]0-i are gone ! Oh ! [Nelly]80-ellen , [the room]243-the room is haunted ! [I]0-i 'm afraid of being alone ! " [I]0-i took [her]80-ellen hand in [mine]0-i , and bid [her]80-ellen be composed , for a succession of shudders convulsed [her]80-ellen frame , and [she]80-ellen would keep straining [her]80-ellen gaze towards the glass . "[0-i] There 's [nobody here]1138-nobody here ! " [I]0-i insisted . "[0-i] It was [yourself]0-i , [Mrs. Linton]48-mrs. linton ; [you]0-i knew it a while since . " "[0-i] [Myself]0-i , " [she]80-ellen gasped , "[0-i] and the clock is striking twelve ! It 's true then ; that 's dreadful ! " [Her]80-ellen fingers clutched the clothes , and gathered them over [her]80-ellen eyes . [I]48-mrs. linton attempted to steal to the door with an intention of calling [[her]80-ellen husband]2614-her husband ; but [I]48-mrs. linton was summoned back by a piercing shriek . The shawl had dropped from the frame . "[48-mrs. linton] Why what is the matter ? " cried [I.]0-i "[48-mrs. linton] Who is coward now ? Wake up ! That is the glass — the mirror , [Mrs. Linton]48-mrs. linton ; and [you]0-i see [yourself]0-i in it , and there am [I]0-i too by [your]0-i side . " Trembling and bewildered , [she]80-ellen held [me]0-i fast , but the horror gradually passed from [her]80-ellen countenance ; its paleness gave place to a glow of shame . "[0-i] Oh , [dear]634-dear ! [I]0-i thought [I]0-i was at [home]239-home , " [she]80-ellen sighed . "[0-i] [I]0-i thought [I]0-i was lying in [[my]0-i chamber]2693-my chamber at [Wuthering Heights]11-wuthering heights . Because [I]0-i 'm weak , [my]0-i brain got confused , and [I]0-i screamed unconsciously . Do n't say anything ; but stay with [me]0-i . [I]0-i dread sleeping , [my]0-i dreams appal [me]0-i . " "[0-i] A sound sleep would do [you]0-i good , [ma'am]3167-ma'am , " [I]0-i answered ; "[0-i] and [I]0-i hope this suffering will prevent [your]0-i trying starving again . " "[0-i] Oh , if [I]0-i were but in [my]0-i own bed in [the old house]1143-the old house ! " [she]3167-ma'am went on bitterly , wringing [her]3167-ma'am hands . "[0-i] And that wind sounding in the firs by the lattice . Do let [me]0-i feel it — it comes straight down [the moor]389-the moor — do let [me]0-i have one breath ! " To pacify [her]3167-ma'am , [I]0-i held the casement ajar , a few seconds . A cold blast rushed through , [I]0-i closed it , and returned to [my]0-i post . [She]3167-ma'am lay still , now : [her]3167-ma'am face bathed in tears — Exhaustion of body had entirely subdued [her]3167-ma'am spirit ; [our]3408-our fiery [Catherine]56-catherine was no better than [a wailing child]3409-a wailing child ! "[0-i] How long is it since [I]0-i shut [myself]0-i in [here]2574-here ? " [she]3167-ma'am asked suddenly reviving . "[0-i] It was Monday evening , " [I]0-i replied , "[0-i] and this is Thursday night , or rather Friday morning , at present . " "[0-i] What ! of the same week ? " [she]3167-ma'am exclaimed . "[0-i] Only that brief time ? " "[0-i] Long enough to live on nothing but cold water , and ill - temper , " observed [I.]0-i "[0-i] Well , it seems a weary number of hours , " [she]3167-ma'am muttered doubtfully , "[91-edgar] it must be more — [I]0-i remember being in [the parlour]3177-the parlour , after [they]1147-they had quarrelled ; and [Edgar]91-edgar being cruelly provoking , and [me]0-i running into [this room]2648-this room desperate — As soon as ever [I]0-i had barred the door , utter blackness overwhelmed [me]0-i , and [I]0-i fell on the floor — [I]0-i could n't explain to [Edgar]91-edgar how certain [I]0-i felt of having a fit , or going raging mad , if [he]91-edgar persisted in teasing [me]0-i ! [I]0-i had no command of tongue , or brain , and [he]91-edgar did not guess [my]0-i agony , perhaps ; it barely left [me]0-i sense to try to escape from [him]91-edgar and [his]91-edgar voice — Before [I]0-i recovered , sufficiently to see , and hear , it began to be dawn ; and [Nelly]80-ellen , [I]0-i 'll tell [you]80-ellen what [I]0-i thought , and what has kept recurring and recurring till [I]0-i feared for [my]0-i reason — [I]0-i thought as [I]0-i lay there with [my]0-i head against that table leg , and [my]0-i eyes dimly discerning the grey square of the window , that [I]0-i was enclosed in the oak - panelled bed at [home]239-home ; and [my]0-i heart ached with some great grief which , just waking , [I]0-i could not recollect — [I]0-i pondered , and worried [myself]0-i to discover what it could be ; and most strangely , the whole last seven years of [my]0-i life grew a blank ! [I]0-i did not recall that they had been at all . [I]0-i was [a child]265-a child ; [[my]0-i father]338-my father was just buried , and [my]0-i misery arose from the separation that [Hindley]115-hindley had ordered between [me]0-i , and [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff — [I]0-i was laid alone , for the first time , and rousing from a dismal dose after a night of weeping — [I]0-i lifted [my]0-i hand to push the panels aside , it struck the table - top ! [I]0-i swept it along the carpet , and then , memory burst in — [my]0-i late anguish was swallowed in a paroxysm of despair — [I]0-i can not say why [I]0-i felt so wildly wretched — it must have been temporary derangement for there is scarcely cause — But , supposing at twelve years old , [I]0-i had been wrenched from the Heights , and every early association , and [my]0-i all in all , as [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff was at that time , and been converted , at a stroke into [Mrs. Linton]48-mrs. linton , [the lady of [Thrushcross Grange]73-mr. linton]1152-the lady of thrushcross grange , and [the wife of [a stranger]2580-a stranger]1153-the wife of a stranger ; an exile , and outcast , thenceforth , from what had been [[my]0-i world]1155-my world — [You]1156-you may fancy a glimpse of [the abyss]1157-the abyss where [I]0-i grovelled ! Shake [your]1156-you head , as [you]1156-you will , [Nelly]80-ellen , [you]1156-you have helped to unsettle [me]0-i ! [You]1156-you should have spoken to [Edgar]91-edgar , indeed [you]1156-you should , and compelled [him]91-edgar to leave [me]0-i quiet ! Oh , [I]0-i 'm burning ! [I]0-i wish [I]0-i were out of doors — [I]0-i wish [I]0-i were [a girl]1158-a girl again , half savage and hardy , and free . . .and laughing at injuries , not maddening under [them]1159-them ! Why am [I]0-i so changed ? why does [my]0-i blood rush into a hell of tumult at a few words ? [I]0-i 'm sure [I]0-i should be [myself]0-i were [I]0-i once among the heather on [those hills]1160-those hills . . .Open the window again wide , fasten it open ! Quick , why do n't [you]1156-you move ? " "[0-i] Because , [I]0-i wo n't give [you]1156-you [your]1156-you death of cold , " [I]0-i answered . "[0-i] [You]0-i wo n't give [me]0-i a chance of life , [you]0-i mean , " [she]1156-you said sullenly . "[0-i] However , [I]0-i 'm not helpless yet , [I]0-i 'll open it [myself]0-i . " And sliding from the bed before [I]0-i could hinder [her]1156-you , [she]1156-you crossed [the room]243-the room , walking very uncertainly , threw it back , and bent out , careless of the frosty air that cut about [her]1156-you shoulders as keen as a knife . [I]0-i entreated , and finally attempted to force [her]1156-you to retire . But [I]0-i soon found [her]1156-you delirious strengh much surpassed [mine]0-i ; ( [she]1156-you was delirious [I]0-i became convinced by [her]1156-you subsequent actions , and ravings . ) There was no moon , and every thing beneath lay in misty darkness ; not a light gleamed from [any house]3411-any house , far or near ; all had been extinguished long ago ; and those at [Wuthering Heights]11-wuthering heights were never visible . . .still [she]1156-you asserted [she]1156-you caught [their]3412-their shining . "[0-i] Look ! " [she]1156-you cried eagerly , "[0-i] that 's [[my]0-i room]415-my room , with the candle in [it]415-my room , and the trees swaying before it . . .and the other candle is in [[Joseph]45-joseph 's garret]1162-joseph 's garret . . .Joseph sits up late , does n't [he]1163-he ? [He]1163-he 's waiting till [I]0-i come [home]239-home that [he]1163-he may lock the gate . . .Well , [he]1163-he 'll wait a while yet . It 's a rough journey , and a sad heart to travel it ; and [we]1165-we must pass by [Gimmerton Kirk]29-gimmerton kirk , to go that journey ! [We]1165-we 've braved it 's ghosts often together , and dared [each other]313-each other to stand among the graves and ask [them]1167-them to come . . .But [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff , if [I]0-i dare [you]43-heathcliff now , will [you]43-heathcliff venture ? If [you]43-heathcliff do , [I]0-i 'll keep [you]43-heathcliff . [I]0-i 'll not lie there by [myself]0-i ; [they]1168-they may bury [me]0-i twelve feet deep , and throw [the church]1169-the church down over [me]0-i ; but [I]0-i wo n't rest till [you]43-heathcliff are with [me]0-i . . .I never will ! " [She]3413-her paused , and resumed with a strange smile , "[1170-he] [He]1170-he 's considering . . .he'd rather [I]0-i 'd come to [him]1170-he ! Find a way , then ! not through [that Kirkyard]1171-that kirkyard . . .You are slow ! Be content , [you]43-heathcliff always followed [me]0-i ! " Perceiving it vain to argue against [her]3413-her insanity , [I]43-heathcliff was planning how [I]43-heathcliff could reach something to wrap about [her]3413-her , without quitting [my]43-heathcliff hold of [herself]3413-her , for [I]43-heathcliff could not trust [her]3413-her alone by the gaping lattice ; when to [my]43-heathcliff consternation , [I]43-heathcliff heard the rattle of the door - handle , and [Mr. Linton]73-mr. linton entered . [He]73-mr. linton had only then come from [the library]3270-the library ; and , in passing through [the lobby]3415-the lobby , had noticed [our]3416-our talking and been attracted by curiosity , or fear to examine what it signified , at that late hour . "[43-heathcliff] Oh , [sir]2571-sir ! " [I]43-heathcliff cried , checking the exclamation risen to [his]73-mr. linton lips at the sight which met [him]73-mr. linton , and the bleak atmosphere of [the chamber]2699-the chamber . "[43-heathcliff] [[My]0-i poor Mistress]1173-my poor mistress is ill , and [she]1173-my poor mistress quite masters [me]0-i ; [I]0-i can not manage [her]1173-my poor mistress at all , pray , come and persuade [her]1173-my poor mistress to go to bed . "[56-catherine] [She]1173-my poor mistress 's been fretting [here]2574-here , " [I]1173-my poor mistress continued , "[1173-my poor mistress] and eating scarcely anything , and never complaining , [she]1173-my poor mistress would admit none of [us]1176-we till this evening , and so [we]1176-we could n't inform [you]1174-your of [her]1173-my poor mistress state , as [we]1176-we were not aware of it [ourselves]1176-we , " but it is nothing . "[430-the master] And [he]430-the master took [[his]430-the master wife]2670-his wife in [his]430-the master arms , and looked at [her]2670-his wife with anguish . "[56-catherine] [A maniac]1183-a maniac 's fury kindled under [her]56-catherine brows ; [she]56-catherine struggled desperately to disengage [herself]56-catherine from [Linton]56-catherine 's arms . [I]0-i felt no inclination to tarry the event ; and resolving to seek medical aid on [my]0-i own responsibility , [I]0-i quitted [the chamber]2699-the chamber . In passing [the garden]2718-the garden to reach [the road]2638-the road , at a place where a bridle hook is driven into the wall , [I]0-i saw something white moved irregularly evidently by [another agent]1187-another agent than the wind . Notwithstanding [my]0-i hurry , [I]0-i staid to examine it , lest ever after [I]0-i should have the conviction impressed on [my]0-i imagination that it was a creature of [the other world]1188-the other world . [My]0-i surprise and perplexity were great to discover , by touch more than vision , [Miss Isabella]112-isabella 's springer Fanny , suspended to a handkerchief , and nearly at its last gasp . [I]0-i quickly released the animal , and lifted [it]1189-it into [the garden]2718-the garden . [I]0-i had seen [it]1189-it follow [[its]1189-it mistress]1191-its mistress up - [stairs]416-stairs , when [she]1191-its mistress went to bed , and wondered much how it could have got out there , and what [mischievous person]1193-mischievous person had treated [it]1189-it so . While untying the knot round the hook , it seemed to [me]0-i that [I]0-i repeatedly caught the beat of horses ' feet gallopping at some distance ; but there were such a number of things to occupy [my]0-i reflections that [I]0-i hardly gave the circumstance a thought , though it was a strange sound , in [that place]1194-that place , at two o'clock in the morning . [Mr. Kenneth]92-kenneth was fortunately just issuing from [[his]92-kenneth house]3060-his house to see [a patient in [the village]1197-the village]1196-a patient in the village as [I]0-i came up [the street]1198-the street ; and [my]0-i account of [Catherine Linton]56-catherine 's malady induced [him]92-kenneth to accompany [me]0-i back immediately . [He]92-kenneth was [a plain , rough man]1199-a plain , rough man ; and [he]92-kenneth made no scruple to speak [his]92-kenneth doubts of [her]56-catherine surviving this second attack ; unless [she]56-catherine were more submissive to [his]92-kenneth directions than [she]56-catherine had shown [herself]56-catherine before . " [Nelly Dean]80-ellen , "[92-kenneth] said [he]92-kenneth , " [I]92-kenneth ca n't help fancying there 's an extra cause for this . What has there been to do at [the Grange]73-mr. linton ? [We]3434-we 've odd reports up here . [A stout , hearty lass]3435-a stout , hearty lass like [Catherine]56-catherine does not fall ill for a trifle ; and [that sort of people]3436-that sort of people should not either . "[92-kenneth] " [The master]430-the master will inform [you]92-kenneth , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered ; " but [you]92-kenneth are acquainted with [the Earnshaw]75-hindley 's violent dispositions , and [Mrs. Linton]48-mrs. linton caps [them]3439-them all . Afterwards , [she]48-mrs. linton refused to eat , and now [she]48-mrs. linton alternately raves , and remains in a half dream , knowing those about [her]48-mrs. linton , but having [her]48-mrs. linton mind filled with all sorts of strange ideas and illusions . "[528-the doctor] This news filled [me]0-i with fresh fears ; [I]0-i outstripped [Kenneth]92-kenneth , and ran most of the way back . The little dog was yelping in [the garden]2718-the garden yet . [I]0-i spared a minute to open the gate for it , but instead of going to [the house]185-the house door , it coursed up and down snuffing the grass , and would have escaped to [the road]2638-the road , had [I]0-i not seized and conveyed it in with [me]0-i . On ascending to [[Isabella]112-isabella 's room]1205-isabella 's room , [my]0-i suspicions were confirmed ; [it]1205-isabella 's room was empty . Had [I]0-i been a few hours sooner , [Mrs. Linton]48-mrs. linton 's illness might have arrested [her]48-mrs. linton rash step . But what could be done now ? There was a bare possibility of overtaking [them]1206-them if pursued instantly . [I]0-i could not pursue [them]1206-them , however ; and [I]0-i dare not rouse [the family]335-the family , and fill [the place]188-the place with confusion ; still less unfold the business to [[my]0-i master]530-my master , absorbed as [he]530-my master was in [his]530-my master present calamity , and having no heart to spare for a second grief ! [I]0-i saw nothing for it , but to hold [my]0-i tongue , and suffer matters to take [their]1206-them course : and [Kenneth]92-kenneth being arrived , [I]0-i went with a badly composed countenance to announce [him]92-kenneth . [Catherine]56-catherine lay in a troubled sleep ; [[her]56-catherine husband]2614-her husband had succeeded in soothing the access of frenzy ; [he]2614-her husband now hung over [her]56-catherine pillow , watching every shade , and every change of [her]56-catherine painfully expressive features . [The doctor]528-the doctor , on examining the case for [himself]528-the doctor , spoke hopefully to [him]528-the doctor of its having a favourable termination , if [we]1212-we could only preserve around [her]56-catherine perfect and constant tranquillity . To [me]0-i , [he]528-the doctor signified the threatening danger was , not so much death , as permanent alienation of intellect . [I]0-i did not close [my]0-i eyes that night , nor did [Mr. Linton]73-mr. linton ; indeed , [we]1212-we never went to bed : and [the servants]2807-the servants were all up long before the usual hour , moving through [the house]185-the house with stealthy tread , and exchanging whispers as [they]2807-the servants encountered each other in [their]2807-the servants vocations . [Every one]1215-every one was active , but [Miss Isabella]112-isabella ; and [they]2807-the servants began to remark how sound [she]112-isabella slept — [[her]112-isabella brother]527-her brother too asked if [she]112-isabella had risen , and seemed impatient for [her]112-isabella presence , and hurt that [she]112-isabella showed so little anxiety for [[her]112-isabella sister - in - law]2886-her sister - in - law . " Why , [I]2711-the servant met on the road a lad that fetches milk here , "[2711-the servant] [she]2711-the servant stammered , " and [he]73-mr. linton asked whether [we]3455-we wern't in trouble at [the Grange]2656-the grange — [I]2711-the servant thought [he]73-mr. linton meant for [Missis]120-missis 's sickness , so [I]2711-the servant answered , yes . [He]73-mr. linton saw [I]0-i knew naught about it , and [he]73-mr. linton told how [a gentleman]201-a gentleman and [lady]640-lady had stopped to have a horse 's shoe fastened at [[a blacksmith]1228-a blacksmith 's shop]1229-a blacksmith 's shop , [two miles out of [Gimmerton]14-gimmerton]1230-two miles out of gimmerton , not very long after midnight ! and how [the blacksmith 's lass]1231-the blacksmith 's lass had got up to spy who [they]1232-they were : [she]1231-the blacksmith 's lass knew [them]1232-they both directly — And [she]1231-the blacksmith 's lass noticed [the man]382-the man , [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff it was , [she]1231-the blacksmith 's lass felt certain , [nob'dy]121-nob'dy could mistake [him]43-heathcliff , besides — put a sovereign in [[her]1231-the blacksmith 's lass father]502-her father 's hand for payment . [The lady]969-the lady had a cloak about [her]969-the lady face ; but having desired a sup of water , while [she]969-the lady drank , it fell back , and [she]969-the lady saw [her]969-the lady very plain — [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff held both bridles as [they]1232-they rode on , and [they]1232-they set [their]1232-they faces from [the village]1197-the village , and went as fast as [the rough roads]1237-the rough roads would let [them]1232-they . [The lass]1238-the lass said nothing to [[her]1238-the lass father]502-her father , but [she]1238-the lass told it al over [Gimmerton]14-gimmerton this morning . " [I]1238-the lass ran and peeped , for form 's sake into [[Isabella]112-isabella 's room]1205-isabella 's room : confirming , when [I]1238-the lass returned , [the servant]2711-the servant 's statement — [Mr. Linton]73-mr. linton had resumed [his]73-mr. linton seat by the bed ; on [my]1238-the lass re - entrance , [he]73-mr. linton raised [his]73-mr. linton eyes , read the meaning of [my]1238-the lass blank aspect , and dropped them without giving an order , or uttering a word . "[1238-the lass] Are [we]1240-we to try any measures for overtaking and bringing [her]1238-the lass back , " [I]1238-the lass inquired . "[1238-the lass] How should [we]1240-we do ? " "[1238-the lass] [She]1238-the lass went of [her]1238-the lass own accord , " answered [the master]430-the master ; "[1238-the lass] [she]1238-the lass had a right to go if [she]1238-the lass pleased — Trouble [me]0-i no more about [her]1238-the lass — Hereafter [she]1238-the lass is only [[my]0-i sister]1241-my sister in name ; not because [I]0-i disown [her]1238-the lass , but because [she]1238-the lass has disowned [me]0-i . " And that was all [he]430-the master said on the subject ; [he]430-the master did not make a single inquiry further , or mention [her]1238-the lass in any way , except directing [me]1238-the lass to send what property [she]1238-the lass had in [the house]185-the house to [[her]1238-the lass fresh home]3463-her fresh home , wherever it was , when [I]1238-the lass knew it . For two months [the fugitives]3464-the fugitives remained absent , in those two months , [Mrs. Linton]48-mrs. linton encountered and conquered the worst shock of what was denominated a brain fever . [No mother]3465-no mother could have nursed [an only child]3466-an only child more devotedly than [Edgar]81-edgar tended [her]1238-the lass . Day and night , [he]430-the master was watching , and patiently enduring all the annoyances that irritable nerves and a shaken reason could inflict : and , though [Kenneth]92-kenneth remarked that what [he]430-the master saved from the grave would only recompense [his]430-the master care by forming the source of constant future anxiety , in fact , that [his]430-the master health and strength were being sacrificed to preserve a mere ruin of humanity , [he]430-the master knew no limits in gratitude and joy , when [Catherine]56-catherine 's life was declared out of danger ; and hour after hour , [he]430-the master would sit beside [her]56-catherine , tracing the gradual return to bodily health , and flattering [his]430-the master too sanguine hopes with the illusion that [her]56-catherine mind would settle back to its right balance also , and [she]56-catherine would soon be entirely [her]56-catherine former self . The first time [she]56-catherine left [[her]56-catherine chamber]2833-her chamber , was at the commencement of the following March . [Mr. Linton]73-mr. linton had put on [her]56-catherine pillow , in the morning , a handful of golden crocuses ; [her]56-catherine eye , long stranger to any gleam of pleasure , caught them in waking , and shone delighted as [she]56-catherine gathered them eagerly together . "[1238-the lass] These are the earliest flowers at [the Heights]568-the heights ! " [she]56-catherine exclaimed . "[1238-the lass] They remind [me]0-i of soft thaw winds , and warm sunshine , and nearly melted snow — [Edgar]81-edgar , is there not a south wind , and is not the snow almost gone ? " "[81-edgar] The snow is quite gone ; down here , [darling]344-darling ! " replied [[her]56-catherine husband]2614-her husband , "[344-darling] and [I]0-i only see two white spots on [the whole range of moors]1244-the whole range of moors — The sky is blue , and the larks are singing , and the becks and brooks are all brim full . [Catherine]56-catherine ; last spring at this time , [I]0-i was longing to have [you]56-catherine under [this roof]1245-this roof — now , [I]0-i wish [you]56-catherine were a mile or two up [those hills]1160-those hills , the air blows so sweetly , [I]0-i feel that it would cure [you]56-catherine . " "[0-i] [I]0-i shall never be there , but once more ! " said [the invalid]3469-the invalid ; "[56-catherine] and then [you]56-catherine 'll leave [me]0-i , and [I]0-i shall remain , for ever . Next spring [you]56-catherine 'll long again to have [me]0-i under this roof , and [you]56-catherine 'll look back and think [you]56-catherine were happy to - day . " [Linton]81-edgar lavished on [her]56-catherine the kindest caresses , and tried to cheer [her]56-catherine by the fondest words ; but vaguely regarding the flowers , [she]56-catherine let the tears collect on [her]56-catherine lashes , and stream down [her]56-catherine cheeks unheeding . [We]3470-we knew [she]56-catherine was really better , and therefore , decided that long confinement to [a single place]3471-a single place produced much of this despondency , and it might be partially removed by a change of scene . [The master]430-the master told [me]56-catherine to light a fire in [the many - week 's deserted parlour]3473-the many - week 's deserted parlour , and to set an easy - chair in the sunshine by the window ; and then [he]430-the master brought [her]56-catherine down , and [she]56-catherine sat a long while enjoying the genial heat , and , as [we]3470-we expected , revived by the objects round [her]56-catherine , which , though familiar , were free from the dreary associations investing [[her]56-catherine hated sick - chamber]3474-her hated sick - chamber . By evening , [she]56-catherine seemed greatly exhausted ; yet no arguments could persuade [her]56-catherine to return to [that apartment]3475-that apartment , and [I]56-catherine had to arrange the parlour sofa for [her]56-catherine bed , till [another room]3476-another room could be prepared . To obviate the fatigue of mounting and descending the stairs , [we]3470-we fitted up this , where [you]3477-you lie at present ; on the same floor with [the parlour]3177-the parlour : and [she]56-catherine was soon strong enough to move from one to the other , leaning on [Edgar]81-edgar 's arm . Ah , [I]56-catherine thought [myself]56-catherine , [she]56-catherine might recover , so waited on as [she]56-catherine was . And there was double cause to desire it , for on [her]56-catherine existence depended that of another ; [we]3470-we cherished the hope that in a little while , [Mr. Linton]73-mr. linton 's heart would be gladdened , and [[his]73-mr. linton lands]3479-his lands secured from [a stranger]2580-a stranger 's gripe , by the birth of [an heir]3481-an heir . [I]56-catherine should mention that [Isabella]112-isabella sent to [[her]112-isabella brother]527-her brother , some six weeks from [her]112-isabella departure a short note , announcing [her]112-isabella marriage with [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff . It appeared dry and cold ; but at the bottom , was dotted in with pencil , an obscure apology , and an entreaty for kind remembrance , and reconciliation , if [her]56-catherine proceeding had offended [him]73-mr. linton ; asserting that [she]56-catherine could not help it then , and being done , [she]56-catherine had now no power to repeal it . [Linton]81-edgar did not reply to this , [I]56-catherine believe ; and , in a fortnight more , [I]56-catherine got a long letter which [I]56-catherine considered odd coming from the pen of [a bride]3483-a bride just out of the honeymoon . [I]56-catherine 'll read it , for [I]56-catherine keep it yet . Any relic of the dead is precious , if [they]3484-they were valued living . "[56-catherine] [Dear Ellen]80-ellen , " it begins . "[80-ellen] [I]0-i came , last night , to [Wuthering Heights]11-wuthering heights , and heard , for the first time , that [Catherine]56-catherine has been , and is yet , very ill . [I]0-i must not write to [her]56-catherine [I]0-i suppose , and [[my]0-i brother]2672-my brother is either too angry , or too distressed to answer what [I]0-i send [him]2672-my brother . Still , [I]0-i must write to [somebody]2654-somebody , and the only choice left [me]0-i is [you]2654-somebody . Inform [Edgar]81-edgar that [I]0-i 'd give [the world]267-the world to see [his]81-edgar face again — that [my]0-i heart returned to [Thrushcross Grange]73-mr. linton in twenty - four hours after [I]0-i left [it]73-mr. linton , and is there at this moment , full of warm feelings for [him]81-edgar , and [Catherine]56-catherine ! [I]0-i ca n't follow it though—(those words are underlined ) [they]1250-they need not expect [me]0-i , and [they]1250-they may draw what conclusions [they]1250-they please ; taking care however , to lay nothing at the door of [my]0-i weak will , or deficient affection . The remainder of the letter is for [yourself]2654-somebody , alone . [I]0-i want to ask [you]2654-somebody two questions : the first is , How did [you]2654-somebody contrive to preserve the common sympathies of human nature when [you]2654-somebody resided [here]2574-here ? [I]0-i can not recognise any sentiment which [those around]1252-those around , share with [me]0-i . The second question , [I]0-i have great interest in ; it is this — Is [Mr. Heathcliff]43-heathcliff [a man]2653-a man ? If so , is [he]43-heathcliff mad ? And if not , is [he]43-heathcliff [a devil]1254-a devil ? [I]0-i sha n't tell [my]0-i reasons for making this inquiry ; but , [I]0-i beseech [you]2654-somebody to explain , if [you]2654-somebody can , what [I]0-i have married — that is , when [you]2654-somebody call to see [me]0-i ; and [you]2654-somebody must call [Ellen]80-ellen , very soon . Do n't write , but come , and bring [me]0-i something from [Edgar]81-edgar . Now , [you]2654-somebody shall hear how [I]0-i have been received in [[my]0-i new home]1255-my new home , as [I]0-i am led to imagine [the Heights]568-the heights will be . It is to amuse [myself]0-i that [I]0-i dwell on such subjects as the lack of external comforts ; [they]1257-they never occupy [my]0-i thoughts , except at the moment when [I]0-i miss [them]1257-they — [I]0-i should laugh and dance for joy , if [I]0-i found [their]1257-they absence was the total of [my]0-i miseries , and the rest was an unnatural dream ! The sun set behind [the Grange]2656-the grange , as [we]1259-we turned on to [the moors]352-the moors ; by that , [I]0-i judged it to be six o'clock ; and [[my]0-i companion]350-my companion halted half - an - hour , to inspect [the park]2652-the park , and [the gardens]1263-the gardens , and , probably , [the place itself]1264-the place itself , as well as [he]350-my companion could ; so it was dark when [we]1259-we dismounted in [the paved yard of [the farmhouse]1266-the farmhouse]1265-the paved yard of the farmhouse , and [[your]1267-your old fellow - servant]1268-your old fellow - servant , [Joseph]45-joseph , issued out to receive [us]1259-we by the light of a dip candle . [He]45-joseph did it with a courtesy that redounded to [his]45-joseph credit . [His]45-joseph first act was to elevate [his]45-joseph torch to a level with [my]0-i face , squint malignantly , project [his]45-joseph under lip , and turn away . Then [he]45-joseph took the two horses , and led [them]1269-them into [the stables]346-the stables ; reappearing for the purpose of locking the outer gate , as if [we]1259-we lived in [an ancient castle]1271-an ancient castle . [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff stayed to speak to [him]43-heathcliff , and [I]0-i entered [the kitchen]194-the kitchen — [a dingy , untidy hole]1273-a dingy , untidy hole ; [I]0-i dare say [you]1274-you would not know it , it is so changed since it was in [your]1274-you charge . By the fire stood [a ruffianly child]1275-a ruffianly child , strong in limb , and dirty in garb , with a look of [Catherine]56-catherine in [his]1275-a ruffianly child eyes , and about [his]1275-a ruffianly child mouth . " This is [[Edgar]81-edgar 's legal nephew]3485-edgar 's legal nephew , "[0-i] [I]0-i reflected—"mine in a manner ; [I]0-i must shake hands , and — yes — [I]0-i must kiss [him]1275-a ruffianly child . It is right to establish a good understanding at the beginning . "[0-i] [I]0-i approached , and , attempting to take [his]1275-a ruffianly child chubby fist , said — " How do [you]1275-a ruffianly child do , [[my]1275-a ruffianly child dear]601-my dear ? "[1275-a ruffianly child] [He]1275-a ruffianly child replied in a jargon [I]0-i did not comprehend . " Shall [you]1275-a ruffianly child and [I]123-throttler be [friends]3176-friends , [Hareton]47-hareton ? "[123-throttler] was [my]0-i next essay at conversation . An oath , and a threat to set [Throttler]123-throttler on [me]0-i if [I]0-i did not " frame off "[0-i] rewarded [my]0-i perseverance . " Hey , [Throttler]3488-throttler , [lad]3489-lad ! "[1275-a ruffianly child] [he]1275-a ruffianly child asked authoritatively . [Mr. Heathcliff]43-heathcliff was nowhere visible ; and [Joseph]45-joseph , whom [I]0-i followed to [the stables]346-the stables , and requested to accompany [me]0-i in , after staring and muttering to [himself]45-joseph , screwed up [his]45-joseph nose and replied — " Mim ! mim ! mim ! "[45-joseph] " [I]0-i say , [I]0-i wish [you]45-joseph to come with [me]0-i into [the house]185-the house ! Aw getten summut else to do , "[45-joseph] [he]45-joseph answered , and continued [his]45-joseph work , moving [his]45-joseph lantern jaws meanwhile , and surveying [my]0-i dress and countenance ( the former a great deal too fine , but the latter , [I]0-i 'm sure , as sad as [he]45-joseph could desire ) with sovereign contempt . [I]0-i walked round [the yard]252-the yard , and through [a wicket]1279-a wicket , to another door , at which [I]0-i took the liberty of knocking , in hopes [some more civil servant]1280-some more civil servant might shew [himself]1280-some more civil servant . " What 's [your]0-i business here ? "[45-joseph] [he]45-joseph demanded , grimly . " Who are [you]0-i ? "[45-joseph] " [My]0-i name was [Isabella Linton]82-isabella , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied . "[0-i] " Is [he]43-heathcliff come back , then ? "[1282-the hermit] asked [the hermit]1282-the hermit , glaring like a hungry wolf . " Yes — [we]3495-we came just now , "[0-i] [I]0-i said ; " but [he]43-heathcliff left [me]0-i by the kitchen door ; and when [I]0-i would have gone in , [[your]45-joseph little boy]3496-your little boy played sentinel over [the place]188-the place , and frightened [me]0-i off by the help of a bull - dog . "[0-i] " It 's well [the hellish villain]3498-the hellish villain has kept [his]3498-the hellish villain word ! "[1283-my future host] growled [[my]0-i future host]1283-my future host , searching the darkness beyond [me]0-i in expectation of discovering [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff , and then [he]1283-my future host indulged in a soliloquy of execrations , and threats of what [he]1283-my future host would have done had [the " fiend]3499-the " fiend "[1283-my future host] deceived [him]1283-my future host . [I]0-i repented having tried this second entrance ; and was almost inclined to slip way before [he]1283-my future host finished cursing , but ere [I]0-i could execute that intention , [he]1283-my future host ordered [me]0-i in , and shut and re - fastened the door . There was a great fire , and that was all the light in [the huge apartment]1284-the huge apartment , whose floor had grown a uniform grey ; and the once brilliant pewter dishes which used to attract [my]0-i gaze when [I]0-i was [a girl]1158-a girl partook of a similar obscurity , created by tarnish and dust . [I]0-i inquired whether [I]0-i might call [the maid]1286-the maid , and be conducted to [a bed - room]1287-a bed - room ? [Mr. Earnshaw]75-hindley vouchsafed no answer . [He]75-hindley walked up and down , with [his]75-hindley hands in [his]75-hindley pockets , apparently quite forgetting [my]0-i presence ; and [his]75-hindley abstraction was evidently so deep , and [his]75-hindley whole aspect so misanthropical , that [I]0-i shrank from disturbing [him]75-hindley again . " [You]0-i 'll not be surprised , [Ellen]80-ellen , at [my]0-i feeling particularly cheerless , seated in worse than solitude , on that inhospitable hearth , and remembering that four miles distant lay [[my]0-i delightful home]3500-my delightful home , containing [the only people [I]0-i loved on [earth]2805-earth]3501-the only people i loved on earth : and there might as well be [the Atlantic]30-the atlantic to part [us]3503-us , instead of those four miles , [I]0-i could not overpass [them]30-the atlantic ! [I]0-i questioned with [myself]0-i — where must [I]0-i turn for comfort ? and — mind [you]0-i do n't tell [Edgar]81-edgar , or [Catherine]56-catherine — above every sorrow beside , this rose pre - eminent — despair at finding [nobody who could or would be [[my]0-i ally against [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff]3505-my ally against heathcliff]3504-nobody who could or would be my ally against heathcliff ! [I]0-i had sought shelter at [Wuthering Heights]11-wuthering heights , almost gladly , because [I]0-i was secured by that arrangement from living alone with [him]43-heathcliff ; but [he]43-heathcliff knew [the people [we]3503-us were coming amongst]3506-the people we were coming amongst , and [he]43-heathcliff did not fear [their]3506-the people we were coming amongst intermeddling . [I]0-i sat and thought a doleful time ; the clock struck eight , and nine , and still [[my]0-i companion]350-my companion paced to and fro , [his]350-my companion head bent on [his]350-my companion breast , and perfectly silent , unless a groan , or a bitter ejaculation forced itself out at intervals . [I]0-i listened to detect [a woman]524-a woman 's voice in [the house]185-the house , and filled the interim with wild regrets , and dismal anticipations , which , at last , spoke audibly in irrepressible sighing , and weeping . [I]0-i was not aware how openly [I]0-i grieved , till [Earnshaw]75-hindley halted opposite , in [his]75-hindley measured walk , and gave [me]0-i a stare of newly awakened surprise . Taking advantage of [his]75-hindley recovered attention , [I]0-i exclaimed — "[0-i] [I]0-i 'm tired with [my]0-i journey , and [I]0-i want to go to bed ! " "[1289-i] [We]1289-i have none , " [he]75-hindley answered ; "[1289-i] [you]0-i must wait on [yourself]0-i ! " "[1289-i] Where must [I]0-i sleep , then ? " [I]1290-he sobbed — [I]1290-he was beyond regarding self - respect , weighed down by fatigue and wretchedness . [Joseph]45-joseph will show [you]1290-he [[Heathcliff]43-heathcliff 's chamber]3510-heathcliff 's chamber , "[1290-he] said [he]1290-he ; " open that door — [he]43-heathcliff 's in [there]2637-there . "[1290-he] " [I]1289-i was going to obey , but [he]1290-he suddenly arrested [me]1289-i , and added in the strangest tone — "[1289-i] Be so good as to turn [your]0-i lock , and draw [your]0-i bolt — don't omit it ! " "[1289-i] Well ! " [I]1289-i said . "[1289-i] But why , [Mr. Earnshaw]75-hindley ? " [I]75-hindley did not relish the notion of deliberately fastening [myself]75-hindley in with [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff . "[75-hindley] Look here ! " [he]1290-he replied , pulling from [his]1290-he waistcoat a curiously constructed pistol , having a double edged spring knife attached to the barrel . "[75-hindley] That 's a great tempter to [a desperate man]1291-a desperate man , is it not ? [I]0-i can not resist going up with this , every night , and trying [his]1290-he door , if once [I]0-i find it open [he]1290-he 's done for ! [I]0-i do it invariably , even though the minute before [I]0-i have been recalling a hundred reasons that should make [me]0-i refrain — it is some devil that urges [me]0-i to thwart [my]0-i own schemes by killing [him]1290-he — [you]1292-you fight against [that devil]1293-that devil , for love , as as long as [you]1292-you may ; when the time comes , [not all the angels in [heaven]809-heaven]1294-not all the angels in heaven shall save [him]1290-he ! [I]0-i surveyed the weapon inquisitively ; a hideous notion struck [me]0-i . How powerful [I]0-i should be possessing such an instrument ! [I]0-i took it from [his]1290-he hand , and touched the blade . [He]1290-he looked astonished at the expression [my]0-i face assumed during a brief second . It was not horror , it was covetousness . [He]1290-he snatched the pistol back , jealously ; shut the knife , and returned it to its concealment . " [I]1290-he do n't care if [you]0-i tell [him]1290-he , "[1290-he] said [he]1290-he . Put [him]1290-he on [his]1290-he guard , and watch for [him]1290-he . [You]1292-you know the terms [we]1296-we are on , [I]0-i see ; [his]1290-he danger does not shock [you]1292-you . " "[0-i] What has [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff done to [you]1290-he ? " [I]43-heathcliff asked . "[43-heathcliff] In what has [he]43-heathcliff wronged [you]1290-he to warrant this appalling hatred ? Would n't it be wiser to bid [him]43-heathcliff quit [the house]185-the house ? " "[43-heathcliff] No , " thundered [Earnshaw]75-hindley , "[43-heathcliff] should [he]43-heathcliff offer to leave [me]0-i , [he]43-heathcliff 's [a dead man]1298-a dead man , persuade [him]43-heathcliff to attempt it , and [you]1290-he are [a murderess]1299-a murderess ! Am [I]0-i to lose all without a chance of retrieval ? Is [Hareton]47-hareton to be [a beggar]1300-a beggar ? Oh , damnation ! [I]0-i will have it back ; and [I]0-i 'll have [his]43-heathcliff gold too ; and then [his]43-heathcliff blood ; and hell shall have [his]43-heathcliff soul ! It will be ten times blacker with [that guest]1301-that guest than ever it was before ! " "[1290-he] [You]1290-he 've acquainted [me]0-i , [Ellen]80-ellen , with [[your]80-ellen [old master]1303-old master]1302-your old master 's habits . [He]1303-old master is clearly on the verge of madness — [he]1303-old master was so last night , at least . [I]0-i shuddered to be near [him]1303-old master , and thought on [the servant]2711-the servant 's ill - bred moroseness as comparatively agreeable . [He]1303-old master now recommenced [his]1303-old master moody walk , and [I]0-i raised the latch , and escaped into [the kitchen]194-the kitchen . [Joseph]45-joseph was bending over the fire , peering into a large pan that swung above it ; and a wooden bowl of oatmeal stood on the settle close by . The contents of the pan began to boil , and [he]1303-old master turned to plunge [his]1303-old master hand into the bowl ; [I]0-i conjectured that this preparation was probably for [our]1306-our supper , and , being hungry , [I]0-i resolved it should be eatable — so crying out , sharply—"I'll make the porridge ! "[0-i] [I]0-i removed the vessel out of [his]1303-old master reach , and proceeded to take off [my]0-i hat and riding habit . " [Mr. Earnshaw]75-hindley , "[0-i] [I]0-i continued , " directs [me]0-i to wait on [myself]0-i — [I]0-i will — [I'm]0-i not going to act [the lady among [you]1303-old master]3512-the lady among you , for fear [I]0-i should starve . "[0-i] " [Gooid Lord]125-gooid lord ! "[1303-old master] [he]1303-old master muttered , sitting down , and stroking [his]1303-old master ribbed stockings from the knee to the ankle . " If [they]3513-they 's tuh be fresh ortherings — just when [Aw]107-aw getten used [tuh]107-aw [two maisters]3514-two maisters , if aw mun [hev]3515-hev [a mistress]3516-a mistress set o'er [my]1303-old master heead , it 's loike time tuh be flitting . Aw niver did think [tuh]107-aw say t ' day ut aw mud lave [th ' owld place]3517-th ' owld place — but aw daht it 's nigh at hend ! "[1303-old master] This lamentation drew no notice from [me]0-i ; [I]0-i went briskly to work ; sighing to remember a period when it would have been all merry fun ; but compelled speedily to drive off the remembrance . It racked [me]0-i to recall past happiness , and the greater peril there was of conjuring up its apparition , the quicker the thible ran round , and the faster the handfuls of meal fell into the water . [Joseph]45-joseph beheld [my]0-i style of cookery with growing indignation . " [Thear]126-thear ! "[45-joseph] [he]45-joseph ejaculated . " [Hareton]47-hareton , [thah]107-aw willut sup [thy]107-aw porridge tuh neeght ; they 'll be nowt bud lumps as big as maw nave . [Thear]126-thear , [agean]3518-agean ! Aw'd fling in bowl un all , if aw [wer]107-aw yah ! [Thear]126-thear , pale t ' guilp off , un ' then [yah'll]107-aw hae done wi't . Bang , bang . It 's a marcy t ' bothom is n't deaved aht ! "[45-joseph] It was rather a rough mess , [I]0-i own , when poured into the basins ; four had been provided , and a gallon pitcher of new milk was brought from [the dairy]1307-the dairy , which [Hareton]47-hareton seized and commenced drinking and spilling from the expansive lip . [I]0-i expostulated , and desired that [he]47-hareton should have [his]47-hareton in a mug ; affirming that [I]0-i could not taste the liquid treated so dirtily . [The old cynic]1308-the old cynic chose to be vastly offended at this nicety ; assuring [me]0-i , repeatedly , that " [the barn]249-the barn was every bit as gooid "[0-i] as [I]0-i , " and every bit as wollsome , "[0-i] and wondering how [I]0-i could fashion to be so conceited ; meanwhile , [the infant ruffian]1309-the infant ruffian continued sucking ; and glowered up at [me]0-i defyingly , as [he]1309-the infant ruffian slavered into the jug . " [I]0-i shall have [my]0-i supper in [another room]3476-another room , "[0-i] [I]0-i said . " Have [you]47-hareton no place [you]47-hareton call a parlour ? "[0-i] " Parlour ! "[47-hareton] [he]47-hareton echoed , sneeringly , " parlour ! Nay , [we]3521-we 've noa parlours . If [[yah]3522-yah dunnut loike wer company]3523-yah dunnut loike wer company , [they]3523-yah dunnut loike wer company 's [maister]2658-maister 's ; un ' if [[yah]3522-yah dunnut loike maister]3525-yah dunnut loike maister , [they]3523-yah dunnut loike wer company 's [us]3521-we . "[47-hareton] " Then [I]0-i shall go up - [stairs]416-stairs , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered ; " shew [me]0-i [a chamber]3527-a chamber ! "[0-i] [I]0-i put [my]0-i basin on a tray , and went [myself]0-i to fetch some more milk . With great grumblings , [the fellow]236-the fellow rose , and preceded [me]0-i in [my]0-i ascent : [we]1311-we mounted to [the garrets]1312-the garrets ; [he]236-the fellow opening a door , now and then , to look into [the apartments]1313-the apartments [we]1311-we passed . " Here 's a rahm , "[236-the fellow] [he]236-the fellow said , at last , flinging back a cranky board on hinges . " It 's weel eneugh tuh ate a few porridge in . [They]3528-they 's a pack uh corn [i]236-the fellow ' t ' corner , thear , meeterly clane ; if [yah're]3529-yer feared [uh]3530-uh muckying [yer]3529-yer grand silk cloes , spread [yer]3529-yer hankerchir ut t ' top on't . "[236-the fellow] The " rahm "[236-the fellow] was a kind of lumber - hole smelling strong of malt and grain ; various sacks of which articles were piled around , leaving a wide , bare space in the middle . " Why , [man]283-man ! "[0-i] [I]0-i exclaimed , facing [him]236-the fellow angrily , " this is not a place to sleep in . [I]0-i wish to see [[my]0-i bed - room]3532-my bed - room . "[0-i] " Bed - rume ! "[236-the fellow] [he]236-the fellow repeated , in a tone of mockery . " [Yah]3529-yer 's see all t ' bed - rumes thear is — yon 's mine . "[236-the fellow] [He]236-the fellow pointed into [the second garret]1314-the second garret , only differing from the first in being more naked about the walls , and having a large , low , curtainless bed , with an indigo - coloured quilt , at one end . " What do [I]0-i want with [yours]236-the fellow ? "[0-i] [I]0-i retorted . " [I]0-i suppose [Mr. Heathcliff]43-heathcliff does not lodge at the top of [the house]185-the house , does [he]43-heathcliff ? "[0-i] " Oh ! it 's [Maister]58-hindley Hathecliff 's yah're wenting ? "[236-the fellow] cried [he]236-the fellow , as if making a new discovery . " Could n't [ye]0-i uh said soa , at onst ? un then , aw mud uh telled [ye]0-i , baht all this wark , ut that 's just one [yah]3529-yer cannut [sea]3534-sea — [he]43-heathcliff allas keeps it locked , un ' nob'dy iver mells on't but hisseln . "[236-the fellow] " [You]236-the fellow 've [a nice house]3535-a nice house , [Joseph]45-joseph , "[0-i] [I]0-i could not refrain from observing , " and [pleasant inmates]3536-pleasant inmates ; and [I]0-i think the concentrated essence of all the madness in [the world]267-the world took up its abode in [my]0-i brain the day [I]0-i linked [my]0-i fate with theirs ! However that is not to the present purpose — there are [other rooms]3538-other rooms . For heaven 's sake , be quick , and let [me]0-i settle somewhere ! "[0-i] [He]236-the fellow made no reply to this adjuration ; only plodding doggedly down the wooden steps , and halting before [an apartment which , from that halt , and the superior quality of [its]1315-an apartment which , from that halt , and the superior quality of its furniture , i conjectured to be the best one furniture , [I]0-i conjectured to be the best one]1315-an apartment which , from that halt , and the superior quality of its furniture , i conjectured to be the best one . There was a carpet , a good one ; but the pattern was obliterated by dust ; a fire - place hung with cut paper dropping to pieces ; [a handsome oak - bedstead with ample crimson curtains of rather expensive material , and modern make]1316-a handsome oak - bedstead with ample crimson curtains of rather expensive material , and modern make . But [they]1317-they had evidently experienced rough usage , the valances hung in festoons , wrenched from [their]1317-they rings ; and the iron rod supporting them was bent in an arc , on one side , causing the drapery to trail upon the floor . The chairs were also damaged , many of them severely ; and deep indentations deformed the panels of the walls . [I]0-i was endeavouring to gather resolution for entering , and taking possession , when [[my]0-i fool of [a guide]2624-a guide]1318-my fool of a guide announced — " This here is [t ' maister]3539-t ' maister 's . "[2624-a guide] [My]0-i supper by this time was cold , [my]0-i appetite gone , and [my]0-i patience exhausted . [I]0-i insisted on being provided instantly with [a place of refuge]1320-a place of refuge , and means of repose . " Whear the divil , "[1321-the religious elder] began [the religious elder]1321-the religious elder . " [The Lord]2633-the lord bless [us]3541-ye ! [The Lord]2633-the lord forgie [us]3541-ye ! Whear the hell , wold [ye]3541-ye gang ? [ye]3541-ye marred , wearisome nowt ! [Yah]3541-ye seen all bud [Hareton]47-hareton 's bit uf a cham'er . [They]3543-they 's nut another hoile tuh lig dahn in [i]1321-the religious elder ' th ' hahse ! "[1321-the religious elder] [I]0-i was so vexed , [I]0-i flung [my]0-i tray , and its contents on the ground ; and then seated [myself]0-i at the stairs - head , hid [my]0-i face in [my]0-i hands , and cried . " Ech ! ech ! "[45-joseph] exclaimed [Joseph]45-joseph . " Weel done , [Miss Cathy]56-catherine ! weel done , [Miss Cathy]56-catherine ! [Gooid - fur - nowt madling]3545-gooid - fur - nowt madling !
