" [He]0-i shook [me]1500-viper till [my]1500-viper teeth rattled , and pitched [me]1500-viper beside [Joseph]45-joseph , who steadily concluded [his]45-joseph supplications , and then rose , vowing [he]45-joseph would set off for [the Grange directly]3797-the grange directly . [Mr. Linton]73-mr. linton was [a magistrate]600-a magistrate , and though [he]73-mr. linton had [fifty wives]3799-fifty wives dead , [he]73-mr. linton should inquire into this . [He]73-mr. linton was so obstinate in [his]73-mr. linton resolution that [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff deemed it expedient to compel , from [my]1500-viper lips , a recapitulation of what had taken place ; standing over [me]1500-viper , heaving with malevolence , as [I]1500-viper reluctantly delivered the account in answer to [his]73-mr. linton questions . It required a great deal of labour to satisfy [the old man]2774-the old man that [he]2774-the old man was not [the aggressor]3801-the aggressor ; especially with [my]1500-viper hardly wrung replies . However , [Mr. Earnshaw]75-hindley soon convinced [him]2774-the old man that [he]2774-the old man was alive still ; [he]75-hindley hastened to administer a dose of spirits , and by [their]3802-their succour [[his]75-hindley master]216-his master presently regained motion and consciousness . [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff , aware that [he]43-heathcliff was ignorant of the treatment received while insensible , called [him]2774-the old man deliriously intoxicated ; and said [he]43-heathcliff should not notice [his]2774-the old man atrocious conduct further ; but advised [him]2774-the old man to get to bed . To [my]1500-viper joy , [he]43-heathcliff left [us]3804-us after giving this judicious counsel , and [Hindley]75-hindley stretched [himself]75-hindley on the hearth - stone . [I]1500-viper departed to [[my]1500-viper own room]3805-my own room , marvelling that [I]1500-viper had escaped so easily . This morning , when [I]1500-viper came down , about half - an - hour before noon , [Mr. Earnshaw]75-hindley was sitting by the fire , deadly sick ; [his]75-hindley evil genius almost as guant and ghastly , leant against the chimney . [Neither]3806-neither appeared inclined to dine ; and having waited till all was cold on the table , [I]1500-viper commenced alone . Nothing hindered [me]1500-viper from eating heartily ; and [I]1500-viper experienced a certain sense of satisfaction and superiority , as , at intervals , [I]1500-viper cast a look towards [[my]1500-viper silent companions]3807-my silent companions , and felt the comfort of a quiet conscience within [me]1500-viper . After [I]1500-viper had done , [I]1500-viper ventured on the unusual liberty of drawing near the fire ; going round [Earnshaw]75-hindley 's seat , and kneeling in the corner beside [him]75-hindley . [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff did not glance [my]1500-viper way , and [I]1500-viper gazed up , and contemplated [his]43-heathcliff features , almost as confidently as if they had been turned to stone . [His]43-heathcliff forehead , that [I]1500-viper once thought so manly , and that [I]1500-viper now think so diabolical , was shaded with a heavy cloud ; [his]43-heathcliff basilisk eyes were nearly quenched by sleeplessness — and weeping , perhaps , for the lashes were wet then : [his]43-heathcliff lips devoid of their ferocious sneer , and sealed in an expression of unspeakable sadness . Had it been another , , [I]1500-viper would have covered [my]1500-viper face , in the presence of such grief . In [his]43-heathcliff case , [I]1500-viper was gratified : and ignoble as it seems to insult [a fallen enemy]3808-a fallen enemy , [I]1500-viper could n't miss this chance of sticking in a dart ; [his]43-heathcliff weakness was the only time when [I]1500-viper could taste the delight of paying wrong for wrong . "[1500-viper] Fie , fie , [Miss]1501-miss ! " [I]1501-miss interrupted . "[1501-miss] [One]285-one might suppose [you]1501-miss had never opened a Bible in [your]1501-miss life . If [God]66-god afflict [[your]1501-miss enemies]1503-your enemies , surely that ought to suffice [you]1501-miss . It is both mean and presumptuous to add [your]1501-miss torture to [his]66-god ! " "[66-god] In general , [I]0-i 'll allow that it would be , [Ellen]80-ellen , " [she]3809-she continued . "[80-ellen] But what misery laid on [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff could content [me]0-i , unless [I]0-i have a hand in it ? [I]0-i 'd rather [he]43-heathcliff suffered less , if [I]0-i might cause [his]43-heathcliff sufferings , and [he]43-heathcliff might know that [I]0-i was the cause . Oh , [I]0-i owe [him]43-heathcliff so much . On only one condition can [I]0-i hope to forgive [him]43-heathcliff . It is , if [I]0-i may take an eye for an eye , a tooth for a tooth , for every wrench of agony , return a wrench , reduce [him]43-heathcliff to [my]0-i level . As [he]43-heathcliff was the first to injure , make [him]43-heathcliff the first to implore pardon ; and then — why then , [Ellen]80-ellen , [I]0-i might show [you]80-ellen some generosity . But it is utterly impossible [I]0-i can ever be revenged , and therefore [I]0-i can not forgive [him]43-heathcliff . [Hindley]75-hindley wanted some water , and [I]0-i handed [him]43-heathcliff a glass , and asked [him]43-heathcliff how [he]43-heathcliff was . " "[0-i] Not as ill as [I]0-i wish , " [he]0-i replied . "[0-i] But leaving out [my]0-i arm , every inch of [me]0-i is as sore as if [I]0-i had been fighting with [a legion of imps]1504-a legion of imps ! " "[54-catherine] Yes , no wonder , " was [my]54-catherine next remark . "[54-catherine] [Catherine]54-catherine used to boast that [she]54-catherine stood between [you]80-ellen and bodily harm — [she]54-catherine meant that [certain persons]1505-certain persons would not hurt [you]80-ellen , for fear of offending [her]54-catherine . It 's well [people]445-people do n't really rise from [their]445-people grave , or , last night , [she]54-catherine might have witnessed a repulsive scene ! Are not [you]80-ellen bruised , and cut over [your]80-ellen chest and shoulders ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i ca n't say , " [he]0-i answered ; "[0-i] but what do [you]0-i mean ? Did [he]1507-he dare to strike [me]0-i when [I]0-i was down ? " "[1507-he] [He]1507-he trampled on , and kicked [you]80-ellen , and dashed [you]80-ellen on the ground , " [I]1507-he whispered . "[1507-he] And [his]1507-he mouth watered to tear [you]80-ellen with [his]1507-he teeth ; because , [he]1507-he 's only half [a man]2653-a man — not so much . " [Mr. Earnshaw]75-hindley looked up , like [me]1507-he , to the countenance of [[our]3810-our mutual foe]3811-our mutual foe ; who , absorbed in [his]0-i anguish , seemed insensible to anything around [him]0-i ; the longer [he]0-i stood , the plainer [his]0-i reflections revealed their blackness through [his]0-i features . "[1507-he] Oh , if [God]66-god would but give [me]0-i strength to strangle [him]1507-he in [my]0-i last agony , [I]0-i 'd go to hell with joy , " groaned [the impatient man writhing to rise , and sinking back in despair]3812-the impatient man writhing to rise , and sinking back in despair , convinced of [his]0-i inadequacy for the struggle . "[0-i] Nay , it 's enough that [he]1507-he has murdered one of [you]1509-you , " [I]1507-he observed aloud . "[1507-he] At [the Grange]73-mr. linton , [every one]1215-every one knows [[your]1509-you sister]1511-your sister would have been living now , had it not been for [Mr. Heathcliff]43-heathcliff . After all , it is preferable to be hated , than loved by [him]1507-he . When [I]0-i recollect how happy [we]1512-we were — how happy [Catherine]54-catherine was before [he]1507-he came — [I'm]0-i fit to curse the day . " Most likely , [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff noticed more the truth of what was said , than the spirit of [the person who said it]3813-the person who said it . [His]43-heathcliff attention was roused , [I]0-i saw , for [his]43-heathcliff eyes rained down tears among the ashes , and [he]43-heathcliff drew [his]43-heathcliff breath in suffocating sighs . [I]0-i stared full at [him]43-heathcliff , and laughed scornfully . The clouded windows of hell flashed , a moment towards [me]0-i ; [the fiend which usually looked out , however]3814-the fiend which usually looked out , however , was so dimmed and drowned that [I]0-i did not fear to hazard another sound of derision . "[0-i] Get up , and begone out of [my]0-i sight , " said [the mourner]3815-the mourner . [I]0-i guessed [he]43-heathcliff uttered those words , at least , though [his]43-heathcliff voice was hardly intelligible . "[0-i] [I]0-i beg [your]0-i pardon , " [I]0-i replied . "[0-i] But [I]0-i loved [Catherine]54-catherine too ; and [[her]54-catherine brother]527-her brother requires attendance which , for [her]54-catherine sake , [I]0-i shall supply . Now that [she]54-catherine 's dead , [I]0-i see [her]54-catherine in [Hindley]75-hindley ; [Hindley]75-hindley has exactly [her]54-catherine eyes , if [you]0-i had not tried to gouge them out , and made them black and red , and [her]54-catherine — " "[54-catherine] Get up , [wretched idiot]1514-wretched idiot , before [I]0-i stamp [you]0-i to death ! " [he]0-i cried , making a movement that caused [me]0-i to make one also . "[0-i] " But then , "[0-i] [I]0-i continued , holding [myself]0-i ready to flee ; " if poor [Catherine]54-catherine had trusted [you]0-i , and assumed the ridiculous , contemptible , degrading title of [Mrs. Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton , [she]54-catherine would soon have presented a similar picture ! [She]54-catherine would n't have borne [your]0-i abominable behaviour quietly ; [her]54-catherine detestation and disgust must have found voice . "[0-i] The back of the settle , and [[Earnshaw]54-catherine 's person]1515-earnshaw 's person interposed between [me]0-i and [him]1515-earnshaw 's person ; so instead of endeavouring to reach [me]0-i , [he]1515-earnshaw 's person snatched a dinner knife from the table , and flung it at [my]0-i head . It struck beneath [my]0-i ear , and stopped the sentence [I]0-i was uttering ; but pulling it out , [I]0-i sprang to the door , and delivered another which [I]0-i hope went a little deeper than [his]1515-earnshaw 's person missile . The last glimpse [I]0-i caught of [him]1515-earnshaw 's person was a furious rush , on [his]1515-earnshaw 's person part , checked by the embrace of [[his]1515-earnshaw 's person host]1516-his host ; and both fell locked together on the hearth . In [my]0-i flight through [the kitchen]194-the kitchen [I]0-i bid [Joseph]45-joseph speed to [[his]45-joseph master]216-his master ; [I]0-i knocked over [Hareton]47-hareton , who was hanging a litter of puppies from a chair back in the doorway ; and , blest as a soul escaped from purgatory , [I]0-i bounded , leaped , and flew down [the steep road]1519-the steep road : then , quitting its windings , shot direct across [the moor]389-the moor , rolling over banks , and wading through [marshes]1521-marshes ; precipitating [myself]0-i , in fact , towards the beacon light of [the Grange]73-mr. linton . And far rather would [I]0-i be condemned to [a perpetual dwelling in [the infernal regions]1523-the infernal regions]1522-a perpetual dwelling in the infernal regions , than even for one night abide beneath the roof of [Wuthering Heights]11-wuthering heights again . " [Isabella]82-isabella ceased speaking , and took a drink of tea ; then [she]82-isabella rose , and bidding [me]1524-i put on [her]82-isabella bonnet , and a great shawl [I]1524-i had brought , and turning a deaf ear to [my]1524-i entreaties for [her]82-isabella to remain another hour , [she]82-isabella stepped onto a chair , kissed [Edgar]81-edgar 's and [Catherine]54-catherine 's portraits , bestowed a similar salute on [me]1524-i , and descended to [the carriage]3748-the carriage accompanied by [Fanny]60-frances , who yelped wild with joy at recovering [[her]60-frances mistress]3817-her mistress , [She]60-frances was driven away , never to revisit [this neighbourhood]3818-this neighbourhood ; but a regular correspondence was established between [her]82-isabella and [[my]1524-i master]530-my master when things were more settled . [I]1524-i believe [[her]82-isabella new abode]3820-her new abode was in [the south]3821-the south , near [London]6-london ; there [she]82-isabella had [a son]447-a son born , a few months subsequent to [her]82-isabella escape . [He]447-a son was christened [Linton]81-edgar , and , from the first , [she]82-isabella reported [him]447-a son to be [an ailing , peevish creature]3823-an ailing , peevish creature . [Mr. Heathcliff]43-heathcliff , meeting [me]1524-i one day in [the village]1197-the village , inquired where [she]82-isabella lived . [I]1524-i refused to tell . [He]43-heathcliff remarked that it was not of any moment , only [she]82-isabella must beware of coming to [[her]82-isabella brother]527-her brother ; [she]82-isabella should not be with [him]43-heathcliff , if [he]43-heathcliff had to keep [her]82-isabella [himself]43-heathcliff . Though [I]1524-i would give no information , [he]43-heathcliff discovered , through [some of [the other servants]636-the other servants]3826-some of the other servants , both [her]82-isabella place of residence , and the existence of [the child]2762-the child . Still [he]43-heathcliff did n't molest [her]82-isabella ; for which forbearance [she]82-isabella might thank [his]43-heathcliff aversion , [I]1524-i suppose . [He]43-heathcliff often asked about [the infant]3829-the infant , when [he]43-heathcliff saw [me]1524-i ; and on hearing its name , smiled grimly , and observed : "[1524-i] [They]1524-i wish [me]0-i to hate it too , do [they]1524-i ? " "[1524-i] [I]0-i do n't think [they]1524-i wish [you]0-i to know any thing about it , " [I]1524-i answered . "[1524-i] But [I]0-i 'll have it , " [he]43-heathcliff said , "[0-i] when [I]0-i want it . [They]1524-i may reckon on that ! " Fortunately , [its mother]3830-its mother died before the time arrived , some thirteen years after the decease of [Catherine]54-catherine , when [Linton]81-edgar was twelve , or a little more . On the day succeeding [Isabella]82-isabella 's unexpected visit , [I]80-ellen had no opportunity of speaking to [[my]80-ellen master]530-my master : [he]43-heathcliff shunned conversation , and was fit for discussing nothing . When [I]80-ellen could get [him]43-heathcliff to listen , [I]80-ellen saw it pleased [him]43-heathcliff that [[his]43-heathcliff sister]577-his sister had left [[her]577-his sister husband]2614-her husband , whom [he]43-heathcliff abhorred with an intensity which the mildness of [his]43-heathcliff nature would scarcely seem to allow . So deep and sensitive was [his]43-heathcliff aversion , that [he]43-heathcliff refrained from going anywhere where [he]43-heathcliff was likely to see or hear of [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff . Grief , and that together , transformed [him]43-heathcliff into [a complete hermit]3834-a complete hermit : [he]43-heathcliff threw up [[his]43-heathcliff office of [magistrate]3836-magistrate]3835-his office of magistrate , ceased even to attend church , avoided [the village]1197-the village on all occasions , and spent a life of entire seclusion within the limits of [[his]43-heathcliff park and grounds]3838-his park and grounds : only varied by solitary rambles on [the moors]352-the moors , and visits to the grave of [[his]43-heathcliff wife]2670-his wife , mostly at evening , or early morning , before [other wanderers]3841-other wanderers were abroad . But [he]43-heathcliff was too good to be thoroughly unhappy long . [He]43-heathcliff did n't pray for [Catherine]54-catherine 's soul to haunt [him]43-heathcliff : Time brought resignation , and a melancholy sweeter than common joy . [He]43-heathcliff recalled [her]54-catherine memory with ardent , tender love , and hopeful aspiring to [the better world]3842-the better world , where , [he]43-heathcliff doubted not [she]54-catherine was gone . And [he]43-heathcliff had earthly consolation and affections , also . For a few days , [I]80-ellen said , [he]43-heathcliff seemed regardless of [the puny successor to the departed]3843-the puny successor to the departed : that coldness melted as fast as snow in April , and ere the tiny thing could stammer a word or totter a step , it wielded [a despot]3844-a despot 's sceptre in [his]43-heathcliff heart . It was named [Catherine]54-catherine , but [he]43-heathcliff never called it the name in full , as [he]43-heathcliff had never called the first [Catherine]54-catherine short , probably because [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff , had a habit of doing so . [The little one]3845-the little one was always [Cathy]54-catherine , it formed to [him]43-heathcliff a distinction from [the mother]409-the mother , and yet , a connection with [her]54-catherine ; and [his]43-heathcliff attachment sprang from its relation to [her]54-catherine , far more than from its being [his]43-heathcliff own . [I]80-ellen used to draw a comparison between [him]43-heathcliff , and [Hindley Earnshaw]75-hindley and perplex [myself]80-ellen to explain satisfactorily , why [their]3847-their conduct was so opposite in similar circumstances . [They]3847-their had both been [fond husbands]3848-fond husbands , and were both attached to [[their]3847-their children]3849-their children ; and [I]80-ellen could not see how [they]3847-their should n't both have taken the same road , for good or evil . But , [I]80-ellen thought in [my]80-ellen mind , [Hindley]75-hindley with apparently the stronger head , has shown [himself]75-hindley sadly the worse and [the weaker man]3850-the weaker man . When [[his]75-hindley ship]3851-his ship struck , [the captain]3852-the captain abandoned [his]75-hindley post ; and [the crew]3853-the crew , instead of trying to save [her]3851-his ship , rushed into riot , and confusion , leaving no hope for [[their]3853-the crew luckless vessel]3854-their luckless vessel . [Linton]81-edgar , on the contrary , displayed the true courage of [a loyal and faithful soul]3855-a loyal and faithful soul : [he]81-edgar trusted [God]66-god ; and [God]66-god comforted [him]81-edgar . [One]131-one hoped , and [the other]289-the other despaired : [they]3853-the crew chose [their]3853-the crew own lots , and were righteously doomed to endure [them]3853-the crew . But [you]3857-you 'll not want to hear [my]80-ellen moralizing , [Mr. Lockwood]44-mr. lockwood : [you]3857-you 'll judge as well as [I]80-ellen can , all these things ; at least , [you]3857-you 'll think [you]3857-you will and that 's the same . The end of [Earnshaw]75-hindley was what might have been expected : it followed fast on [[his]75-hindley sister]577-his sister 's , there was scarcely six months between [them]3853-the crew . [We]3859-we , at [the Grange]73-mr. linton , never got a very succinct account of [his]75-hindley state preceding it ; all that [I]80-ellen did learn , was on occasion of going to aid in the preparations for the funeral . [Mr. Kenneth]92-kenneth came to announce the event to [[my]80-ellen master]530-my master . "[80-ellen] Well , [Nelly]80-ellen ; " said [he]0-i , riding into [the yard]252-the yard , one morning , too early not to alarm [me]80-ellen with an instant presentiment of bad news . "[80-ellen] It 's [yours]80-ellen , and [my]0-i turn to go into mourning at present . Who 's given [us]1525-us the slip , now do [you]80-ellen think ? " "[80-ellen] Who ? " [I]80-ellen asked in a flurry . "[80-ellen] Why , guess ! " [he]0-i returned , dismounting , and slinging [his]0-i bridle on a hook by the door . "[80-ellen] And nip up the corner of [your]80-ellen apron ; [I]0-i 'm certain [you]80-ellen 'll need it . " "[0-i] Not [Mr. Heathcliff]43-heathcliff , surely ? [I]0-i exclaimed . " "[0-i] What ! would [you]0-i have tears for [him]43-heathcliff ? " said [the doctor]528-the doctor . No , [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff 's [a tough young fellow]3863-a tough young fellow ; [he]43-heathcliff looks blooming to - day — [I've]80-ellen just seen [him]43-heathcliff . [He]43-heathcliff 's rapidly regaining flesh since [he]43-heathcliff lost [his]43-heathcliff better half . "[0-i] Who is it , then [Mr. Kenneth]92-kenneth ? " [I]92-kenneth repeated impatiently . "[92-kenneth] [Hindley Earnshaw]75-hindley ! [[Your]92-kenneth old friend]3565-your old friend [Hindley]75-hindley — " [he]92-kenneth replied . "[75-hindley] And [my]0-i wicked gossip ; though [he]75-hindley 's been too wild for [me]0-i this long while . There ! [I]0-i said [we]1527-we should draw water — But cheer up ! [He]75-hindley died true to [his]75-hindley character drunk as [a lord]1528-a lord — [Poor lad]1529-poor lad ; [I]0-i 'm sorry too . [One]285-one ca n't help missing [an old companion]1531-an old companion ; though [he]75-hindley had the worst tricks with [him]75-hindley that [ever man]1532-ever man imagined ; and has done [me]0-i many a rascally turn — [He]75-hindley 's barely twenty - seven , it seems ; that 's [your]1533-your own age ; who would have thought [you]1533-your were born in one year ! " [I]75-hindley confess this blow was greater to [me]75-hindley than the shock of [Mrs. Linton]48-mrs. linton 's death : ancient associations lingered round [my]75-hindley heart ; [I]75-hindley sat down in [the porch]535-the porch , and wept as for a blood relation , desiring [Kenneth]92-kenneth to get [another servant]3865-another servant to introduce [him]75-hindley to [the master]430-the master . [I]75-hindley could not hinder [myself]75-hindley from pondering on the question—"Had[75-hindley] [he]75-hindley had fair play ? " Whatever [I]1534-i did that idea would bother [me]1534-i : it was so tiresomely pertinacious that [I]1534-i resolved on requesting leave to go to [Wuthering Heights]11-wuthering heights , and assist in the last duties to the dead . [Mr. Linton]73-mr. linton was extremely reluctant to consent , but [I]1534-i pleaded eloquently for the friendless condition in which [he]73-mr. linton lay ; and [I]1534-i said [[my]1534-i old master]3867-my old master , and [foster brother]3868-foster brother had a claim on [my]1534-i services as strong as [his]73-mr. linton own . Besides , [I]1534-i reminded [him]73-mr. linton that [the child]2762-the child , [Hareton]47-hareton , was [[his]73-mr. linton wife 's nephew]3870-his wife 's nephew ; and , in the absence of [nearer kin]3871-nearer kin , [he]73-mr. linton ought to act as [its guardian]3872-its guardian ; and [he]73-mr. linton ought to and must inquire how the property was left , and look over the concerns of [[his]73-mr. linton brother - in - law]3873-his brother - in - law . [He]73-mr. linton was unfit for attending to such matters then , but [he]73-mr. linton bid [me]1534-i speak to [[his]73-mr. linton lawyer]3874-his lawyer ; and at length , permitted [me]1534-i to go . [[His]73-mr. linton lawyer]3874-his lawyer had been [Earnshaw]75-hindley 's also : [I]1534-i called at [the village]1197-the village , and asked [him]3874-his lawyer to accompany [me]1534-i . [He]3874-his lawyer shook [his]3874-his lawyer head , and advised that [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff should be let alone ; affirming , if the truth were known , [Hareton]47-hareton would be found little else than [a beggar]1300-a beggar . "[1534-i] [[His]1534-i father]518-his father died in debt ; " [he]3874-his lawyer said , "[1534-i] [the whole property]1536-the whole property is mortgaged , and the sole chance for [the natural heir]1537-the natural heir is to allow [him]1537-the natural heir an opportunity of creating some interest in [the creditor]1538-the creditor 's heart , that [he]1538-the creditor may be inclined to deal leniently towards [him]1537-the natural heir . " When [I]1538-the creditor reached [the Heights]568-the heights , [I]1538-the creditor explained that [I]1538-the creditor had come to see everything carried on decently , and [Joseph]45-joseph , who appeared in sufficient distress , expressed satisfaction at [my]1538-the creditor presence . [Mr. Heathcliff]43-heathcliff said [he]43-heathcliff did not perceive that [I]1538-the creditor was wanted , but [I]1538-the creditor might stay and order the arrangements for the funeral , if [I]1538-the creditor chose . "[1538-the creditor] Correctly , " [he]0-i remarked , "[1538-the creditor] [that fool]1539-that fool 's body should be buried at [the cross - roads]1540-the cross - roads , without ceremony of any kind — [I]0-i happened to leave [him]1539-that fool ten minutes , yesterday afternoon ; and , in that interval , [he]1539-that fool fastened the two doors of [the house]185-the house against [me]0-i , and [he]1539-that fool has spent the night in drinking [himself]1539-that fool to death deliberately ! [We]1542-we broke in this morning , for [we]1542-we heard [him]1539-that fool snorting like a horse ; and there [he]1539-that fool was , laid over the settle — flaying and scalping would not have wakened [him]1539-that fool — [I]0-i sent for [Kenneth]92-kenneth , and [he]1539-that fool came ; but not till the beast had changed into carrion — [he]1539-that fool was both dead and cold , and stark ; and so [you]1543-you 'll allow , it was useless making more stir about [him]1539-that fool ! " [The old servant]3794-the old servant confirmed this statement , but muttered , "[132-aw'd rayther] [Aw'd rayther]132-aw'd rayther [he]1539-that fool 'd goan hisseln fur t'doctor ! Aw sud uh taen tent uh t'maister better nur [him]1539-that fool — un [he]1539-that fool warn't deead when [Aw]107-aw left , nowt uh t'soart ! " [I]1539-that fool insisted on the funeral being respectable — [Mr. Heathcliff]43-heathcliff said [I]1539-that fool might have [my]1539-that fool own way [there]2637-there too ; only , [he]43-heathcliff desired [me]1539-that fool to remember , that the money for the whole affair came out of [his]43-heathcliff pocket . [He]43-heathcliff maintained a hard , careless deportment , indicative of neither joy nor sorrow ; if anything , it expressed a flinty gratification at a piece of difficult work , successfully executed , [I]1539-that fool observed once , indeed , something like exultation in [his]43-heathcliff aspect . It was just when [the people]1123-the people were bearing the coffin from [the house]185-the house ; [he]43-heathcliff had the hypocrisy to represent [a mourner]3883-a mourner ; and previous to following with [Hareton]47-hareton [he]43-heathcliff lifted [the unfortunate child]3884-the unfortunate child on to the table , and muttered with peculiar gusto , "[1539-that fool] Now [[my]0-i bonny lad]1544-my bonny lad [you]1544-my bonny lad are [mine]0-i ! And [we]1545-we 'll see if one tree wo n't grow as crooked as another , with the same wind to twist it ! " [The unsuspecting thing]3885-the unsuspecting thing was pleased at this speech ; [he]3885-the unsuspecting thing played with [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff 's whiskers , and stroked [his]43-heathcliff cheek , but [I]1546-that boy divined its meaning and observed tartly , "[1546-that boy] [That boy]1546-that boy must go back with [me]0-i to [Thrushcross Grange]73-mr. linton , [Sir]2571-sir — There is nothing in [the world less]1548-the world less [yours]2571-sir than [he]1546-that boy is ! " "[2571-sir] Does [Linton]73-mr. linton say so ? " [he]43-heathcliff demanded . "[73-mr. linton] Of course — [he]73-mr. linton has ordered [me]0-i to take [him]1546-that boy . " [I]73-mr. linton replied . "[73-mr. linton] Well , " said [the scoundrel]3327-the scoundrel , "[1545-we] [We]1545-we 'll not argue the subject now ; but [I]0-i have a fancy to try [my]0-i hand at rearing [a young one]1549-a young one , so intimate to [[your]2571-sir master]3179-your master , that [I]0-i must supply the place of this with [my]0-i own , if [he]3179-your master attempt to remove it ; [I]0-i do n't engage to let [Hareton]47-hareton go , undisputed : but , [I]0-i 'll be pretty sure to make the other come ! remember to tell [him]3179-your master . " This hint was enough to bind [our]1545-we hands . [I]0-i repeated its substance , on [my]0-i return , and [Edgar Linton]81-edgar , [little interested at the commencement]3887-little interested at the commencement , spoke no more of interfering . [I]0-i 'm not aware that [he]81-edgar could have done it to any purpose , had [he]81-edgar been ever so willing . [The guest]3275-the guest was now [the master of [Wuthering Heights]11-wuthering heights]3889-the master of wuthering heights : [he]3889-the master of wuthering heights held firm possession , and proved to [the attorney]3890-the attorney , who , in [his]3890-the attorney turn , proved it to [Mr. Linton]73-mr. linton , that [Earnshaw]75-hindley had mortgaged every yard of land [he]75-hindley owned for cash to supply [his]75-hindley mania for gaming : and [he]75-hindley , [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff , was [the mortgagee]3891-the mortgagee . In that manner , [Hareton]47-hareton , who should now be [the first gentleman in [the neighbourhood]3573-the neighbourhood]3892-the first gentleman in the neighbourhood , was reduced to a state of complete dependence on [[his]47-hareton father 's inveterate enemy]3894-his father 's inveterate enemy ; and lives in [[his]47-hareton own house]3895-his own house as [a servant deprived of the advantage of wages]3896-a servant deprived of the advantage of wages , and quite unable to right [himself]47-hareton , because of [his]47-hareton friendlessness , and [his]47-hareton ignorance that [he]47-hareton has been wronged . "[0-i] The twelve years , " continued [Mrs. Dean]71-mrs. dean , "[0-i] following that dismal period , were the happiest of [my]0-i life : [my]0-i greatest troubles , in [their]1551-their passage , rose from [[our]1552-our little lady]1553-our little lady 's trifling illnesses which [she]1553-our little lady had to experience in common with [all children , rich and poor]1554-all children , rich and poor . ' For the rest , after the first six months , [she]1553-our little lady grew like a larch ; and could walk and talk too , in [her]1553-our little lady own way , before the heath blossomed a second time over [Mrs. Linton]48-mrs. linton 's dust . [She]1553-our little lady was the most winning thing that ever brought sunshine into [a desolate house]1555-a desolate house — a real beauty in face — with [the Earnshaws]78-earnshaws ' handsome dark eyes , but [the Lintons]74-the lintons ' fair skin , and small features , and yellow curling hair . [Her]1553-our little lady spirit was high , though not rough , and qualified by a heart , sensitive and lively to excess in its affections . That capacity for intense attachments reminded [me]0-i of [[her]1553-our little lady mother]1556-her mother ; still [she]1553-our little lady did not resemble [her]1556-her mother ; for [she]1553-our little lady could be soft and mild as a dove , and [she]1553-our little lady had a gentle voice , and pensive expression : [her]1553-our little lady anger was never furious ; [her]1553-our little lady love never fierce ; it was deep and tender . However , it must be acknowledged , [she]1553-our little lady had faults to foil [her]1553-our little lady gifts . A propensity to be saucy was one ; and a perverse will that indulged [children]704-children invariably acquire , whether [they]704-children be good tempered or cross . If [a servant]269-a servant chanced to vex [her]1553-our little lady , it was always : " [I]269-a servant shall tell [papa]2871-papa ! "[269-a servant] And if [he]269-a servant reproved [her]1553-our little lady , even by a look , [you]1559-you would have thought it a heartbreaking business : [I]0-i do n't believe [he]269-a servant ever did speak a harsh word to [her]1553-our little lady . [He]269-a servant took [her]1553-our little lady education entirely on [himself]269-a servant , and made it an amusement : fortunately , curiosity , aud a quick intellect urged [her]1553-our little lady into [an apt scholar]1560-an apt scholar ; [she]1553-our little lady learnt rapidly and eagerly , and did honour to [his]269-a servant teaching . Till [she]1553-our little lady reached the age of thirteen , [she]1553-our little lady had not once been beyond [the range of [the park]2652-the park]1561-the range of the park by [herself]1553-our little lady . [Mr. Linton]73-mr. linton would take [her]1553-our little lady with [him]73-mr. linton , a mile or so outside , on rare occasions ; but [he]73-mr. linton trusted [her]1553-our little lady to [no one else]1563-no one else . [Gimmerton]14-gimmerton was an unsubstantial name in [her]1553-our little lady ears ; [the chapel]366-the chapel , [the only building [she]1553-our little lady had approached , or entered]1565-the only building she had approached , or entered , except [[her]1553-our little lady own home]1566-her own home ; [Wuthering Heights]11-wuthering heights and [Mr. Heathcliff]43-heathcliff did not exist for [her]1553-our little lady ; [she]1553-our little lady was [a perfect recluse]1567-a perfect recluse ; and , apparently , perfectly contented . Sometimes , indeed , while surveying [the country]438-the country from [her]1553-our little lady nursery window , [she]1553-our little lady would observe — " [Ellen]80-ellen , how long will it be before [I]1553-our little lady can walk to [the top of [those hills]1160-those hills]3898-the top of those hills ? [I]1553-our little lady wonder what lies on the other side — is it [the sea]1359-the sea ? "[1553-our little lady] " No , [Miss Cathy]56-catherine , "[0-i] [I]0-i would answer , " it is hills again just like these . "[0-i] " And what are those golden rocks like , when [you]0-i stand under them ? "[1553-our little lady] [she]1553-our little lady once asked . The abrupt descent of [Penistone Craggs]34-penistone craggs particularly attracted [her]1553-our little lady notice , especially when the setting sun shone on [it]34-penistone craggs , and the top - most Heights ; and the whole extent of landscape besides lay in shadow . [I]0-i explained that they were bare masses of stone , with hardly enough earth in [their]34-penistone craggs clefts to nourish a stunted tree . " And why are they bright so long after it is evening here ? "[1553-our little lady] [she]1553-our little lady pursued . " Because [they]1160-those hills are a great deal higher up than [we]3901-we are , "[0-i] replied [I]0-i ; " [you]1553-our little lady could not climb them , they are too high and steep . In winter the frost is always there before it comes to [us]3901-we ; and , deep into summer , [I]0-i have found snow under [that black hollow on the north - east side]3902-that black hollow on the north - east side ! "[0-i] " Oh , [you]0-i have been on them ! "[1553-our little lady] [she]1553-our little lady cried , gleefully . " Then [I]1553-our little lady can go , too , when [I]1553-our little lady am [a woman]524-a woman . Has [papa]2871-papa been , [Ellen]80-ellen ? [The moors]352-the moors , where [you]1553-our little lady ramble with [him]133-papa , are much nicer ; and [Thrushcross park]3907-thrushcross park is [the finest place in [the world]267-the world]3908-the finest place in the world . "[0-i] " But [I]1553-our little lady know [the park]2652-the park , and [I]1553-our little lady do n't know those , "[1553-our little lady] [she]1553-our little lady murmured to [herself]1553-our little lady . "[1553-our little lady] [One of [the maids mentioning [the Fairy cave]1571-the fairy cave]1570-the maids mentioning the fairy cave]1569-one of the maids mentioning the fairy cave , quite turned [her]1569-one of the maids mentioning the fairy cave head with a desire to fulfil this project ; [she]1569-one of the maids mentioning the fairy cave teased [Mr. Linton]73-mr. linton about it ; and [he]73-mr. linton promised [she]1569-one of the maids mentioning the fairy cave should have the journey when [she]1569-one of the maids mentioning the fairy cave got older : but [Miss Catherine]56-catherine measured [her]56-catherine age by months , and — " Now , am [I]56-catherine old enough to go to [Penistone Craggs]34-penistone craggs ? "[56-catherine] was the constant question in [her]56-catherine mouth . [The road thither]1572-the road thither wound close by [Wuthering Heights]11-wuthering heights . [Edgar]81-edgar had not the heart to pass it ; so [she]56-catherine received as constantly the answer . " Not yet , love , not yet . "[0-i] [I]0-i said [Mrs. Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton lived above a dozen years after quitting [[her]48-mrs. linton husband]2614-her husband . [[Her]48-mrs. linton family]1574-her family were of a delicate constitution : [she]48-mrs. linton and [Edgar]81-edgar both lacked the ruddy health that [you]1575-you will generally meet in these parts . What [her]48-mrs. linton last illness was , [I]0-i am not certain ; [I]0-i conjecture , [they]1576-they died of the same thing , a kind of fever , slow at its commencement , but incurable , and rapidly consuming life towards the close . [She]48-mrs. linton wrote to inform [[her]48-mrs. linton brother]527-her brother of the probable conclusion of a four months ' indisposition , under which [she]48-mrs. linton had suffered ; and entreated [him]527-her brother to come to [her]48-mrs. linton , if possible , for [she]48-mrs. linton had much to settle , and [she]48-mrs. linton wished to bid [him]527-her brother adieu , and deliver [Linton]81-edgar safely into [his]527-her brother hands . [Her]48-mrs. linton hope was , that [Linton]81-edgar might be left with [him]527-her brother , as [he]527-her brother had been with [her]48-mrs. linton ; [[his]81-edgar father]518-his father , [she]48-mrs. linton would fain convince [herself]48-mrs. linton , had no desire to assume the burden of [his]81-edgar maintenance or education . [[My]0-i master]530-my master hesitated not a moment in complying with [her]48-mrs. linton request ; reluctant as [he]530-my master was to leave [home]239-home at ordinary calls , [he]530-my master flew to answer this ; commending [Catherine]56-catherine to [my]0-i peculiar vigilance , in [his]530-my master absence ; with reiterated orders that [she]56-catherine must not wander out of [the park]2652-the park , even under [my]0-i escort ; [he]530-my master did not calculate on [her]56-catherine going unaccompanied . [He]530-my master was away three weeks : the first day or two , [[my]0-i charge]1582-my charge sat in [a corner of [the library]3270-the library]1583-a corner of the library , too sad for either reading or playing : in that quiet state [she]56-catherine caused [me]0-i little trouble ; but it was succeeded by an interval of impatient , fretful weariness ; and being too busy , and too old then , to run up and down amusing [her]56-catherine , [I]0-i hit on a method by which [she]56-catherine might entertain [herself]56-catherine . [I]0-i used to send [her]56-catherine on [her]56-catherine travels round [the grounds]1585-the grounds — now on foot , and now on [a pony]1586-a pony ; indulging [her]56-catherine with a patient audience of all [her]56-catherine real and imaginary adventures , when [she]56-catherine returned . The summer shone in full prime ; and [she]56-catherine took such a taste for this solitary rambling that [she]56-catherine often contrived to remain out from breakfast till tea ; and then the evenings were spent in recounting [her]56-catherine fanciful tales . [I]0-i did not fear [her]56-catherine breaking bounds , because the gates were generally locked , and [I]0-i thought [she]56-catherine would scarcely venture forth alone , if they had stood wide open . Unluckily , [my]0-i confidence proved misplaced . [Catherine]56-catherine came to [me]0-i , one morning , at eight o'clock , and said [she]56-catherine was that day [an Arabian merchant]1587-an arabian merchant , going to cross [the Desert]35-the desert with [[his]1587-an arabian merchant caravan]1588-his caravan ; and [I]0-i must give [her]56-catherine plenty of provision for [herself]56-catherine , and beasts , a horse , and three camels , personated by a large hound , and a couple of pointers . [I]0-i got together good store of dainties , and slung them in a basket on one side of the saddle ; and [she]56-catherine sprang up as gay as a fairy , sheltered by [her]56-catherine wide - brimmed hat and gauze veil from the July sun , and trotted off with a merry laugh , mocking [my]0-i cautious counsel to avoid gallopping , and come back early . The naughty thing never made [her]56-catherine appearance at tea . [One traveller]1589-one traveller , the hound , being an old dog , and fond of its ease , returned ; but neither [Cathy]56-catherine , nor the pony , nor the two pointers were visible in any direction ; and [I]0-i despatched [emissaries]1590-emissaries down [this path]1591-this path , and [that path]1592-that path , and , at last , went wandering in search of [her]56-catherine [myself]0-i . There was [a labourer]1593-a labourer working at a fence round [a plantation]1594-a plantation , on [the borders of [the grounds]1585-the grounds]1595-the borders of the grounds . [I]0-i enquired of [him]1593-a labourer if [he]1593-a labourer had seen [[our]1597-our young lady]891-our young lady ? " [I]1593-a labourer saw [her]56-catherine at morn , "[1593-a labourer] [he]1593-a labourer replied , " [she]56-catherine would have [me]1593-a labourer to cut [her]56-catherine a hazel switch ; and then [she]56-catherine leapt [her]56-catherine galloway over the hedge yonder , where it is lowest , and gallopped out of sight . "[1593-a labourer] [You]1599-you may guess how [I]0-i felt at hearing this news . It struck [me]0-i directly [she]891-our young lady must have started for [Penistone Craggs]34-penistone craggs . " What will become of [her]891-our young lady ? "[0-i] [I]0-i ejaculated , pushing through a gap which [the man]382-the man was repairing , and making straight to [the high road]1601-the high road . [I]0-i walked as if for a wager , mile after mile , till a turn brought [me]0-i in view of [the Heights]568-the heights , but no [Catherine]56-catherine could [I]0-i detect , far or near . [The Craggs]36-the craggs lie about a mile and a half beyond [[Mr. Heathcliff]43-heathcliff 's place]1603-mr. heathcliff 's place , and that is four from [the Grange]2656-the grange , so [I]0-i began to fear night would fall ere [I]0-i could reach [them]36-the craggs . " And what if [she]56-catherine should have slipped in clambering among [them]36-the craggs , "[0-i] [I]0-i reflected , " and been killed , or broken some of [her]56-catherine bones ? "[0-i] [My]0-i suspense was truly painful ; and , at first , it gave [me]0-i delightful relief to observe , in hurrying by [the farm - house]1605-the farm - house , [Charlie]135-charlie , [the fiercest of [the pointers]1607-the pointers]1606-the fiercest of the pointers , lying under a window , with swelled head , and bleeding ear . [A woman whom [I]0-i knew , and who formerly lived at [Gimmerton]14-gimmerton]1608-a woman whom i knew , and who formerly lived at gimmerton , answered — [she]1608-a woman whom i knew , and who formerly lived at gimmerton had been [servant there]1609-servant there since the death of [Mr Earnshaw]75-hindley . "[0-i] Hush , hush ! " [I]0-i whispered , "[0-i] [people]445-people can have [many cousins and of all sorts]1636-many cousins and of all sorts , [Miss Cathy]56-catherine , without being any the worse for it ; only [they]445-people need n't keep [their]445-people company , if [they]445-people be disagreeable , and bad . " "[133-papa] [He]133-papa 's not , [he]133-papa 's not [[my]0-i cousin]3951-my cousin , [Ellen]80-ellen ! " [she]56-catherine went on , gathering fresh grief from reflection , and flinging [herself]56-catherine into [my]80-ellen arms for refuge from the idea . [I]80-ellen was much vexed at [her]56-catherine and [the servant]2711-the servant for [their]3955-their mutual revelations ; having no doubt of [Linton]56-catherine 's approaching arrival , communicated by [the former]304-the former , being reported to [Mr. Heathcliff]43-heathcliff ; and feeling as confident that [Catherine]56-catherine 's first thought on [[her]56-catherine father]502-her father 's return , would be to seek an explanation of [the latter]2991-the latter 's assertion , concerning [her]56-catherine rude - bred kindred . [Hareton]47-hareton , recovering from [his]47-hareton disgust at being taken for [a servant]269-a servant , seemed moved by [her]56-catherine distress ; and , having fetched the pony round to the door , [he]47-hareton took , to propitiate [her]56-catherine , a fine crooked - legged terrier whelp from the kennel ; and putting it into [her]56-catherine hand , bid [her]56-catherine wisht for [he]47-hareton meant naught . Pausing in [her]56-catherine lamentations , [she]56-catherine surveyed [him]47-hareton with a glance of awe , and horror , then burst forth anew . [I]80-ellen could scarcely refrain from smiling at this antipathy to [the poor fellow]3960-the poor fellow ; who was [a well - made , athletic youth]3961-a well - made , athletic youth , good looking in features , and stout and healthy , but attired in garments befitting [his]47-hareton daily occupations of working on [the farm]2643-the farm , and lounging among [the moors]352-the moors after rabbits and game . Still , [I]80-ellen thought [I]80-ellen could detect in [his]47-hareton physiognomy a mind owning better qualities than [[his]47-hareton father]518-his father ever possessed . Good things lost amid a wilderness of weeds , to be sure , whose rankness far over - topped their neglected growth ; yet notwithstanding , evidence of a wealthy soil that might yield luxuriant crops , under other and favourable circumstances . [Mr. Heathcliff]43-heathcliff , [I]80-ellen believe , had not treated [him]47-hareton physically ill ; thanks to [his]43-heathcliff fearless nature which offered no temptation to that course of oppression ; it had none of the timid susceptibility that would have given zest to ill - treatment , in [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff 's judgment . [He]43-heathcliff appeared to have bent [his]43-heathcliff malevolence on making [him]47-hareton [a brute]3965-a brute : [he]43-heathcliff was never taught to read or write ; never rebuked for any bad habit which did not annoy [[his]43-heathcliff keeper]3966-his keeper ; never led a single step towards virtue , or guarded by a single precept against vice . And from what [I]80-ellen heard , [Joseph]45-joseph contributed much to [his]47-hareton deterioration by a narrow minded partiality which prompted [him]45-joseph to flatter , and pet [him]47-hareton , as [a boy]602-a boy , because [he]45-joseph was [the head of [the old family]3969-the old family]3968-the head of the old family . And as [he]45-joseph had been in the habit of accusing [Catherine Earnshaw]54-catherine , and [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff , when [children]704-children , of putting [the master]430-the master past [his]45-joseph patience , and compelling [him]45-joseph to seek solace in drink , by what [he]45-joseph termed , [their]704-children "[80-ellen] offalld ways , " so at present , [he]45-joseph laid the whole burden of [Hareton]47-hareton 's faults on the shoulders of [the usurper of [[his]45-joseph property]3973-his property]3972-the usurper of his property . If [the lad]2768-the lad swore [he]45-joseph would n't correct [him]2768-the lad ; nor however culpably [he]2768-the lad behaved . It gave [Joseph]45-joseph satisfaction , apparently , to watch [him]2768-the lad go the worst lengths . [He]45-joseph allowed that [he]45-joseph was ruined ; that [his]45-joseph soul was abandoned to perdition ; but then , [he]45-joseph reflected that [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff must answer for it . [Hareton]47-hareton 's blood would be required at [his]45-joseph hands ; and there lay immense consolation in that thought . [Joseph]45-joseph had instilled into [him]45-joseph a pride of name , and of [his]45-joseph lineage ; [he]45-joseph would had [he]45-joseph dared , have fostered hate between [him]45-joseph and [the present owner of the Heights]3975-the present owner of the heights , but [his]45-joseph dread of [that owner]3976-that owner amounted to superstition ; and [he]45-joseph confined [his]45-joseph feelings , regarding [him]3976-that owner , to muttered inuendo 's and private comminations . [I]80-ellen do n't pretend to be intimately acquainted with the mode of living customary in those days , at [Wuthering Heights]11-wuthering heights . [I]80-ellen only speak from hearsay ; for [I]80-ellen saw little . [The villagers]3734-the villagers affirmed [Mr. Heathcliff]43-heathcliff was near , and [a cruel hard landlord to [[his]43-heathcliff tenants]3979-his tenants]3978-a cruel hard landlord to his tenants ; but [the house]185-the house , inside had regained [its]185-the house ancient aspect of comfort under female management ; and the scenes of riot common in [Hindley]75-hindley 's time , were not now enacted within [its]185-the house walls . [The master]430-the master was too gloomy to seek companionship with [any people]3982-any people , good or bad , and [he]430-the master is yet — This , however , is not making progress with [my]80-ellen story . [Miss Cathy]56-catherine rejected the peace - offering of the terrier , and demanded [her]56-catherine own dogs , [Charlie]135-charlie and [Phenix]136-phenix . [They]3983-they came limping , and hanging [their]3983-they heads ; and [we]3984-we set out for [home]239-home , sadly out of sorts , [every one of [us]3984-we]3986-every one of us . [I]80-ellen could not wring from [[my]80-ellen little lady]3987-my little lady how [she]3987-my little lady had spent the day ; except that , as [I]80-ellen supposed , the goal of [her]3987-my little lady pilgrimage was [Penistone Crags]37-penistone crags ; and [she]3987-my little lady arrived without adventure to the gate of [the farmhouse]1266-the farmhouse , when [Hareton]47-hareton happened to issue forth , attended by [some canine followers who attacked [her]3987-my little lady train]3989-some canine followers who attacked her train . [They]3983-they had a smart battle , before [[their]3983-they owners]3990-their owners could separate [them]3983-they : that formed an introduction . [Catherine]56-catherine told [Hareton]47-hareton who [she]3987-my little lady was , and where [she]3987-my little lady was going ; and asked [him]47-hareton to show [her]3987-my little lady the way ; finally , beguilnig [him]47-hareton to accompany [her]3987-my little lady . [He]47-hareton opened the mysteries of [the Fairy cave]1571-the fairy cave , and [twenty other queer places]3992-twenty other queer places ; but being in disgrace , [I]80-ellen was not favoured with a description of the interesting objects [she]3987-my little lady saw . [I]80-ellen could gather however , that [[her]3987-my little lady guide]3993-her guide had been [a favourite]515-a favourite till [she]3987-my little lady hurt [his]47-hareton feelings by addressing [him]47-hareton as [a servant]269-a servant , and [[Heathcliff]43-heathcliff 's housekeeper]3996-heathcliff 's housekeeper hurt [hers]3996-heathcliff 's housekeeper , by calling [him]47-hareton [[her]3996-heathcliff 's housekeeper cousin]462-her cousin . Then the language [he]47-hareton had held to [her]3987-my little lady rankled in [her]3987-my little lady heart ; [she]3987-my little lady [who was always "[80-ellen] love , " and "[80-ellen] darling , " and "[80-ellen] queen , " and "[80-ellen] angel]3998-who was always " love , " and " darling , " and " queen , " and " angel , " with [[everybody]2736-everybody at [the Grange]2656-the grange]4000-everybody at the grange ; to be insulted so shockingly by [a stranger]2580-a stranger ! [She]3987-my little lady did not comprehend it ; and hard work [I]80-ellen had , to obtain a promise that [she]3987-my little lady would not lay the grievance before [[her]3987-my little lady father]502-her father . [I]80-ellen explained how [he]47-hareton objected to [the whole household at [the Heights]568-the heights]4004-the whole household at the heights , and how sorry [he]47-hareton would be to find [she]3987-my little lady had been [there]2637-there ; but , [I]80-ellen insisted most on the fact , that if [she]3987-my little lady revealed [my]80-ellen negligence of [his]47-hareton orders , [he]47-hareton would perhaps , be so angry that [I]80-ellen should have to leave ; and [Cathy]56-catherine could n't bear that prospect : [she]56-catherine pledged [her]56-catherine word , and kept it , for [my]80-ellen sake — after all , [she]56-catherine was [a sweet little girl]4007-a sweet little girl . A letter , edged with black , announced the day of [[my]80-ellen master]530-my master 's return . [Isabella]82-isabella was dead ; and [he]47-hareton wrote to bid [me]80-ellen get mourning for [[his]47-hareton daughter]4009-his daughter , and arrange a room , and other accommodations , for [[his]47-hareton youthful nephew]4010-his youthful nephew . [Catherine]56-catherine ran wild with joy at the idea of welcoming [[her]56-catherine father]502-her father back : and indulged most sanguine anticipations of the innumerable excellencies of [[her]56-catherine "[80-ellen] real " cousin]4012-her " real " cousin . The evening of [their]4013-their expected arrival came . Since early morning , [she]56-catherine had been busy , ordering [her]56-catherine own small affairs ; and now , attired in [her]56-catherine new black frock — poor thing ! [[her]56-catherine aunt]4014-her aunt 's death impressed [her]56-catherine with no definite sorrow — [she]56-catherine obliged [me]56-catherine , by constant worrying , to walk with [her]56-catherine , down through [the grounds]1585-the grounds , to meet [them]4013-their . "[56-catherine] [Linton]56-catherine is just six months younger than [I]0-i am , " [she]56-catherine chattered as [we]4016-we strolled leisurely over the swells and hollows of mossy turf , under shadow of the trees . "[56-catherine] How delightful it will be to have [him]1638-him for a playfellow ! [Aunt Isabella]137-aunt isabella sent [papa]133-papa a beautiful lock of [his]133-papa hair ; it was lighter than [mine]0-i — more flaxen , and quite as fine . [I]0-i have it carefully preserved in a little glass box ; and [I]0-i 've often thought what pleasure it would be to see [its owner]491-its owner — Oh ! [I]0-i am happy — and [papa]2871-papa , dear , [dear papa]1641-dear papa ! come , [Ellen]80-ellen , let [us]1642-they run ! come run ! " [She]56-catherine ran , and returned and ran again , many times before [my]80-ellen sober footsteps reached the gate , and then [she]56-catherine seated [herself]56-catherine on the grassy bank beside [the path]4017-the path , and tried to wait patiently ; but that was impossible ; [she]56-catherine could n't be still a minute . "[80-ellen] How long they are ! " [she]56-catherine exclaimed . "[80-ellen] Ah , [I]0-i see some dust on [the road]2638-the road — [they]1644-i are coming ! No ! When will [they]1644-i be here ? May [we]1642-they not go a little way — half a mile , [Ellen]80-ellen , only just half a mile ? Do say yes , to that clump of birches at the turn ! " [I]1644-i refused staunchily : and , at length , [her]56-catherine suspense was ended : [the travelling carriage]4018-the travelling carriage rolled in sight . [Miss Cathy]56-catherine shrieked , and stretched out [her]56-catherine arms , as soon as [she]56-catherine caught [[her]56-catherine father]502-her father 's face , looking from the window . [He]502-her father descended , nearly as eager as [herself]56-catherine ; and a considerable interval elapsed , ere [they]1642-they had a thought to spare for any but [themselves]1642-they . While [they]1642-they exchanged caresses , [I]1644-i took a peep in to see after [Linton]56-catherine . [He]502-her father was asleep , in a corner , wrapped in a warm , fur - lined cloak , as if it had been winter , [A pale , delicate , effeminate boy]4020-a pale , delicate , effeminate boy , who might have been taken for [[my]1644-i master 's younger brother]4021-my master 's younger brother , so strong was the resemblance , but there was a sickly peevishness in [his]502-her father aspect , that [Edgar Linton]81-edgar never had . [The latter]2991-the latter saw [me]1644-i looking ; and having shaken hands , advised [me]1644-i to close the door , and leave [him]502-her father undisturbed ; for the journey had fatigued [him]502-her father . [Cathy]56-catherine would fain have taken one glance ; but [[her]56-catherine father]502-her father told [her]56-catherine to come on , and [they]1642-they walked together up [the park]2652-the park , while [I]1644-i hastened before , to prepare [the servants]2807-the servants . "[1644-i] Now , [darling]344-darling , " said [Mr. Linton]73-mr. linton , addressing [[his]73-mr. linton daughter]4009-his daughter , , as [they]1642-they halted at the bottom of [the front steps]4027-the front steps . "[1644-i] [[Your]344-darling cousin]3950-your cousin is not so strong , or so merry as [you]344-darling are , and [he]3950-your cousin has lost [[his]3950-your cousin mother]2878-his mother , remember , a very short time since , therefore , do n't expect [him]3950-your cousin to play , and run about with [you]344-darling directly . And do n't harass [him]3950-your cousin much by talking — let [him]3950-your cousin be quiet this evening , at least , will [you]344-darling ? " "[344-darling] Yes , yes , [papa]2871-papa , " answered [Catherine]56-catherine ; "[344-darling] but [I]0-i do want to see [him]3950-your cousin ; and [he]3950-your cousin has n't once looked out . " [The carriage]3748-the carriage stopped ; and [the sleeper , being roused]4029-the sleeper , being roused , was lifted to the ground by [[his]344-darling uncle]4030-his uncle . "[3950-your cousin] This is [[your]344-darling cousin]3950-your cousin [Cathy]56-catherine , [Linton]56-catherine , " [he]4030-his uncle said , putting [their]4031-their little hands together . "[56-catherine] [She]56-catherine 's fond of [you]344-darling already ; and mind [you]344-darling do n't grieve [her]56-catherine by crying to - night . Try to be cheerful now ; the travelling is at an end , and [you]344-darling have nothing to do but rest and amuse [yourself]344-darling as [you]344-darling please . " "[56-catherine] Let [me]0-i go to bed then , " answered [the boy]2803-the boy , shrinking from [Catherine]56-catherine 's salute ; and [he]2803-the boy put [his]2803-the boy fingers to [his]2803-the boy eyes to remove incipient tears . "[56-catherine] Come , come , there 's [a good child]1650-a good child , " [I]0-i whispered , leading [him]2803-the boy in . "[0-i] [You]0-i 'll make [her]1650-a good child weep too — see how sorry [she]1650-a good child is for [you]0-i ! " [I]0-i do not know whether it were sorrow for [him]2803-the boy , but [[his]2803-the boy cousin]4033-his cousin put on as sad a countenance as [himself]2803-the boy , and returned to [[her]4033-his cousin father]502-her father . [All three]4035-all three entered , and mounted to [the library]3270-the library where tea was laid ready . [I]0-i proceeded to remove [Linton]56-catherine 's cap , and mantle , and placed [him]2803-the boy on a chair by the table ; but [he]2803-the boy was no sooner seated than [he]2803-the boy began to cry afresh . [[My]0-i master]530-my master inquired what was the matter . "[0-i] [I]0-i ca n't sit on a chair , " sobbed [the boy]2803-the boy . "[0-i] Go to the sofa then ; and [Ellen]80-ellen shall bring [you]0-i some tea , " answered [[his]2803-the boy uncle]4030-his uncle , patiently . [He]2803-the boy had been greatly tried during the journey , [I]80-ellen felt convinced , by [his]2803-the boy fretful , ailing charge . [Linton]56-catherine slowly trailed [himself]56-catherine off , and lay down . [Cathy]56-catherine carried a foot - stool and [her]56-catherine cup to [his]2803-the boy side . At first [she]56-catherine sat silent ; but that could not last ; [she]56-catherine had resolved to make a pet of [[her]56-catherine little cousin]4040-her little cousin , as [she]56-catherine would have [him]4040-her little cousin to be ; and [she]56-catherine commenced stroking [his]2803-the boy curls , and kissing [his]2803-the boy cheek , and offering [him]2803-the boy tea in [her]56-catherine saucer , like [a baby]758-a baby . This pleased [him]2803-the boy , for [he]2803-the boy was not much better ; [he]2803-the boy dried [his]2803-the boy eyes , and lightened into a faint smile . "[80-ellen] Oh , [he]1651-him 'll do very well , " said [the master]430-the master to [me]1651-him , after watching [them]1652-we a minute . "[1651-him] Very well , if [we]1652-we can keep [him]1651-him , [Ellen]80-ellen . The company of [a child of [his]1651-him own age]1653-a child of his own age will instil new spirit into [him]1651-him soon : and by wishing for strength [he]1651-him 'll gain it . " Aye , if [we]1652-we can keep [him]1651-him ! [I]0-i mused to [myself]0-i ; and sore misgivings came over [me]0-i that there was slight hope of that . And then , [I]0-i thought , however will [that weakling]4043-that weakling live at [Wuthering Heights]11-wuthering heights , between [[his]1651-him father]518-his father and [Hareton]47-hareton ? what [playmates]4045-playmates and instructors [they]1652-we 'll be . [Our]1652-we doubts were presently decided ; even earlier than [I]0-i expected . [I]0-i had just taken [the children]2755-the children up [stairs]416-stairs , after tea was finished ; and seen [Linton]56-catherine asleep — [he]1651-him would not suffer [me]0-i to leave [him]1651-him , till that was the case — [I]0-i had come down , and was standing by the table in [the hall]3354-the hall , lighting a bed - room candle for [Mr. Edgar]91-edgar , when [a maid]3588-a maid stepped out of [the kitchen]194-the kitchen , and informed [me]0-i that [[Mr. Heathcliff'a]138-mr. heathcliff'a servant]4051-mr. heathcliff'a servant , [Joseph]45-joseph , was at the door , and wished to speak with [the master]430-the master . "[0-i] [I]0-i shall ask [him]1654-him what [he]1654-him wants first , " [I]0-i said , in considerable trepidation . "[0-i] A very unlikely hour to be troubling [people]445-people , and the instant [they]445-people have returned from a long journey . [I]0-i do n't think [the master]430-the master can see [him]1654-him . " [Joseph]45-joseph had advanced through [the kitchen]194-the kitchen , as [I]430-the master uttered these words , and now presented [himself]45-joseph in [the hall]3354-the hall . [He]45-joseph was donned in [his]45-joseph Sunday garments , with [his]45-joseph most sanctimonious and sourest face ; and holding [his]45-joseph hat in one hand , and [his]45-joseph stick in the other , [he]45-joseph proceeded to clean [his]45-joseph shoes on the mat . "[430-the master] Good evening , [Joseph]45-joseph , " [I]45-joseph said , coldly . "[45-joseph] What business brings [you]45-joseph here to - night ? " "[45-joseph] It 's [Maister Linton Aw]51-maister mun spake tull , " [he]45-joseph answered , waving [me]51-maister disdainfully aside . "[73-mr. linton] [You]45-joseph had better sit down in [there]2637-there , and entrust [your]45-joseph message to [me]0-i . " "[45-joseph] Which is [his]73-mr. linton rahm ? " pursued [the fellow , surveying the range of closed doors]4055-the fellow , surveying the range of closed doors . [I]45-joseph perceived [he]73-mr. linton was bent on refusing [my]45-joseph mediation ; so very reluctantly , [I]45-joseph went up to [the library]3270-the library , and announced [the unseasonable visiter]4057-the unseasonable visiter ; advising that [he]73-mr. linton should be dismissed till next day . [Mr. Linton]73-mr. linton had no time to empower [me]45-joseph to do so , for [he]73-mr. linton mounted close at [my]45-joseph heels , and pushing into [the apartment]195-the apartment , planted [himself]73-mr. linton at the far side of the table , with [his]73-mr. linton two fists clapped on the head of [his]73-mr. linton stick , and began in an elevated tone , as if anticipating opposition . "[45-joseph] [Hathecliff]139-hathecliff has send [me]0-i for [[his]139-hathecliff lad]1658-his lad , un Aw ' munn't goa back ' baht [him]1658-his lad . " [Edgar Linton]81-edgar was silent a minute ; an expression of exceeding sorrow overcast [his]81-edgar features ; [he]81-edgar would have pitied [the child]2762-the child on [his]81-edgar own account ; but , recalling [Isabella]137-aunt isabella 's hopes and fears , and anxious wishes for [[her]137-aunt isabella son]4060-her son , and [her]137-aunt isabella commendations of [him]81-edgar to [his]81-edgar care , [he]81-edgar grieved bitterly at the prospect of yielding [him]81-edgar up , and searched in [his]81-edgar heart how it might be avoided . No plan offered [itself]4061-itself : the very exhibition of any desire to keep [him]81-edgar would have rendered [the claimant]4062-the claimant more peremptory : there was nothing left but to resign [him]81-edgar . However , [he]81-edgar was not going to rouse [him]81-edgar from [his]81-edgar sleep . "[1658-his lad] Tell [Mr. Heathcliff]43-heathcliff , " [he]0-i answered , calmly , "[1658-his lad] that [[his]43-heathcliff son]475-his son shall come to [Wuthering Heights]11-wuthering heights to - morrow . [He]475-his son is in bed , and too tired to go the distance now . [You]1660-you may also tell [him]475-his son that [the mother of [Linton]81-edgar]1661-the mother of linton desired [him]475-his son to remain under [my]0-i guardianship ; and , at present , [his]475-his son health is very precarious . " "[1661-the mother of linton] Noa ! " said [Joseph]45-joseph , giving a thud with [his]45-joseph prop on the floor , and assuming an authoritative air . "[1661-the mother of linton] Noa ! that manes nowt — [Hathecliff]475-his son maks noa ' cahnt uh [t ' mother]1662-t ' mother , nur yah norther — bud [he]475-his son 'll [hev]475-his son [[his]475-his son lad]1658-his lad ; und [Aw]107-aw mun tak [him]475-his son — soa nah [yah]1664-yah knaw ! " "[1660-you] [You]1660-you shall not to - night ! " answered [Linton]81-edgar , decisively . "[1660-you] Walk down stairs at once , and repeat to [[your]1660-you master]3179-your master what [I]0-i have said . [Ellen]80-ellen , show [him]475-his son down . Go — " And , aiding [the indignant elder]4063-the indignant elder with a lift by the arm , [he]0-i rid [the room]243-the room of [him]475-his son , and closed the door . "[1664-yah] Varrah weel ! " shouted [Joseph]45-joseph , as [he]45-joseph slowly drew off . "[1664-yah] [Tuh morn]140-tuh morn , [he]475-his son 's come hisseln , un ' thrust [him]475-his son aht , if [yah]1664-yah darr ! " To obviate the danger of this threat being fulfilled , [Mr. Linton]73-mr. linton commissioned [me]1664-yah to take [the boy]2803-the boy [home]239-home early , on [Catherine]56-catherine 's pony , and , said [he]0-i — "[1664-yah] As [we]1666-we shall now have no influence over [his]475-his son destiny , good or bad , [you]1667-you must say nothing of where [he]475-his son is gone to [[my]0-i daughter]1668-my daughter ; [she]1668-my daughter can not associate with [him]475-his son hereafter ; and it is better for [her]1668-my daughter to remain in ignorance of [his]475-his son proximity , lest [she]1668-my daughter should be restless , and anxious to visit [the Heights]568-the heights — merely tell [her]1668-my daughter , [[his]475-his son father]518-his father sent for [him]475-his son suddenly , and [he]475-his son has been obliged to leave [us]1666-we . " [Linton]81-edgar was very reluctant to be roused from [his]81-edgar bed , at five o'clock , and astonished to be informed that [he]81-edgar must prepare for further travelling : but [I]338-my father softened off the matter by stating that [he]81-edgar was going to spend some time with [[his]81-edgar father]518-his father , [Mr. Heathcliff]43-heathcliff , who wished to see [him]81-edgar so much , [he]81-edgar did not like to defer the pleasure till [he]81-edgar should recover from [his]81-edgar late journey . "[338-my father] [[My]0-i father]338-my father ? " [he]0-i cried , in strange perplexity . "[338-my father] [Mamma]141-mamma never told [me]0-i [I]0-i had [a father]1672-a father . Where does [he]338-my father live ? [I]0-i 'd rather stay with [uncle]1673-uncle . " "[338-my father] [He]338-my father lives a little distance from [the Grange]2656-the grange , " [I]338-my father replied , "[338-my father] just beyond [those hills]1160-those hills — not so far , but [you]0-i may walk over here , when [you]0-i get hearty . And [you]0-i should be glad to go [home]239-home , and to see [him]338-my father . [You]0-i must try to love [him]338-my father , as [you]0-i did [[your]0-i mother]683-your mother , and then [he]338-my father will love [you]0-i . " "[338-my father] But why have [I]0-i not heard of [him]338-my father before ? " asked [Linton]81-edgar ; "[338-my father] why did n't mamma , and [he]338-my father live together as [other people]291-other people do ? " "[338-my father] [He]338-my father had business to keep [him]338-my father in [the north]1679-the north , " [I]338-my father answered ; "[338-my father] and [[your]0-i mother]683-your mother 's health required [her]683-your mother to reside in [the south]3821-the south . " "[683-your mother] And why did n't [mamma]141-mamma speak to [me]0-i about [him]338-my father ? " persevered [the child]2762-the child . "[141-mamma] [She]141-mamma often talked of [uncle]1673-uncle , and [I]0-i learnt to love [him]338-my father long ago . How am [I]0-i to love [papa]2871-papa ? [I]0-i do n't know [him]338-my father . " "[0-i] Oh , [all children]1684-all children love [[their]1684-all children parents]1685-their parents , " [I]1684-all children said . "[1684-all children] [[Your]0-i mother]683-your mother , perhaps , thought [you]0-i would want to be with [him]338-my father , if [she]683-your mother mentioned [him]338-my father often to [you]0-i . Let [us]1687-us make haste . An early ride on such a beautiful morning is much preferable to an hour 's more sleep . " "[141-mamma] Is [she]141-mamma to go with [us]1687-us , " [he]0-i demanded . "[141-mamma] [The little girl [I]0-i saw]1688-the little girl i saw yesterday ? " "[1688-the little girl i saw] Not now , " replied [I.]1684-all children "[1673-uncle] Is [uncle]1673-uncle ? " [he]0-i continued . "[1673-uncle] No , [I]0-i shall be [[your]0-i companion]1690-your companion there , " [I]0-i said . [Linton]81-edgar sank back on [his]81-edgar pillow , and fell into [a brown study]4069-a brown study . "[0-i] [I]0-i wo n't go without [uncle]1673-uncle ; " [he]0-i cried at length ; "[0-i] [I]0-i ca n't tell where [you]0-i mean to take [me]0-i . " [I]0-i attempted to persuade [him]0-i of the naughtiness of showing reluctance to meet [[his]0-i father]518-his father : still [he]0-i obstinately resisted any progress towards dressing ; and [I]0-i had to call for [[my]0-i master]530-my master 's assistance , in coaxing [him]0-i out of bed . [The poor thing]2815-the poor thing was finally got off with several delusive assurances that [his]0-i absence should be short ; that [Mr. Edgar]91-edgar and [Cathy]56-catherine would visit [him]0-i ; and other promises , equally ill - founded , which [I]0-i invented and reiterated , at intervals , throughout the way . The pure heather - scented air , and the bright sunshine , and the gentle canter of [Minny]134-minny relieved [his]0-i despondency , after a while . [He]0-i began to put questions concerning [[his]0-i new home]4073-his new home , and [its inhabitants]4074-its inhabitants , with greater interest , and liveliness . "[0-i] Is [Wuthering Heights]11-wuthering heights as pleasant a place as [Thrushcross Grange]73-mr. linton ? " [he]0-i inquired , turning to take a last glance into [the valley]3650-the valley , whence a light mist mounted , and formed fleecy cloud , on the skirts of the blue . "[0-i] It is not so buried in trees , " [I]0-i replied , "[0-i] and it is not quite so large , but [you]1692-you can see [the country]438-the country beautifully , all round ; and the air is healthier for [you]1692-you — fresher , and dryer . [You]1692-you will , perhaps , think [the building]854-the building old and dark , at first — though [it]854-the building is [a respectable house]1695-a respectable house , the next best in [the neighbourhood]3573-the neighbourhood . And [you]1692-you will have such nice rambles on [the moors]352-the moors ! [Hareton Earnshaw]47-hareton — that is [[Miss Cathy]56-catherine 's other cousin]1698-miss cathy 's other cousin ; and so [yours]1692-you in a manner — will show [you]1692-you [all the sweetest spots]1699-all the sweetest spots ; and [you]1692-you can bring a book in fine weather , and make a green hollow [[your]1692-you study]1700-your study ; and , now and then , [[your]1692-you uncle]1701-your uncle may join [you]1692-you in a walk ; [he]1701-your uncle does , frequently , walk out on [the hills]2957-the hills . " "[1701-your uncle] And what is [[my]0-i father]338-my father like ? " [he]0-i asked . "[338-my father] Is [he]338-my father as young and handsome as [uncle]1673-uncle ? " "[338-my father] [He]338-my father 's as young , " said [I]338-my father "[338-my father] but [he]338-my father has black hair , and eyes ; and looks sterner , and [he]338-my father is taller and bigger altogether . [He]338-my father 'll not seem to [you]1692-you so gentle and kind at first , perhaps , because , it is not [his]338-my father way — still , mind [you]1692-you be frank and cordial with [him]338-my father ; and naturally , [he]338-my father 'll be fonder of [you]1692-you than [any uncle]1705-any uncle , for [you]1692-you are [his]338-my father own . " "[338-my father] Black hair and eyes ! " mused [Linton]56-catherine . "[0-i] [I]0-i ca n't fancy [him]338-my father . Then [I]0-i am not like [him]338-my father , am [I]0-i ? " "[0-i] Not much , " [I]0-i answered . . .Not a morsel , [I]0-i thought : surveying with regret the white complexion , and slim frame of [[my]0-i companion]350-my companion , and [his]338-my father large languid eyes . . .his [mother]564-mother 's eyes save that , unless a morbid touchiness kindled them , a moment , they had not a vestige of [her]564-mother sparkling spirit . "[0-i] How strange that [he]338-my father should never come to see [mama]1706-mama , and [me]0-i " [he]338-my father murmured . "[338-my father] Has [he]338-my father ever seen [me]0-i ? If [he]338-my father have , [I]0-i must have been [a baby]758-a baby — [I]0-i remember not a single thing about [him]338-my father ! " "[338-my father] Why , [Master Linton]73-mr. linton , " said [I]73-mr. linton , "[73-mr. linton] three hundred miles is a great distance : and ten years seem very different in length , to [a grown up person]1708-a grown up person , compared with what [they]1708-a grown up person do to [you]1709-you . It is probable [Mr. Heathcliff]43-heathcliff proposed going , from summer to summer , but never found a convenient opportunity : and now it is too late — Don't trouble [him]338-my father with questions on the subject : it will disturb [him]338-my father for no good . " [The boy]2803-the boy was fully occupied with [his]2803-the boy own cogitations for the remainder of the ride , till [we]4079-we halted before [the farm - house garden]4080-the farm - house garden gate . [I]80-ellen watched to catch [his]2803-the boy impressions in [his]2803-the boy countenanance . [He]2803-the boy surveyed the carved front , and low - browed lattices ; the straggling gooseberry bushes , and crooked firs , with solemn intentness , and then shook [his]2803-the boy head : [his]2803-the boy private feelings entirely disapproved of the exterior of [[his]2803-the boy new abode]4081-his new abode ; but [he]2803-the boy had sense to postpone complaining — there might be compensation within . Before [he]2803-the boy dismounted , [I]80-ellen went and opened the door . It was half - past six ; [the family]335-the family had just finished breakfast ; [the servant]2711-the servant was clearing and wiping down the table : [Joseph]45-joseph stood by [[his]45-joseph master]216-his master 's chair telling some tale concerning a lame horse ; and [Hareton]47-hareton was preparing for [the hay - field]4085-the hay - field . "[80-ellen] Hallo , [Nelly]80-ellen ! " cried [Mr. Heathcliff]43-heathcliff , when [he]0-i saw [me]80-ellen . "[80-ellen] [I]0-i feared [I]0-i should have to come down and fetch [[my]0-i property]1710-my property , [myself]0-i — [You've]1711-you've brought it have [you]80-ellen ? Let [us]1712-us see what [we]1712-us can make of it . " [He]0-i got up and strode to the door : [Hareton]47-hareton and [Joseph]45-joseph followed in gaping curiosity . [Poor Linton]142-linton ran a frightened eye over the faces of [the three]4086-the three . "[80-ellen] Sure - ly , " said [Joseph]45-joseph after a grave inspection , ' [he]43-heathcliff 's swopped wi ' [ye]80-ellen , [maister]2658-maister , an ' yon 's [[his]43-heathcliff lass]4088-his lass ! "[80-ellen] [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff having stared [[his]43-heathcliff son]475-his son into an ague of confusion , uttered a scornful laugh . " Have n't [they]4086-the three reared it on snails , and sour milk , [Nelly]80-ellen ? "[43-heathcliff] [I]0-i bid [the trembling and bewildered child]1714-the trembling and bewildered child get down , and enter . " Tut , tut ! " None of that nonsense ! [we]4092-we 're not going to hurt [thee]2803-the boy , [Linton]142-linton — isn't that [thy]2803-the boy name ? "[43-heathcliff] [He]43-heathcliff took off [the boy]2803-the boy 's cap and pushed back [his]1714-the trembling and bewildered child thick flaxen curls , felt [his]1714-the trembling and bewildered child slender arms , and [his]1714-the trembling and bewildered child small fingers ; during which examination , [Linton]142-linton ceased crying , and lifted [his]142-linton great blue eyes to inspect [the inspector]1719-the inspector . "[43-heathcliff] " Well , "[0-i] replied [I]0-i , " [I]0-i hope [you]2803-the boy 'll be kind to [the boy]2803-the boy , [Mr. Heathcliff]43-heathcliff , or [you]2803-the boy 'll not keep [him]1720-him long , and [he]1720-him 's all [you]2803-the boy have akin , in [the wide world]4103-the wide world that [you]2803-the boy will ever know — remember .
