Besides , [he]299-my son 's [mine]0-i , and [I]0-i want the triumph of seeing [[my]0-i descendent]1727-my descendent fairly lord of [[their]1727-my descendent estates]1728-their estates ; [[my]0-i child]1729-my child hiring [[their]1727-my descendent children]3849-their children , to till [[[their]1727-my descendent fathers]1731-their fathers ' lands]1732-their fathers ' lands for wages — That is the sole consideration which can make [me]0-i endure the whelp — [I]0-i despise [him]299-my son for [himself]299-my son , and hate [him]299-my son for the memories [he]299-my son revives ! But , that consideration is sufficient ; [he]299-my son 's as safe with [me]0-i , and shall be tended as carefully , as [[your]1733-your master]3179-your master tends [his]3179-your master own — [I]0-i have [a room up stairs]1735-a room up stairs , furnished for [him]299-my son , in handsome style — [I've]0-i engaged [a tutor]1736-a tutor , also , to come three times a week , from twenty miles distance , to teach [him]299-my son what [he]299-my son pleases to learn . [I]0-i 've ordered [Hareton]47-hareton to obey [him]3179-your master : and in fact , [I]0-i 've arranged every thing with a view to preserve [the superior]1737-the superior , and [the gentleman in [him]299-my son]1738-the gentleman in him , above [[his]299-my son associates]1739-his associates — [I]0-i do regret however , that [he]299-my son so little deserves the trouble — if [I]0-i wished any blessing in [the world]267-the world , it was to find [him]299-my son a worthy object of pride , and [I]0-i 'm bitterly disappointed with [the whey - faced whining wretch]1741-the whey - faced whining wretch ! " While [he]0-i was speaking , [Joseph]45-joseph returned , bearing a basin of milk - porridge , and placed it before [Linton]142-linton . [He]45-joseph stirred round the homely mess with a look of aversion , and affirmed [he]45-joseph could not eat it . [I]1741-the whey - faced whining wretch saw [the old man servant]4105-the old man servant shared largely in [[his]4105-the old man servant master]216-his master 's scorn of [the child]2762-the child , though [he]45-joseph was compelled to retain the sentiment in [his]45-joseph heart , because [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff plainly meant [[his]43-heathcliff underlings]4108-his underlings to hold [him]45-joseph in honour . "[1741-the whey - faced whining wretch] But [Maister Hareton nivir]143-hareton ate nowt else , when [he]143-hareton wer a little un : und what [wer]1742-wer gooid eneugh fur [him]143-hareton 's gooid eneugh fur [yah]1743-yah , Aw 's rayther think ! " [I]2878-his mother suggested boiled milk or tea ; and [the housekeeper]240-the housekeeper received instructions to prepare some . Come , [I]2878-his mother reflected , [[his]1745-yon dainty chap father]518-his father 's selfishness may contribute to [his]1745-yon dainty chap comfort . [He]1745-yon dainty chap perceives [his]1745-yon dainty chap delicate constitution , and the necessity of treating [him]1745-yon dainty chap tolerably . [I]2878-his mother 'll console [Mr. Edgar]91-edgar by acquainting [him]91-edgar with the turn [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff 's humour has taken . Having no excuse for lingering longer , [I]2878-his mother slipped out , while [Linton]142-linton was engaged in timidly rebuffing the advances of a friendly sheep - dog . But [he]1745-yon dainty chap was too much on the alert to be cheated — as [I]2878-his mother closed the door , [I]2878-his mother heard a cry , and a frantic repetition of the words — "[2878-his mother] Do n't leave [me]0-i ! [I]0-i 'll not stay here ! [I]0-i 'll not stay here ! " Then the latch was raised and fell — [they]4112-they did not suffer [him]1745-yon dainty chap to come forth . [I]0-i mounted [Minny]134-minny , and urged [her]4113-her to a trot ; and so [my]0-i brief guardianship ended . [We]4114-we had sad work with [little Cathy]56-catherine that day : [she]56-catherine rose in high glee , eager to join [[her]56-catherine cousin]462-her cousin ; and such passionate tears and lamentations followed the news of [his]1745-yon dainty chap departure , that [Edgar]91-edgar , [himself]91-edgar , was obliged to sooth [her]56-catherine , by affirming [he]1745-yon dainty chap should come back soon ; [he]91-edgar added , however , "[0-i] if [I]0-i can get [him]1749-him ; " and there were no hopes of that . This promise poorly pacified [her]56-catherine ; but time was more potent ; and though still , at intervals , [she]56-catherine inquired of [[her]56-catherine father]502-her father , when [Linton]56-catherine would return ; before [she]56-catherine did see [him]502-her father again , [his]502-her father features had waxed so dim in [her]56-catherine memory that [she]56-catherine did not recognise [him]502-her father . When [I]0-i chanced to encounter [the housekeeper of [Wuthering Heights]11-wuthering heights]4117-the housekeeper of wuthering heights , in paying business - visits to [Gimmerton]14-gimmerton , [I]0-i used to ask how [the young master]517-the young master got on ; for [he]502-her father lived almost as secluded as [Catherine]56-catherine [herself]56-catherine , and was never to be seen . [I]0-i could gather from [her]56-catherine that [he]502-her father continued in weak health , and was [a tiresome inmate]4119-a tiresome inmate . [She]56-catherine said [Mr. Heathcliff]43-heathcliff seemed to dislike [him]502-her father ever longer and worse , though [he]502-her father took some trouble to conceal it . [He]502-her father had an antipathy to the sound of [his]502-her father voice , and could not do at all with [his]502-her father sitting in [the same room]4120-the same room with [him]502-her father many minutes together . There seldom passed much talk between [them]4121-them ; [Linton]56-catherine learnt [his]502-her father lessons , and spent [his]502-her father evenings in [a small apartment]4122-a small apartment , [they]4121-them called [the parlour]3177-the parlour ; or else lay in bed all day ; for [he]502-her father was constantly getting coughs , and colds , and aches , and pains of some sort . "[0-i] And [I]0-i never knew [such a faint - hearted creature]1750-such a faint - hearted creature , " added [the woman]1617-the woman ; "[1750-such a faint - hearted creature] nor one so careful of [hisseln]144-hisseln . [He]1750-such a faint - hearted creature will go on , if [I]0-i leave the window open , a bit late in the evening . Oh ! it 's killing a breath of night air ! And [he]1750-such a faint - hearted creature must have a fire in the middle of summer ; and [Joseph]45-joseph 's ' bacca pipe is poison ; and [he]1750-such a faint - hearted creature must always have sweets and dainties , and always milk , milk for ever — heeding naught how [the rest of [us]1752-us]1751-the rest of us are pinched in winter — and there [he]1750-such a faint - hearted creature 'll sit , wrapped in [his]1750-such a faint - hearted creature furred cloak in [his]1750-such a faint - hearted creature chair by the fire , and some toast and water , or other slop on the hob to sip at ; and if [Hareton]143-hareton , for pity , comes to amuse [him]1750-such a faint - hearted creature — [Hareton]143-hareton is not bad - natured , though [he]143-hareton 's rough — [they're]1753-they're sure to part , one swearing , and the other crying . [I]0-i believe [the master]430-the master would relish [Earnshaw]47-hareton 's thrashing [him]1750-such a faint - hearted creature to a mummy , if [he]1750-such a faint - hearted creature were not [[his]430-the master son]475-his son : and , [I]0-i 'm certain , [he]430-the master would be fit to turn [him]1750-such a faint - hearted creature out of doors , if [he]430-the master knew half the nursing [he]430-the master gives hisseln . But then , [he]430-the master wo nt go into danger of temptation ; [he]430-the master never enters [the parlour]3177-the parlour , and should [Linton]56-catherine show those ways in [the house where [he]430-the master is]1757-the house where he is , [he]430-the master sends [him]430-the master up stairs directly . " [I]430-the master divined , from this account , that utter lack of sympathy had rendered [young Heathcliff]43-heathcliff selfish and disagreeable , if [he]43-heathcliff were not so originally ; and [my]430-the master interest in [him]43-heathcliff , consequently , decayed : though still [I]430-the master was moved with a sense of grief at [his]43-heathcliff lot , and a wish that [he]43-heathcliff had been left with [us]4125-us . [Mr. Edgar]91-edgar encouraged [me]430-the master to gain information ; [he]91-edgar thought a great deal about [him]43-heathcliff , [I]430-the master fancy , and would have run some risk to see [him]43-heathcliff ; and [he]43-heathcliff told [me]430-the master once to ask [the housekeeper]240-the housekeeper whether [he]43-heathcliff ever came into [the village]1197-the village ? [She]240-the housekeeper said [he]43-heathcliff had only been twice , on horseback , accompanying [[his]43-heathcliff father]518-his father : and both times [he]43-heathcliff pretended to be quite knocked up for three or four days afterwards . [That housekeeper]4129-that housekeeper left , if [I]430-the master recollect rightly , two years after [he]43-heathcliff came ; and another , whom [I]430-the master did not know , was [[her]240-the housekeeper successor]4130-her successor : [she]4130-her successor lives [there]2637-there still . Time wore on at [the Grange]2656-the grange in [its]2656-the grange former pleasant way , till [Miss Cathy]56-catherine reached sixteen . On the anniversary of [her]56-catherine birth [we]4133-we never manifested any signs of rejoicing , because it was , also , the anniversary of [[my]430-the master late mistress]4134-my late mistress 's death . [[Her]56-catherine father]502-her father invariably spent that day alone in [the library]3270-the library ; and walked , at dusk , as far as [Gimmerton kirkyard]14-gimmerton , where [he]502-her father would frequently prolong [his]502-her father stay beyond midnight . Therefore [Catherine]56-catherine was thrown on [her]56-catherine own resources for amusement . This twentieth of March was a beautiful spring day , and when [[her]56-catherine father]502-her father had retired , [[my]430-the master young lady]3319-my young lady came down dressed for going out , and said [she]3319-my young lady had asked to have a ramble on [the edge of [the moors]352-the moors]4139-the edge of the moors with [me]430-the master ; and [Mr. Linton]73-mr. linton had given [her]3319-my young lady leave , if [we]4141-we went only a short distance , and were back within the hour . "[430-the master] So make haste , [Ellen]80-ellen ! " [she]3319-my young lady cried . "[0-i] [I]0-i know where [I]0-i wish to go ; where a colony of moor game are settled ; [I]0-i want to see whether [they]1758-they have made [their]1758-they nests yet . " "[0-i] That must be a good distance up , " [I]0-i answered ; "[0-i] [they]1758-they do n't breed on the edge of [the moor]389-the moor . " "[0-i] No , it 's not , " [she]3319-my young lady said . "[0-i] [I]0-i 've gone very near with [papa]2871-papa . " [I]2871-papa put on [my]2871-papa bonnet , and sallied out ; thinking nothing more of the matter . [She]3319-my young lady bounded before [me]2871-papa , and returned to [my]2871-papa side , and was off again like a young greyhound ; and , at first , [I]2871-papa found plenty of entertainment in listening to the larks singing far and near ; and enjoying the sweet , warm sunshine ; and watching [her]3319-my young lady , [[my]2871-papa pet]4142-my pet , and [my]2871-papa delight , with [her]3319-my young lady golden ringlets flying loose behind , and [her]3319-my young lady bright cheek , as soft and pure in its bloom , as a wild rose , and [her]3319-my young lady eyes radiant with cloudless pleasure . [She]3319-my young lady was [a happy creature]4143-a happy creature , and [an angel]3219-an angel , in those days . It 's a pity [she]3319-my young lady could not be content . "[2871-papa] Well , " said [I]2871-papa , "[2871-papa] where are [your]0-i moor - game , [Miss Cathy]56-catherine ? [We]1761-we should be at them — [the Grange park - fence]1762-the grange park - fence is a great way off now . " "[80-ellen] Oh , a little further — only a little further , [Ellen]80-ellen , " was [her]3319-my young lady answer , continually . "[80-ellen] Climb to [that hillock]1763-that hillock , pass that bank , and by the time [you]0-i reach the other side , [I]0-i shall have raised the birds . " But there were so many hillocks and banks to climb and pass , that , at length , [I]0-i began to be weary , and told [her]3319-my young lady [we]1761-we must halt , and retrace [our]1761-we steps . [I]0-i shouted to [her]3319-my young lady , as [she]3319-my young lady had outstripped [me]0-i , a long way ; [she]3319-my young lady either did not hear , or did not regard , for [she]3319-my young lady still sprang on , and [I]0-i was compelled to follow . Finally , [she]3319-my young lady dived into [a hollow]4145-a hollow ; and before [I]0-i came in sight of [her]3319-my young lady again , [she]3319-my young lady was two miles nearer [Wuthering Heights]11-wuthering heights than [[her]3319-my young lady own home]1566-her own home ; and [I]0-i beheld [a couple of persons arrest [her]3319-my young lady]4147-a couple of persons arrest her , one of whom [I]0-i felt convinced was [Mr. Heathcliff]43-heathcliff [himself]43-heathcliff . [Cathy]56-catherine had been caught in the fact of plundering , or , at least , hunting out the nests of the grouse . [The Heights]11-wuthering heights were [[Heathcliff]43-heathcliff 's land]4148-heathcliff 's land , and [he]43-heathcliff was reproving [the poacher]4149-the poacher . "[0-i] [I]0-i 've neither taken any nor found any , " [she]3319-my young lady said , as [I]0-i toiled to [them]4147-a couple of persons arrest her , expanding [her]3319-my young lady hands in corroboration of the statement . "[0-i] [I]0-i did n't mean to take them ; but [papa]2871-papa told [me]0-i there were quantities up here , and [I]0-i wished to see the eggs . " [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff glanced at [me]2871-papa with an ill - meaning smile , expressing [his]43-heathcliff acquaintance with the party , and , consequently , [his]43-heathcliff malevolence towards it , and demanded who "[2871-papa] papa " was ? "[73-mr. linton] [Mr. Linton of Thrushcross Grange]73-mr. linton , " [she]3319-my young lady replied . "[73-mr. linton] [I]0-i thought [you]73-mr. linton did not know [me]0-i , or [you]73-mr. linton would n't have spoken in that way . " "[73-mr. linton] [You]0-i suppose [papa]2871-papa is highly esteemed and respected then ? " [he]73-mr. linton said , sarcastically . "[0-i] And what are [you]73-mr. linton ? " inquired [Catherine]56-catherine , gazing curiously on [the speaker]2714-the speaker . "[73-mr. linton] [That man [I]0-i 've seen before]1766-that man i 've seen before . Is [he]1766-that man i 've seen before [[your]73-mr. linton son]1767-your son ? " [She]56-catherine pointed to [Hareton]47-hareton , [the other individual]4151-the other individual ; who had gained nothing but increased bulk and strength by the addition two years to [his]47-hareton age : [he]47-hareton seemed as awkward and rough as ever . "[56-catherine] [Miss Cathy]56-catherine , " [I]56-catherine interrupted , "[56-catherine] it will be three hours instead of one , that [we]1768-we are out , presently . [We]1768-we really must go back . " "[1768-we] No , [that man]3334-that man is not [[my]0-i son]299-my son , " answered [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff , pushing [me]1768-we aside . "[1768-we] But [I]0-i have one , and [you]56-catherine have seen [him]1766-that man i 've seen before before too ; and , though [[your]56-catherine nurse]1771-your nurse is in a hurry , [I]0-i think both [you]56-catherine and [she]1771-your nurse would be the better for a little rest . Will [you]56-catherine just turn [this nab of heath]1772-this nab of heath , and walk into [[my]0-i house]1773-my house ? [You]56-catherine 'll get [home]239-home earlier for the ease ; and [you]56-catherine shall receive a kind welcome . " [I]0-i whispered [Catherine]56-catherine , that [she]56-catherine must n't , on any account , accede to the proposal ; it was entirely out of the question . "[0-i] Why ? " [she]56-catherine asked , aloud . "[0-i] [I]0-i 'm tired of running , and the ground is dewy — [I]0-i ca n't sit here . Let [us]1775-us go , [Ellen]80-ellen ! Besides , [he]0-i says [I]0-i have seen [[his]0-i son]475-his son . Do n't [you]80-ellen ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i do . Come , [Nelly]80-ellen , hold [your]80-ellen tongue — it will be a treat for [her]1778-her to look in on [us]1775-us . " "[80-ellen] No , [she]1778-her 's not going to [any such place]1780-any such place , " [I]1778-her cried , struggling to release [my]1778-her arm which [he]43-heathcliff had seized ; but [she]1778-her was almost at the door - stones already , scampering round the brow at full speed . [[Her]1778-her appointed companion]4152-her appointed companion did not pretend to escort [her]1778-her ; [he]4152-her appointed companion shyed off by [the road]2638-the road side , and vanished . "[1778-her] [Mr. Heathcliff]43-heathcliff , it 's very wrong , " [I]43-heathcliff continued , "[43-heathcliff] [you]43-heathcliff know [you]43-heathcliff mean no good ; and there [she]1778-her 'll see [Linton]56-catherine , and all will be told , as soon as ever [we]1781-we return ; and [I]0-i shall have the blame . " "[0-i] [I]0-i want [her]1778-her to see [Linton]56-catherine , " [he]0-i answered : [he]0-i 's looking better these few days ; it 's not not often [he]0-i 's fit to be seen . And [we]1781-we 'll soon persuade [her]1778-her to keep the visit secret — where is the harm of it ? "[0-i] " The harm of it is , that [[her]1778-her father]502-her father would hate [me]0-i , if [he]502-her father found [I]0-i suffered [her]1778-her to enter [[your]0-i house]3447-your house ; and [I]0-i am convinced [you]0-i have a bad design in encouraging [her]1778-her to do so , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied . " [My]1782-i design is as honest as possible . [I]1782-i 'll inform [you]0-i of its whole scope , "[1782-i] [he]1782-i said . " That [the two cousins]4156-the two cousins may fall in love , and get married . "[1782-i] " If [Linton]56-catherine died , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , " and [his]3179-your master life is quite uncertain , [Catherine]56-catherine would be [the heir]4160-the heir . "[0-i] " No , [she]56-catherine would not , "[1782-i] [he]1782-i said . " There is no clause in the will to secure it so ; [[his]3179-your master property]3973-his property would go to [me]1782-i ; but , to prevent disputes , [I]1782-i desire [their]4162-their union , and am resolved to bring it about . "[1782-i] " And [I]0-i 'm resolved [she]56-catherine shall never approach [[your]1782-i house]3447-your house with [me]0-i again , "[0-i] [I]0-i returned , as [we]1783-we reached the gate , where [Miss Cathy]56-catherine waited [our]1783-we coming . [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff bid [me]0-i be quiet ; and preceding [us]1783-we up [the path]4017-the path , hastened to open the door . [[My]0-i young lady]3319-my young lady gave [him]43-heathcliff several looks , as if [she]3319-my young lady could not exactly make up [her]3319-my young lady mind what to think of [him]43-heathcliff ; but now [he]43-heathcliff smiled when [he]43-heathcliff met [her]3319-my young lady eye , and softened [his]43-heathcliff voice in addressing [her]3319-my young lady , and [I]0-i was foolish enough to imagine the memory of [[her]3319-my young lady mother]1556-her mother might disarm [him]43-heathcliff from desiring [her]3319-my young lady injury . [Linton]56-catherine stood on the hearth . [He]43-heathcliff had been out , walking in [the fields]2851-the fields ; for [his]43-heathcliff cap was on , and [he]43-heathcliff was calling to [Joseph]45-joseph to bring [him]43-heathcliff dry shoes . [He]43-heathcliff had grown tall of [his]43-heathcliff age , still wanting some months of sixteen . [His]43-heathcliff features were pretty yet , and [his]43-heathcliff eye and complexion brighter than [I]0-i remembered them , though with merely temporary lustre borrowed from the salubrious air and genial sun . " Now , who is that ? "[43-heathcliff] asked [Mr. Heathcliff]43-heathcliff , turning to [Cathy]56-catherine . " Can [you]56-catherine tell ? "[43-heathcliff] " [[Your]43-heathcliff son]1767-your son ? "[56-catherine] [she]56-catherine said , having doubtfully surveyed , first one , and then the other . " Yes , yes , "[43-heathcliff] answered [he]43-heathcliff ; " but is this the only time [you]56-catherine have beheld [him]1767-your son ? Think ! Ah ! [you]56-catherine have a short memory . "[43-heathcliff] " What , [Linton]56-catherine ! "[56-catherine] cried [Cathy]56-catherine , kindling into joyful surprise at the name . " Is that [little Linton]56-catherine ? [He]1767-your son 's taller than [I]293-the youth am ! Are [you]56-catherine , [Linton]56-catherine ? "[293-the youth] [The youth]293-the youth stepped forward , and acknowledged [himself]293-the youth : [she]56-catherine kissed [him]293-the youth fervently , and [they]1789-they gazed with wonder at the change time had wrought in the appearance of each . [Catherine]56-catherine had reached [her]56-catherine full height ; [her]56-catherine figure was both plump and slender , elastic as steel , and [her]56-catherine whole aspect sparkling with health and spirits . [Linton]56-catherine 's looks and movements were very languid , and [his]293-the youth form extremely slight ; but there was a grace in [his]293-the youth manner that mitigated these defects , and rendered [him]293-the youth not unpleasing . After exchanging numerous marks of fondness with [him]293-the youth , [[his]293-the youth cousin]4033-his cousin went to [Mr. Heathcliff]43-heathcliff , who lingered by the door , dividing [his]43-heathcliff attention between the objects inside , and those that lay without , pretending , that is , to observe [the latter]2991-the latter , and really noting [the former]304-the former alone . " And [you]293-the youth are [[my]56-catherine uncle]4167-my uncle , then ! "[56-catherine] [she]56-catherine cried , reaching up to salute [him]293-the youth . [Mr. Linton]73-mr. linton has a prejudice against [me]0-i ; [we]1795-us quarrelled at one time of [our]1795-us lives , with unchristian ferocity ; and , if [you]0-i mention coming here to [him]73-mr. linton , [he]73-mr. linton 'll put a veto on [your]0-i visits altogether . " "[0-i] Why did [you]0-i quarrel ? " asked [Catherine]56-catherine , considerably crest - fallen . " [The father]464-the father launched towards [[his]464-the father son]475-his son a glance of bitter contempt . Now , if it had been [Hareton]47-hareton — do [you]1803-you know that , twenty times a day , [I]0-i covet [Hareton]47-hareton , with all [his]47-hareton degradation ? [I]0-i 'd have loved [the lad]2768-the lad had [he]2768-the lad been [some one else]1805-some one else . But [I]0-i think [he]2768-the lad 's safe from [her]56-catherine love . [I]0-i 'll pit [him]2768-the lad against that paltry creature , unless it bestir , itself briskly . [We]1806-we calculate it will scarcely last till it is eighteen . Oh , confound the vapid thing . [He]2768-the lad 's absorbed in drying [his]2768-the lad feet , and never looks at [her]56-catherine — [Linton]56-catherine ! " "[56-catherine] Yes , [father]552-father , " answered [the boy]2803-the boy . " [I]56-catherine do n't know , "[56-catherine] [she]56-catherine replied , casting a longing look to the door , and evidently eager to be active . [He]2768-the lad kept [his]2768-the lad seat , and shrank closer to the fire . [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff rose , and went into [the kitchen]194-the kitchen , and from thence to [the yard]252-the yard , calling out for [Hareton]47-hareton . [Hareton]47-hareton responded , and presently [the two]3659-the two re - entered . [The young man]259-the young man had been washing [himself]259-the young man , as was visible by the glow on [his]259-the young man cheeks , and [his]259-the young man wetted hair . " That 's not [[my]56-catherine cousin]3951-my cousin , is [he]259-the young man ? "[259-the young man] [he]259-the young man continued . [The uncivil little thing]1816-the uncivil little thing stood on tiptoe , and whispered a sentence in [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff 's ear . [He]43-heathcliff laughed ; [Hareton]47-hareton darkened ; [I]0-i perceived [he]43-heathcliff was very sensitive to suspected slights , and had obviously a dim notion of [his]43-heathcliff inferiority . But [[his]43-heathcliff master]216-his master or [guardian]1818-guardian chased the frown by exclaiming — " [You]43-heathcliff 'll be the favourite among [us]4182-us , [Hareton]47-hareton ! [She]56-catherine says [you]43-heathcliff are a — What was it ? Well , something very flattering — Here ! [you]43-heathcliff go with [her]56-catherine round [the farm]2643-the farm . And behave like [a gentleman]201-a gentleman , mind ! Do n't use any bad words ; and do n't stare , when [the young lady]276-the young lady is not looking at [you]43-heathcliff , and be ready to hide [your]43-heathcliff face when [she]56-catherine is ; and , when [you]43-heathcliff speak , say [your]43-heathcliff words slowly , and keep [your]43-heathcliff hands out of [your]43-heathcliff pockets . Be off , and entertain [her]56-catherine as nicely as [you]43-heathcliff can . "[1819-he] [He]1819-he watched [the couple]1820-the couple walking past the window . [Earnshaw]47-hareton had [his]47-hareton countenance completely averted from [[his]47-hareton companion]3282-his companion . [He]47-hareton seemed studying the familiar landscape with [a stranger]2580-a stranger 's , and [an artist]1823-an artist 's interest , [Catherine]56-catherine took a sly look at [him]47-hareton , expressing small admiration . [She]56-catherine then turned [her]56-catherine attention to seeking out objects of amusement for [herself]56-catherine , and tripped merrily on , lilting a tune to supply the lack of conversation . " [I]43-heathcliff 've tied [his]43-heathcliff tongue , "[43-heathcliff] observed [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff . " [He]43-heathcliff 'll not venture a single syllable , all the time ! [Nelly]80-ellen , [you]80-ellen recollect [me]43-heathcliff at [his]43-heathcliff age — nay , some years younger — Did [I]43-heathcliff ever look so stupid , so ' gaumless , ' as [Joseph]45-joseph calls it . "[43-heathcliff] " Worse , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied , " because more sullen with it . "[0-i] " [I]43-heathcliff 've a pleasure in [him]43-heathcliff ! "[43-heathcliff] [he]43-heathcliff continued reflecting aloud . " [He]43-heathcliff has satisfied [my]43-heathcliff expectations — If [he]43-heathcliff were [a born fool]4186-a born fool [I]43-heathcliff should not enjoy it half so much — But [he]43-heathcliff 's [no fool]4187-no fool ; and [I]43-heathcliff can sympathise with all [his]43-heathcliff feelings , having felt them [myself]43-heathcliff — [I]43-heathcliff know what [he]43-heathcliff suffers now , for instance , exactly — it is merely a beginning of what [he]43-heathcliff shall suffer , though . And [he]43-heathcliff 'll never be able to emerge from [his]43-heathcliff bathos of coarseness , and ignorance . [I]43-heathcliff 've got [him]43-heathcliff faster than [[his]43-heathcliff scoundrel of [a father]1672-a father]4188-his scoundrel of a father secured [me]43-heathcliff , and lower ; for [he]43-heathcliff takes a pride in [his]43-heathcliff brutishness , [I]43-heathcliff 've taught [him]43-heathcliff to scorn everything , extra - animal , as silly and weak — Don't [you]4190-you think [Hindley]75-hindley would be proud of [[his]75-hindley son]475-his son , if [he]75-hindley could see [him]43-heathcliff ? almost as proud as [I]43-heathcliff am of [mine]43-heathcliff — But there 's this difference , one is gold put to the use of paving stones ; and the other is tin polished to ape a service of silver — Mine has nothing valuable about it ; yet [I]43-heathcliff shall have the merit , of making it go as far as such poor stuff can go . [His]43-heathcliff had first - rate qualities , and they are lost — rendered worse than unavailing — [I]43-heathcliff have nothing to regret ; [he]43-heathcliff would have more than any , but [I]43-heathcliff , are aware of — And the best of it is , [Hareton]47-hareton is damnably fond of [me]43-heathcliff ! [You]4190-you 'll own that [I]43-heathcliff 've out - matched [Hindley]75-hindley there — If [the dead villain]4192-the dead villain could rise from [his]4192-the dead villain grave to abuse [me]43-heathcliff for [[his]4192-the dead villain offspring]4193-his offspring 's wrongs , [I]43-heathcliff should have the fun of seeing [the said offspring]4194-the said offspring fight [him]4192-the dead villain back again , indignant that [he]4192-the dead villain should dare to rail at [the one friend [he]4192-the dead villain has in [the world]267-the world]4195-the one friend he has in the world ! "[43-heathcliff] [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff chuckled a fiendish laugh at the idea ; [I]0-i made no reply , because [I]0-i saw that [he]43-heathcliff expected none . "[56-catherine] [[My]0-i master]530-my master , perceiving that [she]530-my master would not take [his]530-my master word for [[her]530-my master uncle - in - law]1848-her uncle - in - law 's evil disposition , gave a hasty sketch of [his]530-my master conduct to [Isabella]137-aunt isabella , and the manner in which [Wuthering Heights]11-wuthering heights became [[his]530-my master property]3973-his property . " [She]56-catherine might have been living yet , if it had not been for [him]43-heathcliff ! "[530-my master] was [his]530-my master constant bitter reflection ; and , in [his]530-my master eyes , [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff seemed [a murderer]1851-a murderer . [Miss Cathy]56-catherine , conversant with no bad deeds except [her]56-catherine own slight acts of disobedience , injustice and passion , rising from hot temper , and thoughtlessness , and repented of on the day [they]1852-they were committed , was amazed at the blackness of spirit that could brood on , and cover revenge for years ; and deliberately prosecute its plans , without a visitation of remorse . [She]56-catherine appeared so deeply impressed and shocked at this new view of human nature — excluded from all [her]56-catherine studies and all [her]56-catherine ideas till now — that [Mr. Edgar]91-edgar deemed it unnecessary to pursue the subject . [He]91-edgar merely added , " [You]56-catherine will know hereafter , [darling]344-darling , why [I]91-edgar wish [you]56-catherine to avoid [[his]502-her father house and [family]4224-family]4223-his house and family — now , return to [your]56-catherine old employments and amusements , and think no more about them ! " "[56-catherine] But may [I]0-i not write a note to tell [him]1857-that master why [I]0-i can not come ? " [she]80-ellen asked rising to [her]80-ellen feet . " [She]80-ellen threw at [me]56-catherine a very naughty look , so naughty that [I]56-catherine would not kiss [her]80-ellen good - night at first : [I]56-catherine covered [her]80-ellen up , and shut [her]80-ellen door , in great displeasure — but , repenting half - way , [I]56-catherine returned softly , and lo ! there was [Miss]4225-miss , standing at the table with a bit of blank paper before [her]4225-miss , and a pencil in [her]4225-miss hand , which [she]4225-miss guiltily slipped out of sight , on [my]56-catherine re - entrance . " [I]0-i then quitted [her]56-catherine again , and [she]56-catherine drew the bolt in one of [her]56-catherine worst , most peevish humours . The letter was finished and forwarded to its destination by [a milk - fetcher who came from [the village]1197-the village]4226-a milk - fetcher who came from the village , but that [I]0-i did n't learn till some time afterwards . Weeks passed on , and [Cathy]56-catherine recovered [her]56-catherine temper , though [she]56-catherine grew wondrous fond of stealing off to corners by [herself]56-catherine , and often , if [I]0-i came near [her]56-catherine suddenly while reading [she]56-catherine would start , and bend over the book , evidently desirous to hide it ; and [I]0-i detected edges of loose paper sticking out beyond the leaves . [She]56-catherine also got a trick of coming down early in the morning , and lingering about [the kitchen]194-the kitchen , as if [she]56-catherine were expecting the arrival of something ; and [she]56-catherine had a small drawer in a cabinet in [the library]3270-the library which [she]56-catherine would trifle over for hours , and whose key [she]56-catherine took special care to remove when [she]56-catherine left it . One day , as [she]56-catherine inspected this drawer , [I]0-i observed that the play - things , and trinkets which recently formed its contents , were transmuted into bits of folded paper . [My]0-i curiosity and suspicions were roused ; [I]0-i determined to take a peep at [her]56-catherine mysterious treasures ; so , at night , as soon as [she]56-catherine and [[my]0-i master]530-my master were safe up [stairs]416-stairs , [I]0-i searched and readily found among [my]0-i house keys , one that would fit the lock . Having opened , [I]0-i emptied the whole contents into [my]0-i apron , and took them with [me]0-i to examine at leisure in [[my]0-i own chamber]4232-my own chamber . Though [I]0-i could not but suspect , [I]0-i was still surprised to discover that they were a mass of correspondence , daily almost , it must have been , from [Linton Heathcliff]48-mrs. linton , answers to documents forwarded by [her]56-catherine . The earlier dated were embarrassed and short ; gradually however they expanded into copious love letters , foolish as the age of [the writer]4233-the writer rendered natural , yet with touches , here and there , which [I]0-i thought , were borrowed from a more experienced source . Some of them struck [me]0-i as singularly odd compounds of ardour , and flatness ; commencing in strong feeling , and concluding in the affected , wordy way that [a school - boy]4234-a school - boy might use to [a fancied , incorporeal sweetheart]4235-a fancied , incorporeal sweetheart . Whether [they]4236-they satisfied [Cathy]56-catherine , [I]0-i do n't know , but they appeared very worthless trash to [me]0-i . After turning over as many as [I]0-i thought proper , [I]0-i tied them in a handkerchief , and set them aside , re - locking the vacant drawer . Following [her]56-catherine habit , [[my]0-i young lady]3319-my young lady descended early , and visited [the kitchen]194-the kitchen : [I]0-i watched [her]56-catherine go to the door , on the arrival of [a certain little boy]4239-a certain little boy ; and , while [the dairy maid]4240-the dairy maid filled [his]4239-a certain little boy can , [she]4240-the dairy maid tucked something into [his]4239-a certain little boy jacket pocket , and plucked something out . [I]0-i went round by [the garden]2718-the garden , and laid wait for [the messenger]3714-the messenger ; who fought valorously to defend [his]3714-the messenger trust , and [we]4243-we spilt the milk between [us]4243-we ; but [I]0-i succeeded in abstracting the epistle ; and threatening serious consequences if [he]4239-a certain little boy did not look sharp [home]239-home , [I]0-i remained under the wall , and perused [Miss Cathy]56-catherine 's affectionate composition . It was more simple and more eloquent than [[her]56-catherine cousin]462-her cousin 's , very pretty and very silly . [I]0-i shook [my]0-i head , and went meditating into [the house]185-the house . The day being wet , [she]56-catherine could not divert [herself]56-catherine with rambling about [the park]2652-the park ; so , at the conclusion of [her]56-catherine morning studies , [she]56-catherine resorted to the solace of the drawer . [[Her]56-catherine father]502-her father sat reading at the table ; and [I]0-i , on purpose , had sought a bit of work in some unripped fringes of the window curtain , keeping [my]0-i eye steadily fixed on [her]56-catherine proceedings . Never did any bird flying back to a plundered nest which it had left brim - ful of [chirping young ones]4249-chirping young ones , express more complete despair in its anguished cries , and flutterings , than [she]56-catherine by [her]56-catherine single "[0-i] Oh ! " And the change that transfigured [her]56-catherine late happy countenance . [Mr. Linton]73-mr. linton looked up . "[0-i] What is the matter , [love]1864-love ? Have [you]1864-love hurt [yourself]1864-love ? " [he]73-mr. linton said . [His]73-mr. linton tone and look , assured [her]1864-love [he]73-mr. linton had not been [the discoverer of the hoard]4250-the discoverer of the hoard . "[1865-no papa] [No papa]1865-no papa — " [she]1864-love gasped . "[80-ellen] [Ellen]80-ellen ! [Ellen]80-ellen ! come up - stairs — [I'm]1864-love sick ! " [I]80-ellen obeyed [her]1864-love summons , and accompanied [her]1864-love out . "[80-ellen] Oh , [Ellen]80-ellen ! [you]80-ellen have got them , " [she]1864-love commenced immediately , dropping on [her]1864-love knees , when [we]4251-we were enclosed alone . "[80-ellen] O , give them to [me]0-i , and [I]0-i 'll never never do so again ! Do n't tell [papa]2871-papa — [You]80-ellen have not told [papa]2871-papa , [Ellen]80-ellen , say [you]80-ellen have not ! [I]0-i 've been exceedingly naughty , but [I]0-i wo n't do it any more ! " With a grave severity in [my]0-i manner , [I]0-i bid [her]56-catherine stand up . "[0-i] So , [I]0-i exclaimed , [Miss Catherine]56-catherine , [you]56-catherine are tolerably far on , it seems — [you]56-catherine may well be ashamed of [them]1868-them ! A fine bundle of trash [you]56-catherine study in [your]56-catherine leisure hours , to be sure — Why it 's good enough to be printed ! And what do [you]56-catherine suppose [the master]430-the master will think , when [I]0-i display it before [him]430-the master ? [I]0-i have n't shown it yet , but [you]56-catherine need n't imagine [I]0-i shall keep [your]56-catherine ridiculous secrets — For shame ! And [you]56-catherine must have led the way in writing such absurdities , [he]430-the master would not have thought of beginning , [I]0-i 'm certain . " "[0-i] [I]0-i did n't ! [I]0-i did n't ! " sobbed [Cathy]56-catherine , fit to break [her]56-catherine heart . "[0-i] [I]0-i did n't once think of loving [him]430-the master till — " "[0-i] Loving ! " cried [I]0-i , as scornfully as [I]0-i could utter the word . "[0-i] Loving ! Did [anybody]329-anybody ever hear the like ! [I]0-i might just as well talk of loving [the miller who comes once a year to buy [our]1872-we corn]1871-the miller who comes once a year to buy our corn . Pretty loving , indeed , and both times together [you]56-catherine have seen [Linton]56-catherine hardly four hours , in [your]56-catherine life ! Now here is the babyish trash . [I]0-i 'm going with it to [the library]3270-the library ; and [we]1872-we 'll see what [[your]56-catherine father]2760-your father says to such loving . " [She]56-catherine sprang at [her]56-catherine precious epistles , but [I]2760-your father held them above [my]2760-your father head ; and then [she]56-catherine poured out further frantic entreaties that [I]2760-your father would burn them — do anything rather than show them . And being really fully as inclined to laugh as scold , for [I]2760-your father esteemed it all girlish vanity , [I]2760-your father at length , relented in a measure , and asked , "[2760-your father] If [I]0-i consent to burn them , will [you]56-catherine promise faithfully , neither to send , nor receive a letter again , nor a book , for [I]0-i perceive [you]56-catherine have sent [him]2760-your father books , nor locks of hair , nor rings , nor playthings ? " "[1872-we] [We]1872-we do n't send playthings ! " cried [Catherine]56-catherine , [her]56-catherine pride overcoming [her]56-catherine shame . "[1872-we] Nor anything at all , then , [[my]0-i lady]1070-my lady ! " [I]1872-we said . "[1872-we] Unless [you]56-catherine will , here [I]0-i go . " "[0-i] [I]0-i promise , [Ellen]80-ellen ! " [she]56-catherine cried catching [my]80-ellen dress . "[80-ellen] Oh put them in the fire , do , do ! " But when [I]80-ellen proceeded to open a place with the poker , the sacrifice was too painful to be borne — [She]56-catherine earnestly supplicated that [I]80-ellen would spare [her]56-catherine one or two . "[80-ellen] One or two , [Ellen]80-ellen , to keep for [Linton]56-catherine 's sake ! " [I]0-i unknotted the handkerchief , and commenced dropping them in from an angle , and the flame curled up the chimney . "[0-i] [I]0-i will have one , [[you]80-ellen cruel wretch]1876-you cruel wretch ! " [she]80-ellen screamed , darting [her]80-ellen hand into the fire , and drawing forth some half consumed fragments , at the expense of [her]80-ellen fingers . "[1876-you cruel wretch] Very well — and [I]0-i will have some to exhibit to [papa]2871-papa ! " [I]80-ellen answered shaking back the rest into the bundle , and turning anew to the door . "[80-ellen] [She]80-ellen emptied [her]80-ellen blackened pieces into the flames , and motioned [me]0-i to finish the immolation . It was done ; [I]0-i stirred up the ashes , and interred them under a shovel full of coals ; and [she]80-ellen mutely , and with a sense of intense injury , retired to [[her]80-ellen private apartment]1878-her private apartment . [I]0-i descended to tell [[my]0-i master]530-my master that [the young lady]276-the young lady 's qualm of sickness was almost gone , but [I]0-i judged it best for [her]80-ellen to lie down a while . [She]80-ellen would n't dine ; but [she]80-ellen re - appeared at tea , pale and red about the eyes , and marvellously subdued in outward aspect . Next morning [I]0-i answered the letter by a slip of paper inscribed , " [Master Heathcliff]43-heathcliff is requested to send no more notes to [Miss Linton]56-catherine as [she]56-catherine will not receive them . "[0-i] And , thenceforth [the little boy]1881-the little boy came with vacant pockets . Summer drew to an end , and early Autumn — it was past Michaelmas , but the harvest was late that year , and a few of [[our]1882-our fields]1883-our fields were still uncleared . [Mr. Linton]73-mr. linton and [[his]73-mr. linton daughter]4009-his daughter would frequently walk out among [the reapers]1885-the reapers : at the carrying of the last sheaves , [they]1886-they stayed till dusk , and the evening happening to be chill damp , [[my]0-i master]530-my master caught a bad cold , that settling obstinately on [his]530-my master lungs , confined [him]530-my master indoors throughout the whole of the winter , nearly without intermission . [Poor Cathy]147-poor cathy , frightened from [her]147-poor cathy little romance , had been considerably sadder and duller since its abandonment : and [[her]147-poor cathy father]502-her father insisted on [her]147-poor cathy reading less , and taking more exercise . [She]147-poor cathy had [his]502-her father companionship no longer ; [I]0-i esteemed [it]1889-it a duty to supply its lack , as much as possible , with [mine]0-i ; an inefficient substitute , for [I]0-i could only spare two or three hours , from [my]0-i numerous diurnal occupations , to follow [her]147-poor cathy footsteps , and then , [my]0-i society was obviously less desirable than [his]502-her father . On an afternoon in October , or the beginning of November , a fresh watery afternoon , when the turf and paths were rustling with moist , withered leaves , and the cold , blue sky was half hidden by clouds , dark grey streamers , rapidly mounting from the west , and boding abundant rain ; [I]0-i requested [[my]0-i young lady]3319-my young lady to forego [her]3319-my young lady ramble because [I]0-i was certain of showers . [She]3319-my young lady refused ; and [I]0-i unwillingly donned a cloak , and took [my]0-i umbrella to accompany [her]3319-my young lady on a stroll to [the bottom of [the park]2652-the park]1891-the bottom of the park ; a formal walk which [she]3319-my young lady generally affected if low - spirited ; and that [she]3319-my young lady invariably was when [Mr. Edgar]91-edgar had been worse than ordinary ; a thing never known from [his]91-edgar confession , but guessed both by [her]3319-my young lady and [me]0-i from [his]91-edgar increased silence , and the melancholy of [his]91-edgar countenance . [She]3319-my young lady went sadly on ; there was no running or bounding now ; though the chill wind might well have tempted [her]3319-my young lady to a race . And often , from the side of [my]0-i eye , [I]0-i could detect [her]3319-my young lady raising a hand , and brushing something off [her]3319-my young lady cheek . [I]0-i gazed round for a means of diverting [her]3319-my young lady thoughts . On one side of [the road]2638-the road rose a high , rough bank , where hazels and stunted oaks , with their roots half exposed , held uncertain tenour : the soil was too loose for the latter ; and strong winds had blown some nearly horizontal . In summer , [Miss Catherine]56-catherine delighted to climb along these trunks , and sit in the branches , swinging twenty feet above the ground ; and [I]0-i pleased with [her]3319-my young lady agility , and [her]3319-my young lady light , childish heart , still considered it proper to scold every time [I]0-i caught [her]3319-my young lady at such an elevation ; but so that [she]3319-my young lady knew there was no necessity for descending . From dinner to tea [she]3319-my young lady would lie in [her]3319-my young lady breeze - rocked cradle , doing nothing except singing old songs — [my]0-i nursery lore — to [herself]3319-my young lady , or watching the birds , joint [tenants]2988-tenants , feed and entice [their]2988-tenants young ones to fly , or nestling with closed lids , half thinking , half dreaming , happier than words can express . " Look , [Miss]4252-miss ! "[0-i] [I]0-i exclaimed , pointing to a nook under the roots of one twisted tree . " Winter is not here yet . There 's a little flower , up yonder , the last bud from the multitude of blue - bells that clouded those turf steps in July with a lilac mist . Will [you]3319-my young lady clamber up , and pluck it to show to [papa]2871-papa ? "[0-i] [Cathy]56-catherine stared a long time at the lonely blossom trembling in its earthy shelter , and replied , at length — " No , [I]56-catherine 'll not touch it — but it looks melancholy , does it not , [Ellen]80-ellen ? "[56-catherine] " Yes , "[0-i] [I]0-i observed , " about as starved and sackless as [you]3319-my young lady — [your]3319-my young lady cheeks are bloodless ; let [us]4254-us take hold of hands and run . [You]3319-my young lady 're so low , [I]0-i dare say [I]0-i shall keep up with [you]3319-my young lady . "[0-i] " No , "[3319-my young lady] [she]3319-my young lady repeated , and continued sauntering on , pausing , at intervals , to muse over a bit of moss , or a tuft of blanched grass , or a fungus spreading its bright orange among the heaps of brown foliage ; and , ever and anon , [her]3319-my young lady hand was lifted to [her]3319-my young lady averted face . " [Catherine]56-catherine , why are [you]3319-my young lady crying , [love]1864-love ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked , approaching and putting [my]0-i arm over [her]3319-my young lady shoulder . " [You]3319-my young lady must n't cry , because [papa]2871-papa has a cold ; be thankful it is nothing worse . "[3319-my young lady] [She]3319-my young lady now put no further restraint on [her]3319-my young lady tears ; [her]3319-my young lady breath was stifled by sobs . " Oh , it will be something worse , "[3319-my young lady] [she]3319-my young lady said . " And what shall [I]3319-my young lady do when [papa]2871-papa and [you]0-i leave [me]3319-my young lady , and [I]3319-my young lady am by [myself]3319-my young lady ? [I]3319-my young lady ca n't forget [your]0-i words , [Ellen]80-ellen , they are always in [my]3319-my young lady ear . How life will be changed , how dreary [the world]267-the world will be , when [papa]2871-papa and [you]0-i are dead . "[3319-my young lady] " [None]4260-none can tell , whether [you]3319-my young lady wo nt die before [us]4261-us , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied . " It 's wrong to anticipate evil — [we'll]4261-us hope there are years and years to come before any of [us]4261-us go — [master]2968-master is young , and [I]0-i am strong , and hardly forty - five . [[My]0-i mother]2753-my mother lived till eighty , [a canty dame to the last]4264-a canty dame to the last . And suppose [Mr. Linton]73-mr. linton were spared till [he]73-mr. linton saw sixty , that would be more years than [you]0-i have counted , [Miss.]148-miss. And would it not be foolish to mourn a calamity above twenty years beforehand ? "[0-i] " But [Aunt Isabella]137-aunt isabella was younger than [papa]2871-papa , "[1895-she] [she]1895-she remarked , gazing up with timid hope to seek further consolation . " [Aunt Isabella]137-aunt isabella had not [you]0-i and [me]0-i to nurse [her]137-aunt isabella , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied . " [She]137-aunt isabella was n't as happy as [master]2968-master ; [she]137-aunt isabella had n't as much to live for . "[0-i] " [I]350-my companion fret about nothing on earth except [papa]2871-papa 's illness , "[350-my companion] answered [[my]0-i companion]350-my companion . " [I]350-my companion care for nothing in comparison with [papa]2871-papa . "[0-i] As [we]1897-we talked , [we]1897-we neared a door that opened on [the road]2638-the road : and [[my]0-i young lady]3319-my young lady , lightening into sunshine again , climbed up , and seated [herself]3319-my young lady on the top of the wall , reaching over to gather some hips that bloomed scarlet on the summit branches of the wild rose trees , shadowing [the highway side]1900-the highway side , the lower fruit had disappeared , but only birds could touch the upper , except from [[Cathy]56-catherine 's present station]1901-cathy 's present station . In stretching to pull them , [her]3319-my young lady hat fell off ; and as the door was locked , [she]3319-my young lady proposed scrambling down to recover it . [I]0-i bid [her]3319-my young lady be cautious lest [she]3319-my young lady got a fall , and [she]3319-my young lady nimbly disappeared . But the return was no such easy matter ; the stones were smooth and neatly cemented , and the rosebushes , and [blackberry stragglers]1902-blackberry stragglers could yield no assistance in re - ascending . Yes ! [you]43-heathcliff have cause to blush . Two or three months since , were [you]43-heathcliff not in the habit of writing to [Linton]56-catherine ? making love in play , eh ? [I]43-heathcliff 've got [your]43-heathcliff letters , and if [you]43-heathcliff give [me]43-heathcliff any pertness , [I]43-heathcliff 'll send them to [[your]43-heathcliff father]2760-your father . [I]43-heathcliff presume [you]43-heathcliff grew weary of the amusement , and dropped it , did n't [you]43-heathcliff ? Though [Hareton]47-hareton has made [him]2760-your father a standing jest for six weeks , and [I]43-heathcliff have used more serious measures , and attempted to frighten [him]2760-your father out of [his]2760-your father idiocy , [he]2760-your father gets worse daily , and [he]2760-your father 'll be under the sod before summer , unless [you]43-heathcliff restore [him]2760-your father ! "[1909-the detected villain] The lock gave way , and [I]0-i issued out . "[43-heathcliff] " Come in , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , taking [Cathy]56-catherine by the arm and half forcing [her]56-catherine to re - enter , for [she]56-catherine lingered , viewing , with troubled eyes , the features of [the speaker]2714-the speaker , too stern to express [his]2714-the speaker inward deceit . [He]2714-the speaker pushed [his]2714-the speaker horse close , and , bending down , observed — " [Miss Catherine]56-catherine , [I]2714-the speaker 'll own to [you]56-catherine that [I]2714-the speaker have little patience with [Linton]56-catherine — and [Hareton]47-hareton and [Joseph]45-joseph have less . [I]2714-the speaker 'll own that [he]2714-the speaker 's with a harsh set . [He]2714-the speaker pines for kindness , as well as love ; and a kind word from [you]56-catherine would be [his]2714-the speaker best medicine . Do n't mind [Mrs. Dean]71-mrs. dean 's cruel cautions , but be generous , and contrive to see [him]2714-the speaker . [He]2714-the speaker dreams of [you]56-catherine day and night , and can not be persuaded that [you]56-catherine do n't hate [him]2714-the speaker , since [you]56-catherine neither write nor call . "[2714-the speaker] [I]0-i closed the door , and rolled a stone to assist the loosened lock in holding it ; and spreading [my]0-i umbrella , [I]0-i drew [my]0-i charge underneath , for the rain began to drive through the moaning branches of the tress , and warned [us]1911-we to avoid delay . [Our]1911-we hurry prevented any comment on the encounter with [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff , as [we]1911-we stretched towards [home]239-home ; but [I]0-i divined instinctively that [Catherine]56-catherine 's heart was clouded now in double darkness . [Her]56-catherine features were so sad , they did not seem hers : [she]56-catherine evidently regarded what [she]56-catherine had heard as every syllable true . [The master]430-the master had retired to rest before [we]1911-we came in . [Cathy]56-catherine stole to [[his]430-the master room]3743-his room to inquire how [he]430-the master was ; [he]430-the master had fallen asleep . [She]56-catherine returned , and asked [me]0-i to sit with [her]56-catherine in [the library]3270-the library . [We]1911-we took [our]1911-we tea together ; and afterwards [she]56-catherine lay down on the rug , and told [me]0-i not to talk for [she]56-catherine was weary . [I]0-i got a book , and pretended to read . As soon as [she]56-catherine supposed [me]0-i absorbed in [my]0-i occupation , [she]56-catherine recommenced [her]56-catherine silent weeping : it appeared , at present , [her]56-catherine favourite diversion . [I]0-i suffered [her]56-catherine to enjoy it a while ; then , [I]0-i expostulated ; deriding and ridiculing all [Mr. Heathcliff]43-heathcliff 's assertions about [[his]43-heathcliff son]475-his son ; as if [I]0-i were certain [she]56-catherine would coincide . Alas ! [I]0-i had n't skill to counteract the effect [his]43-heathcliff account had produced ; it was just what [he]43-heathcliff intended . " [You]0-i may be right , [Ellen]80-ellen , "[56-catherine] [she]56-catherine answered ; " but [I]56-catherine shall never feel at ease till [I]56-catherine know — and [I]56-catherine must tell [Linton]56-catherine it is not [my]56-catherine fault that [I]56-catherine do n't write ; and convince [him]43-heathcliff that [I]56-catherine shall not change . "[56-catherine] What use were anger and protestations against [her]56-catherine silly credulity ? [We]1917-we parted that night hostile — but next day beheld [me]0-i on [the road to [Wuthering Heights]11-wuthering heights]1918-the road to wuthering heights , by the side of [[my]0-i wilful young mistress]1919-my wilful young mistress 's pony . [I]0-i could n't bear to witness [her]56-catherine sorrow , to see [her]56-catherine pale , dejected countenance , and heavy eyes ; and [I]0-i yielded in the faint hope that [Linton]56-catherine [himself]56-catherine might prove by [his]1920-his reception of [us]1917-we , how little of the tale was founded on fact .

The rainy night had ushered in a misty morning — half frost , half drizzle — and temporary brooks crossed [our]1917-we path , gurgling from [the uplands]1921-the uplands . [My]0-i feet were thoroughly wetted ; [I]0-i was cross and low , exactly the humour suited for making the most of these disagreeable things . [We]1917-we entered [the farm - house]1605-the farm - house by [the kitchen]194-the kitchen way to ascertain whether [Mr. Heathcliff]43-heathcliff were really absent ; because [I]0-i put slight faith in [his]43-heathcliff own affirmation . [Joseph]45-joseph seemed sitting in a sort of elysium alone , beside a roaring fire ; a quart of ale on the table near [him]45-joseph , bristling with large pieces of toasted oat cake ; and [his]45-joseph black , short pipe in [his]45-joseph mouth . [Catherine]56-catherine ran to the hearth to warm [herself]56-catherine . [I]0-i asked if [the master]430-the master were in ? [My]0-i question remained so long unanswered , that [I]0-i thought [the old man]2774-the old man had grown deaf , and repeated it louder . " Na — ay ! "[2774-the old man] [he]2774-the old man snarled , or rather screamed through [his]2774-the old man nose . " [Na]149-na — ay ! [yah]4295-yah muh goa back whear [yah]4295-yah coom frough . "[2774-the old man] " [Joseph]45-joseph , "[150-vigorous] cried a peevish voice , simultaneously with [me]0-i , from [the inner room]326-the inner room . " How often am [I]150-vigorous to call [you]45-joseph ? There are only a few red ashes now . [Joseph]45-joseph ! come this moment . "[150-vigorous] [Vigorous]150-vigorous puffs , and a resolute stare into the grate declared [he]2774-the old man had no ear for this appeal . [The housekeeper]240-the housekeeper and [Hareton]47-hareton were invisible ; one gone on an errand , and the other at [his]2774-the old man work , probably . [We]1928-we knew [Linton]56-catherine 's tones and entered . " Oh , [I]2803-the boy hope [you]45-joseph 'll die in a garret ! starved to death , "[2803-the boy] said [the boy]2803-the boy , mistaking [our]1928-we approach for that of [[his]2803-the boy negligent attendant]1930-his negligent attendant . [He]2774-the old man stopped , on observing [his]2774-the old man error ; [[his]2774-the old man cousin]4033-his cousin flew to [him]2774-the old man . " Is that [you]4033-his cousin , [Miss Linton]56-catherine ? "[2774-the old man] [he]2774-the old man said , raising [his]2774-the old man head from the arm of the great chair , in which [he]2774-the old man reclined . " No — don't kiss [me]2774-the old man . It takes [my]2774-the old man breath — dear [me]2774-the old man ! [Papa]133-papa said [you]4033-his cousin would call , "[2774-the old man] continued [he]2774-the old man , after recovering a little from [Catherine]56-catherine 's embrace ; while [she]56-catherine stood by looking very contrite . " Will [you]4033-his cousin shut the door , if [you]4033-his cousin please ? [you]4033-his cousin left it open — and those — those detestable creatures wo nt bring coals to the fire . It 's so cold ! "[56-catherine] [I]0-i stirred up the cinders , and fetched a scuttle full [myself]0-i . [The invalid]3469-the invalid complained of being covered with ashes ; but [he]3469-the invalid had a tiresome cough , and looked feverish and ill , so [I]0-i did not rebuke [his]3469-the invalid temper . " Well , [Linton]56-catherine , "[56-catherine] murmured [Catherine]56-catherine , when [his]3469-the invalid corrugated brow relaxed . " Are [you]56-catherine glad to see [me]56-catherine ? Can [I]56-catherine do [you]56-catherine any good ? "[56-catherine] " Why did n't [you]56-catherine come before ? "[2774-the old man] [he]2774-the old man said . " [You]56-catherine should have come , instead of writing . It tired [me]2774-the old man dreadfully , writing those long letters . [I]2774-the old man 'd far rather have talked to [you]56-catherine . Now , [I]2774-the old man can neither bear to talk , nor anything else . [I]2774-the old man wonder where [Zillah]49-zillah is ! will [you]56-catherine , ( looking at [me]2774-the old man , ) step into [the kitchen]194-the kitchen and see ? "[2774-the old man] [I]0-i had received no thanks for [my]0-i other service ; and being unwilling to run to and fro at [his]2774-the old man behest , [I]0-i replied — " [Nobody]442-nobody is out there but [Joseph]45-joseph . "[0-i] " [I]2774-the old man want to drink , "[2774-the old man] [he]2774-the old man exclaimed , fretfully , turning away . " [Zillah]49-zillah is constantly gadding off to [Gimmerton]14-gimmerton since [papa]2871-papa went . It 's miserable ! And [I]2774-the old man 'm obliged to come down [here]2574-here — [they]4300-they resolved never to hear [me]2774-the old man up [stairs]416-stairs . [Miss Linton]56-catherine , that [brute Hareton]47-hareton laughs at [me]2774-the old man — [I]2774-the old man hate [him]43-heathcliff — indeed , [I]2774-the old man hate [them]4300-they all — [they]4300-they are [odious beings]4305-odious beings . "[2774-the old man] [Cathy]56-catherine began searching for some water ; [she]56-catherine lighted on a pitcher in the dresser ; filled a tumbler , and brought it . [He]2774-the old man bid [her]56-catherine add a spoonful of wine from a bottle on the table ; and having swallowed a small portion , appeared more tranquil , and said [she]56-catherine was very kind . " And are [you]2774-the old man glad to see [me]56-catherine ? "[56-catherine] asked [she]56-catherine , reiterating [her]56-catherine former question , and pleased to detect the faint dawn of a smile . " Yes , [I]2774-the old man am — It 's something new to hear a voice like [yours]56-catherine ! "[3319-my young lady] " Not many : "[56-catherine] answered [Linton]56-catherine , but [he]1934-he goes onto [the moors]352-the moors frequently , since the shooting season commenced , and [you]3319-my young lady might spend an hour or two with [me]0-i , in [his]1934-he absence — Do ! say [you]3319-my young lady will ! [I]0-i think [I]0-i should not be peevish with [you]3319-my young lady ; [you]3319-my young lady 'd not provoke [me]0-i , and [you]3319-my young lady 'd always be ready to help [me]0-i , would n't [you]3319-my young lady ? " "[3319-my young lady] Yes , " said [Catherine]56-catherine stroking [his]3319-my young lady long soft hair , "[3319-my young lady] if [I]0-i could only get [papa]2871-papa 's consent , [I]0-i 'd spend half [my]0-i time with [you]3319-my young lady — [Pretty Linton]151-pretty linton ! " observed [he]0-i more cheerfully . "[0-i] But [papa]2871-papa says [you]0-i would love [me]0-i better than [him]2871-papa , and all [the world]267-the world , if [you]0-i were [[my]0-i wife]1941-my wife — so [I]0-i 'd rather [you]0-i were that ! " "[0-i] No ! [I]0-i should never love [anybody]329-anybody better than [papa]2871-papa , " [she]1941-my wife returned gravely . "[0-i] And [people]445-people hate [[their]445-people wives]1945-their wives , sometimes ; but not [[their]445-people sisters]1946-their sisters and [brothers]1947-brothers , and if [you]0-i were [the latter]2991-the latter , [you]0-i would live with [us]1949-us , and [papa]2871-papa would be as fond of [you]0-i , as [he]2871-papa is of [me]0-i . " [Linton]151-pretty linton denied that [people]445-people ever hated [[their]445-people wives]1945-their wives ; but [Cathy]56-catherine affirmed [they]445-people did , and in [her]56-catherine wisdom , instanced [[his]4315-his own father]4316-his own father 's aversion to [[her]4315-his aunt]4014-her aunt . [I]133-papa endeavoured to stop [her]56-catherine thoughtless tongue — [I]133-papa could n't succeed , till everything [she]56-catherine knew was out . [Master Heathcliff]43-heathcliff , much irritated , asserted [her]56-catherine relation was false . "[133-papa] [Papa]133-papa told [me]0-i ; and [papa]2871-papa does not tell falsehoods ! " [she]56-catherine answered pertly . "[1952-my papa] [[My]0-i papa]1952-my papa scorns [yours]1953-yours ! " cried [Linton]56-catherine . "[1952-my papa] [He]1952-my papa calls [him]1952-my papa [a sneaking fool]1954-a sneaking fool ! "[2803-the boy] " [She]137-aunt isabella did ! "[3319-my young lady] cried [[my]0-i young lady]3319-my young lady . " Well [I]56-catherine 'll tell [you]56-catherine something ! "[56-catherine] said [Linton]56-catherine " [[Your]56-catherine mother]683-your mother hated [[your]56-catherine father]2760-your father , now then . "[2803-the boy] " Oh ! " [She]683-your mother did ! [she]683-your mother did !
