" Hush , [Master Heathcliff]43-heathcliff ! "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " that 's [[your]56-catherine father]2760-your father 's tale too , [I]0-i suppose . "[0-i] " It isn't — [you]56-catherine hold [your]56-catherine tongue ! "[2803-the boy] [he]2803-the boy answered , " [she]683-your mother did , [she]683-your mother did , [Catherine]56-catherine , [she]683-your mother did , [she]683-your mother did ! "[2803-the boy] " [Cathy]56-catherine , beside [herself]56-catherine , gave the chair a violent push , and caused [him]2803-the boy to fall against one arm . [He]2803-the boy was immediately seized by a suffocating cough that soon ended [his]2803-the boy triumph . It lasted so long , that it frightened even [me]0-i . As to [[his]2803-the boy cousin]4033-his cousin , [she]683-your mother wept with all [her]683-your mother might , aghast at the mischief [she]683-your mother had done , though [she]683-your mother said nothing . [I]0-i held [him]2803-the boy , till the fit exhausted itself . Then [he]2803-the boy thrust [me]0-i away ; and leant [his]2803-the boy head down , silently — [Catherine]56-catherine quelled [her]56-catherine lamentations also , took a seat opposite , and looked solemnly into the fire . "[0-i] How do [you]1959-you feel now , [Master Heathcliff]43-heathcliff , " [I]1959-you inquired after waiting ten minutes . "[1959-you] [I]0-i wish [she]1960-she felt as [I]0-i do , " [he]0-i replied , "[1960-she] spiteful , cruel thing ! [Hareton]47-hareton never touches [me]0-i , [he]47-hareton never struck [me]0-i in [his]47-hareton life — And [I]0-i was better to - day — and there — " [his]0-i voice died in a whimper . "[0-i] [I]0-i did n't strike [you]1959-you ! " muttered [Cathy]56-catherine chewing [her]56-catherine lip to prevent another burst of emotion . [He]0-i sighed and moaned like one under great suffering ; and kept it up for a quarter of an hour , on purpose to distress [[his]0-i cousin]4033-his cousin , apparently , for whenever [he]0-i caught a stifled sob from [her]56-catherine , [he]0-i put renewed pain and pathos into the inflexions of [his]0-i voice . "[0-i] [I]0-i 'm sorry [I]0-i hurt [you]1959-you , [Linton]56-catherine ! " [she]56-catherine said at length , racked beyond endurance . "[56-catherine] But [I]0-i could n't have been hurt by that little push ; and [I]0-i had no idea that [you]1959-you could , either — [you're]1959-you not much , are [you]1959-you , [Linton]56-catherine ? Do n't let [me]0-i go [home]239-home , thinking [I]0-i 've done [you]1959-you harm ! answer , speak to [me]0-i . " "[0-i] [I]0-i ca n't speak to [you]0-i , " [he]0-i murmured , "[0-i] [you]0-i 've hurt [me]0-i so , that [I]0-i shall lie awake all night , choking with this cough ! If [you]0-i had it [you]0-i 'd know what it was — but [you]0-i 'll be comfortably asleep , while [I]0-i 'm in agony — and [nobody]442-nobody near [me]0-i ! [I]0-i wonder how [you]0-i would like to pass those fearful nights ! " And [he]0-i began to wail aloud for very pity of [himself]0-i . "[0-i] Since [you]1959-you are in the habit of passing dreadful nights , " [I]1959-you said , "[1959-you] it wo nt be [Miss]1963-miss who spoils [your]1959-you ease ; [you]1959-you 'd be the same , had [she]1963-miss never come — However , [she]1963-miss shall not disturb [you]1959-you , again — and perhaps , [you]1959-you 'll get quieter when [we]1964-we leave [you]1959-you . " "[1963-miss] Must [I]0-i go ? " asked [Catherine]56-catherine dolefully , bending over [him]1959-you . "[1963-miss] Do [you]1959-you want [me]0-i to go , [Linton]56-catherine ? " "[1959-you] [You]0-i can^t alter what [you]0-i 've done ? " [he]1959-you replied pettishly , shrinking from [her]56-catherine , "[0-i] unless [you]0-i alter it for the worse , by teasing [me]0-i into a fever ! " "[0-i] Well , then [I]0-i must go ? " [she]56-catherine repeated . "[0-i] Let [me]0-i alone , at least , " said [he]1959-you "[0-i] [I]0-i ca n't bear [your]0-i talking ! " [She]56-catherine lingered , and resisted [my]0-i persuasions to departure , a tiresome while , but as [he]1959-you neither looked up , nor spoke , [she]56-catherine finally made a movement to the door and [I]0-i followed . [We]4324-we were recalled by a scream — [Linton]56-catherine had slid from [his]1959-you seat on to the hearthstone , and lay writhing in the mere perverseness of an indulged plague of [a child]265-a child , determined to be as grievous and harassing as it can . [I]0-i thoroughly guaged [his]1965-he disposition from [his]1965-he behaviour , and saw at once it would be folly to attempt humouring [him]1965-he . Not so [[my]0-i companion]350-my companion , [she]56-catherine ran back in terror , knelt down , and cried , and soothed , and entreated , till [he]1965-he grew quiet from lack of breath , by no means from compunction at distressing [her]56-catherine . "[0-i] [I]0-i shall lift [him]1965-he on to the settle , " [I]0-i said , "[0-i] and [he]1965-he may roll about as [he]1965-he pleases ; [we]1966-we ca n't stop to watch [him]1965-he — [I]0-i hope [you]1967-you are satisfied , [Miss Cathy]56-catherine that [you]1967-you are not the person to benefit [him]1965-he , and that [his]1965-he condition of health is not occasioned by attachment to [you]1967-you . Now then , there [he]1965-he is ! Come away , as soon as [he]1965-he knows there is [nobody]442-nobody by to care for [his]1965-he nonsense , [he]1965-he 'll be glad to lie still ! " [She]56-catherine placed a cushion under [his]1965-he head , and offered [him]1965-he some water , [he]1965-he rejected the latter , and tossed uneasily on the former , as if it were a stone , or a block of wood . [She]56-catherine tried to put it more comfortably . "[0-i] [I]0-i ca n't do with that , " [he]1965-he said , "[0-i] it 's not high enough ! " [Catherine]56-catherine brought another to lay above it . "[0-i] That 's too high ! " murmured the provoking thing . "[0-i] How must [I]0-i arrange it , then ? " [she]56-catherine asked despairingly . [He]1965-he twined [himself]1965-he up to [her]56-catherine , as [she]56-catherine half knelt by the settle , and converted [her]56-catherine shoulder into a support . "[0-i] No , that wo n't do ! " [I]0-i said . "[0-i] [You]0-i 'll be content with the cushion , [Master Heathcliff]43-heathcliff ! [Miss]1969-miss has wasted too much time on [you]0-i , already ; [we]1970-we can not remain five minutes longer . " "[1970-we] Yes , yes , [we]1970-we can ! " replied [Cathy]56-catherine . "[43-heathcliff] [He]43-heathcliff 's good and patient , now — [He]43-heathcliff 's beginning to think [I]0-i shall have far greater misery than [he]43-heathcliff will , to - night , if [I]0-i believe [he]43-heathcliff is the worse for [my]0-i visit ; and then , [I]0-i dare not come again — Tell the truth about it , [Linton]56-catherine — for [I]0-i mutsn't come , if [I]0-i have hurt [you]56-catherine . " "[0-i] [You]0-i must come , to cure [me]0-i , " [he]43-heathcliff answered . "[0-i] [You]0-i ought to come because [you]0-i have hurt [me]0-i — [You]0-i know [you]0-i have , extremely ! [I]0-i was not as ill , when [you]0-i entered , as [I]0-i am at present — was [I]0-i ? " "[0-i] But [you]0-i 've made [yourself]0-i ill by crying , and being in a passion . " "[0-i] [I]0-i did n't do it all , " said [[his]0-i cousin]4033-his cousin . "[0-i] However , [we]1971-we 'll be [friends]3176-friends now . And [you]0-i want [me]0-i — [you]0-i would wish to see [me]0-i sometimes , really ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i told [you]0-i , [I]0-i did ! " [he]0-i replied impatiently . "[0-i] Sit on the settle and let [me]0-i lean on [your]0-i knee — That 's as [mama]1706-mama used to do , whole afternoons together — Sit quite still , and do n't talk , but [you]0-i may sing a song if [you]0-i can sing , or [you]0-i may say a nice , long interesting ballad — one of those [you]0-i promised to teach [me]0-i , or a story — [I'd]0-i rather have a ballad though , begin . " [Catherine]56-catherine repeated the longest [she]56-catherine could remember . The employment pleased [both]496-both mightily . [Linton]56-catherine would have another , and after that another ; notwithstanding [my]56-catherine strenuous objections ; and so , [they]496-both went on , until the clock struck twelve , and [we]4329-we heard [Hareton]47-hareton in [the court]180-the court , returning for [his]47-hareton dinner . "[56-catherine] And to - morrow , [Catherine]56-catherine , will [you]56-catherine be here to - morrow ? " asked [young Heathcliff]43-heathcliff , holding [her]56-catherine frock , as [she]56-catherine rose reluctantly . "[56-catherine] No ! " [I]56-catherine answered , "[56-catherine] nor next day neither , " [She]56-catherine however , gave a different response , evidently , for [his]43-heathcliff forehead cleared , as [she]56-catherine stooped , and whispered in [his]43-heathcliff ear . "[56-catherine] [You]56-catherine wo n't go to - morrow , recollect , [Miss]1974-miss ! " [I]1974-miss commenced when [we]4331-we were out of [the house]185-the house . "[1974-miss] [You]56-catherine are not dreaming of it , are [you]56-catherine ? " [She]56-catherine smiled . "[56-catherine] Oh , [I]0-i 'll take good care ! " [I]0-i continued , "[0-i] [I]0-i 'll have that lock mended , and [you]56-catherine can escape by no way else . " "[0-i] [I]0-i can get over the wall , " [she]56-catherine said laughing . "[0-i] [The Grange]2656-the grange is not [a prison]1976-a prison , [Ellen]80-ellen , and [you]80-ellen are not [[my]0-i jailer]1977-my jailer . And besides [I]0-i 'm almost seventeen . [I]0-i 'm [a woman]524-a woman — and [I]0-i 'm certain [Linton]56-catherine would recover quickly if [he]1979-he had [me]0-i to look after [him]1979-he — [I'm]0-i older than [he]1979-he is , [you]80-ellen know , and wiser , less childish , am [I]0-i not ? And [he]1979-he 'll soon do as [I]0-i direct [him]1979-he with some slight coaxing — [He]1979-he 's [a pretty little darling]1980-a pretty little darling when [he]1979-he 's good . [I]0-i 'd make such a pet of [him]1979-he , if [he]1979-he were [mine]0-i — [We]1981-we should never quarrel , should [we]1981-we , after [we]1981-we were used to [each other]313-each other ? Do n't [you]80-ellen like [him]1979-he , [Ellen]80-ellen ? " "[80-ellen] Like [him]1979-he ? " [I]1979-he exclaimed . "[1979-he] The worst tempered bit of [a sickly slip that ever struggled into its teens]1983-a sickly slip that ever struggled into its teens ! Happily , as [Mr. Heathcliff]43-heathcliff conjectured , [he]1979-he 'll not win twenty ! [I]0-i doubt whether [he]1979-he 'll see spring indeed — and small loss to [[his]1979-he family]2781-his family , whenever [he]1979-he drops off ; and lucky it is for [us]1981-we that [[his]1979-he father]518-his father took [him]1979-he — The kinder [he]1979-he was treated , the more tedious and selfish [he]1979-he 'd be ! [I]0-i 'm glad [you]80-ellen have no chance of having [him]1979-he for [a husband]1986-a husband , [Miss Catherine]56-catherine ! " [[My]56-catherine companion]350-my companion waxed serious at hearing this speech — To speak of [his]1979-he death so regardlessly wounded [her]350-my companion feelings . "[56-catherine] [He]1979-he 's younger than [I]0-i , " [she]350-my companion answered , after a protracted pause of meditation , "[1979-he] and [he]1979-he ought to live the longest , [he]1979-he will — [he]1979-he must live as long as [I]0-i do . [He]1979-he 's as strong now as when [he]1979-he first came into [the North]41-the north , [I]0-i 'm positive of that ! It 's only a cold that ails [him]1979-he , the same as [papa]2871-papa has — [You]0-i say [papa]2871-papa will get better , and why should n't [he]1979-he ? " "[0-i] Well , well , " [I]0-i cried , "[0-i] after all , [we]1989-i need n't trouble [ourselves]1989-i ; for listen , [Miss]1990-miss , and mind , [I]0-i 'll keep [my]0-i word — If [you]1990-miss attempt going to [Wuthering Heights]11-wuthering heights again , with , or without [me]0-i , [I]0-i shall inform [Mr. Linton]73-mr. linton , and unless [he]73-mr. linton allow it , the intimacy with [[your]1990-miss cousin]3950-your cousin must not be revived . " "[73-mr. linton] It has been revived ! " muttered [Cathy]56-catherine sulkily . "[73-mr. linton] Must not be continued , then ! " [I]1989-i said . "[1989-i] [We]1989-i 'll see ! " was [her]1990-miss reply , and [she]1990-miss set off at a gallop , leaving [me]1989-i to toil in the rear . [We]1989-i both reached [home]239-home before [our]1989-i dinner - time : [[my]1989-i master]530-my master supposed [we]1989-i had been wandering through [the park]2652-the park , and therefore , [he]530-my master demanded no explanation of [our]1989-i absence . As soon as [I]1989-i entered , [I]1989-i hastened to change [my]1989-i soaked shoes , and stockings ; but sitting such a while at [the Heights]568-the heights , had done the mischief . On the succeeding morning , [I]1989-i was laid up ; and during three weeks [I]1989-i remained incapacitated for attending to [my]1989-i duties — a calamity never experienced prior to that period , and , never [I]1989-i am thankful to say since . [[My]1989-i little mistress]4338-my little mistress behaved like [an angel]3219-an angel in coming to wait on [me]1989-i , and cheer [my]1989-i solitude : the confinement brought [me]1989-i exceedingly low — It is wearisome , to a stirring active body — but few have slighter reasons for complaint than [I]1989-i had . The moment [Catherine]56-catherine left [[Mr. Linton]73-mr. linton 's room]4340-mr. linton 's room , [she]56-catherine appeared at [my]1989-i bed - side . [Her]56-catherine day was divided between [us]4341-us ; no amusement usurped a minute : [she]56-catherine neglected [her]56-catherine meals , [her]56-catherine studies , and [her]56-catherine play ; and [she]56-catherine was [the fondest nurse that ever watched]4342-the fondest nurse that ever watched : [she]56-catherine must have had a warm heart , when [she]56-catherine loved [[her]56-catherine father]502-her father so , to give so much to [me]1989-i ! [I]1989-i said [her]56-catherine days were divided between [us]4344-us ; but [the master]430-the master retired early , and [I]1989-i generally needed nothing after six o'clock , thus the evening was [her]56-catherine own . "[1989-i] Poor thing , [I]0-i never considered what [she]1992-her did with [herself]1992-her after tea . And though frequently , when [she]1992-her looked in to bid [me]0-i good night [I]0-i remarked a fresh colour in [her]1992-her cheeks , and a pinkness over [her]1992-her slender fingers ; instead of fancying the hue borrowed from a cold ride across [the moors]352-the moors , [I]0-i laid it to the charge of a hot fire in [the library]3270-the library . At the close of three weeks , [I]0-i was able to quit [[my]0-i chamber]2693-my chamber , and move about [the house]185-the house . And on the first occasion of [my]0-i sitting up in the evening , [I]0-i asked [Catherine]56-catherine to read to [me]0-i , because [my]0-i eyes were weak . [We]1997-we were in [the library]3270-the library , [the master]430-the master having gone to bed : [she]1992-her consented , rather unwillingly , [I]0-i fancied ; and imagining [my]0-i sort of books did not suit [her]1992-her , [I]0-i bid [her]1992-her please [herself]1992-her in the choice of what [she]1992-her perused . [She]1992-her selected one of [her]1992-her own favourites , and got forward steadily about an hour ; then came frequent questions . " [Ellen]80-ellen , are not [you]80-ellen tired ? Had n't [you]80-ellen better lie down now ? [You]80-ellen 'll be sick , keeping up so long , [Ellen]80-ellen . "[1992-her] " No , no , [dear]634-dear , [I]0-i 'm not tired , "[0-i] [I]0-i returned , continually . Perceiving [me]0-i immovable , [she]1992-her essayed another method of showing [her]1992-her dis - relish for [her]1992-her occupation . It changed to yawning , and stretching , and — " [Ellen]80-ellen , [I]1992-her 'm tired . "[1992-her] " Give over then and talk , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered . That was worse ; [she]1992-her fretted and sighed , and looked at [her]1992-her watch till eight ; and finally went to [[her]1992-her room]800-her room , completely overdone with sleep , judging by [her]1992-her peevish , heavy look , and the constant rubbing [she]1992-her inflicted on [her]1992-her eyes . The following night [she]1992-her seemed more impatient still ; and on the third from recovering [my]0-i company , [she]1992-her complained of a head - ache , and left [me]0-i . [I]0-i thought [her]1992-her conduct odd ; and having remained alone a long while , [I]0-i resolved on going , and inquiring whether [she]1992-her were better , and asking [her]1992-her to come and lie on the sofa , instead of up stairs , in the dark . No [Catherine]56-catherine could [I]0-i discover up stairs , and none below . [The servants]2807-the servants affirmed [they]2807-the servants had not seen [her]1992-her . [I]0-i listened at [Mr. Edgar]91-edgar 's door — all was silence . [I]0-i returned to [[her]1992-her apartment]2002-her apartment , extinguished [my]0-i candle , and seated [myself]0-i in the window . The moon shone bright ; a sprinkling of snow covered the ground , and [I]0-i reflected that [she]1992-her might , possibly , have taken it into [her]1992-her head to walk about [the garden]2718-the garden , for refreshment . [I]0-i did detect a figure creeping along the inner fence of [the park]2652-the park ; but it was not [[my]0-i young mistress]2005-my young mistress ; on its emerging into the light , [I]0-i recognised [one of [the grooms]2007-the grooms]2006-one of the grooms . [He]2006-one of the grooms stood a considerable period , viewing [the carriage road]2008-the carriage road through [the grounds]1585-the grounds ; then started off at a brisk pace , as if [he]2006-one of the grooms had detected something , and reappeared , presently , leading [Miss]2010-miss 's pony ; and there [she]1992-her was , just dismounted , and walking by its side . [The man]382-the man took [his]382-the man charge stealthily across the grass towards [the stable]476-the stable . [Cathy]56-catherine entered by the casement - window of [the drawing - room]2013-the drawing - room , and glided noiselessly up to where [I]0-i awaited [her]56-catherine . [She]56-catherine put the door gently to , slipped off [her]56-catherine snowy shoes , untied [her]56-catherine hat , and was proceeding , unconscious of [my]0-i espionage , to lay aside [her]56-catherine mantle , when [I]0-i suddenly rose , and revealed [myself]0-i . The surprise petrified [her]56-catherine an instant : [she]56-catherine uttered an inarticulate exclamation , and stood fixed . " [[My]0-i dear]601-my dear [Miss Catherine]56-catherine , "[0-i] [I]0-i began , too vividly impressed by [her]56-catherine recent kindness to break into a scold , " where have [you]56-catherine been riding out at this hour ? And why should [you]56-catherine try to deceive [me]0-i , by telling a tale . Where have [you]56-catherine been ? Speak ! "[0-i] " To [the bottom of [the park]2652-the park]1891-the bottom of the park , "[56-catherine] [she]56-catherine stammered . " [I]56-catherine did n't tell a tale . "[56-catherine] " And no where else ? "[0-i] [I]0-i demanded . " No , "[0-i] was the muttered reply . " Oh , [Catherine]56-catherine , "[0-i] [I]0-i cried , sorrowfully . " [You]56-catherine know [you]56-catherine have been doing wrong , or [you]56-catherine would n't be driven to uttering an untruth to [me]0-i . That does grieve [me]0-i . [I]0-i 'd rather be three months ill , than hear [you]56-catherine frame a deliberate lie . "[0-i] [She]56-catherine sprang forward , and bursting into tears , threw [her]56-catherine arms round [my]0-i neck . " Well [Ellen]80-ellen , [I]56-catherine 'm so afraid of [you]80-ellen being angry , "[56-catherine] [she]56-catherine said . " Promise not to be angry , and [you]80-ellen shall know the very truth . [I]56-catherine hate to hide it . "[56-catherine] [We]2014-we sat down in the window - seat ; [I]0-i assured [her]56-catherine [I]0-i would not scold , whatever [her]56-catherine secret might be , and [I]0-i guessed it , of course , so [she]56-catherine commenced — " [I]56-catherine 've been to [Wuthering Heights]11-wuthering heights , [Ellen]80-ellen , and [I]56-catherine 've never missed going a day since [you]80-ellen fell ill ; except thrice before , and twice after [you]80-ellen left [[your]80-ellen room]4350-your room . [I]56-catherine gave [Michael]152-michael books and pictures to prepare [Minny]134-minny every evening , and to put [her]56-catherine back in [the stable]476-the stable ; [you]80-ellen must n't scold [him]134-minny either , mind . [I]56-catherine was at [the Heights]568-the heights by half - past six , and generally stayed till half - past eight , and then gallopped [home]239-home . It was not to amuse [myself]56-catherine that [I]56-catherine went ; [I]56-catherine was often wretched all the time . Now and then , [I]56-catherine was happy , once in a week perhaps . At first , [I]56-catherine expected there would be sad work persuading [you]80-ellen to let [me]56-catherine keep [my]56-catherine word to [Linton]56-catherine , for [I]56-catherine had engaged to call again next day , when [we]4354-we quitted [him]134-minny ; but , as [you]80-ellen stayed up [stairs]416-stairs on the morrow , [I]56-catherine escaped that trouble ; and while [Michael]152-michael was refastening the lock of [the park]2652-the park door in the afternoon , [I]56-catherine got possession of the key , and told [him]152-michael how [[my]56-catherine cousin]3951-my cousin wished [me]56-catherine to visit [him]134-minny , because [he]134-minny was sick , and could n't come to [the Grange]2656-the grange : and how [papa]2871-papa would object to [my]56-catherine going . And then [I]56-catherine negotiated with [him]152-michael about the pony . [He]152-michael is fond of reading , and [he]152-michael thinks of leaving soon to get married , so [he]152-michael offered , if [I]56-catherine would lend [him]152-michael books out of [the library]3270-the library , to do what [I]56-catherine wished ; but [I]56-catherine preferred giving [him]152-michael [my]56-catherine own , and that satisfied [him]152-michael better . "[56-catherine] On [my]0-i second visit , [Linton]56-catherine seemed in lively spirits ; and [Zillah]49-zillah , that is [[their]2015-their housekeeper]2016-their housekeeper , made [us]2017-we [a clean room]2018-a clean room , and a good fire , and told [us]2017-we that as [Joseph]45-joseph was out at a prayer - meeting , and [Hareton Earnshaw]47-hareton was off with [his]47-hareton dogs , robbing [[our]2017-we woods]2019-our woods of pheasants , as [I]0-i heard afterwards , [we]2017-we might do what [we]2017-we liked . " [She]49-zillah brought [me]0-i some warm wine and gingerbread ; and appeared exceedingly good - natured ; and [Linton]56-catherine sat in the arm - chair , and [I]0-i in the little rocking chair , on the hearthstone , and [we]2017-we laughed and talked so merrily , and found so much to say ; [we]2017-we planned where [we]2017-we would go , and what [we]2017-we would do in summer . [I]0-i need n't repeat that , because [you]4361-you would call it silly . "[0-i] One time , however , [we]2017-we were near quarrelling . [He]47-hareton said the pleasantest manner of spending a hot July day was lying from morning till evening on [a bank of heath in the middle of the moors]2020-a bank of heath in the middle of the moors , with the bees humming dreamily about among the bloom , and the larks singing high up over head , and the blue sky , and bright sun shining steadily and cloudlessly . That was [his]47-hareton most perfect idea of heaven 's happiness — [mine]0-i was rocking in a rustling green tree , with a west wind blowing , and bright , white clouds flitting rapidly above ; and not only larks , but throstles , and blackbirds , and linnets , and cuckoos pouring out music on every side , and the moors seen at a distance , broken into cool dusky dells ; but close by great swells of long grass undulating in waves to the breeze ; and [woods and sounding water]2021-woods and sounding water , and [the whole world]2022-the whole world awake and wild with joy . [He]47-hareton wanted all to lie in an ecstacy of peace ; [I]0-i wanted all to sparkle , and dance in a glorious jubilee . " [I]0-i said [his]47-hareton heaven would be only half alive , and [he]47-hareton said [mine]0-i would be drunk ; [I]0-i said [I]0-i should fall asleep in [his]47-hareton , and [he]47-hareton said [he]47-hareton could not breathe in mine , and began to grow very snappish . At last , [we]2017-we agreed to try both as soon as the right weather came ; and then [we]2017-we kissed [each other]313-each other and were [friends]3176-friends . After sitting still an hour , [I]0-i looked at [the great room]4364-the great room with [its]4364-the great room smooth , uncarpeted floor ; and thought how nice it would be to play in , if [we]2017-we removed the table ; and [I]0-i asked [Linton]56-catherine to call [Zillah]49-zillah in to help [us]2017-we — and [we]2017-we 'd have a game at [blind - man]4365-blind - man 's buff — [she]49-zillah should try to catch [us]2017-we — [you]4366-you used to , [you]4366-you know , [Ellen]80-ellen . [He]4365-blind - man would n't ; there was no pleasure in it , [he]4365-blind - man said ; but [he]4365-blind - man consented to play at ball with [me]0-i . [We]2017-we found two , in a cupboard , among a heap of old toys ; tops , and hoops , and battledoors , and shuttlecocks . One was marked C. , and the other H ; [I]0-i wished to have the C. , because that stood for [Catherine]56-catherine , and the H. might be for [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff , [his]4365-blind - man name ; but the bran came out of H. , and [Linton]56-catherine did n't like it . "[0-i] [I]0-i beat [him]2023-he constantly ; and [he]2023-he got cross again , and coughed , and returned to [his]2023-he chair ; that night , though , [he]2023-he easily recovered [his]2023-he good humour ; [he]2023-he was charmed with two or three pretty songs — [your]2024-your songs , [Ellen]80-ellen ; and when [I]0-i was obliged to go , [he]2023-he begged and entreated [me]0-i to come the following evening , and [I]0-i promised . " [Minny]134-minny and [I]2023-he went flying [home]239-home as light as air : and [I]2023-he dreamt of [Wuthering Heights]11-wuthering heights , and [[my]2023-he sweet , darling cousin]4368-my sweet , darling cousin , till morning . "[2023-he] On the morrow , [I]0-i was sad ; partly because [you]2024-your were poorly , and partly that [I]0-i wished [[my]0-i father]338-my father knew , and approved of [my]0-i excursions : but it was beautiful moonlight after tea ; and , as [I]0-i rode on , the gloom cleared . " [I]0-i shall have another happy evening , [I]0-i thought to [myself]0-i , and what delights [me]0-i more , [my]0-i pretty Linton will . "[0-i] [I]0-i trotted up [[their]2026-their garden]2027-their garden , and was turning round to the back , when [that fellow [Earnshaw]47-hareton]2028-that fellow earnshaw met [me]0-i , took [my]0-i bridle , and bid [me]0-i go in by [the front entrance]2029-the front entrance . [He]47-hareton patted [Minny]134-minny 's neck , and said [she]2030-she was a bonny beast , and appeared as if [he]47-hareton wanted [me]0-i to speak to [him]47-hareton . [I]0-i only told [him]47-hareton to leave [my]0-i horse alone , or else it would kick [him]47-hareton . " [He]47-hareton answered in [his]47-hareton vulgar accent . "[0-i] ' It would n't do mitch hurt if it did ; ' and surveyed [its]2030-she legs with a smile . " [I]56-catherine was half inclined to make it try ; however , [he]47-hareton moved off to open the door , and , as [he]47-hareton raised the latch , [he]47-hareton looked up to the inscription above , and said , with a stupid mixture of awkwardness , and elation : "[56-catherine] ' [Miss Catherine]56-catherine ! [I]0-i can read yon , nah . " "[0-i] ' Wonderful , ' [I]0-i exclaimed . ' Pray let [us]2031-us hear [you]0-i — [you]0-i are grown clever ! ' " [He]47-hareton spelt , and drawled over by syllables , the name — "[47-hareton] ' [Hareton Earnshaw]47-hareton . " "[47-hareton] ' And the figures ? ' [I]0-i cried , encouragingly , perceiving that [he]47-hareton came to a dead halt . " ' [I]0-i can not tell [them]4369-them yet , ' [he]47-hareton answered . "[0-i] ' Oh , [you]0-i dunce ! ' [I]0-i said , laughing heartily at [his]47-hareton failure . [The fool]3378-the fool stared , with a grin hovering about [his]47-hareton lips , and a scowl gathering over [his]47-hareton eyes , as if uncertain whether [he]47-hareton might not join in [my]0-i mirth ; whether it were not pleasant familiarity , or what it really was , contempt . [I]0-i settled [his]47-hareton doubts by suddenly retrieving [my]0-i gravity , and desiring [him]47-hareton to walk away , for [I]0-i came to see [Linton]56-catherine not [him]47-hareton . [He]47-hareton reddened — [I]0-i saw that by the moonlight — dropped [his]47-hareton hand from the latch , and skulked off , a picture of mortified vanity . [He]47-hareton imagined [himself]47-hareton to be as accomplished as [Linton]56-catherine , [I]0-i suppose , because [he]47-hareton could spell [his]47-hareton own name ; and was marvellously discomfited that [I]0-i did n't think the same . " Stop [Miss Catherine]56-catherine , [dear]634-dear ! "[0-i] [I]0-i interrupted . " [I]0-i shall not scold , but [I]0-i do n't like [your]634-dear conduct there . If [you]634-dear had remembered that [Hareton]47-hareton was [[your]634-dear cousin]3950-your cousin , as much as [Master Heathcliff]43-heathcliff , [you]634-dear would have felt how improper it was to behave in that way . At least , it was praiseworthy ambition , for [him]47-hareton to desire to be as accomplished as [Linton]56-catherine : and probably [he]47-hareton did not learn merely to show off ; [you]634-dear had made [him]47-hareton ashamed of [his]47-hareton ignorance , before : [I]0-i have no doubt ; and [he]47-hareton wished to remedy it and please [you]634-dear . To sneer at [his]47-hareton imperfect attempt was very bad breeding — had [you]634-dear been brought up in [his]47-hareton circumstances , would [you]634-dear be less rude ? [he]47-hareton was as quick and as intelligent [a child]265-a child as ever [you]634-dear were , and [I]0-i 'm hurt that [he]47-hareton should be despised now , because that base [Heathcliff]43-heathcliff has treated [him]47-hareton so unjustly . "[0-i] " Well , [Ellen]80-ellen , [you]80-ellen wo n't cry about it , will [you]80-ellen ? "[2033-she] [she]2033-she exclaimed , surprised at [my]0-i earnestness . " But wait , and [you]0-i shall hear if [he]47-hareton conned [his]47-hareton a b c , to please [me]0-i ; and if it were worth while being civil to [the brute]4373-the brute . "[0-i] [I]0-i entered , [Linton]56-catherine was lying on the settle and half got up to welcome [me]0-i . " [I]2034-him 'm ill to - night [Catherine]56-catherine , [love]1864-love ; "[2034-him] [he]2034-him said , " and [you]56-catherine must have all the talk , and let [me]2034-him listen . Come , and sit by [me]2034-him — [I]2034-him was sure [you]56-catherine would n't break [your]56-catherine word , and [I]2034-him 'll make [you]56-catherine promise again , before [you]56-catherine go . "[2034-him] " [I]2038-i knew now that [I]2038-i must n't tease [him]2034-him , as [he]2034-him was ill ; and [I]2038-i spoke softly and put no questions , and avoided irritating [him]2034-him in any way . [I]2038-i had brought some of [my]2038-i nicest books for [him]2034-him ; [he]2034-him asked [me]2038-i to read a little of one , and [I]2038-i was about to comply , when [Earnshaw]47-hareton burst the door open , having gathered venom with reflection . [He]47-hareton advanced direct to [us]4375-us ; seized [Linton]56-catherine by the arm , and swung [him]2034-him off the seat . "[2038-i] Get to [[thy]2035-you own room]2036-thy own room ! " [he]47-hareton said in a voice almost inarticulate with passion , and [his]47-hareton face looked swelled and furious . "[2034-him] Take [her]2037-her there if [she]2037-her comes to see [thee]2035-you — [thou]2038-i shalln't keep [me]0-i out of this . Begone , wi ' [ye]2035-you both ! " [He]47-hareton swore at [us]4375-us , and left [Linton]56-catherine no time to answer , nearly throwing [him]2034-him into [the kitchen]194-the kitchen ; and [he]47-hareton clenched [his]47-hareton fist , as [I]2039-he followed , seemingly longing to knock [me]2039-he down . [I]2039-he was afraid , for a moment , and [I]2039-he let one volume fall ; [he]47-hareton kicked it after [me]2039-he , and shut [us]4375-us out . [I]2039-he heard a malignant , crackly laugh by the fire , and turning beheld [that odious Joseph]4377-that odious joseph , standing rubbing [his]2039-he bony hands , and quivering . "[2039-he] Aw wer sure [he]2039-he 'd sarve [ye]2035-you eht ! [He]2039-he 's [a grand lad]2040-a grand lad ! [He]2039-he 's getten t'raight sperrit in [him]2039-he ! [He]2039-he knaws — Aye , [he]2039-he knaws , as weel as Aw do , who sud be t'maister yonder — Ech , ech , ech ! [He]2039-he mad [ye]2035-you skift properly ! Ech , ech , ech ! " "[2039-he] Where must [we]2041-we go ? " [I]56-catherine said to [[my]56-catherine cousin]3951-my cousin , disregarding [the old wretch]4379-the old wretch 's mockery . "[56-catherine] [Linton]56-catherine was white and trembling . [He]2039-he was not pretty then — [Ellen]80-ellen , Oh ! no , [he]2039-he looked frightful ! for [his]2039-he thin face , and large eyes were wrought into an expression of frantic , powerless fury . [He]2039-he grasped the handle of the door , and shook it — it was fastened inside . " If [you]2035-you do n't let [me]2039-he in [I]2039-he 'll kill [you]2035-you ; If [you]2035-you do n't let [me]2039-he in [I]2039-he 'll kill [you]2035-you ! "[2039-he] [he]2039-he rather shrieked than said . " Devil ! devil ! [I]2039-he 'll kill [you]2035-you , [I]2039-he 'll kill [you]2035-you ! "[2039-he] " [Joseph]45-joseph uttered [his]45-joseph croaking laugh again . "[2039-he] ' Thear that 's t'father ! " [he]45-joseph cried . ' That 's [father]552-father ! [We]4381-we 've allas summut uh orther side in [us]4381-we — [Niver]153-niver heed [Hareton]47-hareton , [lad]3489-lad — dunnut be ' feard — [he]2039-he can not get at [thee]3489-lad ! ' "[0-i] [I]0-i took hold of [Linton]56-catherine 's hands , and tried to pull [him]2039-he away ; but [he]2039-he shrieked so shockingly that [I]0-i dared not proceed . At last , [his]2039-he cries were choked by a dreadful fit of coughing ; blood gushed from [his]2039-he mouth , and [he]2039-he fell on the ground . " [I]0-i ran into [the yard]252-the yard , sick with terror ; and called for [Zillah]49-zillah , aa loud as [I]0-i could . [She]49-zillah soon heard [me]0-i ; [she]49-zillah was milking the cows in [a shed behind [the barn]249-the barn]4384-a shed behind the barn ; and hurrying from [her]49-zillah work , [she]49-zillah inquired what there was to do ? "[0-i] [I]0-i had n't breath to explain ; dragging [her]2042-her in , [I]0-i looked about for [Linton]56-catherine , [Earnshaw]47-hareton had come out to examine the mischief [he]47-hareton had caused , and [he]47-hareton was then conveying the poor thing up - stairs . [Zillah]49-zillah and [I]0-i ascended after [him]47-hareton ; but , [he]47-hareton stopped [me]0-i , at the top of the steps , and said , [I]0-i should n't go in , [I]0-i must go [home]239-home . " [I]47-hareton exclaimed that [he]47-hareton had killed [Linton]56-catherine and [I]47-hareton would enter . "[47-hareton] [Joseph]45-joseph locked the door , and declared [I]0-i should do ' no sich stuff , ' and asked [me]0-i whether [I]0-i were ' bahn to be as mad as [him]47-hareton . ' " [I]80-ellen stood crying , till [the housekeeper]240-the housekeeper re - appeared ; [she]240-the housekeeper affirmed [he]47-hareton would be better in a bit ; but [he]47-hareton could n't do with that shrieking , and din , and [she]240-the housekeeper took [me]80-ellen , and nearly carried [me]80-ellen into [the house]185-the house . "[80-ellen] [Ellen]80-ellen , [I]0-i was ready to tear [my]0-i hair off [my]0-i head ! [I]0-i sobbed and wept so that [my]0-i eyes were almost blind : and [the ruffian [you]2045-you have such sympathy with]2044-the ruffian you have such sympathy with , stood opposite ; presuming every now and then , to bid [me]0-i " wisht , "[47-hareton] and denying that it was [his]47-hareton fault ; and finally , frightened by [my]0-i assertions that [I]0-i would tell [papa]2871-papa , and that [he]2871-papa should be put in [prison]2047-prison , and hanged , [he]2871-papa commenced blubbering [himself]2871-papa , and hurried out to hide [his]2871-papa cowardly agitation . " Still , [I]0-i was not rid of [him]2871-papa : when at length [they]4388-they compelled [me]0-i to depart , and [I]0-i had got some hundred yards off [the premises]4389-the premises , [he]2871-papa suddenly issued from the shadow of [the road - side]4390-the road - side , and checked [Minny]134-minny and took hold of [me]0-i . "[0-i] ' [Miss Catherine]56-catherine , [I]0-i 'm ill grieved , ' [he]0-i began , ' but it 's rayther too bad — ' " [I]0-i gave [him]2871-papa a cut with [my]0-i whip , thinking , perhaps [he]2871-papa would murder [me]0-i — [He]2871-papa let go , thundering one of [his]2871-papa horrid curses , and [I]0-i gallopped [home]239-home more than half out of [my]0-i senses . "[0-i] [I]0-i did n't bid [you]2048-you good - night , that evening ; and [I]0-i did n't go to [Wuthering Heights]11-wuthering heights , the next — [I]0-i wished to , exceedingly ; but [I]0-i was strangely excited , and dreaded to hear that [Linton]56-catherine was dead , sometimes ; and sometimes shuddered at the thought of encountering [Hareton]47-hareton . " On the third day [I]2768-the lad took courage ; at least , [I]2768-the lad could n't bear longer suspense and stole off , once more . [I]2768-the lad went at five o'clock , and walked , fancying [I]2768-the lad might manage to creep into [the house]185-the house , and up to [[Linton]56-catherine 's room]4393-linton 's room , unobserved . However , the dogs gave notice of [my]2768-the lad approach : [Zillah]49-zillah received [me]2768-the lad , and saying "[2768-the lad] [the lad]2768-the lad was mending nicely , " showed [me]2768-the lad into [a small , tidy , carpeted apartment , where , to [my]2768-the lad inexpressible joy]4394-a small , tidy , carpeted apartment , where , to my inexpressible joy , [I]2768-the lad beheld [Linton]56-catherine laid on a little sofa , reading one of [my]2768-the lad books . But [he]47-hareton would neither speak to [me]2768-the lad , nor look at [me]2768-the lad , through a whole hour , [Ellen]80-ellen — [He]47-hareton has such an unhappy temper — and what quite confounded [me]2768-the lad , when [he]47-hareton did open [his]47-hareton mouth it was to utter the falsehood , that [I]2768-the lad had occasioned the uproar , and [Hareton]47-hareton was not to blame ! "[2768-the lad] " Unable to reply , except passionately , [I]56-catherine got up , and walked from [the room]243-the room . [He]2050-he sent after [me]56-catherine a faint "[56-catherine] [Catherine]56-catherine ! " [he]2050-he did not reckon on being answered so — but [I]56-catherine would n't turn back ; and the morrow was the second day on which [I]56-catherine stayed at [home]239-home , nearly determined to visit [him]2050-he no more . "[56-catherine] But it was so miserable going to bed , and getting up , and never hearing anything about [him]2050-he , that [my]0-i resolution melted into air , before it was properly formed . It had appeared wrong to take the journey once ; now it seemed wrong to refrain . [Michael]152-michael came to ask if [he]152-michael must saddle [Minny]134-minny ; [I]0-i said " Yes , "[0-i] and considered [myself]0-i doing a duty as [she]2051-she bore [me]0-i over [the hills]2957-the hills . " [I]49-zillah was forced to pass the front windows to get to [the court]180-the court ; it was no use trying to conceal [my]49-zillah presence . "[49-zillah] ' [Young master]2053-young master is in [the house]185-the house , ' said [Zillah]49-zillah as [she]49-zillah saw [me]0-i making for [the parlour]3177-the parlour . " [I]49-zillah went in , [Earnshaw]47-hareton was [there]2637-there also , but [he]47-hareton quitted [the room]243-the room directly . [Linton]56-catherine sat in the great arm chair half asleep ; walking up to the fire , [I]49-zillah began in a serious tone , partly meaning it to be true . "[49-zillah] As [you]2056-you do n't like [me]0-i [Linton]56-catherine , and as [you]2056-you think [I]0-i come on purpose to hurt [you]2056-you , and pretend that [I]0-i do so every time , this is [our]2057-our last meeting — let [us]2057-our say good bye ; and tell [Mr. Heathcliff]43-heathcliff that [you]2056-you have no wish to see [me]0-i , and that [he]43-heathcliff must n't invent any more falsehoods on the subject . " ' Sit down and take [your]2056-you hat off , [Catherine]56-catherine , ' [he]0-i answered . ' [You]2056-you are so much happier than [I]0-i am , [you]2056-you ought to be better . [Papa]133-papa talks enough of [my]0-i defects , and shows enough scorn of [me]0-i , to make it natural [I]0-i should doubt [myself]0-i — [I]0-i doubt whether [I]0-i am not altogether as worthless as [he]133-papa calls [me]0-i , frequently ; and then [I]0-i feel so cross and bitter , [I]0-i hate [everybody]2736-everybody ! [I]0-i am worthless , and bad in temper , and bad in spirit , almost always — and if [you]2056-you choose , [you]2056-you may say good - bye — [you'll]2056-you get rid of an annoyance — Only , [Catherine]56-catherine , do [me]0-i this justice ; believe that if [I]0-i might be as sweet , and as kind , and as good as [you]2056-you are , [I]0-i would be , as willingly , and more so , than as happy and as healthy . And , believe that [your]2056-you kindness has made [me]0-i love [you]2056-you deeper than if [I]0-i deserved [your]2056-you love , and though [I]0-i could n't , and can not help showing [my]0-i nature to [you]2056-you , [I]0-i regret it , and repent it , and shall regret , and repent it , till [I]0-i die ! ' "[0-i] [I]0-i felt [he]2058-his spoke the truth ; and [I]0-i felt [I]0-i must forgive [him]2058-his ; and , though [he]2058-his should quarrel the next moment , [I]0-i must forgive [him]2058-his again . [We]2059-we were reconciled , but [we]2059-we cried , both of [us]2059-we , the whole time [I]0-i stayed . Not entirely for sorrow , yet [I]0-i was sorry [Linton]56-catherine had that distorted nature . [He]2058-his 'll never let [[his]2058-his friends]2060-his friends be at ease , and [he]2058-his 'll never be at ease [himself]2058-his ! " [I]43-heathcliff have always gone to [[his]2058-his little parlour]4401-his little parlour , since that night ; because [[his]2058-his father]518-his father returned the day after . About three times , [I]43-heathcliff think , [we]2059-we have been merry , and hopeful , as [we]2059-we were the first evening ; the rest of [my]43-heathcliff visits were dreary and troubled — now , with [his]2058-his selfishness and spite ; and now with [his]2058-his sufferings : but [I]43-heathcliff 've learnt to endure the former with nearly as little resentment as the latter . "[43-heathcliff] [Mr. Heathcliff]43-heathcliff purposely avoids [me]0-i . [I]0-i have hardly seen [him]43-heathcliff at all . Last Sunday , indeed , coming earlier than usual , [I]0-i heard [him]43-heathcliff abusing poor [Linton]56-catherine , cruelly , for [his]43-heathcliff conduct of the night before . [I]0-i ca n't tell how [he]43-heathcliff knew of it , unless [he]43-heathcliff listened . [Linton]56-catherine had certainly behaved provokingly ; however , it was the business of [nobody but [me]0-i]2061-nobody but me ; and [I]0-i interrupted [Mr. Heathcliff]43-heathcliff 's lecture , by entering , and telling [him]43-heathcliff so . [He]43-heathcliff burst into a laugh , and went away , saying [he]43-heathcliff was glad [I]0-i took that view of the matter . Since then , [I]0-i 've told [Linton]56-catherine [he]43-heathcliff must whisper [his]43-heathcliff bitter things . " Now , [Ellen]80-ellen , [you]80-ellen have heard all ; and [I]43-heathcliff ca n't be prevented from going to [Wuthering Heights]11-wuthering heights , except by inflicting misery on [two people]2784-two people — whereas , if [you]80-ellen 'll only not tell [papa]133-papa , [my]43-heathcliff going need disturb the tranquillity of [none]4260-none . [You]80-ellen 'll not tell , will [you]80-ellen ? It will be very heartless if [you]80-ellen do . "[43-heathcliff] " [I]0-i 'll make up [my]0-i mind on that point by to - morrow . [Miss Catherine]56-catherine , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied . " It requires some study : and so [I]0-i 'll leave [you]56-catherine to [your]56-catherine rest , and go think it over . "[0-i] [I]0-i thought it over aloud , in [[my]0-i master]530-my master 's presence ; walking straight from [[her]2063-her room]800-her room to [his]530-my master , and relating the whole story , with the exception of [her]2063-her conversations with [[her]2063-her cousin]462-her cousin , and any mention of [Hareton]47-hareton . [Mr. Linton]73-mr. linton was alarmed and distressed more than [he]73-mr. linton would acknowledge to [me]0-i . In the morning , [Catherine]56-catherine learnt [my]0-i betrayal of [her]56-catherine confidence , and [she]56-catherine learnt also that [her]56-catherine secret visits were to end . In vain [she]56-catherine wept and writhed against the interdict ; and implored [[her]56-catherine father]502-her father to have pity on [Linton]56-catherine ; all [she]56-catherine got to comfort [her]56-catherine was a promise that [he]73-mr. linton would write , and give [him]73-mr. linton leave to come to [the Grange]73-mr. linton when [he]73-mr. linton [he]73-mr. linton pleased ; but explaining that [he]73-mr. linton must no longer expect to see [Catherine]56-catherine at [Wuthering Heights]11-wuthering heights . Perhaps , had [he]73-mr. linton been aware of [[his]73-mr. linton nephew]2067-his nephew 's disposition and state of health , [he]73-mr. linton would have seen fit to withhold even that slight consolation . " These things happened last winter , [sir]2571-sir , "[71-mrs. dean] said [Mrs. Dean]71-mrs. dean ; " hardly more than a year ago . Yet , who knows how long [you]2571-sir 'll be [a stranger]2580-a stranger ? [You]2571-sir 're too young to rest always contented , living by [yourself]2571-sir ; and [I]71-mrs. dean some way fancy , [no one]404-no one could see [Catherine Linton]56-catherine , and not love [her]56-catherine . [You]2571-sir smile ; but why do [you]2571-sir look so lively and interested , when [I]71-mrs. dean talk about [her]56-catherine — and why have [you]2571-sir asked [me]71-mrs. dean to hang [her]56-catherine picture over [your]2571-sir fireplace ? and why — "[71-mrs. dean] " Stop , [[my]0-i good friend]2954-my good friend ! "[0-i] [I]0-i cried . " It may be very possible that [I]0-i should love [her]56-catherine ; but would [she]56-catherine love [me]0-i ?
